description:
The best neighborhood spot around. 

Excellent:
Bread
Pastries 
Pizza 
Cookies
author: Danielle B.

description:
Arizmendi is the go-to spot if your craving a slice of pizza. They make a different gourmet pizza everyday on their signature sourdough crust. It has the perfect balance of a crisp exterior and a light and airy texture on the inside. I had a slice of their kalamata olive, spinach, fontana cheese, garlic oil, parsley & parmesan pizza and it was delicious. They also have a variety of sweet and savory breads you can order. 

The employees enjoy what they do and are nice to speak to. Their pizza is popular so expect a crowd. Overall, the atmosphere is pleasant and I am definitely going to come back to try more items on the menu.

Tip: Check out their pizza menu online or just head over for a surprise.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Came here for a cookie, breadstick, pizza, and tomato and cheese focaccia.

Let me start by saying pass on the cookie. Nothing special there.

Where they specialize is their bread. Wow that's really good. The breadstick is a bit firm and not warm/fresh, but the flavoring on it is spot on. Really enjoyed the cheese sprinkles on it.

The pizza is different than most pizza's because the dough is unlike anywhere else. It's quite flavorful and usually it's the dough that doesn't stand out in pizza, but here it's quite the opposite. The topping are usually simple (always vegetarian) and go very well with the dough.

The focaccia was also really good. Again, the emphasis is on the bread, and the toppings are just a little something extra.
author: Victor D.

description:
What the whaaaat!? So the only negatives are... it's tiny, busy,  and $10 credit card minimum.  
However,  that focaccia... seriously... it's as good as focaccia in Italy... maybe even better.  I didn't get any sweets but their coffee was fantastic too :)
author: Lia V.

description:
My go to place when in need of a pizza slice made with wholesome ingredients. I'm glad that this spot is not far from my school's campus! :)

The pizza here are great, pastry's are so-so, but you can always rely on them that it's decent and made w good ingredients, great atmosphere, and pretty chill staff
author: Catherine N.

description:
The first time I passed by there were a ton of people, some carrying out these beautiful slices of pizza & so I told myself I would have to return. 

Well today was the day. Friday at noon, there was a short line. The breads looked good but I was on a mission for pizza and so I grabbed a slice togo (today's special was the shiitake, portables, and button mushroom w/ sesame ginger garlic vinaigrette). It came out rather quickly and was piping hot. The mushrooms were plentiful and I like the addition of the vinaigrette which added a subtle sweetness to the pizza. The crust was a bit thicker and chewier than I normally prefer but I actually really enjoyed it - I think this is the first time I've ever tried a sourdough crust! 

As for seating, there were only a few seats inside and a single bench outside (there's usually other seating outside but there's construction right now I believe). 

I read a few reviews mentioning a somewhat unfriendly cashier but the cashier working when I went today was very nice & I had zero problems with service. 

Will definitely be back for more slices & hopefully some baked goods!
author: Janice L.

description:
This place is amazing. The food, the service and the fact that is is a worker-owned cooperative. Prepare to wait in line if you're coming at a prime time. The staff are notoriously just the right amount of friendly--they are slammed and the level of efficiency of the individual serving as cashier at any given time is stellar. They have a great system here. The line moves quickly, but more importantly the cashier NEVER makes you feel RUSHED! 

My go-to recommendations: pecan roll is out of this world and not-too-sweet; the shortbread is delectable and comes in fun holiday shapes/colors; the scones are to die for and like a true scone (less sugar, more flavor). They use organic ingredients when possible and you can really tell. I'm not a big fan of their cookies, but people are known to rave over them. 

The pizza deserves a section all of it's own! It's so so good. The flavors they create together are incredible. I've yet to have the same one twice and LOVE all of the ones I've had (about 5). The crispness is PERFECT! Sometimes it's a wee bit too cheesy, but I'm not complaining. Plus it's $3 for a slice! Hello NYC pricing! Such a deal in SF. 

LOVE Arizmendi and recommend it to anyone in the area.
author: Shelley V.

description: This bakery is amazing! Very crowded on a Saturday morning so prepare to stand in line.. But the line moves fast. They have a large selection of bread and baked goods and their pizza comes out at 11 am it seems. Tried the baguette, almond croissant, brioche, dried fruit bun, bluberry gluten free some, oat scone, and English muffin. The bread was nice and warm when we got it! I had to try a little of all of the items and they were all so delicious. I see what the hype is about and would be back over and over again if I could.
author: Rou M.

description: Excellent bakery! I'm sure theres other reviews that will tell you more or less the same.  People stop in to grab a slice of their freshly made pizza or their delicious foccacias.  The foccacia I had was great! Crispy, yet pillowy.  Plenty of flavor, and still warm (and cheeeeeesy!).
author: Anthony C.

description:
This is a basic bakery that's not as good as it seems. There's not a large selection of items, but there is variety. There's not any service except for payment, you grab and bag your own items from the shelves and cases. Prices are reasonable.

I think your opinion will depend on what you order. I got the strawberry coffee cake, which looks a lot better than most of the stuff on the shelves, which at the time seemed overbaked and almost burnt. I was going for a pecan roll, but I picked it up and it was hard, I want a soft roll, not something that I have to microwave to become soft. The croissants were also pretty dark. The coffee cake is just alright, it's pretty thick and dense, but not too sweet.
author: Spencer H.

description:
My friend and I came here on Easter and tried the pizza and the hot cross buns. There wasn't much of a wait and we got our food rather quickly. There is a minimum of $10 for credit card purchases.

The pizza was delicious! Great quality, a bit on the smaller size, but the taste was exquisite and the ingredients tasted top-notch. It's quite amazing how something so simple can be so delicious! It had tomato sauce this time, though usually they are tomato sauceless (that being said the tomato sauce was great tasting!)

The hot cross buns weren't all that hot by the time we had them, and they had been sitting on the shelves for a while. They tasted okay, no something amazingly good but still acceptable.

Overall I'd come back here for the pizza, though the bakery items seem a bit more hit or miss.
author: Tyler T.

description:
Simply wow. The focaccia is to die for. I got the vegan focaccia with artichoke hearts and another one with olives and tomatoes. Both were so delicious and seasoned perfectly. 

The line might seem long but it moves quickly. Highly recommended!
author: Joan S.

description:
I stopped by for breakfast and coffee with my mom.  We were in awe with the selection of fresh baked goods, many of which are fresh from the oven. There are a variety of both savory and sweet pastries. I got the cheese and tomato focaccia, which was so delicious that mom made me get another after we had finished mine! The sourdough croissant and the rhubarb scone were decent but not anything to write home about. 

Espresso drinks are made to order, and black coffee (decaf and caffeinated)  is kept hot in thermoses for you to pour at your leisure after you pay. I also really appreciated that the milk and half and half provided are both organic! 

I'm a huge fan of Cheeseboard in Berkeley, so I can't wait to stop by during lunch for their pizza! Daily specials are posted in the morning, pizza is available starting at 11:30!
author: Sherry L.

description:
I probably wrote a five star review of this place once upon a time.  It's usually great.

We've been coming here happily ever since the place first opened.  Yeah.  The very first week, if not the exact first day.  

So, you can imagine that it takes a helluva lot to make a customer who has been happy -- whose whole family has been happy -- for many many years to write a negative review after one bad experience.

It was such a bad experience that, yeah, I'm
Doing this one star thing that I hate to do.

Blech.


We had a disappointing interaction here today, Sunday, August 26 at 4:45 pm, with the man at the register (6'3"ish, white, well over 40) that left a terrible taste in our mouths even though we did not end up eating anything at all.

As I was reaching for a piece of focaccia and thinking of the other few items I wanted to bring to our friends' home, I heard the aforementioned man say "no sampling from the bins" in an accusatory voice... aimed at me???

'Nahhh.. that makes no sense,' I thought.  

I was clearly not eating anything or making any "about to sample from the bin" gestures.

But he was indeed staring at me sternly, as would a librarian at a patron talking on a cell phone.

Strange.  

I tried to disarm him with kindness/humor/a great big smile... showed him with empty hands etc that I'd not even thought of doing any nefarious bin sampling.  

'Ok.  That should put him at ease.  We are all
Friends here.'

I went back to filling my bag of goodies.  'Must have had a hard day, that guy.  All's chill... carry on.'

I approached the register as did my wife - the only other person selecting items at the time.  

They guy accused her of bin sampling too.

"Hey, that's no bin sampler, THAT'S MY WIFE!"  

Now, I was affronted.  You can insult me all day long and ... well, please don't, but, really that's not as bad as insulting my absolutely non-bin sampling wife, dammit.

So I started to calmly tell this man that his false accusations offended me and why... when he cut me off to say that he'd seen us both eating out of the bins.  

'Ummm.... he might have had a tougher day than I realized and maybe he's actually hallucinating or I don't know what...'. Whatever was going on in his head, what came out of his mouth was simply offensive in tone and content and made both my wife and me feel unwelcome in the extreme.

We left our bags in the store and said we did not want to buy food there after all.  

Would you have wanted to spend another second with that man talking to you that way?  Probably not even if you were super hungry and really wanted yummy baked goods.  

So... I'll go to other locations and eventually come
back to this store on 9th ave too.  I hope that man is not working when I do.
author: Scott C.

description:
Sister restaurant of Cheeseboard? What?!

It's the same concept as Cheeseboard. One vegetarian pizza daily. Check their menu online to see what pizza they have that day! 

On the day we went, it was mushrooms, mixed greens, feta cheese, rosemary oil, p&p. It was definitely good, but nothing amazing. The pizza is definitely fresh because they're constantly making it throughout the day. It's thin crust NY style, which I love. However, they don't have the green sauce Cheeseboard has which is why I like Cheeseboard better.
author: Samantha C.

description: What a heavenly piece of pesto pizza I had! Arizmendi as my boyfriend would call it, "represents the pinnacle of baking". And I would agree with that statement. I'm quite lucky that I live 5 min away from the bakery, and every time I pass it, there's either a huge long line, or when the line is short because they had run out of baked goods and waiting for the next batch to be available. I've tried their desserts, pizza, bread, and they were all mouth wateringly delicious. Loved the vibe of the place too, very accessible, friendly and comfortable for hanging out, if you are lucky enough to find an empty seat!
author: Yingna L.

description:
Stopped by here for a quick bite because I was starving. I took a random flatbread pizza thing out of their display cabinet and it tasted like it was on sourdough bread with tomato sauce, delicious sweet red onions, and cheese . It was $4.75 flat. Wasn't too bad for what I wanted! Would've definitely been better if it was hot though.

Small space and it had a line but it moved quickly.

Outside there's a lot of nice wooden benches for you to sit, people watch, and enjoy your food.
author: Joshua H.

description:
This place has a nice interior with lots of wood so that you feel cozy on cold days. On warm days you can enjoy the outdoors in the parklet right outside of it.

My sister loves getting their pizza so much that whenever she passes by Arizmendi, she won't just settle on buying one slice of pizza. She would buy a 'whole pie' or even two 'whole pies'. I like that their pizzas are vegetarian, organic, and very tasty. They have a special taste and texture that is different from regular pizzas. Even after you microwave them several days later they still taste as good! Their crust has a little bit of cheese on them that makes them a bit crunchy on the outside but still soft on the inside.
author: Andrea T.

description:
OMG! What have I been missing?! I feel like I am late to the game, but I am happy I made it and I will be loyal forevermore. I came in just to pick up a baked good for the road, but saw the $10 min limit to use a credit card and was more than happy to choose a few more items. I ended up getting a plain shortbread cookie, a blueberry corn muffin, an apple scone, and a slice of pizza. 

The shortbread cookie was AMAZING. At $2, it's kinda pricey for a plain Jane kind of a cookie, but so worth. I actually had planned to give it to my dad whose favorite cookie is shortbread. But of course I decided to to do some quality control and took a nibble out of it first. You can probably guess that I finished the whole cookie and my dad got nothing. But the cookie was buttery and crumbly, everything a good shortbread cookie should be. I am definitely going to load up on this next time I go. Also intrigued by the cardamom flavored one. 

The slice of pizza I had was also really delicious. It was a mushroom pizza with a miso sesame dressing. It was so incredibly aromatic. While I was driving. I kept on opening my paper bag to smell it. The pizza crust was delicious but it was the dressing that pushed it over the top.

The blueberry corn muffin was good. They were generous with the blueberries and I love the texture cornmeal gives the muffin. It wasn't super moist, probably because of the cornmeal, but the taste was great.

My least favorite was the apple scone. Texturally it wasn't doing it for me. Taste wise it was a little bland.
author: Kim W.

description:
Pizza of today! And it's as good as the comment said!
And I also try the hard bread with orange inside. That was recommended by the lady sat next to me. It's a nice environment and people who love to sit inside seem the old customers. It feels so friendly.
author: Yantong Z.

description:
I live near this bakery and every weekend when I walk by in the mornings, there is always a line out the door! 

I've tried their scones and lavender short bread cookies and their scones were good but the lavender short bread is divine. I know their pastries change day by day but get the short bread if you get a chance! You won't regret it!
author: Christina C.

description:
Stopped by by chance and picked up a sourdough chocolate croissant and an assortment of cookies.

Never had a sourdough chocolate croissant before. Had a good amount of chocolate (not too much, not too little) and was flaky, which was nice, but overall, it was a bit tough (probably because I tried it in the evening as opposed to when it was freshly baked).

Big fan of the assorted cookies (though they were a bit pricey).

While I was at Arizmendi, I saw a lot of other patrons ordering the pizza slices, so I'll have to try those next time!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Coffee cake (Sundays only) - gigantic slices that are pretty good

Sourdough chocolate croissant - what? Really?  It's surprisingly good, with that slight sourdough tang and a little heartier than a normal croissant.

Overall though I think Arizmendi is a step below Cheeseboard - which is a real bummer since I love cheeseboard bakery.  For the same exact item, like oat scone or seasonal fruit scone, the Cheeseboard made one in Berkeley is a far cry above Arizmendi.  There's huge inconsistency with Arizmendi, and quite a few times their goods were burnt, and the flavor is just not the same as Cheeseboard's.  In the most recent trip I got some fruit scones (plum/nectarine was flavor of the day) which had next to no actual fruit filling, so I was just eating a gigantic lump of sweet flour/scone, whereas at Cheeseboard there'd also be bits and pieces of whatever is the flavor of the day.
author: Melody L.

description: I often go here.  It's near my home and the price is cheap for San Francisco. You can take the N Line to 9th Ave which has a lot of different restaurants.  Good place.
author: St Giles I.

description: Awesome service. Most of the folks in line were getting regular baked goods and I was there for sweets. Good but not great from the sweets perspective. 3.5 Stars. Folks were mighty enthused about the other stuff, I didn't try it
author: Ottis M.

description:
Definitely a solid place to stop by for quick scones, coffee, foccacias, and their awesome pizza of the day if you're on this side of Golden Gate Park!

Decided to take my SoCal friend here and decided to grab a quick bite before walking around with her. I love their freshly made foccacias and pizza, especially since I like having something quick, cheap, and savory.

My friend was super happy because they had vegan foccacia, and I was super happy because they had a mushroom one--win win for less than $5 each. You just self serve, grab a paper bag, pay for your goods, and watch as some of that saucy and slightly oily goodness seeps through the bag (so maybe you should grab two in case...and a couple napkins).
I completely forgot this time, but they have one type freshly made pizza of the day they will totally heat up for you. I'm definitely getting that next time. 

As for seating, they don't really have much indoor seating since it's mostly a grab-and-go-place. If it's not too chilly (ha.), there's a nice little parklet with some benches and tables right outside on the sidewalk that's nice to stop to quickly eat on. Otherwise, just bring your food to the museum areas and enjoy a picnic! 

Be aware they have a $10 credit card minimum. They aren't crazy strict if you're not too far off, but should still note it and bring cash!
author: Clarissa C.

description:
I went here on Saturday with a friend, purchased scones for the hubby and MIL and an Italian amaretto cookie for myself. All of the items were fresh and delicious, the amaretto cookie was so delightful, I immediately turned around and purchased three more. After my husband and MIL ate the cookies, they've now been dubbed crack cookies.

I don't have a sweet tooth but the texture and taste of these was so good I ate two. After eating several baked goodies, my sweet tooth was more than satisfied; by day's end, I was going through the five stages of grief from the sugar ~ but it was WELL worth it.

Warning, there is a line, and it gets crowded, and there's no parking, but the line moves quickly and the reward of sugary baked heaven is worth the wait. I had to hit the gym afterward for an hour of cardio to assuage my guilt but who cares, one only lives once.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
On 9th street you'll find Arizmendi Bakery. This place was lively around lunch time. 

I picked up a single slice of pizza , a chocolate chip cookie and another baked good. 

The pizza was thin crust and pretty tasty while the cookie and the other baked good weren't nearly as impressive. 

I have them at 3 stars and at #26 in my SF Bakeries list below.

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. 

Here is a look at how I rank the SF Bakeries I've visited and I indicated what they're known for or a dish I recommend:

Rod's SF Bakery rankings (and what they're known for or what I like). ?) Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.

35 Vive La Tarte=tacro
36 Jane The Bakery=matcha twist , cardamom Lattice Bun
37 Café Madeline=various goods
38 Panaderia La Mexicana=mexican sweet bread
39 Hot cookie=Cookies
40 Les Gourmands Bakery=Croissant
41 Grand Mission Donuts and Bakery
author: Rod M.

description: This is my go to spot for breakfast. There's always a line when I go no matter what time of the day it is. Don't worry. The line moves fast. They have wide variety of baked items which is freshly made. It can be confusing for first timers because they have so many selections from pizza to pastries. Most are regulars that already know what they want, so they know what to grab while in line as they go. While in line, you will see the pizza display case first. I grabbed a slice of their special of the day pizza. There are 3 more display cases ahead of me. Since there is a line formed, it was difficult to walk up see what else they have to offer. I basically had to wait in line to walk pass every display case and then go back in order to finalize what I want without over grabbing everything I see in line as I go.
author: Tiffany L.

description: I love this bakery and envy anyone who lives within walking distance from it! The zucchini kale focaccia bread was soooo good, chewy and crispy and garlicky - all the things you wish for in a savory focaccia. For sweets, we had the blueberry scone which was beyond scrumptious and the almond croissant - super flaky!
author: Rachel C.

description: Lines get so long here on the weekends. The bakery goods are delicious, but the prices make up for it with the fresh appeal. Arizmendi is conveniently nearby the N bus stop, and even has outdoor seating.
author: Erica K.

description: Their pizza and bakery items are seriously on another level! I haven't had a pizza flavor I wasn't satisfied with. They have the most unique pizza flavors and they vary every single day - check their website for the pizza schedule. $3/slice isn't bad at all and it's delish!
author: Vicky R.

description: I remember trying them for the first time in Berkeley. The pizza was great and their bakes items are really good. I tried the Italian and dark chocolate cookies which were yummy. Very friendly service as well.
author: Sunil R.

description: Decent pizza. Other bake goods were fine. I personally would visit just for the pizza.  Although, I do think the east bay and cheese board locations were better than this Sunset location.  Pizza here were slightly mushy side. If you like your extra crispy pizza, you wont get it here. If you're new to Arizmendi, the pizzas change everyday, so I cannot comment on which one is better. So come here for the treasure hunt and discover what they have for the day.
author: Jason C.

description:
I was finishing up breakfast down the street and as I walked out, I smelled something delicious. It smelled like cheeseboard pizza so I traced the scent to this bakery. They make vegetarian pizza on sourdough bread just like cheeseboard! The pizza tasted just as fresh. Each slice is only $3 dollars.

There's also a good selection of bread and pastries. As much as I wanted to try their fresh bread, I was on a mission to get the pizza that dragged my nose into the store. I would absolutely come back to this location to get pizza again. It definitely saves me to long drive to Berkeley for what I consider the best vegetarian pizza ever.
author: Andrew T.

description: Carb heaven.  I haven't tried anything from this bakery that I haven't loved.  I've even gone out of my muffin & scone comfort zone & tried their tomato cheese roll for breakfast (delicious).  Truly a neighborhood favorite.
author: Molly M.

description:
Finally made it to the oh so popular  Arizmendi after a walk up the tiled steps on 16th. We tried a gluten free blueberry scone, cheese roll, slice of pizza, and an oatmeal chocolate cookie. I don't think you can go wrong with anything here - wish I could've tried one of everything! The gluten free scone was really good (for a gluten free pastry) and the cookie was so indulgent, chewy, and perfect. 

Definitely get a slice or two of their pizza of the day - they know what they're doing when it comes to pizza. The toppings are fresh and flavorful on a wonderfully crispy crust. Love that nothing is too $$$ so you can load up on all the pastries and not break the bank.
author: Renu A.

description:
Still 5 stars!! I'm back and I'll be back again! Their vegan focaccia aka vegan pizza was surprisingly warm and toasty. What a pleasant surprise! I thought it was served cold since they're put on the bread/pastry shelf. For $4.25-$4.75 a slice, I think they're more filling than a $3 average slice of pizza. 

Also, the people of this employee-owned bakery are simply good people. I was sitting on the bench outside munching away, and the cashier popped his head out the door to let me know the rest of my order was ready at the register. Considering there were customers waiting in line, it was nice of them to go beyond. Love their all inclusive motto (see photo.) 

$10 minimum credit card charge but that's ok I just treated myself to three slices.
author: Mandy L.

description:
A worthy 5 star place that will have you wanting to go back for more.  The kind of pining you get for your bed after a long day: excited to ease into a warm soft goodness that makes you forget all your worries.  Arizmendi is hard to bash because of their perfection.  Rarely do you get 5 stars all around from the average yelper save for the most conservative of yelpers but this place has done it.  

Their pizzas are perfectly doused in oil and delicious toppings and cooked to a delightful crisp along the edges.  I have enjoyed the one with roasted tomato on it and the one with corn and other "fiesta" appropriated toppings.  All the scones are amazing.  Buttery, sweet and a soft inner center.  Most of the time I eat multiple scones because you know I just want to learn how each one tastes.  I do the same with the pizzas.  Just to try them all.  No im addicted.  Everything is so good my gosh.

Coffee is decent.  Cash only.  Outside seating is contained to a couple tables and a few benches.  No bathrooms.
author: Rob C.

description: This bakery is a coop. That is it's a nonprofit and the people working there are in it for the work. And it shows. The muffins, danishes, breads and the other baked goods are made with care.
author: Leung T.

description:
Walked in to get a cup of coffee and came out with more.

First time here and I noticed people were grabbing an empty bag by themselves and selecting pastries alongside the wall. So naturally I thought to myself, "Hm, I guess I should maybe get a pastry or (two) too." And that's how I ended up getting their cheese dough and ($3) and chocolate sourdough croissant ($3.75) in addition to the coffee.

Came here pretty early around 8:30am on a weekday. Their doors were wide open and welcoming, sun was shining and the air was crisp. I'm so glad I got their pastries. They got me through a long road trip for hours. 

First off, I'm not sure about the others but the ones I selected were pretty dense. The chocolate sourdough croissant was so amazing that I almost wanted to stop and get a cup of milk somewhere. It was still warm inside so I'm assuming they were fresh out of the oven. As for the cheese dough, the more you chew the tastier it gets! It might be hard at first to rip off a piece but once you start chewing you taste the cheese flavor just oozing out. Both pastries kept me full for a while and they were even better with coffee.

I'll have to go back next time I'm around the area to try some of their other baked goods!
author: Christine S.

description:
Great place to get a slice of fresh, hot, mostly organic vegetarian pizza and any number of baked goods. Favorites: ricciarelli (Italian cookies made of almond paste), cheese rolls, and the chocolate thing. 

High quality ingredients and dependably consistent quality at this worker owned co-op. I'm a regular.
author: Jeanie S.

description:
Absolutely love, love, loooveee this place!! 

I wanted a change of scenery, so I decided to make the trek to SF and study at the UCSF Parnassus library. Around midday, I felt like taking a break, so I went out to get some fresh air. I took a walk around the area near campus and came across Arizmendi Bakery. I'd heard so many good things about this place, and I'd always wanted to go, so finding this on my stroll was a nice surprise. I walked in...and oh my goodness...the wafting aroma of pizza, focaccia, bread, scones, muffins...*drools* give me all da carbs and gluttony

Cheese Board (in Berkeley) is my favorite restaurant in the Bay Area. They're also a worker owned co-op like Arizmendi. They serve one type of vegetarian sourdough pizza a day too. I was so, so, soooo excited to finally be trying Arizmendi's!! Upon first bite, I was craving more. Arizmendi did not disappoint. The cheese was the perfect gooeyness/rigidness, the crust was brown in all the right places, the toppings complemented each other to create the most savory, flavorful, aromatic taste...the pizza that day was house-made tomato sauce, smoked gouda, garlic oil, parsley and parmesan cheese, and it was absolutely delicious!! 

I think they have a $10 card minimum because I remember paying with cash since I only got the slice

Bottom line: I'll definitely be back!! The pizza was absolutely divine, and the other pastries and breads looked scrumptious too. The focaccia was calling my name, but I wasn't super hungry at the time...but I'll be back for you. I WANT TO TRY EVERYTHING!! If you're a fan of Cheese Board and Sliver in Berkeley, you'll surely be a fan of Arizmendi
author: Kithumini J.

description: I was a non-believer before I came here.  Heard about the hype, but I came, I ate a whole pizza, and I went to heaven.  I didn't leave any room for desert so that's my next mission.  I think it's only $20 for a whole pizza and they bake it in ten minutes.  All vegetarian but it pleased this carnivore.
author: Bailey N.

description: I have yet to find anything to criticize at this place! Any kind of scone with a cup of organic coffee is so satisfying! Their wheat bread is so enticing I can't stop eating them. And the friendly staff makes you feel like you are at a friend's house.
author: SJ L.

description:
A cozy little bakery and pizza store located in the inner Sunset district. Stopped by here for a quick bite. I got a slice of the pizza of the day ($3), which happened to be mushroom with sesame-ginger-garlic vinaigrette. The pizza itself was solid: the layer of cheese and mushroom went well with the soft cooked dough and crust. However, I didn't really like the vinaigrette as it added a bit of sweetness to a mostly savory pizza.

Their bread options looked decent as well, though I came pretty late in the day and they didn't have many options left.
author: Alvin W.

description: I often walk into Arizmendi and don't end up getting anything. Today I decided to try their pizza($3/slice). The slices are small, so you might get 2 at a time. Today's toppings were artichoke and onion. It was pretty good. Lots of fun baked goods here.
author: Denise C.

description:
I am a big fan of the cheeseboard cooperatives. In comparison, I would choose cheeseboard pizzas over Arizmendi - no one can resist their delectable green sauce! With this in mind, it is still nice to go to Arizmendi for their fresh baked goodies.

I like Arizmendi's scones and bread, everything is freshly baked and still warm! Though I must warn that they do not slice bread here! When you buy a loaf of bread, you should expect to slice it yourself.
author: Tina O.

description:
Another hip coffee shop, but I'll write about their chai.

The house made chai is incredible. I came in with a terrible cough looking to soothe my aching throat. The chai was perfect - smooth, milky, frothy, hot but not super hot. It was just what I needed to calm my cough. 

I also got the Wolverine roll which was very interesting and tasty. Many breads/sweets look delicious here, I'm definitely coming again, getting that chai and something delicious looking.
author: Irina R.

description: There was a line out of the door. Bay to breakers was going on in the background, not sure how much of the foot traffic was generated from that. The berry coffee cake was so moist with perfectly sweet crumbles and the very scone was fluffy and buttery. I saw other people order these pizza things that looked really amazing! Im sure they were good since everything else was so great. I'm going to have to try that next!
author: Crystal L.

description: This is our got place for our favorite cherry corn scones,  and love there amaretto cookies.  Or a slice of there begins pizza for lunch.  Always fresh and hot out of the item. We try to support employee owned place.  What a way to put a smile on our faces. Don't let the lack parking scare you off,  a little walk helps walk off the great food.
author: Greg L.

description:
The baked goods here are amazing! Love the almond cookies (2.50) made with almond flour and rolled in powder sugar. It has a soft and chewy texture and almost taste like a cross between a macaron and sugar cookie. Would definitely recommended! 

One type of pizza ($3) is made throughout the day. They are thin sliced pizzas with a good amount of toppings and flavors. A lot of crunch to it because the dough is quite thin.
author: Chrisy T.

description: We ran into this place by accident, seeing a bunch of ppl standing in queue. We ordered chocolate and berry souer bread and pizza. Very unique flavor.
author: Yifei W.

description: How have I managed to not write a review of Arizmendi until now?  I went recently and got a loaf of their daily special, a cherry chocolate sourdough round for $5 and it was fantastic!  The loaf was still warm, the texture was perfect, they didn't skimp on the cherries or chocolate, and the slightly tart cherries complemented the chocolate so well.   The $4 rustic sourdough round was also good for sandwiches.  This time I also wanted to try something new so I got a brioche knot but was unimpressed as it was denser than I was hoping for.  We also tried a blueberry scone and it was pretty good but not as good as the corn cherry scone.  In the past I've also ordered their Cheeseboard pizza and it too is good.  I'm definitely a fan!
author: Beatrice W.

description: This place was insanely good. When I got there on a Saturday afternoon after walking around the park, de Young, and SF Botanical Garden, I wanted to eat everything I saw. I took home a little bit of each item: shortbread cookies, cowgirl cookies, a boule of levain, focaccia (STILL WARM), a slice or two of pizza, and an apple scone.  Pretty much all of it was delicious, but the true standout was the focaccia and its innovative toppings. The other item that I couldn't get enough of was the cardamom shortbread cookie, which was an addicting flavor.  I'm glad I don't live nearby, or I would basically live on carby baked goods from here.  The only drawback is the tiny little space, and weird layout to grab your items while waiting in the long line.  However, it makes sense since the place is so small (especially when half-filled with giant strollers). My only other complaint is that the guy did not bag my items, and instead just handed me the bag so I could hurriedly pack my items while he helped the next person. I thought that was a little wonky, but ymmv.
author: Kati P.

description: Bought the cheese scone and pizza of the day! Both were superb and very delicious! Would go again and try their shortbreads and focaccia breads!!!
author: Alyssa D.

description:
Absolutely LOVE going here. I used to come for the daily pizzas, but now that I've grown more intolerant to dairy, my sister and I actually come here for the pastries & bread. 

The vegan CHOCOLATE MINT COOKIE is seriously crack. I'm sure it's the molasses...I think that makes it SO CHEWY and SOFT. like please teach me. HOW do I make cookies like this?! Although perhaps not because then I'll just be eating a dozen a day. (MUST get here early to ensure your dose of chocolate). Last time I came, they ran out so I asked and they just made a fresh batch - aka WARM FRESHLY BAKED CHOCOLATE HEAVEN. 

The sourdough baguette pieces are absolutely so soft (when eaten fresh) and pretty cheap. It's a perfect size for when you crave sourdough bread like my sister and I do. We naturally buy as many as we can at once (get here early or they run out).  

My sister also gets the vegan focaccia, which is great when you love to eat focaccia but is lactose intolerant. SPEAKING OF vegan goodies, the LEMON POPPYSEED MUFFINS. Excuse all my caps, but these are also the bomb diggity. Usually when you get the fresher batch, the muffin tops are the 2nd greatest thing ever (after the cookie). 

So next time you come here, please do your mind, heart, soul, and stomach the goodness of pleasing it with these goodies.
author: Cheri C.

description:
Worker-owned. Prices are reasonable enough for San Francisco. You aren't paying the Starbuck's overhead to some McDonald's-like corporation, you're giving it to a totally local, worker-owned cooperative. 

Anyway, the vegan Foccaccia and pizza crust are outlandishly good. The soda bread is dreamy if you can catch it on St. Pat's. The lemon poppyseed muffins are perfectly good for dinner. 

I came home to look at the Web site and see if they generally use organic sustainable ingredients but found nothing informative in that regard. Nevertheless I'm sure it's all hearty. No crash after eating a slab of dough the size of a window pane. Let the garlic be your decision.
author: Roxmarie M.

description:
We visited on Mother's Day and they had the pastry special w/ blueberries.  Everything that we picked was good.  The brownies were a little meh..but it was all good. 
Parking is non existent so I just got dropped off in the corner.  There were street market and other stuff going on so it was super packed and busy. 
This is worth a try.
author: May A.

description: I've only been here once and I'm hooked. The flatbread daily special is off the hook! They are fancy and gourmet ingredients and baked to perfection. Also for only $3, you can't go wrong. Definitely get two if you're hungry. So cool that they offer a variety of baked in the house goods. So many to choose from it's awesome. It's cool that they have vegan options too. Can't wait to go back and try the other flatbreads. :)
author: Jim G.

description: Wanted to try the cheese rolls but they were out. Like that things come out fresh. The pizza was AMAZING.
author: Julianna L.

description: Arizemendi is mainly known for their baked goods.  They sell scones, breads, and many other bread related food.  I came here solely for their pizza.  It goes for 3 dollars a slice and pretty good.  I've had Cheese board pizza, which was amazing and I've heard how close they are to taste and texture so I stopped by for a slice.  Loved it!
author: Danny N.

description: First time here and it is a little gem! Grabbed a blueberry and strawberry scone and a cookie to go and enjoyed a slice of pizza while I was there. The pizza of the day was homemade sauce with basil pesto. The slice was so delicious. The crust was insane and the garlicky greatness of the pesto was intoxicating. I could have ate a pizza to myself. I can't wait to go back and try more of what they have.
author: Melissa Z.

description:
This really is a wonderful bakery! Their baked goods, both savory and sweet are amazing and decently priced for SF. Service is wonderful and even when there is a line it goes fast.

I recommend the bialy and every flavor of scone.
author: Hagit K.

description:
Since word off the streets were that Arizmendi's pizza was as good as Cheeseboard's, I had to check this place out. But alas, I came in the morning so I decided to settle with a pastry and the sourdough croissant piqued my interest. Sourdough is the best, and croissants are even better, so I figured the combination must be good. Is it the best croissant I've ever had in my life? Yes, quite possibly. Is it the most unique croissant I've ever had? Yes, most definitely. 
As a Cheeseboard lover, I am eager to return and try some of their pizza. I'll be back for you, sourdough pizza!
author: Jessica H.

description:
This bakery sells a uniquely flavored pizza each day, and I've been twice and felt like I hit the lotto twice. At 2.75 a slice, it's not the cheapest option, but they do tend to give you a little more than a slice :) 

Bakery-wise, I've enjoyed a lot of their options, from their bread to their cookies. I particularly enjoy their peanut butter cookie. Friendly service and a nice, relaxing environment. Parking can be tricky, but what can you expect from the area?
author: Innsu K.

description: Better to go during the week rather than the weekend when it's common to find a line out the door. Parking is nearly impossible on a weekend also.
author: Mrs G.

description:
Wow! Their Green Tea Shortbread is out of this world! It has the flaky, easy-to-break, buttery consistency of a good shortbread with ACTUAL bits of GREEN TEA LEAVES. Repeat: Not matcha powder, but green tea leaves. It has the same taste as if I were drinking a cup of loose leaf green tea. Now that I've awakened to this existence of Green Tea (leaf) Shortbread ($2 each), I need Arizmendi in my life. (Update: sadly, this isn't offered everyday but they have other delicious shortbread.)

In the same visit, I also tried the massive Chocolate Chip Cookie ($2.50) and daily pizza ($3). The Chocolate Chip Cookie tastes different from those in other stores - for starters, it's bigger (Sorry, I really had to point that out) and it's not overpoweringly sweet. It's also soft, chewy, a little crumbly, and pretty addicting. The cookie would get a 4/5.

The pizza of the day had artichoke hearts, spinach, ricotta (I think), and herbs. I wasn't fond of it because the artichoke hearts made it sour. The crust wasn't anything special and the cheese was pretty rich/milky. That pizza might have been a 2/5 for me.
author: Sarina C.

description: If you want freshly baked things DAILY, then this is the place to go. Nothing but the best ingredients at this bakery. Great costumer service, and great food/ pastries.
author: Marissa L.

description: loved this place. My cousin took me here while we were visiting SF and this was one of our favorite places. Looked like a place mostly locals go to on a weekend morning with their families. Their pastries were delicious. Also, I was extremely excited to see bialies and they were pretty good. They also have vegan options too. Really a great place all around. And the coffee was good too. Definitely will go again if/when I am in the area
author: Alex S.

description:
Arrived at 10:45 am and, yeah, their pizza of the day had just come out of oven.

It was sooooo good.

Broccoli,,roasted garlic, Parmesan cheese, thyme oil.  Wish it was bigger for $2.75. But it is the perfect pizza,

So easy to walk here after visiting different places all thru Golden Gate Park.

January 2, 2016 today after walking all over golden park we stopped here for Saturday's Pizza
marinated artichoke hearts, spinach, feta cheese, garlic oil, p&p

June 15, 2017
Mixed greens tomato Gorgonzola.  Fantastic

May 16, 2018
Asparagus, goat cheese, mozerella, thyme
author: Foodlover B.

description:
I adore this gem of a bakery. It's just so authentic and delicious and WOW. The pizza was so bomb and fresh, I had the roasted potato, spinach, dubliner, garlic oil, parsley, and Parmesan pizza and I'm already craving more. I'll definitely be back to try the mushroom pizza, but they only have one type of pizza a day so you can't be too picky. 

I also tried the gluten free blueberry scone and provolone olive roll. Both were super delicious! And the scone wasn't too sweet, which was great! I highly recommend this place for a quick treat and/or pick-me-up :) the service was great too.
author: Nikki R.

description: Wow!! amazing pizza. Pizza's of the day is all they have so don't go here if your looking to get just a plain cheese pizza. But if you are into trying new things GO HERE. Didn't try anything in the bakery unfortunately but it all looked delicious. Had great service and the outside little patio is very nice in the summer. Will definitely be returning here soon.
author: Lauren E.

description: Used to live across the street and just loved this little bakery - everything, especially the bread and pizzas are so tasty. Who knew a bakery could make such good pizza?!
author: Megan C.

description:
Arizmendi is a fantastic little bakery that churns out a bunch of great bread, pastries, and, of course, pizza. I went to pick some bread up on a Saturday for a house party, and we selected the wolverine loaf (which was kind of like a harvest bread with dried fruit) and the apple sage sourdough loaf (lots of dried apples along with the classic Thanksgiving herb). We also got two sesame/sunflower seed rolls, and of course, I had to try a slice of the pizza of the day, which was a three mushroom, ginger vinaigrette. 

The wolverine loaf was surprisingly tart from the dried fruit, and the rolls were great as well with a nice hearty nutty flavor. Overall, though, my favorite bread was the apple sage sourdough, which had a nice moist, chewy texture! The pizza was decent, though a little bit on the oily side and a bit expensive for the price. While I wouldn't necessarily come back just for the pizza, I'd love to try more of their breads and pastries, which can be had at a great value!
author: David K.

description:
I don't know why all of the Arizmendi family of restaurants aren't listed on this Yelp page. Until just now, I didn't have any idea one exists in San Rafael. I love this place. I've been going to The Cheese Board in Berkeley since it was a little place on Vine St. 

Arizmendi is a fantastic offshoot. The pizza is amazing, no matter what they put on it. Order a slice and you almost always get a little extra slice on the plate. Now that I live in the city, I go to the Mission location. All of them have delicious offerings that change daily. 

My mouth is watering.
author: Judith Z.

description: I tried their pizza bread, corn muffins, brioche bread and carrot muffin. It was all satisfactory except for the brioche bread which went rock-hard within 24 hours. I'd visit here again, probably for the pizza bread.
author: rado l.

description:
Easily the best bakery in San Francisco (yes, better than Tartine). After years of going here every week, here are my Do's and Don'ts: 

1) Don't miss the pizza. It's available at 11am every day and you can get a quick slice or a whole pie. I think it's better than their sister spot, Cheeseboard in Berkeley. Like Cheeseboard, they only offer one glorious flavor and it is ALWAYS delicious.

2) Don't let the line turn you off. It moves quickly. I've never waited more than 10 minutes. 

3) Do grab a cup of coffee in a mug at the Beanery down the street and return the mug when you're done. It feels like home to have great coffee in a mug, and you can drink it while you stand in line. 

4) Do try the scones! My favorite is the oat scone. It's got a little more crunch and it's less biscuit-y than the scone of the day. But if you prefer a more biscuit-style scone, go for the scone of the day with delicious chunks of fruit in it. 

5) Do look for the pumpkin muffin! It's seasonal and phenomenal, with candied walnuts on top. Nothing's better with a warm cup of coffee. 

6) Don't forget they have a $10 cash minimum and they do tend to get grumpy about it, so bring cash. 

7) I don't have kids, but they seem to live for the breadsticks. If you're bringing kids, give them a try. 

Enjoy Arizmendi! It's a local's favorite.
author: Celie H.

description:
This was a go to spot to escape the office and grab a quick bite when I worked near by many years ago. It's almost always crowded but you can't blame them when simple pastries and carb delights are this good.

Nothing remains the same on a daily basis which encourages you to try something new and appreciate your favorite when it's being made that random day. Almost anything chocolate here is good and the pizzas, especially veggies, are fantastic for a quick bite on the run.
author: Hala A.

description:
I drop by here maybe once a month and am sure to bring friends when they visit. I've tried their scones, focaccia (a great deal), pizza (oh the pizza!), and cheese rolls. Everything is handcrafted/wonderful/amazing. No frills here, just well made breads and baked goods. The workers are incredibly friendly, and prices are fair. 

If you have tried the Cheeseboard in Berkeley, you'll enjoy the pizza here as well. I believe they're part of the same collective.
author: Lauren C.

description: The chocolate cake is terrific!! The seasonal pizza slices are also usually very delicious. They always have fresh bakery stuff being made. Last but not the least, their stuff is very fairly priced.
author: Ushma S.

description:
Although this was my first visit to Arizmendi in the Sunset, I have been a longtime patron of the Arizmendi in Oakland and also Cheeseboard in Berkeley, so I knew what I was getting into.  You can't really beat fresh baked breads, patries, cookies, pizza galore made with TLC.  Arizmendi is a co-op bakery, which means it's run by the community and I am all for that.  Thank you Arizmendi bakers for waking up at the crack of dawn every morning and start creating and baking all the goodies at 4am!  

I don't think there's anything in the shop that I wouldn't like to eat.  Everything looks and smells delicious.  It's hard not to fill up a bag or two before getting to the register.  All the baked goods are made with wholesome, seasonal ingredients.  It's honest baking at it's best.  

This location is small but there are a few seats outside (although always filled with people).  Your best bet is to take it to go and you will end up taking some to go regardless if you eat there or not.  It's that good.  The only problem I have with the grab a bag in line and start filling it up system is that I always am so indecisive on what to get.  Everything looks so good, so it's hard to narrow down the selection.  Basically, by the time you have reached the register with your bag(s) of baked items, just tell the cashier what you have in the bag.  They never question you or look in the bag, so it's really an honor system.  They only accept cc payments if your total is more than $10.      

On my last visit, I picked up a raspberry and peach scone, a pecan roll and a slice of the daily pizza.  The scone was yummy just as other yelpers have mentioned - crisp on the exterior but soft like cake on the inside.  The pecan roll is like a cinnamon roll upgraded.  Nice and sticky, filled with pecans but not too sweet.  The pizza of the day was house-made tomato sauce, spinach, fontina, garlic oil.  Wasn't wowed by the pizza but it was good.  Definitely wasn't one of their best.  I do love the thin crust and veggie element though, since those are my preferences for pizza.  Total was $9.50.  Will be back to try out some of the other breads and pastries soon!
author: Liv A.

description: Tried a slice of pizza with mixed greens, feta, rosemary oil, parsley and Parmesan. Very good pizza slice!
author: Shelly N.

description: Picked up a pizza here for dinner, and it was phenomenal! The pizza of the day was a mushroom pizza. It had a really rich savory flavor with tons of garlic! The crust was awesome too, flavorful and with a good chew. My boyfriend and I ended up just sitting at the window and devouring the whole thing! It was the perfect portion size for the two of us too. And for $24 for the whole pizza, it was a pretty good deal for dinner for 2! We ended the meal with a chocolate mint cookie which was HUGE and delicious! The perfect minty bite! Overall, we'll definitely be back to try more of their pizzas and the other baked goodies!
author: Rachel D.

description:
Maybe my favorite bakery in sf (sorry tartine and b.patisserie)? 

They have the best savory veggie focaccia selection and I am obsessed with their daily veggie pizzas (order by the $3 slice or whole pie). Which is saying a lot because meat is important to me.

In addition to the well-known cheese rolls, focaccia, and pizza a la Cheeseboard in Berkeley, 
Hidden gems to try include:
Any variation of their Blueberry scone
Sourdough chocolate croissants

Multiple locations, but this one in the inner sunset is  closest to my heart as it was the first I visited when I moved to the city!
author: Cindy T.

description:
Addendum
Not remembering that i'd reviewed this place before I had to read my initial installment first. Sadly the majority of what I wrote still holds true and still with no serious competition in the neighborhood I continue to selectively shop there. I'm now compelled to challenge them to reverse the disappointing changes made to the corn blueberry muffins. Not so much corn flavor or grain anymore and the texture is gummy. And I'd like to give a third star but there's so much that is inconsistent with their quality that I just can't make that leap! Very sad! I just wish I wanted more of the things I assume they do well!
author: j d.

description:
A friend of mine told me she travels all the way from portrero hill just to eat at this bakery. I can see why!  It's carb heaven in here, but not just a wasteful amount of carbs to eat. Every bite is savory and mouth watering! You have quite a few choices of types of breads, scones, and bites. 

They also have a different type of pizza everyday. We chose to try their pizza which had potato fingerlings, cheese, parmesan and something else. Super good and fresh out of the oven! The crust is quite crispy and can be considered a thin pizza. Their toppings are generous and in this case with the potatoes, you get quite full from just one slice. If I'm ever back in the area I'll definitely be back to try their other baked goods. There are just so many wonderful bakeries in the bay area!
author: Lilian N.

description: There's a line of the door every time so that must mean something, but the line moves quickly. My 4 star review is probably bias because of the line and because I'm not a bread critic. I got the coffee cake slice with their homemade chai. The coffee cake should be shared or saved for later. It was moist and tasty with real apple bits. The chai was decent, just not as strong as I preferred.
author: Ellen L.

description: For a bakery they have a great balance between savory and sweet options. There is literally something for everyone all at high quality.
author: Kira S.

description:
Woooooo I love the scones and the baked goods! Everything is fresh and delicious, and whenever I come here I'm tempted to just buy all the baked goods + bread. I have yet to try all of them, but getting a scone + a coffee (the coffee is just meh) has become a regular weekend tradition for me. They have some pretty casual outdoor and indoor seating that rotates out frequently, so I sit outside when it's sunny and enjoy the weekend hustle and bustle. 

I know it's a spin-off from Cheeseboard, BUT I don't think the pizza is as good as it is there. Having said that, I like that the lines aren't ridiculously long and you don't have to wait a long time to get what you want. They also do the same 2 slices + 1 sliver, which I appreciate. 

Yes to bakery! Meh to pizza.
author: Julianna K.

description: While staying nearby our group popped in for a quick bite for breakfast. There was a 10minute wait as the line snaked out of the door but the staff seemed efficient and moved folks along. I chose the house made chai tea -- which definitely tasted fresh and made by the shop rather than from concentrate like other commercial chains do -- and had a carrot muffin that was delicious and moist. I bought a cowgirl cookie, which I believe was gluten free (which isn't necessarily something I look for), and was really happy with the taste and texture of the cookie. I love when the yelp reviews and recommendations really get it right and this is one of those times! I'll be back next time I'm in the area.
author: Jordann A.

description: Tried the chocolate brioche and the sourdough croissant on a Sunday morning. Neither seemed spectacular. They were actually kind of dry- disappointing!
author: Piper W.

description: Not accepting credit card for under $10? What kind of retarded policy is that? Fewer and fewer people are carrying cash. After waiting for ten minutes, I am told that they don''t take card for a scone purchase?? Absolutely backward!
author: bora o.

description: I stopped by for slice of pizza. It had red onion, garlic, basil, and feta cheese. It was one of the best slices of pizza I have ever eaten. I also purchased hummus that was very good.
author: Amanda S.

description: We love the sourdough pizza, especially the triple mushroom and the curry & kale, yummy! Also, a huge fan of the bialys and the corn & cherry scones.
author: Charlene L.

description:
A cooperative bakery... that is genius. Did I use the term correctly? Not important. The only thing you really need to know, the pizza is amazing. It rivals any slice in NYC. And it's affordable at only $2.75 each. Move over, dollar slices. Affordable pizza that actually tastes good is here.
I didn't know meatless pizza could taste so good. Of course it helps that the vegetables are seasoned well, topped with a lot of herbs, cheese, and fragrant oils. The crust is wonderfully thin and crispy. It does tend to get oily, though that doesn't bother me. I think my favorite is the marinated artichoke, spinach, garlic oil, parmesan pizza. Very strong savory flavors. I think I'm usually good with about two slices.

There's plenty of sweet and savory baked goods and fresh bread throughout the store. Plus, there is a decent cheese selection in the fridge. They sell Cowgirl here.

I've tried some of their baked goods too. 
$2.75 Cheese Roll - perfectly baked golden brown with cheesy crust, with crisped up edges
$2.50 Corn Blueberry Muffin - great muffin, some of the blueberries sink to the bottom, kind of looks like a hat
$4.00 Brownie - rich with a hint of nuttiness 

The pizza is still the best thing to get. 

The bakery is a simple setup with a few seats along the walls and by the window, as well as some outdoor seating. 

Make loaves, not war. Yes, indeed.
author: Joy W.

description:
this is only for the sourdough crossiant which is DELICIOUS. I got it on saturday and am planning my next visit to get more and def more than 1 this time. $10 min for CC usage. Parking is a bit difficult at this location which shoulnd't be a surprise for inner sunset. 

great little shop with tons of options for bread and pastries as well as a couple of seating areas too.
author: Tao Tao W.

description: Everything is delicious here! My favorites are gluten free blueberry scone, coffee cake, and banana walnut muffin. People that work here have very kind heart. I always see them bring a cup of coffee for this blind lady that waits outside. Not sure but I think they give her a free drink everyday.
author: Clara L.

description: The pizza was excellent and the staff was very friendly. I will go back next time I am in San Francisco.
author: Vanessa P.

description:
arizmendi came highly recommended by a local and it didn't disappoint. 
really good focaccia bread pizza.  great bakery/bread selection.  super cute place.
author: Super B.

description:
Who doesn't love fresh baked goodies and bread. I love their offerings they have. Just liek their sister stores same great offerings no complaints here.

Parking is tough!
author: Meishi M.

description:
Some of the best scones I've ever had. I really wished I had been around when the pizza was available but I was a few hours too early.

There's a small store front and some small tables inside and outside for sipping your coffee. As you wait in line, you can grab a paper bag and some wax paper to pick out your baked goods. They just have a few cases with selves of stuff. There's also bread which they'll grab for you behind the counter. I got a scone of the day (raspberry apple) and an oat scone - total came out to $5.75

While these look like your typical scones, breaking into one was like taking a bite out of a moist cake. The outside has a harder shell but the inside is moist and fluffy. The texture is coarser than cake, but it's not really dry and crumbly like most scones. The oat scone is kind of like eating a giant oatmeal cookie with a hint of spice and some raisins scattered about. The raspberry apple scone was fruity though it would have been better with more apple chunks. These were slightly sweet but nothing overwhelming. I was out all day and slowly munched on these over a few hours - great snack. 

Oh, and there's a $10 credit card minimum, so bring cash if you're just stopping by for breakfast.
author: Liza X.

description: I'm a bit partial to this establishment because I lived in Berkeley and had the opportunity to consistently visit cheeseboard on a weekly basis.  Compared to them this place doesn't seem as busy so their food never feels as fresh as it could be.  The baked goods are seriously delicious.  I like to come here, ask what their freshest item is and fill up on that.  The pizzas as so so.  Great establishment for this neighborhood.  There is no other like it in SF (for now of course).
author: Samantha S.

description: What else can I say about Arizmendi? I am less inclined towards their pastries and morning buns but I am such a fan of the pizza. Incredibly crispy (and buttery?) crust, heavy on the garlic, go when there is corn and/or red sauce. Go with friends so you can get a whole pizza. (Protip: the monthly menu is online.)
author: Heidi L.

description:
Tip: have a good idea of what you want before you walk in, and grab a paper bag and piece of parchment paper to pick up your baked goods as you move in line. The breads and pastries are along the left wall as you walk in, the same side where the line follows toward the cash register. This makes it difficult to check out what's there before deciding on something. You have to be in line just to look.

As we made our way through the line, we picked up a sourdough croissant and a cheese scone. Didn't see the pizza menu until we got to the cash register and saw it written on a chalkboard on the wall. Now having checked their website, we should've checked their online menu for the pizza of the day. At the time, we decided to skip it.

- Sourdough Croissant ($3.50)
The croissant was much heavier than a traditional croissant and had an interesting flavor from the sourdough starter.

Cheese Scone ($3)
Very heavy too. Loved the crispy cheese on top, but the inside was more cornmeal than cheesy. Moist, but not a favorite.

Definitely will be back to try the pizza though.
author: Lindsey C.

description: Peach scone and coffee cake were so worth it!!! We would have loved to try their pizza too because it smelled delicious, but we were on our way to lunch. Looking forward to coming back here sometime in the future.
author: Patricia Y.

description: Good wild mushroom pizza, but pecan swirl was dry and way too sweet. Terrific friendly service, but not nearly enough seating. Such a shame that the moms with kids, who were camping out at largest communal table, would not take their bags off the seats to free them up for other customers. Ya think they'd want to set a better example for their kiddies.
author: Judy P.

description:
Nice selection of baked goods!

Context: Visited once on a weekend

I felt like a kid in a candy store! (Or a hungry carb lover in a bakery )

I got a garlic twist, cheese bread, and a bottled iced tea. My boyfriend got a pastry and a hot chocolate. Other friends got scones.

We happily munched on our treats while sitting in a parklet outside.

Next time I'm in the area, would love to stop in again for a scone, cookie, or one of the many other tasty-looking items!
author: Elizabeth C.

description: By FAR my FAVORITE PIZZA ever. I live in NY now and none of the NY pizzas could ever compare to Arizmendis. I used to come here every other day to get a slice or two of the pizza of the day, and I come every time I'm back visiting home. They have a new pizza of the day everyday, and it is always amazing. Other than their pizzas, their pastries/breads are to die for! If you are a local or a tourist, Arizmendis is a must try. I highly recommend.
author: Yeji S.

description: All I wanted was an Arizmendi Pizza for my birthday! It's delicious, fresh, and inventive.  The cheese rolls are always a bonus.  Friendly staff and don't be intimidated by the line out the door; they move fast.
author: Bhu P.

description:
Scones. In my world, a scone is plagued with an identity crisis. Firm, dry, doughy, flaky, crumbly, chewy? Is it supposed to be a bougie biscuit? A brittle bread??

Thankfully, Wiki came to the rescue. Scones are made with baking powder rather than the yeast that goes into most other sweet buns. "Round British scones can resemble North American biscuits in appearance, but scones traditionally rely on cold butter, while biscuits are more often made with other kinds of animal fat or vegetable shortening. Also, while scones are frequently (but not always) sweet, and served with coffee and tea, biscuits are served more as a bread, often with breakfast. In recent years, scones under that name have begun to appear in coffee houses. They are universally sweet, often containing fruit such as blueberries or raspberries, or else such flavorings as cinnamon."

Sounds delicious, right? And Arizmendi's scones, $3, are perfect examples. My scone of the day was BERRYLICIOUS and contained the most delicious strawberries you'll ever eat, plus some organic flour, butter, sugar, buttermilk, cream, baking soda, baking powder, and sea salt (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/arizmendi-bakery-san-francisco?select=bwXm0l6XuvuHqzZzA8PYPQ). Upon first impression, I was reminded of a firm berry buttermilk biscuit in terms of texture and flavor, like KFC biscuits but with more judicious butter usage. The edges were browned and and had a delicious crunch to them. The roommate thought it was too dry for her tastes. When I microwaved the leftover portion the next day, it got softer and reminded me of berry buttermilk pancakes/waffles. 2-for-1!

Their BRIOCHE KNOT, $2.75, is less exciting. Made with organic flour, water, butter, sugar, buttermilk, cream, organic eggs, golden raisins, sea salt, yeast, and cinnamon, it resembles good bread with a nice glaze and some raisins...and not even that many raisins (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/arizmendi-bakery-san-francisco?select=LmrMq0pOYvMm84CypHYAiQ). Pop it in your microwave for 15 seconds to warm it up and soften the dough.

Self-serve. Pizzas start rolling out at 11am. CCs accepted over $10. A few benches outside. Solid scones.
author: Adele F.

description: Very friendly and nice place! We found a freshly baked pizza with pesto as the pizza of the day which we loved.  We also had a cookie and spotted other things which seemed delicious. Recommended!
author: Andrea S.

description:
I appreciate the fact that they have a vegan focaccia bread option, with flavors rotating everyday. Everything is made fresh. Workers are super friendly. 

I just discovered how amazing the vegan chocolate mint cookie is. I believe it's the only vegan dessert they have, but I'm not mad about it. Perfect amount of chewiness, not overly sweet despite having chocolate chips in it (which aren't hard when you bite into them - they maintain that melt-in-your mouth consistency, even when they're not freshly made). This will be one of my go-to desserts whenever I'm in the area.
author: Stacey L.

description: I already loved their ready to bake pizzas. And now I've discovered their pastries. It's a favorite spot in the Inner Sunset.
author: Rob B.

description: Friendly and nice ambience. A great choice of breads and pastries. Not a bad pizza. However, the staff is slow. Prices slightly inflated.
author: Maisie D.

description:
Excellent focaccia and pizza
Very good choice for a quick lunch.
I have to go back and try their numerous breads.
author: Ivonne V.

description: Everything here is stellar. They do a wide range of baked goods including standard (but delicious) breads, scones, and cookies as well as seasonal variations of each and some amazing focaccia and pizzas. Like others have said, be ready to wait in line but it generally moves very quickly.
author: Curtis M.

description: Visiting from Las Vegas and needed something to eat before we started a guided tour. This place is a must stop. The Hot Cross Buns were super yummy. I know I would stop here often if I lived in town. We also had a strawberry scone that was just the way I like them. Sweet and tasty! Their house Chai was also a great way to start the day. Please stop here if you want a little something to start off your day right.
author: Chad S.

description: The line is out the door and the food is certainly worth all the buzz.  The pizza is delicious and creatively original. The pastries are like an orgasm in your mouth.  I wish my orgasms tasted like this, I'd be getting blow jobs three times a day.
author: Zeus M.

description: Pizza was great! A small line but goes very fast. Many choices of bakery goods too, we got the currant scone and loved it
author: Grace L.

description:
Such a great little gem!! It was super busy, and for good reason - the food was amazing! I just wish I had tried more of their bread and pastries! My friends and I came in craving pizza, and their pizza of the day was amazing! If I remember correctly, it had fontina, artichoke hearts, either kale or spinach, among other ingredients. Sooo good!! I also got a chocolate chip and double chocolate cookie. Great choice, as those were delicious, too!

It was pretty dang busy for a rainy Friday at 2pm, but we still managed to find a little area with four seats with a window facing the street. What a wonderful afternoon it was, with pizza and cookies! I'll definitely be back next time I'm in town!
author: Jane C.

description: The pizza changes every day and it's delicious. The dough is perfectly crunchy and the ingredients are fresh. The Foccacia is mmmmmm. The sauce has the perfect acidity with excellent toppings. On a cold day grab a pizza and hot chocolate.
author: Rick O.

description: Stopped by to pick up a apple cranberry pie for thanksgiving! Glad that they had one left. I highly recommend ordering one for next year. They have the best bread and pastries. The best part their service is Phenomenal!
author: Tina T.

description:
I stumbled upon this bakery on a Friday morning after an appointment I had down the street. It was about 10:30, past the normal weekday cafe shop kind of rush. However, there was quite a buzz going on inside that drew me to check it out. 

There was a small selection left of breakfasty items at this time of the morning and I spotted their gluten free blueberry scones. I'm not a strict GF person, and generally if I were to be "treating" myself I would go all out and get the good stuff. But to be honest, this was the tastiest looking pastry they had, and I'm not one to turn away something blueberry. So I got it, and it was amazing! (even for being gluten free)

This place stuck in my mind all weekend and I couldn't help but wonder what other tasty things they had. Sunday night I got myself to run down their and pick up a bag of their pre-made pizza dough. Made some pizza that night and it was the best "store bought" dough I've ever had! 

Ok, ok and I picked up a chocolate chip cookie. Couldn't resist. I don't regret it. It was PACKED with chocolate chunks. Very delish.
author: Kelly G.

description:
As a sourdough bread lover, what more could you ask for?! The shelves are stocked with loaves and loaves of sourdough bread (classic, rustic, round, sandwich, etc.). The classic sourdough with poppy seed was delicious! They also have a daily bread schedule and bake different types of bread each day. 

I came here just to get a loaf of bread, but the goat cheese pizza-of-the-day looked/smelled so good that I couldn't resist! Plus, the crust was made of organic sourdough!! 

The owners of this bakery were also very genuine and friendly that I'll definitely be back. I foresee lots of sourdough in my future diet...
author: Kris C.

description: Gluten free baked goods (regular glutenous baked goods, too) and fresh baked challah on Friday!  I love this place.  The line is insane, but moves quickly and is 100% worth the wait.
author: Katie S.

description: If you're picky about your pizza options do not go here. But if you like fresh pizza, that tastes amazing with fresh ingredients and is made with love then come!!  You get 2 pizzas of the day to choose from and they are phenomenal .... there are fresh baked goods such as breads, pastries, cookies to add to your carb load & .... there is usually a line. I used to go to their sister store in San Rafael for baked goods and donuts before work.... the two places are consistently excellent from my experience
author: Erin B.

description: Everything at this bakery is delicious, high quality and reasonably priced.  My favorite treat is the cornbread blueberry muffin.  Love Arizmendi Bakery!
author: Jenny B.

description: After reading the positive reviews I decided to head in and grab their daily pizza and it definitely lived up to the hype! Crunchy crust and delicious fresh toppings were fantastic. Slices were on the smaller side so I opted for 2 which worked out great.
author: Ariana A.

description: Got the cheese roll, which was a bit tougher than I expected, but quite delicious. I ate it during my hike around Land's End, the last bite was actually just cheese (not complaining). I wish I bought more snacks to eat along the way, like one of the scones, a piece of focaccia, or a cookie - I'll definitely be back (and hopefully add to this review)!
author: Gina L.

description: This place is fantastic! We got the daily focacia bread that was legitimately one of the tastiest things I've had. The pecan roll I got was moist and easily pulled apart, and the chocolate brioche knot my girlfriend got was solid, fluffy, and abundantly chocolatey. Absolutely going back.
author: Otis L.

description:
Came here for the pizza and scones. I really liked the pizza (vegetarian) and at $3/slice, it makes for a good afternoon snack. The crust is spectacular - pleasantly crunchy and crisp. You could break the crust and hear the lovely snap that it has. The toppings are pretty good and original too!

They have a wide selection of sweet baked goods and savory ones. Focaccia looked tempting but I think if you're gonna eat it there, get something that's hot from the oven. It really makes all the difference. Scones are okay - but wouldn't order again.
author: Cindy W.

description:
I was walking around the Inner Sunset and had to head to Arizmendi.  The first thing you notice when you walk-in, is the aroma of fresh bread.  That smell is addicting.  This location is smaller than the Oakland location, but you can tell that it's a local's favorite, based upon how many people were lined-up to enjoy the delicious treats Arizmendi has to offer.  Like their other locations, everything is freshly baked and amazing.  I typically go for the sweets and this trip wasn't any different.  

The Cheese Roll, Chocolate Thing, Chocolate Croissant, Regular Croissant and Lemon Poppyseed muffin were amazing.  Their coffee cake is awesome and it changes all the time, so I highly recommend it.  Of course the pizza's are amazing, but I've come to expect that, since their bread is so good.  

Service here was excellent and the staff was friendly.  I walked-out with a bag of goodies for less than $20.  Simply awesome.
author: Lon H.

description: Pizza here completely admires his taste. They sell exceptionally stunning taste and aroma of pizza. However, pizza is not the only good reason. There is also excellent baking.
author: Yehuda D.

description:
We love the asiago cheese bread and the scones. If you go early in the morning they come out fresh and you avoid the lines. 
Overall, everything is good here. We've been returning for a couple of years now and quality has never gone down! Love this place!
author: Goku U.

description:
Arizmendi!!!
We came here to try out this place that everyone raves about, beware of the line however it does move fast, so it's not too bad.

Once we finally made it in, we got a baked good with olives and tomato, 2 slices of the daily pizza and we also got a blueberry scone.

The Oliveands and tomato baked good wasn't great in my opinion, maybe because it sat out too long and wasn't as fresh, the pizza on the flipside was fresh and pretty good. The thing that stood out the most was the scone,  definitely the best scone I ever had, it wasn't dry which is my main complaint when I eat scones, it was pure deliciousness.

Overall all it's definitely worth the visit, I will definitely be back in the near future.

Ps: the baguette was sold out and it was 11 am so it must be good.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: I've had their pizza before and it was pretty good for a quick bit to eat on a cold day. However, this line is always long... because it's so good. I just picked up a bialy after visiting the autobody shop down the street this morning. Oh man, it was sooooo goood and actually quite inexpensive ($2.25) for a pastry compared to a Starbucks for example. I highly recommend you get a bialy (onion & poppyseed). It was warm when I picked it up too and it smells delicious inside. :) Also, they take credit card now for purchases over $10, otherwise I think it's cash only. There really isn't much indoor seating, so don't count on it, but they do have an outdoor seating parklet (I think that's the correct word for it). However, it's the inner sunset, where it's often cold. Would only hesitate to go back if the line was ridiculous.
author: Julie L.

description:
Arizmendi Bakery has been on my "to try" list for quite some time, and when I finally made my way over I was not disappointed! The pizza of the day was a delicious pesto, tomato, and mozzarella masterpiece. The crust was thin and crisp. The flavors were aromatic and strong, which worked together so nicely. My only regret was that I had just one slice. Next time I'll get two... or three.... or the whole pizza. They make a different pizza every day so you can come here frequently and still be able to mix it up and try new/ different things. Genius idea.
