They also have scones of the day. Not as delicious as the pizza, but hearty and not too sweet. The star was the ricciarelli (my grandfather always calls them 'wedding cookies'). They were some of the best I have ever had. Again I was regretting only getting one. 

Not a lot of seating, but that doesn't seem to be to much of a problem. There is a nice little "parklet" where you can enjoy your meal/ snack and do some people watching.
author: Catherine H.

description:
Cute breakfast/brunch place in the Sunsets! Also very tasty pastry. CASH ONLY for purchase less than $20.

FOOD: I got a pecan roll ($3) from one of the pastry stands and it was delicious and satisfying. It looked like a flattened/condensed cinnamon roll but not as sweet. It was about the size of my hand. The pastry was not too sweet but had brown sugar drizzle and sugar-coated pecan. I could have saved half for dessert but it was so good that I ate everything in one setting. I didn't feel grossed out because it didn't taste like it would give me diabetes. They also sell freshly made pizza for $2.50/slice or $22/whole pizza. 

PRICE: I paid $3 in cash and was very happy with my spontaneous purchase.

SETTING: Located on one of the busiest intersection in inner sunset, the place gets crowded during breakfast or brunch hours. There are 3 small tables inside and a few benches & tables outside. Whenever I pass by there is always a line. On Sundays there is also a whole food market right across the street! 

SERVICE: I stood in line for less than 5 minutes to pay for my pastry. The cashier was also very nice and friendly. 

OVERALL IMPRESSION: I've always heard about this place and I wasn't disappointed. I want to come back again to try their pizza/other pastry during brunch hours on a sunny day.
author: Wendy F.

description:
Their pizza is little oily but tastes good.
Muffin was moist and good.
Cookies are not impressed.
Croissants are expensive but other pastries are average price.
author: Kurumi O.

description: I think they just might be place with the best whole wheat bread in San Francisco. If they only had bread slicer it would be excellent. Also good staff . Never a bad experience!
author: Karina G.

description: Loved this place. So many vegan options. The mushroom focaccia was one of or the best to go vegan foods I've ever had. Plus the vegan chocolate mint cookie was outrageous. Plus it was really super affordable. The foccacia (huge) Plus the cookie and 2 pieces of pizza for my boyfriend and it was only $13.25. Definitely my new go to.
author: Camillia A.

description: It's a good thing I don't live closer to this place. The variety of baked goods, coffee, tea and a daily delicious pizza would make me so ridiculously unhealthy. Every thing looked amazing, but I decided to try their pizza, which you can buy by the slice or a whole pie. I had their "Sugar plum tomatoes, red onions, sweet corn, lime oil, cilantro, Parmesan" pizza which was absolute perfection. I'm still dreaming of it. Next time I'm in the area will definitely stock up on their breads and get a slice of their pizza which changes daily. Service was excellent, even though the line was out the door it moved along pretty quickly and staff was cheery and patient.
author: Angela D.

description: This place has the best pizza and tasty baked. Fresh and delicious bread. Friendly staff. Everything is great!
author: Mariah W.

description:
I was introduced to this bakery by my sister who has been a loyal customer for over 12 years! 
All their pastries and breads are made with sourdough. However, it does not have that usual sourdough taste that most breads have. Everything is always soooo fresh! Every day they have a different topping for their pizza and they sell them by the slice. One of my top favorites is their mushroom with sesame SOOOOO GOOOD and tasty! Their scones are always really good as well. They have a variety of flavors that they interchange with daily. Strawberry and blackberry are my two top flavors. Now for their savory. They have really good cold mushroom pizza and AMAZING Tomato and cheese bread (not sure of the correct name). Its lightly salted with a thin slice of tomato. The bread is always crunchy on the outside and soft and doughy in the inside, a MUST HAVE. 

Now for their drinks. I have only really had their coffee and mocha. Both are tasty. I never really get the small because their small is REALLY small lol. They have good Mochas also, however I always ask for extra hot.

Arizmendi has been on 9th Ave for 12+ years and they are a worker-owned co-op which I think is great because they really put in a lot of work and dedication to their amazing pastries, artisan breads, and pizzas.
author: Gabrielle C.

description:
Cozy bakery with super nice service. There's limited seating inside but they have more spots outside so it's a great place to catch up with friends. 

I only tried the coffee and chai here which were excellent. I wish I hadn't already had lunch when I stopped by. Their pizza and pastries looked amazing! They only make one type of pizza each day so you can check online for their schedule.
author: Linda X.

description: Great bakery, worth the hype, expect to wait in line, go with a group so you can try a bunch of things! Loved their croissants, cookies, scones, and pizza.
author: Gabriella M.

description:
They only sell one type of pizza per day (ours had some mushroom, fetta cheese, and other stuff) for $3 a slice, a little steep, but you can tell its a good quality slice of carbs. Good place to just grab a quick pastry or slice and be on your way. Seating isn't too abundant here, but if you manage the grab a bench/table its a nice atmosphere to grab a coffee. You can tell that they make some good quality pastries and that it is well loved by the locals. 

Stop by if you're in the area!
author: Amanda H.

description: Fresh made on the premise bread, pastries, pizza. High quality and good prices. Did I say Fresh! A must stop for your carb desires.
author: David H.

description:
Honestly, I have never been to Arizmendi in person. But I've been lucky enough to have people bring their pizzas to work. I've tried 2 different pizzas so far.

The first one was years ago and a spinach pizza. I love my meat, but even with just the veggies, this was delicious!

A couple weeks ago, I got to try another Pizza: mushrooms, sugar plum tomatoes, Dubliner cheese, garlic oil, scallions and parmesan. I adore mushrooms and the addition of the garlic and scallions was perfect! I'm not a huge fan of tomatoes as a topping, but the sugar plums gave it a slight sweetness which I thought worked. I loved the pizza so much, I had 4 slices!

I wish it was easier to get to Arizmendi. I'd have their pizza more often. I guess I'll just have to wait for the next person to bring a pizza to work.
author: Elena N.

description:
The pizza of the day was "roasted garlic, sugar plum tomatoes, feta cheese, lemon-thyme oil". I have had a lot of good pizza in my life, but somehow that breakfast slice just hit the spot. It was revolutionary- I couldn't stop gushing about it for the rest of the day. I can't speak for the other flavors, but if you see the above on their pizza menu (online), run there! 

Expect a line (at least on Saturday morning), but it moves reasonably fast. Scones were good as well, especially the corn cherry. Chai was decent but not groundbreaking.
author: Ivana J.

description:
It's so fluffy I'm gonna DIE. "It" referring to the light, buttery consistency inside Arizmendi's cakes and scones.

I happened to be nearby after breakfast and wandered into the line, observing that everyone on the wooden deck and bench outside were eating slices of pesto pizza. I wasn't yet aware that Arizmendi was related to Cheese Board until seeing the Cheese Board Collective Works book on a shelf above the coffee supplements counter. Hence the pizza craze. 

To me, pizza can only be so good. I was here solely to treat myself to the pastries. Grab a paper bag and some tissue paper right inside the door to keep your goodies in. I split a Strawberry Scone and Blueberry Coffee Cake. From the outside, the scone was nothing impressive. But once I broke off a piece, revealing the golden center, I knew this was a scone of scones. The outside is hard enough to give your teeth something to crunch into, but not so firm as to be brittle. The fruit is sweet and just a tad tart, and if I were one of these strawberries I would happily surround myself with the cakey goodness that makes up the rest of this scone. 

After the scone I was prepared to be disappointed with the coffee cake. First off, it was massive - I have pretty small hands, but this slab actually dwarfed one of them when I held it up. Not to mention I was pretty full already. I broke off a piece of the crusty side, taking care to get some of the oats sprinkled on top. It was good, but I've never been a huge fan of coffee cakes because of the cinnamon. My partner in crime mentioned that we should just ditch the top crust. After I tried a piece from just the airy, airy center I knew why. Give me this cake (minus the top) for every birthday and I will love you forever. This cake possesses a comforting sweetness with a hint of almond flavor, it's soft on the palate and light in your mouth. A few sips of latte in between bites rounded out this perfect snack. 

If you're here on a sunny day, try to get some curb space outside and enjoy the air while you're in Arizmendi's neighborly arms. I felt too hot while I was inside with the ovens going full blast in the back, but there are a few tables where you can get a cup of water and sit down while you wait. I'm also told there is a bathroom down outside, down a hallway adjacent to the bakery, but I was also told it wasn't very clean. If the rest of the pastries taste this good though, my stomach will be back to collect them all.
author: Helen S.

description:
Decided to stop here on the way to Holy Gelato and so glad we stopped!  It was my first time here so I was unsure of how it worked, but you pretty much grab a paper bag and fill it with whatever baked goods you want.  If you want pizza by the slice you can order at the cashier.  The pizza seemed to be a very popular but I didn't see a vegan option for it.

I filled my bag with some of the vegan options like focaccia with zucchini, poppy seed muffin and couple of English muffins to take home.  After I paid, my BF and I sat outside and tried the vegan focaccia.   We loved the homemade sauce and the crust was the bomb.  We were fighting over the one piece we got and it was the last piece in the case too!  No worries because on our way back after we got ice cream I walked back in to see if they put more focaccia out and they did!  So I bought a few more pieces to take home with us.  Definitely coming back!
author: Rosanne P.

description:
This place is kinda famous for how good the pizza is, so I was on that end of town and decided to see for myself.

It was good. REALLY good, even. But I don't know if it's worth-twenty-minutes-on-the-MUNI good for me. I mean, I enjoyed it... but I think that Starbelly, in my neighborhood, is every bit as good, and two blocks away.

An epic, five-star pizzeria inspires cult-like loyalty and devotion. This place, a super respectable four stars, would definitely get me back if I were in that neighborhood. Otherwise... I'm okay with other options closer by. It's four, maybe 4.5 stars, but not a must-have five.
author: Sean B.

description:
We stumbled upon Arizmendi after visiting the Botanical Garden on a rainy day. I wouldn't have gone in, but just moments before had ran into the nearby bookstore for a glance around and fallen in love with the curated book selections. Anyway. We passed by Arizmendi and I noticed the smell of pizza and a short line. I popped inside, just for a look. But I couldn't help myself. I had to buy something. I'd spotted a oat-filled scone that looked full and filling and textured.

While my friends went and got the car, which was more than a few blocks away, I stood online and considered my options. I knew I wanted the scone, but the pizza of the day, the cookies, and the other treats all looked good. Thinking the scone would be it and that would be that, I made my way to the cashier, only to find that they had a ten dollar minimum. I grabbed a sugar cookie (enormous, puffy) and a croissant (buttery and flaking gently). The sum was 8.45 but she left me off with a warning.

We three split the purchases in our car. Me in the backseat divvying up the wares. We agreed the cookie was the best - how could it not be? But as far as satisfaction went, I loved the scone.

Whatever. Go here. Try it all! Or as much as you can.
author: Emily M.

description:
Great pizza, and a variety of other delicious baked goods!

It's hard to resist stopping in for a slice of the day's pizza whenever I pass Arizmendi. I love the sourdough crust and their toppings are always fresh and well-paired. Lines can get pretty long on the weekends, but they move fast. I wish they had more seating, but really that's just an epidemic with so many SF establishments.

I've tried a few other things I've loved - giant berry scones (so rich and addicting), the strawberry coffee cake (light, fluffy, and not too sweet!), the chocolate chip cookie (oh my god), and the light and buttery chocolate croissant. Their focaccia is also delicious - a great option to bring home and reheat for a perfectly crisp crust.

One star subtracted, though, for the things I've tried and found underwhelming - the "chocolate thing" (pretty boring and dense) and the brownie (not as rich a flavor/texture as I would have hoped.)

I would say most things are good, and you just have to know what to get! But honestly, trying their wide variety of goodies is all in good fun anyhow. And when they're good, they're straight up amazing.
author: Delia Z.

description: Feel good food. All baked goods are on point. Focaccia here is great. Pizza is phenomenal. Not everything is amazing, but still love this place.
author: Ashley G.

description: I was tempted to stop by after I saw a long line out the door this weekend. I'm had I did. Thy have a delicious variety of scones, pizzas, muffins, and more! They keep them rolling out of the kitchen so everything looks and is fresh. They serve equator coffee . The pricing was also affordable... especially by SF standards. I'll definitely be coming back to try more of the baked goods!
author: Sabrina P.

description:
Usually not a fan of cinnamon but LOVED the pecan roll! Nice thick gooey texture with a hint of cinnamon and caramel undertone! 
The pizzas are also good! Tried Wednesday, Thursday and Sunday so far and Sunday's special was my favorite (thanks to the overflowing kale sitting on top of my pizza.)
Potato rolls and Challah rolls are also good - I made mini burgers with them for my family and it was a winner! 
Will return until I try EVERYTHING!
author: Vega N.

description:
Snuck into Arizmendi on our way to lunch. Can't walk past and not buy anything right? The lines were long as usual but that never stops any of the locals in this neighborhood. Once you walk in, you are greeted by wall full of pastries that lure you into rubbing your face on the glass. The pastries and cheese lined up next to you wont stop taunting you until you get to the front of the line which is what everyone is waiting for - pizza. Now, as I mentioned before we were going to lunch, so pizza wasn't what I waited in line for. 

I waited for the delicious blackberry coffee cake the size of my face for $3.45! It was very moist and the top was very crunchy from the crumbs and oats. The blackberries were an amazing addition to this masterpiece. This was one of the best coffee crumble cakes I have ever had and yes, you guessed it, it was perfect with coffee!
author: Linda K.

description: This place has some of the best vegetation pizza in the city! Every day they showcase a new and unique different veggie pizza. Also, if you love sourdough bread - this is the spot for you!
author: Kris N.

description: Delish!! Mostly locals in line that went out the door but moved quickly. Focaccia breads with toppings were great savory items. Cheese bread also a winner. Daily pizza looked great, but we were too early to try it.
author: Mischa P.

description:
Came in a few weeks back on a whim to try out Ariz's pizza and was pleasantly surprised. For $2.75 you get a large slice of freshly made pizza.  The make one type per day, with the month's schedule of pizza listed on their web site.  The pizza is made with organic, sourdough crust, whole-milk mozzarella and organic veggies.  The crust is nicely baked (as to be expected) and has a solid but "fold-able" NYC quality to it. 

Keep up the good work guys!
author: Nick G.

description:
i usually don't go to bakeries with my friends in the sunset; the sunset is generally reserved for family dinners with chinese food.but we were actually in the neighborhood for once, and i can never resist a bakery. 

two friends and i each got a slice of foccacia ($4ish for a huge square). i can't remember exactly what toppings were on there, but mine had mushrooms cooked down until dark and not at all watery, and another had tomato sauce and zucchini. the texture of the bread was amazing- it was fluffy but also chewy, with a really satisfying density. the edges were crispy and golden, and this had to be some of the best focaccia i've had in my life.

four stars. the focaccia is great, and i can't wait to come back to try more things.
author: Heather F.

description:
Oh man, oh man, I love Arizmendi Pizza, it's just like Cheeseboard in Berkeley, but in The Sunset! The pizzas are different everyday, usually they're really good, sometimes they're incredible, and every once in awhile it's WTF?

Although I'm a total meatlover carnivore, I almost always love Arizmendi Pizza, which is always vegetarian. As amazing as it might sound, I'm pretty sure that most of their pizzas would not taste better covered in Italian sausage.  My absolute favorite pizza is the triple mushroom, which apparently is their most popular pizza. 

One weird thing about their pizzas is that 99% of the time, it does not have sauce. I almost always prefer my pizza with sauce and sausage, but it seems to workout fine at Arizmendi. 

If you want to take the pizza home, you can get a half baked pizza (either a whole or a half) to take home and finish in the oven.
author: Allen T.

description: I'm one of the many people who've been priced out of San Francisco, and one of the things I miss most is Arizmendi Bakery.  I was so happy to go back again on a recent trip into the city!  My very favorite is the cherry corn scones, but the brioche knots, the pecan rolls, the other scones, the pizza... it's all good.
author: Md G.

description: Their daly pizza's are always amazing. I love the coffee cakes. Have to restrain myself from over-indulging every single time!
author: Ankit A.

description: Their pizzas are the bomb! Don't mistake Arizmendi's for just a haven of pastry yumminess - they also offer their customers amazing pizzas. Their triple mushroom pizza hits the spot! There are always long lines at Arizmendi's - but I don't mind the wait because it's worth every minute. INCREDIBLE pastries and really yummy pizzas. Great food and amazing service and staff is what you'll find at this bakery. P.S. Try their homemade break and cookies!!
author: Michelle O.

description:
Everything here is amazing!!
My fav is the scones and pizza!
Their strawberry cake is good as well.
author: Candice L.

description: I give 5 stars, because it gives me satisfied for this pizza and I'm so happy for this and I will promise that I'll be back soon.
author: Team M S.

description: Good place but, ya got ramp up the gluten free/vegan portion of the program.
author: Henry K.

description:
For all you hippy dippies out there looking for some tasty eats that won't take a bite out of your wallet, make sure to stop by this Inner Sunset co-op bake shop. Here's why: 1. The service is amazing! It felt like all the workers knew the customers. You definitely get the feeling that everyone is a regular, which is usually a good sign! 2. There's a cute parklet located right outside the front door so you can take a seat, enjoy the view and your coffee while you fill'er up. 3. Also, major props to any establishment that makes an effort to promote compost. SO MUCH YES! Go green, or go home, baby!

From savory to sweet, your carbs are a treat! Bes believe I will be back for your pizza!
author: Flor K.

description:
I've driven, walked and commuted passed Arizmendi for about 3 years now, and never got a chance to go in, though the sign stating that they were award winning and best rated would be sure to sway just about anyone. 
Finally, I stepped in a few weeks ago, and was more then pleasantly surprised by the quality of food, the service and the atmosphere.

It is a small shop, with bread stands upon entering all along the wall, and then a clear view of the ovens in the back.

They have a special pizza menu that changes daily, and on the day I went there special was feta cheese, red onion, and garlic oil. And it was delicious and extremely decently priced. 

I had to follow up on two scones, one was currant and the other was a mixed berry. I'm not much of a scone person, they're either too dry, too crumbly or too simple. These two were perfect, you could taste the honey in the currant scone, the berries in the other! They've definitely changed my perspective on scones!

I will definitely be coming back!
author: Drea G.

description: Great coffee and delicious fresh pizza baked on focaccia bread Each day.  they bake a new type of pizza every day. They also have a nice outdoor seating area right across from the store. Great vibes, definitely coming back here.
author: Jon P.

description:
Amazing. Hands down this is one of my favorite bakeries in the city. It's a family-owned business with fresh, fresh baked goods coming out constantly throughout the day. 

Personal recommendations: go for the corn-blueberry muffins and the blueberry coffee cake (seemingly a bias towards blueberries?). 

But the thing you HAVE to get? The pizza. My god I have dreams about that pizza. It's an incredibly thin crust and they only have one flavor a day--but I've never had any problems with any of the ones I've tried. You can find their monthly pizza flavors on their website. Their mushroom pizza with ginger-sesame vinaigrette and caramel iced onion pizza are to die for. 

They've also got great Ecuador coffee to top off your pastry run! It's pretty small, so don't expect to get good seating inside, but on a nice day they have a few tables and chairs right outside on the street to enjoy your slice of pizza and coffee :)
author: Jay P.

description:
The SO and I stopped by as we were walking around the area for dessert one day. So this review is basically for the one scone I got, but holy crap it was an amazing scone. Arizmendi is basically a pizza/bakery place -- they have a variety of savory and sweet pastries that are on display. You grab and go and then pay at the register ($10 minimum). 

We got the apple blueberry scone and wow. You wouldn't think that apple could make that big of a difference in a scone, but it was AMAZING. Super soft and just moist enough, apple was great flavor, just a spectacular scone. Definitely looking forward to trying some more things from this place in the future.

tldr; yummy pastries! go for the apple blueberry scone
author: Jasmine X.

description: Vegan kalamata olive focaccia was my first purchase here, and I'm in love. Will have to come back for the pizza and other goodies. I also got a sourdough to take home and share with my parents, who loved it.
author: Connie K.

description: Stopped by here on a Thursday and it was busier than expected.  Similar options as the Mission location though seemed better stocked.  I really like all their pastries, and this visit, their cookies didn't disappoint.
author: Jeff A.

description:
Love pizza? Love different kinds of pizza? This place makes a new pizza every day!

I came here once before and only had their pastries. I decided to try their one of a kind pizzas, additional to the pastries. Oh and a mocha to wash it down. 

If you see a long line out the door, you've hit the right spot. If the line doesn't look so long, you don't want to wait; the line grows pretty quickly. 

To the left will be a shelf with paper bags, grab one or two or three. Next are two casements of a variety of fresh baked goodies. Make your way and pay. Don't forget the pizza and a beverage! Oh and don't forget your own bag! 

There's plenty of seating outside or sit inside at one of the two tables. Always friendly service and delicious food!
author: Kacie Y.

description:
Fresh pizza and baked goods? I'm in!

While visiting and roaming around San Francisco, I wanted to go for some of the best eats. Looking at the reviews on Yelp, this place seemed promising. Like Cheeseboard, Arizmendi makes one pizza a day to sell. The place overall is pretty small inside with limited seating. They have a small seating section outside as well. You can buy pizza by the slice, or a whole one.

There was a small line when we got there, but that gave us time to look at some of their freshly baked goods. I decided on their oats scone and a green tea shortbread. We decided to get a whole pizza since we are such hungry eaters.

We were able to get the seats by the window. They have a water dispenser and cups for those eating there. The pizza crust is made of sourdough so it's a different spin on your classic kind of pizza. At first I didn't really taste the sourdough, but then it started to hit me with every bite. It's different, but it actually works well. The pizza we ordered was a take on a traditional margarita pizza. You could taste the quality of the cheese and the pieces of ricotta throughout were to die for. The clumps just burst with flavor. I really appreciated the quality of the tomato sauce because it tasted very fresh. The only thing I would change is more basil. There just didn't seem like enough basil on the pizza and a margarita pizza is known for that basil! Our pizza came out piping hot because it was served to us right out of the oven. Because of that, we suffered some pretty bad damage on the roofs of our mouths but I think it was worth it for super fresh pizza.

The oat scone was so crumbly but moist. It had little raisins throughout and the oat flavor was just screaming out at you. It does dry out your mouth so have water or milk on hand. The green tea shortbread was my favorite though. I love when you can see the actual specs of tea leaves throughout tea desserts. It makes it more fresh and the flavor more authentic. If you love green tea, then this shortbread will be a real treat. It has that bitter taste of green tea, but it is balanced out because of the sweetness from the shortbread crust. 

Whole pizzas are roughly $20 and the baked desserts range depending on what it is. Overall, pricing is fair for the quality and size. Great little place to step by while in San Francisco.
author: Liz C.

description: Baked goods are fine. However it's touch and go with some folks who work there. My latest interaction the person was too engaged talking to a customer across the room to acknowledge my existence as I. No hello, no eye contact, no thank you even after I said thanks as I picked up my goods from the counter. Extremely off putting.
author: Angelito R.

description:
This place is a hipster/granola 9th Avenue staple. The crowd is very classic Inner Sunset - a bit grungy, edgy, and leftist in the 90s way. The pastries and pizza are great. The pecan rolls are like a go-to comfort food for me. The coffee is very mediocre, though. You'd think a place with such indie, edgy pretentions would put some more thought into the quality of coffee. 

My biggest gripe about this place is the definite exclusionary, clique-ish vibe - like many places in San Francisco. Whenever I go there, I don't quite feel welcome there. Staff is pretty indifferent, at least towards me. I'd sit down on the bench, in close quarters with others, and I always get the feeling they don't want me sitting there. 

As much as Arizmendi feels so much part of me and my neighborhood, I always feel a "rejecting" sort of vibe when I go there. I'd love to go there some more, but I simply do not feel welcome or comfortable there. There are too many places in SF that feel "me", and I love the food, but it seems the staff and clientele would rather not have me there. That's just really sad. :(
author: Alecia K.

description:
I would give arizmendi 10 stars if I could! Friendly service, good food, and good prices! But really I would give them 10 stars because they are really nice and it is reflected in their food and their atmosphere! I've been coming to arizmendi since I was in middle school and it's been at least 10 years that I've been coming here. They treat all their customers like friendly neighbors lol! I love it! 

    Also their baked goods are A+, I get their pizzas all the time! They have a new flavor everyday and it's always vegetarian with a sourdough crust! I practically grew up on it since I'd get it after school almost everyday till now! 

   But all their stuff is delicious, there's nothing I don't like! 

For drinks- my favorite is their house made chai and their stumptown coffee in the milk cartons! Also their coffee is not bad!
author: Janet K.

description: They have a minimum for cards (they don't sell 1000 dollars jewellery) and they wouldn't do an exception. I lost my train because I went to the ATM, since I had already picked and touched my scon.
author: Maia L.

description:
Arizmendi Bakery has only a few tables for eat-in inside. more space in parklet outside.

eats: daily pizza slice (2.75)
-tomato sauce, fontina/mozzarrella cheese, basil oil,  parsley  & parmesan cheese
-yummy, slightly greasy. slice small

crumbs:
-space too small for me, feel cramped
-breads, baked goodies, cookies on left or in front as u wait to pay.
4.5 stars.
author: Victor G.

description:
I had heard great things about this place and, being a massive Cheeseboard/Sliver fan from my days in Berkeley, I just had to finally give it a try. Luckily, Arizmendi did not disappoint.

My fiance and I are huge pizza snobs. We love pizza, and we can eat it for every meal (no joke). On our way up to Marin, we decided to stop by here and pick up a pizza to eat later. Their pizza of the day was mushrooms, spinach, and parmesan (and maybe other things?). The line was fairly long, snaking outside of the place, but it moved fairly quickly. I also purchased a cheese roll because cheese.

Once we got to our picnic spot, we grabbed the pizza and sat on a bench with a view of the Golden Gate and started eating. The pizza was super nomz- a perfect blend of cheese and mushrooms and spinach and all the other good stuff.

Would I come back? yes!
author: Shrina S.

description:
The Good
* AAAAAHHH MAAAZZINNGGG pizza. The crust is just... so on point, I still dream about it... and I just ate it yesterday!!
* This is probably the only pizza in which I will actually eat the entire crust. A delicious pizza is 95% dependent on the crust. 

The Bad
* na-da

The Weird
* na-da
author: Juliann C.

description: My boyfriend's been raving about this place for a long time and I finally got a chance to try it last weekend! We had their pizza of the day and one of those big chocolate chip cookies. Both sound pretty ordinary but both were delicious!! The pizza had spinach, roasted garlic, feta cheese, and Rosemary and lemon olive oil I think. I also liked it because it was thin and crispy - my favorite kind of pizza! The chocolate chip cookie was soft and chewy and had big chunks of chocolate in it. I would definitely come back and try their other baked goods!
author: Annie L.

description: Cute, rustic bakery.  They have a variety of pastries, bread, cookies, muffins, etc. here and they all look amazing.  Chocolate babka is delicious and it loaded with chocolate.  Pecan roll is sweet and decadent, but a bit heavy.  Scones are just alright.
author: Samantha C.

description: Great breads and pizza. The service can use some improvement. Came yesterday and the tall man behind the counter dealt with the customers including me with such sarcastic remarks that they were offensive. For instance he called out to someone shouting, hey, (name of person) pick up your order now. Your pizza is getting cold. When I came up to order, I felt like I was being rushed and since I wasn't familiar with the types of pizza they sold and he asked impatiently how he could help me, I responded, I would like to order some slices or pizza and said this while I was looking at the menu trying to figure out how many and what type and he answered sarcastically, "some slices", I don't know what that means. A typical cashier would say "how many would you like?"  Then I asked what type of pizza they had that day and he just walked off without responding. Good thing the other cashier heard me and explained. Their food is good; customer service can use improvement or maybe with just the particular guy we had.
author: Caroline S.

description:
What a great, small pizza and bakery shop in the city!

Their pizza topping of the day tasted amazing!  The crust was lightly crisp and crunchy! The twist of diced sugar plums with diced tomatoes and balsamic vinegar, gave it a sweet and sour with savory tasty delight!  For only $2.50 per gourmet slice and $20 for a box, it is surely worth it!

They offer freshly baked bread and Focaccia selections!  Their diced eggplants with tomatoes Vegan focaccia, was topped off with a generous portion of those ingredients!  Their spinach with marinated artichoke and cheese focaccia, was the better focaccia!  It is because of the marinated artichoke with the cheese that I preferred over the diced eggplants!  

They have limited seating inside and outside, but the turnover is quick after the finishing of the pizza!

Nonetheless, this bakery and pizza shop in the city, is scrumptiously yummy to the tummy!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I love, love, love Arizmendi Bakery!  This happens to be my friend's neighborhood, but I've never been.  My cousin (from SoCal) was in town and wanted to explore GG Park and we got hungry, so I text my friend for some suggestions... this came back in all caps. She warned me that this was a vegan bakery, so I wouldn't expect meat on the pizza, but I have no issues with that.

I had the pizza there (pesto with organic tomatoes) and we brought home a cookie (I forget the name, but it has peanut butter?) and a sticky bun.  We each only ordered a slice of pizza to eat there because we were saying that we were only a "little hungry", but we regretted that pretty quickly.  I could probably eat a whole pizza of their thin crust.  Crispy crust, yummy pesto, and the tomatoes tasted like they were fresh off the vine.  

Service was awesome and there's a lot of parking nearby!
author: Leanne P.

description:
3.5 stars.

Flew in from SFO, got a manicure, and was starving! Some friends took us here because it was walking distance from the nail salon we were ate. Ordered one slice of pizza of the day for 2.50 and a house chai tea latte $3.50. The pizza had Yukon potatoes and garlic and parmesan and was tasty but ended up making me a bit gassy!! O_o The chai tea is not sweetened. They had a lot of baked goods and bread that looked amazing but we didn't end up getting. May come back if I'm in the area.
author: Vivian N.

description: Love the pizzas in this place.Everyday is different. Amazing and delicious.If you come to Golden garden, you can pass by to get a pizzas or a piece of scone as a snack.
author: 雪梅

description: Came here for a snack by my friends recommendation. I tried the corn cranberry scone and I'm hooked. It's like a cross between cornbread and scorn with big cranberries. I wasn't even hungry but I ate it all and more .... will be back!!
author: Yoshi O.

description:
Every time I pass this sweet little bakery, I am drawn in by the aromas wafting out onto the sidewalk. Whether we dine in or take home their products, everything has been absolutely delicious! There is usually a line, but the friendly workers/coop owners are amazingly efficient, so the wait is not long.

Our favorites include the daily pizza, especially the triple mushroom, and the focaccia. The focaccia sells out early. That's how good it is. Nevertheless, you will find plenty of other choices. Their croissants are perfectly baked, soft on the inside and flaky/crunchy on the outside.

And then there are the sweets...My favorite is the pecan roll. It's loaded with pecans and the raisins do not overpower the pastry. 

I have to say that I just love a worker-owned cooperative for the love that they put into their products and the outstanding service that they provide. Why can't we have more businesses that are run this way?!?!?
author: Rebecca H.

description:
I might be a little biased -- every time I've come here has been in the context of spending long hours outside at the Botanical Garden doing research. Coming out of my damp and mosquito ridden field site into Arizmendi's cozy, warm, fresh-bread-scented space is a much needed reprieve. But also: their baked goods are awesome, the employees are friendly, and so are other customers. I enjoyed their crisp, buttery, chocolate sourdough croissants, focaccia bread (including vegan option), creative vegetarian pizzas -- crispy thin crusts and the toppings change from one day to the next (caramelized onions and arugula? don't mind if I do). The pizza's a steal at $3 a slice; they warm it up for you in the oven, too. Good coffee, too, and at $1.75 for an 8oz cup, just the right amount for me.

There's not much indoor seating, but an older gentleman let me share his table and offered me his newspaper when he got up to leave. If I lived in this neighborhood, I would be here all the time. As it is, I'm already plotting to go back and try some scones, or maybe some cookies, or...
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Not bad, but not mind blowing either. There's always a crowd here - a line out the door that moved very quickly. Nice high ceilings, lots of natural light. Communal tables, easy to get space for four of us. However, I wasn't too wowed by anything I had.

COST: $10.17 for the scone, small hot chocolate, cookie, and a pelligrino. That plus the pizza was a good mid-afternoon snack for four.

* Blackberry/pear scone - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/arizmendi-bakery-san-francisco?select=vMt9OO4kOkjoNuecA3BVaw#DM49on5hh0lww3-C42H1DQ
cross-section: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/arizmendi-bakery-san-francisco?select=vMt9OO4kOkjoNuecA3BVaw#vMt9OO4kOkjoNuecA3BVaw
Soft and sweet, but for such a high-rated bakery, this was really a little on the dry side. I've had much more buttery and moist scones. I wished the tartness of the blackberry came through more, and I only got one chunk of pear in there.

* Pizza of the day: Tomato sauce w/ goat cheese & fresh basil ($2.50 slice) - 3 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/arizmendi-bakery-san-francisco?select=vMt9OO4kOkjoNuecA3BVaw#XZsaRPzIkiM-gtBWdH2awg
I found this to not be very fresh - the cheese was thick, a little hard, and congealed. I couldn't really tasted the goat cheese and the basil, nor the tomato very much. 

* Mexican hot chocolate ($2.75 small) - 3.5 stars
I asked for extra chili, but this still wasn't too spicy. Texture was foamy and nice, but I wished it was more spicy - the only reason I ordered this was for the spice!

* Mint chocolate cookie - 3 stars
I tried a bite of a friend's. To be frank, I'm not a fan of chocolate+mint as a flavor combination, but even

The day's menu: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/arizmendi-bakery-san-francisco?select=vMt9OO4kOkjoNuecA3BVaw#UoyvFO_fWmlBV3Vq9o1iBA
author: Ziyan C.

description: My in laws live in San Francisco and one of them is an early riser. He frequently makes sure we have fresh pastries waiting for us for breakfast. I have tried quite a few their offerings and never been disappointed. Went back today and had a chocolate filled crescent and a pecan roll. Both were amazing. Totally worth the effort to swing in there and pick something up.
author: Kevin L.

description:
The pizza was ok. Today was garlic oil, p+p etc. Most of the flavor came from the garlic, but other than that, it wasn't anything too special. 

$2.75 per slice...which is a little steep for what we got. It was good enough for a snack though.

The bakery itself smelled really good!! Perhaps we should have gotten some other baked goods.
author: Amy K.

description:
What I liked about Arizmendi: 
-It's a co-op, so it's collectively owned by all the workers rather than a single owner. Very cool concept. 
-Outdoor seating area. Can get a bit chilly, but there is plenty of seating. It feels clean and I like the sleek sanded and matte finish for the chairs, benches, and tables. 

Good, but not great: 
-My friend and I shared a roasted sun-dried tomato, spinach, and garlic focaccia bread for $4.25. The ingredients were very good. I particularly liked the copious amounts of sun-dried tomatoes and whole garlic pieces. Could have been more flavorful in spice and might have been better heated. 

Overall consensus is that Arizmendi is good, but not great. I'm surprised two of the Inner Sunset locals talked so highly about this place. Perhaps factoring in its location and the selection available, it is one of the better, if not best, choices?
author: Phoebe C.

description: I was starving after walking around Golden Gate Park for a few hours and was looking to grab something quick.  I had their olive focaccia bread which was good, but the strawberry cream scone and Italian almond cookie were amazing.  Worth a stop to grab a few goodies to take into the park.
author: Melissa W.

description:
Arizmendi is absolutely superb! What a hidden little gem of a wonder in the Inner Sunset. My coworker introduced me to this spot and I, an SF local born and raised, admittedly was a bit embarrassed/shocked that I'd never even heart about it, let alone been! Luckily for me, it's just over the hill from Cole Valley and located near the bustling corner of 9th & Irving. For those unfamiliar with the neighborhood, you might walk by and not notice it but due to their nice outdoor seating - definitely keep your eyes peeled and bellys empty. This has become a bit of a Sunday treat for us now to meet at Arizmendi, pick a bunch of things to try and split but end up going back for more! This is the type of place that does everything so well but the real hit and crowd pleaser are the pizzas. They change daily but are so fresh, warm, and use minimal ingredients. I love knowing that this worker owned spot only serves what they make right then and there. Nothing has been sitting out or looks stale - it's all freshly baked and you'll be tempted not to go back for seconds and sample some other items! 

Crusty cheese sticks with Parmesan, any warm focaccia they have, the scones, and of course the pizza of the day are all delicious. If you don't have a sweet tooth like me but feel like you just need to try one last thing before departing, go in for the almond cookies!! They are to die for and you can't miss them (they're right near the register) so, soooo good! I can't wait to buy them in bulk for the holidays! Overall, love Arizmendi's - I highly recommend because everything they produce is as good as it can get.
author: Frankie I.

description:
Mmmm the smell of fresh baked breads and sweets! What a wonderful little bakery that also crafts tasty pizza! (fresh corn, onions, feta with roasted tomato and basil vinaigrette was the pizza of the day). I love that it's a worker owned co-op as well. Definitely stop by if you're in the area. 

I came here for the bread sticks, which I got here on my last visit to San Fran and just couldn't forget about! I didn't try the pizza last time, but since they are known for it, I decided to give it a try. It was good, I wouldn't put it in my top three pizza favorites, but it certainly was delicious and their flavor combination was spot on. 

Sidenotes....
I stopped by on a Monday late afternoon and there was a very short line (I hear weekends can be crazy)

Cash only for purchases under $10. 

Not a large place and only a couple places to sit inside but there are some benches and tables right outside the shop where you can enjoy your baked good and coffee!
author: Jess K.

description:
Best pizza & pastries (especially the delicious scones) in Oakland.  Very friendly atmosphere & great service.
A GrandLake 5 star
author: Tommie H.

description: I like that it's self serve which makes the line go quickly. The blackberry scone I got had NO blackberry in it. It had maybe one speck of a blackberry. I ended up throwing most of it out because I didn't want to eat plain biscuit. The cherry corn muffin was a letdown. Not a lot of cornmeal flavor or texture and very few cherries as well. I only ate the top and threw the rest out. My husband's croissant seemed good (no complaints from him) but I'm surprised the two pastries I got were so mediocre!
author: Marilynn L.

description: I go here every time I'm in San Francisco. A different pizza is made each day with a dazzling rotation of veggie-only toppings, all delicious.
author: Benjamin L.

description: That was one SLAMMIN bûche! (And one fiiiiine stollen.) The dense cake and not-overwhelming icing on the bûche made my week - in light of a lot of sadness. Hats off to Arimendi 9th Ave collective members. You made it a very feliz navidad!
author: Chris V.

description:
This is a review for the baked goods only (although pizza is sometimes baked, but let's not focus on that).

Suggestions for items to try (because you will be a little overwhelmed and possibly order too many things and not be able to eat all of them fresh - and fresh is best!)

Sourdough croissant - the flakiest flakes that ever flaked, plus a hint of sour
Corn and cherry scone - how to describe it? if you married southern and northern cornbreads, added cherries, made a thicker dough, and baked just right to yield a crispy outside with a soft, moist inside

Suggestions for items to not try (because I took the hit for you - you're welcome!)

Chocolate things - It's just brioche with chocolate chips. And only so-so brioche. A little dense, a little moist, a little boring. Let's make it a loaf so that it maintains freshness for longer.
Olive and tomato bialy - Disappointingly dry and a tad tough. The olives are delicious because they're olives, and the tomato made the bialy under it more edible than the rest. Maybe one of the other bialys is better.

Despite the shortcoming for those two items, I'd return. The prices are fairly reasonable. Next time, pizza!
author: Andrew R.

description:
I've always said that the pigeons which hang outside of Arizmendi are the happiest pigeons in the city.

When I lived in Inner Sunset, Arizmendi used to be a staple. I'd come here, get some pizza, a scone, a cookie, some bread, you name it.

There's something very warm about the place, and it's not just the ovens baking their fresh bread and rolls in the back. It's a Cooperative, meaning that everyone who works here is a partial-Owner of the company. There is no tip jar because everyone working here makes a decent living wage. On top of the fact that they serve amazing, organic bread and other delicious things at an affordable price? It fast becomes an essential that the community has been spoiled with for a good long while.

Other Great Notables:

-There's a parklet out in front that is great for sitting in and watching the N-Judah drift right in front of your face

-Their pizza flavor changes every day, and with seasonal produce in mind. Not used to thinking about "produce" on your pizza? Come try it and see what I'm talking about. I've had cauliflower curry, sesame and bok choy, and squash on my pizza before (not all at once, but one can dare to dream).

-The blackberry/raspberry scones are amazing, if they happen to be in season when you stop by, grab one.

-The WOLVERINES are something I subsisted off of for a good long while when I cut out processed sugar for a year. They are humble-looking, but delicious, rolls made from organic, unbleached wheat, dried fruit, and sweetened with sucanat (dried can syrup). Eat piece-by-piece with butter and enjoy.

-Their chai base is homemade and very flavorful, it's also not too sweet. Many cafes use Oregon Chai, which is boring and flavor-lacking so any place that makes their own base is usually good at everything else, too.

-Arizmendi carries Columbia Gorge juices for $3.50. I dare you to find another establishment that offers that price, even a grocery store. 

The staff is so laid-back and easy to get along with. There's nothing saccharin about your interactions with them, you can tell they are all very authentic people.

One day I will find it in me to buy a slice of that chocolate sea salted caramel cake...it looks so rich that it's probably better to split with someone else but one day...I'm gonna do it.
author: Megan D.

description:
baguette was delicious.

the round brownie crumbled all over my car seat.
author: Animal K.

description: BEST chocolate chip cookies in the world!! And focaccia. So hard living right next door to this place!!! ;)
author: Holly K.

description: One of my favorite brunch places out of all the brunch places I've been to! Had the Salmon Benedict with crunchy potatoes cakes every single time. I love how their hollandaise sauce is really thick and isn't too runny.
author: Alianna S.

description: I basically have to go to Arizmendi every single time I'm in the city. Their chocolate sourdough croissants are to die for and their pizzas are EPIC. I spent a week in the neighborhood and ate a different pizza flavor every day. I don't even care I missed out on other restaurants - the pizza (especially the potato one) is an absolute favorite.
author: N G.

description:
Delicious bakery with great service! These are my go-to items
-Focaccia Breads (mushroom and spinach is my fav)
-English Muffins
-Scones
author: Kristen T.

description:
Delicious sourdough croissant! The chocolate sourdough croissant was not quite as good however.

I was a little confused going in because you have to grab a bag and pick out your own breads. They had coffee and hot tea but no iced tea which I was craving. 

It was nice that there is a little parklet outside with a bike rack.
author: Mariah C.

description:
Be prepared to leave with more pastries than you have wanted to bring home. 

Azrimendi has a delicious selection of crafted fresh baked goods. You pretty much pick up a paper bag when you start in line. My mistake was picking up a smaller paper bag, and I ended up needing to switch to a larger one because I wanted to try everything! 

A few favorites:

Mushroom focaccia
Chocolate thing (lol yes that's the actual name)
Cowgirl cookie
Cherry scone

Normally, I don't like scones because they're usually very hard and dry; however their scone was crispy on the outside, moist on the inside. I was a bit hesitant about the Chocolate Thing because it seemed hard on the outside; but when I bit into it, it was soft! I also loved that there was chocolate chips in every bite. You get to really enjoy the pastry without missing out on chocolate in each bite :)

To top it off, their cowgirl cookie was stellar. It was a tasty, soft cookie with oats, raisins, and chocolate. 

Unf, so many carbs but zero regrets.
author: Grace H.

description: I came in and just wanted a little snack so got their provolone olive bread roll and was surprised at how good it was. There was a little line going out the door but it made sense because the food here is so good and great quality! Definitely want to come back and try more stuff! For my first time there, it was a confusing experience since everyone is lining up and you just get a bag and grab whatever items as you go down the line until you hit the cashier.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I wish I lived closer to Arizmendi. 

We went this morning and of course there was a line out the door. But I don't mind waiting. We got a berry scone, coffee cake, blueberry corn muffin and 2 slices of pizza. All of it was SO good!!!!! This place never disappoints!
author: S K.

description: Got a chocolate croissant and a coffee and it must be the best croissant I've had in ages. Considered getting the babka, but they only had cinnamon... And let's face it, you can't get the lesser babka. It's gotta be the chocolate. So I stuck with the croissant and it did not disappoint.
author: Ella M.

description:
OK this is a business that just deserves 27 stars. A worker owned co-op that makes the most insane pastries humanly possible, the bread is unreal and the service is fabulous. Discovered it by accident and have been going back 2-3 times a week for all the baked goods needs. 

The pizza is YUMMY ! and they make these things called Wolverine Rolls which by name alone appeal to the geek inside me. 

Basically everything is amazing here from the English Muffins, to the Scones and Brownies and all the variations of bread ! 

Situated on a charming street, always full of cheery people and great energy. My personal favorite person there is a lady named Tanya who is just amazing = ) 

A local business that does it completely and totally RIGHT !!!
author: Aud S.

description:
Their pizza man... 
Today was some kind of amazing curry spinach and yukon potato pizza. SOOOO GOOOOOOD. 
Thank you Arizmendi!
author: Lisa K.

description: good bread, rolls, brioches, scones,etc. Coffee and Chai are on point. The pizza is good also. A+
author: James P.

description:
This bakery is one of my favorite places, ever. All of the goods are SO AMAZING and FRESH. 

Things that I've tried here: pizza, sourdough chocolate croissants, various foccaccia, cheesy rolls, scones 
Things that I loved: literally everything.
author: Cynthia S.

description:
LOVE these guys. I don't care what anyone says, they always make special breads for all occasions. They let you order ahead of time, they open early (7am) and are right next to the 24hour emergency vet and trust me they came in handy. Also, they make pizzas for lunch, which they sell by the slice. I also love that they make vegetarian pizzas. Their breads are wonderful, in par with Acme and Arizmendi was created by the Cheese Board Collective people. 

Prices for their sweets and breads are a tad pricey, but they use great ingredients. Again, you can buy cheeses here by such wonderful people as Cowgirl Creamery. The lines go quickly, even with the lunch crowd and now they have parklet.
author: Carolina S.

description:
Yum. Tried their pizza of the day which featured roasted poblano peppers, sugar plum tomatoes, feta cheese, lime oil, and cilantro. It's not exactly a thin crust pizza, but its definitely crispy. The pizza was delivered piping hot and had excellent flavor. It's $2.50 a slice, but I definitely found it very delicious.

To finish off my meal, I opted for a mint chocolate cookie. The crispy edges reminded me of the crispy, chewy edges of a brownie, totally delicious...but I definitely think the cookie was chocolate overload....which doesn't happen to me quite often. I'm definitely down to come back and try my luck at their other assortment of pastries though.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
How hot is it?  Let's just say, have that glass of milk handy.
Coming here on a recent Sunday, I shared a half baked mushroom pizza with a friend and spotted this new item in their focaccia section.  It is deceiving as the other toppings disguise those sleeping peppers.  If you like strong flavors, this one is for you.
Yes, I also bought several sweet items (see last review) to satisfy my craving for guilty pleasures.  Worried that the farmers' market would make this place a madhouse, I was surprised that it was not too bad.
Needless to say, will be back, just hopefully sooner than later.
author: Mike C.

description: Like their breads, pizza, scones...I get that people are lining up weekends to get their carb fix...They are not even overpriced if you look at the market...not pretentious either. Only problem is that they are in my neighborhood and can become addictive and a temptation...
author: VIORICA C.

description: The pizza of the day was very good - goat cheese, red onion & artichoke. It wasn't too heavy and was wonderfully satisfying.
author: Aurora J.

description:
So good. So fresh. Yummmmm.

I finally made my way in to try the pizza - so happy I got at least 2 slices - although I probably could have finished 3. The pizza of the day was: marinated artichoke hearts, spinach, lemon-thyme oil. It was a perfect combination of flavors - cooked to perfection - with the most flavorful thyme oil. Check the website for the days selection - as they only have 1 pizza per day. 

And of course I finished the pizza off with dessert! I opted on the scone of the day: it was a blackberry raspberry blend of sorts. Big chunks of berries, just sweet enough, and so fresh tasting even at 2 in the afternoon!

They take cards but have a $10 minimum.
author: Shannon H.

description:
I came here because I saw they had scones but they only had fruit flavored ones like currant. I was looking for chocolate chip scones so alas I struck out here.

I did try the chocolate croissant made with sourdough. The taste was interesting, and yes the sourdough taste was prominent. I wouldn't go out of my way to go here. Also the front is bag it yourself so I guess there's a potential for a bottleneck.

Credit card minimum $10.
author: Danielle C.

description: Their shortbread is amazing!! Get it. Also get the scones. Going to come back
author: Brian C.

description:
OMG. I. AM. OBSESSED. WITH. THEIR. PIZZA.

Okay, I LOVE pizza and this place did NOT disappoint. I came here for the first time a couple weeks ago and their pizza was sold out...so I waited until the weekend and went there RIGHT at 11 to get a whole pizza. OMG. I was in heaven. Thin crust, SUPER tasty sauces, and a damn good size for the whole pizza. 

They have different pizzas everyday so be sure to look at their menu to see what pizza they're offering.  They start serving pizza at 11 and they do run out by the end of the day - esp on weekends. They can start selling out in the afternoon - so reserve one or get one in the morning! 

Ugh. I am craving another one of their pizzas now...must. try. all. them. all.

I've had their other breads as well - their cheese roll and tomato/olive roll is really good as well.  Basically...everything here is just delicious. I'm just now scared because this place is walking distance from my apartment...
author: Steph S.

description: Didn't care for butter cookie, pecan roll was delicious but perhaps unnecessarily too rich, and the sourdough pizza was a miss for me. Good crust but the pizza part didn't work.  Could have been just that particular day though.
author: Mike J.

description: This place makes the best pizza in town. My favorite has roasted Yukon gold potatoes, Irish cheddar cheese, rosemary, basil, and olive oil. The crust is amazing and the pizza is so good it'll make your toes curl. For dessert enjoy a tasty piece of lavender shortbread. Go. Eat. You won't be sorry.
author: Teri L.

description: Pure bliss from the moment I stepped in. Everything looks and smells amazing. The pizza is beyond flavorful. Make plans to stop here asap!
author: Michael S.

description:
Ugh.  I didn't like myself for taking so long to finally try Cheeseboard in Berkeley, but I dislike myself even more for letting so much time pass between my last couple of visits to Arizmendi.  Cheeseboard was (somewhat) forgivable since it's out in the East Bay, but Arizmendi?  Inexcusable!  Same owners, same great pizza...and just a short drive away with no toll??  Man, you'd think I'd be here all the time!

Although the veggie-hating child inside me still has trouble believing it, the pizzas here are awesome!  Like Cheeseboard, Arizmendi only makes one type of pizza each day (vegetarian), but they have several varieties that they rotate through.  The most recent one I tried was topped with Spinach, Red Onions, Feta Cheese, and a Balsamic Vinaigrette...YUM.  With a crispy crust, plenty of tasty vegetables, and oodles of cheese, it was so good!  I'm not sure I could go longer than a week or two on a vegetarian diet, but it helps to know I can just pig out on these babies the whole time.

The pizza schedule is posted online in case you want to sneak a peek before stopping in, but there's really no need to worry - each one I've tried has been great.  Besides, what's the worst case scenario?  If you walk in and don't like the day's offering, just pick up some of their awesome pastries and baked goods instead (love their coffee cakes!).  And if your inner-carnivore starts to make some noise, shut it up with another bite of delicious pizza and tell it "you're welcome!".  That's what I do.
author: Mike L.

description:
Great neighborhood type bakery, and in a great neighborhood.  It is very small inside and the place pretty much stays crowded, especially on the weekends.  There are items available in the "store" type area; e.g. breads, cookies, etc, while you wait in line to order anything behind the counter; e.g. pizza, and pay for any of the other items you gathered.

Arizmendi smells of freshly baked bread and gives off a really good vibe from the second you walk in.  If you're looking for some great bread in the neighborhood then this is your spot.

*Note: CASH ONLY!
author: Pia V.

description:
It's a worker owned co-op that happens to be a bakery. I don't really see what's so confusing. The banner on the wall says it all: "Make loaves, not war." Not as decadently indulgent as Tartine nor as slavishly health-conscious as you might expect, Arizmendi's all-veg pastries and breads are delicious on their own merits, and sometimes in their own unexpected ways. 

The Pizza: If you're a pizza purist, what are you even doing getting pizza here? There are a million other places you could go. Go wait forever for a seat at Little Star! Crowd back into Arinell's and dab your slice with a napkin, you philistine! 

Seriously tho, Arizmendi's slices are a whole different kind of pie than you'll find around The Bay ...except at their sister spot, The Cheese Board in Berkeley. Both tend to be light on the sauce, heavy with a flavorful oil of some sort (for example, truffle) and dressed with enough co-op veggies (sunchokes, broccolini, heritage tomatoes) to make a teenage boy cry out for Totinos.

If you're a pizza glutton (I am--isn't everyone when it comes to pizza?), take heart--Arizmendi pizza is CHEAP ($2.50 a slice), pies are available by the box, and they come with a tiny extra sliver of 'za if you buy single slices.

Slight discount if you mention you rode your bike (don't lie--they know!).
author: Jackson S.

description:
Pretty good baked goods and pizza.   Stop in and you can pick up some delicous treats.  

A
author: Michael E.

description: Good cheese roll and baguette, not quite the Cheese Board but it will do! The granola is OK.
author: Jonathan P.

description:
Affordable, delicious and conveniently located in the Sunset District.

We were cruisin around SF with our friends and they took us to Arizmendi - a local bakery with some of the yummiest pastries. We were first sold on the idea of a tasty morning bun, but upon arriving they had sold out. We opted for a variety of pastries including; a croissant, pecan roll, and pizza of the day. Holy crap - you NEED this pizza in your life. At first I couldn't think of consuming pizza at 10 am with coffee, but once you try it, you'll realize why everyone buys it. Try their pecan roll too- it's massive, dense and tasty.

There is a cute pop up park/seating area in front of Arizmendi and some shops you can stroll into post grubbin. They do sell coffee and noticed Stumptown in their fridge area, but you could also walk to Beanery just a few feet away. So happy my friends introduced us to this local spot, we will be back!
author: Juanita D.

description: This place is great! Their pizza are awesome and so cheap (one slice for $2.75). I also tried a cookie which was really good. I definitely recommend it!
author: Sara-Fleur S.

description: I love their scones! Just right amount of crispy crust and moist inside.
author: Esther L.

description: First impressions - not as delicious as cheeseboard but still a decent slice. More sourdough flavor to their crusts. They've got a nice selection of baked goods that I enjoyed too.
author: Estella H.

description:
Our go-to morning spot when we head back to the city and our old Sunset neighborhood. 

Line can be out the door. There's limited seating inside and a cute little city parkscape/ seating area right outside the bakery.

They have amazing baked goods and pizzas. My favorites so far: corn cherry muffins, any of the savory rolls eg the provolone olive, tomato cheese, etc. My kids and husband love the sweet blueberry scones, green tea shortbread cookies, and other sweets.
author: Angela W.

description: My new neighborhood spot, this place is awesome and dangerous to have so close. The pies have been fantastic each day and you can't go wrong with the baked goods/breads. Even if there is a line, it moves fast and is worth the wait.
author: Andrew N.

description: Love this place. Freshly baked bread, but I always come in for the slices of pizza. Love the customer service and how good the quality is. Always a staple here.
author: Rj L.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for years and now that I have, I'm bummed I haven't been eating the delicious baked goods all along! My boyfriend and I dropped by after lunch to grab some desserts and ended up with the strawberry coffee cake, pecan roll, and Italian ricciarelli. They were all DELICIOUS - moist, flavorful, but not too sweet. Bonus points for their coffee and latte as well! 

As other reviews have said, don't be turned off by the line. It moves quick and you'll get a chance to check everything out as you go.
author: Brittany L.

description:
I've been to the other location on Valencia much more but always try to stop by this one if I'm in the area. 

We stopped here for pastries on the way to Muir Woods for a day of hiking. We got a cheese roll, pumpkin muffin, sourdough croissant, and blueberry scone. Everything was tasty but I inadvertently got the gluten free scone and it was NOT the same--awful texture. It was on the top next to the pumpkin muffin. I wish the GF things would be on the bottom shelf or kept in the way back to avoid this in the future (only half kidding, but seriously nothing more disappointing than GF pastries :/

Their coffee was delicious (can't remember the brand). Prices are fair and service is great even when they have a line out the door. The line moves quickly and there's a lovely parklet outside. I've had the pizza at the other location and it's delish!
author: Semuteh F.

description: I miss you so much Arizmendi!!  Moved out of bay area, but still reminisce of those tomato faccachia bread, the pizza slices that are special for each day. I love you guys!!
author: Vanita G.

description: Arizmemdi is our fav. Hubby and I hit here every Friday and we try to squeeze in at least one more day. We even treat our pup to a baguette piece. Everything is truly delish. My boys and hubby always get the chocolate thing. I do the gluten free scone or when I'm off the gluten free wagon, the corn cherry scone. It's amazing!!! All the owner workers are awesome too!
author: N M.

description: Good thin crust pizza and bakery goods! Mocha was also pleasant.  Good place to stop by after a walk through golden gate park.  Prices are very reasonable and staff very friendly
author: Daniel M.

description: Cherry cornbread or the blueberry-pear scone....you can't go wrong with either choice. Don't try to save any of it for later, you'll be hard-pressed to stop enjoying these delicious baked goods. Both had a fresh, flavorful taste...slightly crunchy on the outside and moist on the inside.
author: Alidad V.

description: Pecan cinnamon roll thing was amazing. The cherry corn scone was delicious. The pizza was good, but a interesting taste. I would come back for the pecan roll.
author: Simon T.

description: Do not pass up this place. Chocolate mint cookie is outstanding, as is the olive-cheese bread. Grab a coffee from the Beanery down the street and never go hungry again!
author: James C.

description:
The 3 Pizza pieces was ok thin which is I like but I had it to go and it was very messy and oily everywhere and not so healthy and good 
the 3 slice was to pricy in my opinion. 9$ for the 3 pizza pieces normal size in sunset it's little bit much.
author: Dylan L.

description: YUM!  Line out the door, but it moves quickly so don't be deterred here.  We got four things - a warm-from-the-oven chocolate mint cookie (omg incredible!), a "chocolate thing" (roll dotted with dark chocolate bits - also delicious), a plain sourdough croissant (good but didn't taste the sourdough), and a corn cherry scone (yes!).  Everything was great - I'd probably skip that plain croissant next time, but I had to try it (and wanted it plain so I could taste the sourdough - but didn't taste any!).  Lots of other delicious items, and very friendly service.  The cookie tray was empty but I asked the cashier if they happened to have any chocolate mint cookies in the back, and voila, cookies were indeed cooling and waiting to be served.  YAY! :)
author: Shannon N.

description: Great place to pick up some baked goods. Their daily pizza specials are always good. Grab a slice and take a seat outside. They have a parklet outside which is pretty cool. I haven't been here in ages but they do accept card now with a minimum.
author: Baron T.

description: Arizmendi has the best pastries and pizza - my favorite being their coffee cake. There is usually a line out the door, but it's well worth the wait.
author: Kelsey F.

description: Needed a quick bite between appts and boy did this spit deliver!  A simply terrific slice of pizza and I splurged on a chocolate - sourdough croissant.  Heavenly.  Very limited seating but lucked out and got a bench on the street.  Will return for sure.
author: Sammy P.

description:
This is the best pizza I've ever had. Best in California. Put up against some New Jersey slices and it might get the K.O on them. Had the pizza of the day.

-house made tomato sauce
-basil pine nut pesto 
-sour dough crust and bread used 

Literally perfect. I did this for my own documentation to remember how great it was. Hilarious that the guy at register doesn't care about anyone .... When you focus on your craft, there is no room to care about people pleasing-- let the food do it.
author: Joshua F.

description:
There's Arizmendi's pizza then there's other pizza. I'd have to say that this was one of the better pizzas I've had in my life. As a whole, the pizza was very fresh and fragrant, unlike many of the pizzas I've eaten before. 

When I went on a Friday and there was only a 5 minute wait, and was well worth it.

The crust was nice and crispy with the cheese on it being very crispy as well. The roasted tomato was plump and juicy. The cheese was smooth and stringy. However, it was just a little too bland for my taste. Aside from that, it was a great pizza.
author: Ian W.

description:
What is there to say bad about this amazing co-op bakery in the inner sunset? It is just great...purty much everything they make tastes good.

I used to roll down here, when they first opened up, from forest hills when I lived there. What is truly amazing is that they still have kept true to all there core values...even after 15 years: respect the customer, respect the food and respect your workers....something a lot of companies could learn from.

First the food is unbelievable...fresh, using quality ingredients, and taking the time to make them right....oh their pizza, their scones, their savory baked goods...yummy. I am eating a pecan roll as I type this...damm there is butter all over the keyboard....but oh so worth it.

Second they treat their customers right....prices are very fair for what you get, the service is very good, and the attitude is very nice...see the line out the door...free market capitalism baby...give people what they want and they will support you (insert god bless america music here)

Thirdly, and perhaps most importantly, Arizmendi Bakery is a co op...owned in conjunction with the employees....yep...they own a piece of the action. What a better way to keep your fellow workers happy and in charge of their own destiny...really great idea.

I am sorry it took so long to come back...but we did...and are still blown away.

CHECK IT OUT!!!
author: David G.

description:
What exactly does a cooperative bakery mean? That they cooperate to bake? Or perhaps that their bakery items cooperate with one another to fulfill all your taste buds' wildest dreams?  Or that the co-op is a reflection of their way of life to bring happiness to people all around them?

Well, whatever the case, all I know is their stuff's decent...wait what am I talking about it's freakin' amazing! GO GET SOME NAU! 

Some fave items: 
Triple mushroom pizza = BOOM. 
Coffee cake = BOOM.
Chocolate mint cookie = BOOM (bonus: it's vegan!!!).

Extra Bonus: you ride a bike? get 10% off!
author: Vien N.

description:
I go nuts in bakeries where you can grab your own things. I do serious damage at places like these. (My personal favorites include 85 degrees bakery and Paris baguette). 

Anyway, a friend took me here and I loved it! I got the cheese roll, the blueberry Apple scone, and the chocolate croissant. The cheese roll was delicious warmed up for a few seconds but a bit too greasy for me. The  chocolate croissant was good, nothing to rave about. It was also good warmed up. But, hands down the scone was literally the best scone I've ever had in my life. It was not dry or crumbly at all and was super buttery and delicious. 

If I lived in the city I would totally come here all the time! 

Also this location has pizza similar to cheeseboard or sliver in Berkeley.
author: Mary J.

description:
I was SO excited to give Arizmendi a try and it was pretty darn good.  However, it wasn't as good as my absolute favorite (Cheeseboard) but it was awesome to have pizza at another place with incredibly delicious and unique pizza.

I want to come back and try more of their baked goods!  They looked delicious.
author: Alyx F.

description: Decent pizza, but a bit on the pricey side ($3/slice) given the size. I think a more fair price would be $2.50. The combination of toppings were ok but not great; could be the day I had visited.
author: Neha G.

description: Pizza of the day is awesome--have tried it on many occasions and while prefer some ingredients over others, the pizza crust and mix of flavors are always good. The other baked goods are wonderful too--focaccia is always excellent.
author: Roy C.

description:
I have yet to try Cheeseboard but this was the closest thing to it so we went. Got here on a weekday at around 11:30 and there was barely a line. We were thrilled thinking that maybe we beat the lunch rush?

The pizza of the day was a mushroom medley with a sweet, gingery glaze and topped with parsley. I loved the pizza. Not only did it look beautiful, but it tasted so fresh and wasn't overly cheesy. 

We also wanted to try some of their baked goods. I'm forgetting all the names but I got a cherry and corn scone, a chocolate chip roll, a raisin/ cinnamon roll, and huge muffin. Let's just say the pizza was the star of the day but their baked goods aren't bad. They just are a bit hard and dry, but I enjoyed them a lot more when I got home and put them in the toaster. Maybe i'll try some other baked goods next time I'm in the area again.
author: Rachel W.

description: Very rude staff here.  The young woman who served me seemed to be spoiling for an argument.  I don't know why.  She made me wait while she had a lengthy conversation with someone, and then made some very off-the-wall, passive-aggressive remarks to me.  Also, after many visits here, I find the baked goods here are way overpriced for the quality.  After this encounter, I won't be returning.  Hope the loss of a frequent customer was worth it to her and the owners.
author: john s.

description: Ordered a King Cake for Mardi Gras & my Birthday and will definitely be ordering one next year! The cake was delicious and very fresh! Loved the ambiance of the bakery itself and everyone I talked to to ensure a King Cake was reserved for me was very helpful and nice. I'll definitely be back in to try some of the other baked goods.
author: Kelly R.

description: first of all, these words-worker owned.  which is just a nice way to start things off.  second of all, go. a friend ran in, i asked for "something savory" with my morning coffee.  she brought out "some bialy thing", and a bialy thing in my book has never been a bad thing, but arizmendi took that to a whole new level-and my guess is that only a new yorker would call it a bialy thing.  here in nor cal they probably call it a pizza thing.  we will not get caught up in semantics, it's a good thing.  no skimping on the onions, poppy seed, plus cheese a little red pepper?  i'd say a stop here is a good way to start or end a day.  or.  you know. both? ;)
author: S Blair P.

description: Come for the scones, stay for the pizza! Delighted to see they have pan de los muertos!
author: Andrea B.

description:
Ah, Arizmendi Bakery... I can just smell their delicious pizzas as I write this review. Served on a thin sourdough crust and perfectly crisp, their pizzas are definitely my favorite in San Francisco! They're so cheesy, all vegetarian, and the ingredients used are so fresh! If it has mushrooms and/ or garlic oil, there's a very high chance that I'm coming in for a delicious, mouthwatering slice.

I've tried several of their pastries and cookies as well. Although I normally despise scones because of their dryness, Arizmendi's scones aren't too bad. They're a little moist and have a perfectly balanced dough to fruit ratio. The shortbread cookies are great as well, and I usually enjoy their weekly special flavored ones, such as lavender or green tea!

Except the pizzas, everything here is self-serve, and I'm not a big fan of that because I'm very very paranoid of whether or not people use the wax paper or their hands. The staff is super friendly. And they've added a parklet sometime earlier this year, which has its pros and cons: you can enjoy eating your awesome pizza outdoors, but at the same time, you loose 1-2 street parking spaces.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
They will not reheat my bialy, but they will reheat pizza...I don't get it...

I prefer their savory items over their sweet items. I've had their scones, muffins, breadsticks, bialies, pizza (yummmmm when they're fresh), cookies...cookies are just okay, they are no Anthony's cookies.

Closed on Mondays =[ I remember trying to go on Monday, not open.

CASH ONLY!
author: Kylie L.

description: This little gem stole my heart.  Great selection of freshly made breads, scones, muffins, and pizza right out of the oven.  Efficient and no hassle staff.
