You pick the items you want from the bins and staff ring you up.  This place could be dangerous for carb enthusiasts.  But so delicious!
author: Danielle M.

description: Their daily slices of pizza are always amazingly fresh and delicious. All their pizzas are vegetarian from my understanding, but they always taste divine! The crust is always perfectly crispy and I have never been disappointed with the pizza here!
author: Diana F.

description:
Lets get this out of the way ,,  
The entire Cooperative, Commune, Hippie, Vibe just rubs me the wrong way. and given that I have never seen the Staff Hustle , I keep getting the feeling that I am paying an inflated price to feed extra mouths that would not be on the payroll if this was a normal Bakery,  

That said ,  
There are still 2 reason why I come here ,  

The Pizza !  Pies change daily so its best to mark your calendar with the pies that catch your eye, and see if your still in the mood come baking day.  

and for me for when the Carnival / Mardi Gras Season comes around , and I need to come here because its ONLY the Arizmedi Bakeries that make a King Cake in San Francisco ! 

The balance of breads, and sweets are good, but they are not why I would make this a destination.
author: Joseph A.

description: We met a couple of our friends that live nearby for lunch here on their recommendation.  Love the fact that it's an employee owned cooperative.  You can taste the love!  They do a daily gourmet thin sourdough crust pizza, so we each got a slice.   We also shared a Focaccia, Cheese Roll, Corn Cherry Scone & Shortbread.  Everything was fantastic!
author: Joyce V.

description:
I had this amazing cookie from here. By amazing I mean I think I was probably just ingesting an entire stick of butter in one cookie, but regardless it was AMAZING. The cookie was delicious, rich, soft, chewy, oatmeal-y ... so good.

I heard so many good things about this bakery that I had hoped to try more things. Maybe I will try some Brioche Knots next time because that sounds fricken amazing! 

By yes, have the cookies, you may be eating a crapload of butter, but it's so deliciously worth it.
author: Lorrie M.

description:
First trip was last Wednesday I got lucky with the line.  I came for the honey whole wheat bread and I wasn't disappointed, it was one of the best loaves I've had, excellent.  Today, Sunday tried chocolate chip cookie and brownie, both very interesting flavor, really good, no EXCELLENT!   

I was tempted to drop their rating by one-star for lack of a bread slicer, but that didn't seem fair.  If they get a bread slicer I will make the hour round-trip just for the bread.
author: Timothy S.

description:
I stopped by here to grab a bite for breakfast and by 9:30 there were already people waiting out the door. Fortunately the line moves pretty quickly so the wait wasn't bad at all. 

I got myself a nice piece of their focaccia bread and a raspberry coffee cake. I was pleasantly surprised when I reached in to grab the focaccia that they were still warm and soft, the raspberry coffee cake also looked amazing so I had to grab myself a piece of that. The focaccia I got had parsley, feta cheese, roasted garlic, olives, and onions. The whole thing came together extremely well and it was delicious, I only wished that it was larger... 

The rest of their baked goods all looked good as well, I wanted to try the pecan rolls, as well as their strawberry scones but could eat so much.. But I plan on trying those two things the next time I stop by!
author: Zach C.

description:
Be prepared - Arizmendi is the type of place that you will get in line at, order something, get that something, scarf that something the second you pay for it, and get right back in line again. Believe me when I say that everything here is perfect - from the pizza to the cookies to the breads. Everything is delicious and expertly executed. 

There is a line but it moves quick. Prices are reasonable and the service is very friendly. The store is small and has very few tables. It was a little messy but based on the volume of patrons and the turn over, I wouldn't fault them for it. The outdoor eating area is nice, I also wish that was a bit bigger as well. Still, a fantastic experience and a must-eat in SF!
author: Kim K.

description:
On my trip to SF, I would pass the Arizmendi Bakery on my daily walking commute from Moraga to GGP or UCSF. Finally, I popped in to grab a slice of pizza and some pastries to take home. The service was speedy and the quality of the food was good. While not the best pizza of my life, we felt that it was made well and with high quality ingredients. The pastries were also very good. All in all, I'm a fan of this establishment for quick and good food. 

Verdict:
Good
author: Laila A.

description:
Mocha was blah, not strong enough.  Chocolate mint cookie was delicious, not sweet, great chocolate flavor, strong mint taste.

$10 minimum for credit card purchase.
author: J W.

description: All baked ones are fantastic. Service is very fine. I do not forget to visit this place whenever I go to SF.
author: Richard L.

description:
Why Arizmendi rocks...

Best pizza by the slice in SF.  This is not a typical pizza joint; no pepperoni or other customary fare.  Gourmet.  That is, gourmet that KICKS ASS.  Think Ferrari to your Volkswagen.  Whatever the pizza flavor of the day is, & it's only 2 friggin 50 a slice.  So it's the best deal in SF too.

They make whole pizzas, then you take it home & bake it.  Whole pizza is 20 bucks.  Love.

Pecan roll.  Brioche.  Cake.  Zucchini bread.  All amazing.  Like, you get to your car & start eating everything before you even start the ignition amazing; forget about getting home w your goods in tact.  I've found that it's best to put everything in the trunk till you get home.

Why Arizmendi rocks even more...

Wheat free. (Yes, I did wheat free for a while) They offer several wheat free items: scones, zucchini muffins, cowgirl cookies & ricciarelli, to name a few.  I love all of it, only I found the scones to be a bit dry.  But the zucchini muffins are the best, & the RICCIARELLI are EFFIN AMAZING.  Warm one up & it's one of the best things you'll ever eat.  W your morning coffee or tea?  Bliss.

Worker owned cooperative.  Love.  They really just crush it.  

Go.  And go early so you have the best selection.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Rating: 97/100 pts

Hands down one of the best bakeries I have ever been to in the US. Enjoy yourself a massive slice of foccacia bread, a freshly baked slice of pizza, a cookie (which are vegan, 'cause why not), a scone, a variation on some of San Francisco's well known sourdough bread, or any other heavenly combination of dough and/or batter that they have come up with.

I picked up a few items, the star of the show for me being the Strawberry Scone (the scone of the day). My intention was to eat it later, but I didn't make it too far out the door before I helplessly devoured it. The batter had a superb dryness to moisture ratio: not overly soft, but not tooth-shatteringly hard either, a failing that many lesser evolved scones tend to fall into. The natural sweetest and moisture of the fresh strawberries seeped into the bread, making for the best scone experience I have had in my life. That's right: I declare this to be the best scone I have ever had.

Scone aside, I also couldn't help but also buy a Chocolate Mint Cookie and a Zampano (a wonderful doughy bun topped with light cheese and red pepper seasoning) for something savory. All were amazing, not to mention so well-priced that I didn't even come close to breaking the $10 credit card minimum.

An excellently managed, well-concevied, and do-good local bakery off of San Francisco's Market street that is committed to nothing more than making people happy, one foccacia at a time.

Recommendation - A piece of Foccacia for now, and a Scone for later
author: Derek K.

description:
LOVE this place. There was a huge line Saturday am, so we went for an early lunch and came back after the line was better....

I filled a giant white box full of amazing goodness ( bread, cookies, pecan rolls, scones) and paid with my credit card (yay thanks for letting us use cards now, Arizmendi!)

Total cost was $20 which was waaaaay beyond reasonable for what I got.
author: El B.

description:
I'm still thinking of their focaccia bread with sun dried tomatoes and cheese.  Drool. It was super oily, but every bite was so good.  Oh why are you 400 miles away?

Their scones were also really good.  The cherry-corn scone tasted like buttery corn bread.

This is going to a must visit when I visit SF again next month.

It's a very small bakery with limited seating.
author: Dianna D.

description:
Arizmendi has evolved with the times.

It's a local institution that is always bustling with neighborhood regulars and their outside parklet is full of toothy kid smiles with parents in tow and tail wagging dogs - with tongues hanging out the side of their mouth.

It's a beautiful, beautiful place.

The aroma of fresh baked bread, kneaded with a wealth of love and care - is everywhere in the small store and they continue to amaze me with their innovative focaccia bread, scones, and daily made pizzas.

The purity of ingredients within each blessed Arizmendi is astounding. They don't put any fake or filler ingredients into their pastries and breads. It's the simple basic ingredients that your grand-parents and your great-grand-parents grew up on. 

I've been especially impressed by Arizmendi's gluten free options which are remarkably what's up. Their blueberry gluten free scone and their gluten-free moist carrot muffin are divine and so satisfying.

I love Arizmendi. It's so right. And so San Francisco.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Stopped by after lunch on this past rainy Saturday since I was a block down and still had time in the meter.  I wanted to get something for later.  I think the format of the storefront is odd.  Like how you have to open each little drawer and use the tissue and bag for everything.  It's just too cluttered (thus is why you see a line sometimes forming out the door).  But my biggest gripe is the foccaica were all shoved in there.  These are big, cheesy and soggy pieces of bread.  They should be individually laid flat and be put in something sturdier than a paper bag (the oil seeped through a little even when double bagged).  Bf & I chose their Southwest foccacia ($3.75) to share for later that night and we got his mom a chocolate croissant ($3.25).   

His mom thought the chocolate crossaint, though it looked very flakey, was just okay. The Southwest foccacia had corn, tomatoes, and cheese on it.  Some of the cheese and tomatoes fell off in the bag.  I loved the bread and though their foccacia is more pizza like than traditional foccacia it was a nice change of pace.  It didn't wow me though however.  I know everyone raves about their pizza, so I probably should have gotten a slice or two to bring home instead.  I may return when in the area for something sweet, but Sheng Kee is now just down the block and I always know my favorites there and what to expect since this franchise is very consistent.
author: Cat C.

description: Very fresh and nice selection of various pastries. The cornbread is really good.  Their pizzas are quite delicious and go on sale after a certain hour of the day.
author: Kimberly H.

description: Wow this place is absolutely to die for! Their pizza and scones and cookies are all so so so so good! This place was so good I had to come back a 2nd time. I highly recommend it! Parking kind of sucked. It's all metered parking. Just had to keep driving around the block over and over again to test my luck. Other than that, this place is freaking awesome!
author: Nari L.

description: My husband and I are great fans of Arizmendi pizza. So tasty and the people are very nice. I also love their pastries, chocolate things is my favorite!
author: Geetha M.

description:
If you happen to be in the 9th and Irving area, Arizmendi is a must. Everything here is wonderful, fresh, and most importantly tasty. Whenever I come here, I always have urges to order their pizza which is $2.50 for one slice. The ingredients are always vegetarian and they usually use pesto as a sauce instead of marinara. However, pizza is not the only good thing you can pick up from here. The breads and pastries taste very hearty. I like their different focaccia breads when I fell like something more filling and their cookies satisfy my sweet tooth.

The workers are always kind and helpful. Arizmendi also has great seating inside and outside. It's a great place to chill with friends and have a great meal. I am definitely a fan.
author: Jessica E.

description:
Gayle and I each took last Friday afternoon off and came into the City to see the Georgia O'Keeffe Exhibit at the De Young. After that, we walked over to Park Chow for Lunch, and on a hunch I asked Gayle to see if there was an Arizmendi nearby. This small chain evolved from Berkeley's Cheese Board, and I've been a regular patron of their shops in Emeryville, Oakland, and San Rafael.  And what do you know, this Inner Sunset Outpost was only a block or 2 away!

Gayle works for the City of Walnut Creek, and I'm fond of pointing out that this Contra Costa County economic powerhouse will (in my eyes) remain a bakery backwater until an Arizmendi sets up shop there. In the meantime, I will continue to be "forced" to travel many miles for a chance to buy corn cherry scones, socialist pizza, and other gluten goodness. 

We found that and more at this Arizmendi. This version seems smaller than the other ones, but with similar selections and consistently delicious versions. I picked out a half a dozen assorted scones for the week and left knowing that my upcoming mornings would start off on the right foot. Our extra bonus was the chocolate chip cookie that was wonderfully warm, melty, and tasty.
author: Eric B.

description:
This place is the best! scones, Brioches knots, sourdough bread, Pizza, cinnmon buns, cookies, pizza dough, good coffee. This place has it all. beat it, GF-ers(GlutenFree-ers)! I'm eating gluten. I'm breathing gluten. I'm going to Arizmendi. 

ride your bicycle and wear your helmet at the register and get a discount (5 or 10% maybe?)
author: Aaron S.

description: I fall in love with Arizmendi Bakery for couple years now since I did my internship in San Francisco. Both savory and sweet bakeries are tasty with reasonable price. After my internship, every time I have a chance, I pack a big bag of the bakery back with curious eyes of friends and other customers (like I never had bakery bread in my life). My favorite is Wolverine Bread. Best if you brink it back home, toast in the oven, and have it with anything you like.. butter, jam, or peanut butter.
author: Tee P.

description:
Ah I love this place. I've had this place bookmarked for quite some time and finally got to try it.

I was staying super close by so decided to come here and get a quick bite after San Tung was closed for some reason. Im glad they were closed though since I got to try this place instead.

Small little bakery and you pretty much just grab the fresh and hot pastries yourself.  I got their pizza of the day which looks and sounds so simple but was super good! the crust was nice and crispy. I also tried their artichoke focaccia as well and that was good.

I came back here the next day as well and was tempted to go there again the third day in a row but they were closed.
author: Phuong K.

description: Amazing place, lovely people and very, very good food!! Bakery for both sweet and salt flavours, it's a shame it is not closer to where I live
author: Giovanni C.

description:
Haha can't believe how long I've been goin here.. once a week for years now *drool Their pizzas are obviously delicious and always vegetarian (yay) (I want one now :( thinking of the thin crisp sourdough crust...sigh). I find their dessert-ish items just ok.. but the pizzas and breads more than make up :) The folks here are a delight :) and the crowd is diverse and interesting.. fun for meeting new friends or just people watching.

A warm spot in the cold sunset area, I'm SO grateful for its existence!
author: P G.

description:
Fast moving line on a Friday morning. Only had the stomach space to try the pizza, since we were going to lunch soon. The pizza of the day ($2.50/slice) was a better version of a margherita pizza- garlic oil, basil, spinach, tomato, and cheese. It was delicious. The bottom crust is very crisp, while the middle is doughy and soft. My bf didn't like the doughy layer, but I really enjoyed the textural variety. I can't wait to come back sometime to try the scones and desserts.

Credit cards have a $10 minimum purchase. Outdoor seating available.
author: Alice T.

description:
It was cold, rainy and blustery outside. What better place to be than in a bakery! Having completed my visit to the De Young museum to see their fabulous special exhibits, I wanted to eat something local and fresh so I made my way to Arizmendi Bakery.

They had a delicious veggie pizza with goat cheese and carmelized onions. I had to have a slice. If you eat there, the bakery staff will heat it up for you and present it to you on a wickery plate. The crust is thin and crisp. The flavors are robust. For $2.50, a slice is a deal! I probably should of had two...

Great people watching from the windows and they have a cutesy parklet outside.  I shall return.
author: Joanna T.

description: Best cheese scone I had in a while! It was good to eat it cold, but so much better if you wait to get home and heat it up in the oven. Also de oats scone is super good with a coffee!
author: Maria S.

description:
Man, carbs are so sinful.  But you know I'm a sinner, and I'm probably gonna sin again.  And in that case, Arizmendi's is the gateway to hell.  

After a much-deserved beer across the street, I dropped by to get a few slices to go.  Around 4:00 p.m. on the Sunday before Christmas, when the rest of San Francisco was dead for all intents and purposes, there was a line winding out of the door.  

While you wait in line, there are bins of pastries to your left to keep you occupied.  The girl in front of me could not seem to control herself and grabbed bag after bag of baked goods.  She must have amazing metabolism.  As for my metabolism-challenged self, I chose a single cheese scone to enjoy tomorrow morning (I am in a savory mood after a full weekend of peppermint bark).  That scone will cost me a full hour at the gym tomorrow.  

AB does a different pizza everyday.  Luckily, AB posts their pizza calendar online, making it easy for me to avoid all mushroom days, as I am fungi-adverse. Today's pizza featured sweet potatoes, goat cheese, red onion, shallot oil, parsley and Parmesan.  That combination works very well for me (crazy delicious).  My only regret is that I did not take a whole pizza home for hoarding purposes.  When you order pizza, they take your name and will call you when it's ready. The bakery itself is tiny--there's about three tables inside--not exactly ideal for waiting, but AB served up my order right quick.  If you just order slices, it comes wrapped in environmentally friendly aluminum foil.  Nice!  

I noticed they had a few gluten-free options for your pain-in-the-ass friends and family members.  You know who you are.  

I ordered a medium coffee in an attempt to cross-cancel the 3/4 of an IPA I had imbibed (I'm a lightweight these days).  I was very impressed with that coffee--it was super fresh and very, very good.  I think the brand was Centro, but don't quote me as I had IPA-induced short term memory loss.

I note that I was able to park right in front of the bakery.  *Bonus.  I went to pay the meter and the meter was $2.00/hour without the option to pay with a card  (unlike the smart meters on the Embarcadero).  Yeezus, $2.00 for parking and you expect me to have quarters for that?  I'd love to know who is carrying around $2.00 worth of quarters with them, but I'd be willing to bet they're using them as a substitute for brass knuckles.  I decided to roll the dice (and not pay) because in general, I feel like a jackass asking a business to give me $2.00 worth of change.  Luckily, I was not ticketed by Law & Order: Special Parking Unit.  Even if you do get a parking ticket in San Francisco, you can pay the fine by volunteering at the Food Bank (so awesome).  

That reminds me, AB is CASH ONLY.  I can keep complaining about "cash only," but it's clearly an exercise in futility.  I love this spot--I'll definitely be back.  P.S. They are closed from Christmas through New Year's Day, so see you in 2014.
author: Sunny S.

description:
Dear Arizmendi Bakery,

You make my mornings 100 x better whenever I stop by. First off, I get to smell the scent of freshly baked breads very frequently. I get to see the hustle and bustle of workers preparing and mixing, making coffee espressos, helping customers at the cash register to get my morning going. I see people inside chatting or reading as they sit at the two little tables centered in the room or by the window which reminds me not to forget to enjoy my morning and the day. But most of all, the thing that makes my eyes glaze and puts a smile on my face are the shelves and trays of beautiful baked goods and the thought of eating them all. Breads. Rolls. Cheese rolls. Handmade pizzas. Scones. More scones! Cookies... You have it all! You even have a little cheese fridge that I have yet to sample. 

My favorite salty snack is the Cheese roll. I feel lucky whenever I get a warm one... which makes me lucky pretty often. Your scones of the days are always so unique and AMAZING! From your standard kinds with berries, black berries, etc. to special seasonal ones... snippets of pear and I am pretty sure I had one with bits of persimmon last fall...I am always curious to see what the 'Scone of the Day' is!

Thank you for supplying Inner Sunset with your delicious treats. I shall be back again and again.

Love,
Grace
author: Grace J.

description:
I love this place due to its accessibility and the great pizza they have. 
Whenever I am around the area, I like to drop in for a slice of the daily pizza and a chocolate mint cookie. Their pizza of the day is different everyday. I have been there over five times and haven't have a repeat pizza of what I already had. I am guessing they have a lot of different types of pizzas. They are also very affordable. 
If you are going for the pizza, go after 11am.
author: Yushi C.

description:
The pizza here has never disappointed! They are a vegetarian pizza place that serves one type of pizza each day. They have a menu online that tells you the type of pizza that will be served each day. However, there may be some last minute changes that occur so definitely be sure to look the day of before going if you are looking for a particular flavor.

Some of my recommendations from what I have tried:

1. shiitake, portabella and button mushrooms, sesame-ginger-garlic vinaigrette - by far one of their most popular pizzas. The mushrooms are made to perfection and the sauce seals the deal. It is very flavor for just having mushrooms on it. The vinaigrette is definitely something you would not have tried at other pizza places. Their crust is also made very well. Although thin, the crust has a lot of flavor that is complemented by the vinaigrette. Definitely a must try!

2. roasted yukon gold potatoes, mixed greens, Dubliner cheese, garlic oil, chives and parsley - another favorite of mine! The potatoes are sliced very thinly and are nice and crispy with each bite of the pizza. The cheese is very distinct and adds a nice bold flavor to the pizza. 

Each slice is $2.50 but I usually like to get a whole pizza and freeze the rest for lunch or dinner. Their pizzas are so good, you cannot simply leave with just having one or two slices. I have also tried their foccacia bread, which is also amazing! Their pastries and breads are a must try while you wait in line to order your pizza ;)
author: Wendy Z.

description:
I've had a craving for bread, so what do I do? I came to Arizmendi Bakery! (I know, weird huh? A bread craving, not sweets.) 

I looked around and saw no tray. So, I grabbed a bag and filled it with a Focaccia, a bread stick & a few petite baguette. I hope this is the right process of getting my breads.

- Focaccia: Smells delicious! It smells like fresh basil and thyme. Just from smelling it, my mouth was drooling. It had pieces of eggplants and onions. It was just oh so delicious that I would order this everyday if I can. 
- Breadstick: It's perfect. It's not one of those thick rolls/sticks, but a thin one. There's a nice crunch to it and it's sprinkled with parmesan cheese (I think, it's parmesan), which feels like the whole bread eating experience seem like eating at a 5 star restaurant. It's good quality bread.
- Petite baguette: What can I say, it's just as good as all the other goodies in this bakery. Smells great with the sesame seeds on top. And it's great for making mini sandwiches. YUMS!

Tip: Please don't paper-bag your Focaccia, the olive oil from it will break your bag. Ask for a plastic bag from the cashier and he'll be happy enough to give you one. I'm so thankful for this, because if I didn't ask, it would've fell through the paper bag.
author: Jane C.

description: Definitely my favorite bakery in the whole city. Great selection and friendly staff:)
author: Michael H.

description:
I finally came to Arizmendi two weeks ago and I love their pizza!!! It's so good and worth the price, but you might need two to fill you up! I also tried the coffee cake which was worth the hype. I would definitely come again, but next time I want to try the focaccia! all the toppings looks so good =)

Con: few tables, hard to find a place to sit
author: Tina P.

description:
I've had quite a few items here ranging from scones to pizza to other random items.  Everything has been good but exceptional?  Eh...not really.  

The quality of the products are amazing though.  Definitely some thought and work placed into every item.

Prices are the usual that you'd find at any local bakery.  4 stars.
author: Jen W.

description: This place never disappoints.  Last time I went in I got a slice of pizza.  Heaven.  Along with some sugary goodie.  I think it was a blueberry cake of some sort.  Yummy.  Love this place.  Always stop by if I am in the neighborhood and can find parking!
author: Marvelous Margaret M.

description:
Instructions for Ordering and Enjoying the BEST Slice of Pizza in SF:

1. Follow the smell of freshly baked goods permeating in the air along 9th Avenue (between Irving/Judah).

2. Walk into Arizmendi Bakery after 11:30 AM and before 7 PM (before 6 PM on weekends).

3. Don't let your eyes stray you. Go past the rolls, baguettes, focaccia, pecan rolls, cookies, muffins, scones, etc. and head straight to the counter.

4. Order a slice of "Today's Pizza" and hand over $2.50 to the cashier.

5. Step aside while you wait for your slice.

6. Inconspicuously wipe the drool off the corners of your mouth as you watch the pizza being sliced.

7. When your piping hot slice of pizza is ready, take it to the ledge, and put several shakes of crushed red chili pepper flakes onto it.

8. Eye rape your pizza (the only time "raping" is encouraged) and all the delicious oooey gooeyness.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/xDwEMq8kgT0eQepn90Jkvg?select=9BqXJ6HBxHeOMyO2aJVz5Q

9. Take a bite and savor the hearty, crunchy thin sourdough crust and top-notch seasonal, organic ingredients with mouth-watering salty richness from the melted whole-milk mozzarella cheese. 

10. Welcome and embrace the following sensations:
*Taste buds dancing in your mouth
*Trembling of your knees
*Tingling in your toes
*A euphoric sensation overcoming your entire body

And that's what you call a FOODGASM, my friend.

P.S. - Keep plenty of tissue near you. You will need it.

OTHER NOTES:
*The Cheeseboard (Berkeley) is their sister co-op
*Rotating bread and pizza menu:
-Bread Menu: http://www.arizmendibakery.com/bread
-Pizza Menu: http://www.arizmendibakery.com/pizza
*Self-serve bakery (please use wax paper to pick up your baked goods)
*Expect a long line on the weekends
*Several tables and chairs inside and outside 
*Cash Only
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
In his search for the perfect macaron, ADDA DADA, decided to also look for the perfect BUCHE DE NOEL (Christmas log cake or YULE LOG). The holidays were upon us, and it would not be a traditional Christmas without a BUCHE DE NOEL cake for dessert.

The PERFECT 'BUCHE DE NOEL'  was found at Arizmendi Bakery !  (Just LOOK at the photo...makes you want to lick the screen, doesn't!)

Absolute heaven! The bakers were angels to have extra BUCHE DE NOELs on Christmas eve for those of us who did not order in advance. (yes, shame on me , I was a naughty boy for not pre-ordering. But, no guilt at ARIZENDI BAKERY. They had several on hand for their customers!)

ARIZMENDI BAKERY made our Christmas dinner complete with our traditional dessert, the BUCHE DE NOEL. MERCI 

It truly was chocolate heaven with whipping cream filling. Even, the meringues mushrooms were so tasty, and perfectly formed. "They're so cute.", exclaimed my mom. 

And now, for your FOODIE HISTORY LESSON:   NAPOLEON BONAPARTE created the first 'SPARE THE AIR DAY' & obliquely ,the first BUCHE DE NOEL. How? Pray tell, you say. Parisians were ordered not to use their fireplaces around Christmas because the air quality became so bad in Paris. So Parisian bakers came up with a symbolic substitute, the BUCHE DE NOEL (chocolate cake in shape of a log). The BUCHE DE NOEL is a time honored Christmas traditional dessert in France. 

Arizmendi Bakery made the best in San Francisco ! (I've had others, mind you.) It also looked super fantastically beautiful.  (OTHER bakeries and OTHER stores had gooey messes on display..those 'yule logs' looked very unappetizing. ).

Also, I'd like to mention. After constantly trying to find edible bread in the City. (OK, I've been spoiled by the bakers in Paris.) Well, I've found the top bread on the list. ARIZMENDI BAKERY's breads are wonderful. Nice and tasty, and surprisingly crunchy crust. My mom and I just marvel over the complexity of the taste. And, yes, we go across the City just to pick up their bread! 

MERCI ARIZMENDI BAKERY for making the best BUCHE DE NOEL outside of PARIS...and some of the best breads outside of PARIS. You've hit the high marks and the gourmet stars in SAN FRANCISCO.
author: Addadada A.

description: Everything is pretty pricey, but you're also paying for the quality of the ingredients. I love how all of the food is sitting on big racks when you walk in - it's very informal and such a great way to figure out what you want. Another thing I like about Arizmendi's pizza is that they only cook one type each day. I'm usually really indecisive when trying to order food, so this makes things a lot easier for me!
author: Carolina S.

description:
Amazingly delicious & friendly, nice people working there!
(my faves are the currant scone, pumpkins muffins, bialys & daily pizza!)
author: Evanovich M.

description:
This is quick eats I have ever had. The focaccia bread with toppings hot out of the oven is so good I wanted to buy a full tray. 

Their shortbread is also pretty stellar.

Only downside is that there is very little seating, most of which is outside, so on foggy days, no bueno.
author: Mallory D.

description:
I love baked goods and I especially love baked goods from Arizmendi. This place already has solid reviews so I will just list a few of my favorite things:

Chocolate Thing 
Foccacia Bread
Brioche Knots
Cheese Rolls
Sourdough Loaf
Green Tea Shortbread
Pizza by the slice

They also have a small selection of great cheese and yogurt.

I love the parklet outside the shop, but wish there was more seating because this place gets busy :)

There is a $10 credit card min I think, so usually this means that  I buy more baked goods than planned in order to use my cc, which...is just what I tell myself to explain why I always leave with so many items.
author: Alice H.

description:
This is a cooperative bakery, sister bakeries with Cheeseboard, for any of you from the East Bay. We stopped by for a quick grab and go breakfast on our way to church on morning. The place is always busy, even on an early Sunday morning in the rain. Their chai latte is way too milky for my tastes. It's like frothy milk with a hint of spicy chai. Wouldn't recommend it. 

We also got the cherry cornmeal scone and some kind of chocolate bread. The bread was the highlight of our goodies. It was a nice twist to your regular SF sourdough with a hint of sweetness and chocolate mixed in. The cornmeal scone had an interesting texture which didn't fly with everyone in our group, but I generally like a grainier texture that I can chew through, so it didn't bother me. 

Great place to stop for baked goods!
author: Annie S.

description: I usually only come for the pizza but decided to try a peanut butter cookie this time. The cookie is more on the crunchy side than soft and chewy (how I like it) but it was still good.  Arizmendi isn't my first choice when it comes to pizza but it's still really good given that this location is close, doesn't have a long line, and open on Sundays!  Maybe one of these days I will grab one of the baked goods but I always get so full off the pizza. The focaccia bread looks really good.
author: Irene C.

description:
Been to this particular Arizmendi only a few times but have had the good fortune to try out a bunch of different stuff.  Few weekends ago, after hearing our Mission Arizmendi was having oven issues, we headed here instead & loaded up on the following:

Cheese Pin Wheels - nice sourdough round w/ lots of cheese

Cheese Tomato Roll - pungent cheese & soft, squirty slice of tomato all in a sourdough roll - yum!  

Their Green Olive & Provolone Rolls are incredible - nice salty green olives are mixed w/ onions & little hunks of cheese scattered throughout the bread - which is soft & doughy, just like I like it!

Peach / Blueberry Scone - sweet hunks of peaches & blueberries were combined w/ the buttery, soft scone - this needed zero jam or butter & was a delight to eat all on its own!

Their Pumpkin Muffin is my absolute fave & has taken my #1 spot for pumpkin breads!  SOOO soft, moist & doughy, lots of cinnamon topping - this was almost like eating a bread pudding it was so doughy.....def my new #1 pumpkin creation of all times!

Also grabbed a couple of their half-baked pizzas & this particular day ( they make 1 kind of pizza & it's different every day ) was the 3-Mushroom w/ a Sesame Vinaigrette.  Loving the fact there was mushroom abundance....no skimping on the shrooms!!  And the crust was soft yet chewy like a good pizza crust should be - it was thin but there was still enough substance for it to have that bit of chew

Thanks so much for the carbilicious days - everything froze extremely well & while we had intended to have these delights on hand for quite some time, let's just say that nothing stayed frozen for very long!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
This is the best pizza I've had outside Italy and I lived in NYC. The sourdough crust is chewy, crunchy, soft but tough in the way only real artisan dough can be. The toppings are masterful- cherry tomatoes taste tart and sweet after being carmelized in the oven and they put the pesto on top of the pizza after the cheese was baked a little. This is the Thursday pizza. I'm so looking forward to the other variations. 

Also their other baked goods are amazingly well done. The shortbread is buttery and sophisticated and comes in a variety of flavors. I also had a cookie. Their focaccia reminds me of the dense Roman pizza I ate all the time when I lived there.

So worth it.
author: Priya S.

description:
I was expecting awesomeness when I saw the amount of people waiting in line here but in the end Arizmendi fell a bit short...

There were a ton of people in line on a Saturday afternoon but my friend wanted to stop by and grab something so I decided to try something as well. I picked the giant coffee cake in the window that looked awesome, but had a bit of trouble fitting it in the bag since it was kind of a giant slice. Everything is self service and then once you get up to the front you tell the cashier what you picked out. I was charged $3.50 for my cake. 

The portion was huge but I was expecting more flavor from the cake itself, and since there were supposed to be berries in there I was excited for the fruit. However there wasn't very much fruit so I ended up just eating a lot of flavorless bread. At least the crunchy, sugary topping was pretty good but I wanted more fruity berries!! There were only a few and it wasn't enough to satisfy my craving. 

I'd still return to give some of their other items a try though... Perhaps a cookie? If I'm in the area maybe I'll pick up something else but I won't be tempted by the coffee cake again.
author: Sam F.

description:
Love the pizzas, brioches, bread sticks, cookies, etc.

EDIT: I wrote one line of this review and had a sudden urge to walk two easy peasy blocks to satisfy my craving for arizmendi! 

Today's pizza special was spinach, goat cheese, & rosemary oil for $2.50! Yes, I recall a slice of pizza was merely $1.00 back then, but hey inflation at its finest. As a matter of fact, the breadsticks were only 50 cents in 2003. Now looking at it for $1.50, I am skeptical in purchasing it. Actually, I take that back. I would purchase it, maybe 2 now. 

11 years later and I'm still a fan of arizmendis! Make loaves, not war.
author: Briana H.

description:
Awesome vegetarian pizza using fresh and wholesome ingredients!  The crust is crispy and is the perfect thickness to still be able to taste the ultra fresh toppings.  I had the mushroom, sugar plum tomatoes, Dubliner cheese, and garlic oil pizza.  Super good and wish I had some right now! 

I also tried the gluten free pumpkin muffins.  I didn't know it was gluten free until my friend told me.  I honestly couldn't tell it was gluten free (which is great), since I've had some pretty gross GF baked goods.  I had some delicious coffee cake as well, it was supposed to be for my breakfast the next day, but I couldn't stop eating it!  It wasn't too sweet and so great with some hot tea of coffee.  

I'll have to go in again and try other pizzas, as it changes daily, and will definitely grab more baked goods as well!
author: Wendy S.

description:
I came here during linner to snack on some bread/pizza/whatever-I-could-find with a friend.
Arizmendi is a perfect grab-and-go place.

My friend and I shared two pizzas. One with tomatoes, red onions, feta cheese, basil, rosemary, and olive oil and another with artichoke, spinach, and garlic parmesan. They were huge in size, but both flavors tasted a little bland to me and the dough wasn't all that spectacular. Also, both weren't heated, which I guess is our fault for not asking. 

I would never feel scared to come by Arizmendi again due to health issues or disgustingly-tasting food, but I wouldn't go out of my way to try this place again.
author: Jane S.

description:
Something weird happened with my last review but this one will be better anyway. $2.75 for a slice of the amazing pizza of the day ($22 for a whole pie). You can also get it half-baked to finish at home. Check online for the flavor calendar!

Pair your slice with some dessert, or for brekkie before the pizzas come out at 11 am. The scones are huge.. I kinda just like the outside crusty bits. I am a fan of the chocolate sourdough croissant, though boyfriend finds them too dense (I actually don't mind it, though I do prefer them normally light and flaky). Their cookies are bomb. Enjoy whatever you get on their parklet or window bar and people-watch for a bit. I'll see you there!
author: Vivian H.

description:
Was craving a delicious sweet dessert after lunch and where better to go then Arizmendi?!

We each got their chocolate chip cookies. It's a pretty big cookies too. Crunchy as you bite in but soft on the inside. yummm. Just how I like my cookies. It wasn't too sweet either. They also have other flavors, but I like the classic choc chip.

This place is a chain restaurant and is known for the bakeries and pizza. I've tried them at a different location but they should still hold the same reputation. This location is in SF and in Sunset District so parking is a bit more difficult.

They have a large variety of baked goods to choose from and all baked fresh daily.
They also make their pizza of the day fresh. You will always get it hot out of the oven. And it's only $2.50 a slice and they give you a little extra ;D. It's vegetarian pizza, but don't let that turn you away. It's flavorful and delicious and the crust is a perfect balance between soft and crunchy. You also won't be disappointed with their pastries too.

Great place to grab breakfast and lunch!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
This is possibly the awesomest bakery in the world! They have pizza!!

I love the various sweet and savory baked goods they have. The focaccia is delicious. The line is usually pretty long, but if you come right before they close, then there's no wait at all!
author: Sherry L.

description: Consistently good and well-priced baked goods, including bread, muffins, pizza, and cookies. I particularly like the vegan dark chocolate mint cookies (I am not a vegan, but really like the cookies).
author: Jethro B.

description: Excellent!!  I had the gluten free blueberry scone and it was really delicious and my husband had the raspberry coffee cake which was also great. We are visiting but I am going to make a point of coming back for more pastry and the pizza!
author: Christine C.

description: I was recently reminded how lucky I was to live a couple blocks from this place. Amazing Friday Challah- it sells out, so go early or call so they keep one for you. And of course, while you're there, eat a slice of pizza to get your mind blown!
author: Anita E.

description: I see what all the hype is about! We had the roasted sweet potato pizza; very tasty! I had ordered a Housemade Chai with Soy and because the bakery was so busy, the cashier forgot to make it. When I asked about my drink, he offered me a cookie of my choice on the house! Excellent Cowgirl Cookie and even better customer service!
author: Emily S.

description: Good, but I don't find that it lives up to the hype. Pizza wavers from interesting and delicious (e.g. Indian curry) to standard and nothing too special (mozz + tomatoes). Baked goods are pretty good (try the wolverine roll), but I don't think worth a special trip. So, good choice if you're in the neighborhood, but not worth seeking out.
author: Mar D.

description:
I wish I could write a review about their baked goods but unfortunately it was not to be. There was a really long line and after waiting 20 minutes for two cookies I was told there was a $10 minimum for credit card purchases. And in their defense there was a small sign at the register that was visible once I got there. For about 30 seconds I looked for other things I might buy, and got out of line so others waiting wouldn't be inconvenienced. But even so, the customers and staff treated me like I had no business being there so I put my cookies on the counter and walked out. 

It's 2015, everyone uses credit/debit for everything these days. And I'm fairly certain all the merchant account providers don't allow purchase minimums. There was no need to treat me that way, especially when your average item is only $2.50. It's not as if I wanted to write a check. 

La Boulange, Tartine & B Patisserie don't have minimums.
author: Alex W.

description: What a great bakery! I came here upon the recommendation of my sister-in-law while I was visiting San Francisco. I was NOT disappointed! We had the mushroom, red onion, asiago cheese, and garlic oil pizza- SO GOOD! I also got a couple really tasty cookies. I saw that they had a chocolate mint cookie and was SO excited until I read that it was vegan. Nooooo! I've never been impressed by vegan desserts. My sister-in-law decided to try it and let me taste some. WOW. I immediately got back in line and bought one. My only regret is that I didn't buy ten more to take back home with me. I can't wait to visit this bakery again!   :)
author: Courtney R.

description:
You know you've found a good place when you arrive at 8 (knowing it opens at 7:30) and there's already a line out the door! 

This place has beautifully rustic baked goods.One thing I absolutely LOVE about this bakery is that the owners aren't in the back/chillin' in the office, they're helping to make everything also! It makes a huge difference; their love and dedication to their business are baked in to everything they sell. 

There is SO much to try, and you can't possibly try everything in one day, so if you live nearby I'd recommend trying a few different things every time you stop by, and then you'll figure out your favorites (although everything really is delicious, so you can't go too wrong here)! 

This place is 100% worth stopping by no matter what time it is!
author: Katie 2.

description:
How did I live without their pizza for so long? Cold. Hot. Sunday at 8am. Sunday at 2pm. It doesn't matter. I want it and I want it now! 
Thank God I moved or else I would be a huge heffer, eating this all the time. Deliciousness comes with a cost...my good looks and hot body.
author: Julianna I.

description: This place is awesome.  I crave the coffee cake, it's perfect.
author: Sarah S.

description:
+1000 reviews is a sure sign this place is AMAZING. Delicious and sustainable products and is a part of the same co-op as the Cheeseboard in Berkeley. 

// LOCATION // On 9th in Inner Sunset, conveniently right off the N Judah stop. 

// HOW TO //
     +Grab some parchment paper and/or paper bags that are hanging on each of the shelves 
     +Peruse the baked goodies in the cases and use the parchment paper to snag your items of choice
     +Bring your bagged items up to the register and tell the cashier what you grabbed so they know how much to ring you up for. They trust you :) 
     +Pizza: Look on the board to see what the flavor of the day is. Walk straight by the people still making their bakery selections and order your slice at the register. Pay at the register and they will either serve your slice fresh or call your name when the next pie is out of the oven.

// FOOD // I've tried a majority of the items here and they are so tasty. 
     +Coffee Cake: My absolute favorite item here. Huge squares of moist coffee cake with some seasonal fruit baked into the top. The cake is so soft and the brown sugar crumbl-y top is to die for. My favorite so far is the strawberry. Only served on Saturdays and Sundays!
     +Chocolate chip cookies: On the pricer side, but huge chocolate chips are baked through out. When you heat it up, it becomes gooey and amazing.
     +Pecan roll: A bit too sticky for my taste
     +Blueberry scone: Dense, but yummy. Not too sweet either 
     +Mushroom and fennel focaccia: Delish but on the oily side
     +Mushroom pizza: So amazing. the crust is cooked perfectly to give you a slight crunch and the whole slice has so much flavor without making you feel heavy/gross after. 

*tip: Some of the stuff has been sitting in the display cases for a bit and can get a bit hard/tough/chewy. Pop everything in the microwave for about 10 seconds and they will be absolutely amazing!
author: Pauline P.

description: OMG! Best gluten-free options in a bakery that I have ever tasted. Bonus is that the Huz says gluten options are first rate too. Great bakery; great staff; great find.
author: Cydney B.

description: Arizmendi is bae.  I have been here 100+ times and have never once been disappointed.  If anything, I always find another reason to come back and try something new.  This is hands down my favorite bakery in San Francisco and also serves some of my favorite pizza in the city, definitely the best in the Sunset.  Their specials that they make for holidays are always worth splurging for.  I bring their desserts to dinner parties and everyone always loves them.  The Cheese and Tomato Bialy might be the steal of the century here.  Or the slice of pizza.  Or the cheese roll.  Or the bread stick.  Or the baguette.  Oh no, the scone.  Definitely the scone.  Whatever they are making that day, get 1 (2).  The pesto pizza here reserved a spot on my final meal wish list a long time ago.  Always happy to share this place with new folks.
author: Daniel C.

description:
I guess we came by a little too late in the day (around 3pm on a Sunday) because the shelves were pretty bare.  I was looking forward to trying their tomato & cheese bialy but they were all out.  I decided just to get a shortbread cookie for my daughter so I grabbed a paper bag, a piece of tissue, grabbed the cookie and put it in the bag.  The cookie was pretty but not awe-worthy.

However, I did see that they make pizza and it smelled really, really good.  The next time I'm back to try a bialy, I'll be sure to give their pizza a try.
author: Rose A.

description: Perfect offering for a perfect Sunday morning breakfast at home. Just the right size pastries and wonderful breads.
author: Roger B.

description: I have been here once and I loved it! I was a little hesitant to try the pizza at first because I was so used to the usual pepperoni blah blah blah. I'm so glad I got to eat here! I loved it! I have yet to try the baked goods though.
author: Jenn T.

description:
I bought a current scone. 

I ate the current scone. 

It was a yummy current scone.

I'd like to come back to try the pizzas. They looked delicious and overloaded with toppings. 

Yelp is forcing me to add this review as a tip because it's so short but what else can I say??
author: Ada C.

description:
SCONES, SCONES, SCONES!

I brought about a dozen to work & they were a huge hit! I brought currant, oat, cherry & corn, and blackberry-pear (which disappeared the fastest). Although a bit pricey at about $2.50-$3 each, I know I will still be back especially for those pizzas. Just superb. Not much can be said about this place other than the quality and fresh ingredients they use. 

I love the smell of freshly baked goods in the morning. Precisely why I keep coming back.
author: Brittany D.

description: I've never had anything here that wasn't delicious.  That said, I've been unable to find out conclusively whether the cheeses used on their pizzas and pastries are vegetarian.  On one visit, I was told that they were, but on another I was told that the cheeses are made with cow rennet, which is a bummer for strict vegetarians and those of us that don't eat beef/veal.  Luckily, there are many other wonderful things to choose from.
author: Lis T.

description:
Savory favorites: cheese roll and the Bialy.  I definitely appreciate their cheese rolls more once I realized how difficult it is to make a cheese roll on your own.

Sweet favorites: corn blueberry muffin, the scone of the day (lemon blueberry is the best), corn cranberry scone, pumpkin muffin, pecan roll

Pizza:  Vegetarian.  My favorite is when there are tomatoes or mushrooms.  They tend to sell out earlier on Thursdays because of Nightlife at the Academy of Sciences.

Why you should trust my recommendations?  Because I've tried everything they have.  Get a couple things to share with a friend, and head to GG Park for a nice way to spend an hour or two.
author: Debra C.

description:
Their credit card limit is $10.

I have never not loved anything I've ordered here:
- Pizza (they're part of the Cheeseboard Collective)
- Muffins, e.g. corn and blueberry
- Scone, e.g. strawberry and apple
- Breads

They usually have a line out the door, but it also usually moves quickly.
author: Basile K.

description:
Bought a whole pizza to go. No, I didn't call in or anything, though they recommend it on their website. 

At first, when I walked in, I saw their bread sticks in the bakery cupboard on the left, and I totally thought those were the pizzas. I then looked around and saw EVERYBODY eating pizza and they were in slices, so I went to the counter an ordered. 

1 whole pizza is 20 dollars. I think it was cut into 8 slices. I waited outside, and in like 20 minutes, the pizza was ready. I asked for red pepper packets, but they didn't have any. The worker instead poured some into a cup and put a lid on it and gave it to me. 

I went home and opened the pizza to find that 2 slices were kinda off... turns out the pizza is bigger than the box. haha, I'm okay with that. The pizza itself was extremely delicious, and a lot more filling than I expected it to be. It was extremely flavourful and is great to pair with beers or wines. 

Good friendly service, delicious and flavourful pizza, what's not to like?
author: Kaje Y.

description: This is the most absolute heart warming bakery I've been to. The bakery is extremely clean and you can smell the fresh goods being baked from a block away. You will not be disappointed. I got the pizza of the day which had pesto and mushrooms. (They only have one type of pizza a day) I didn't know I could love pizza with out marinara sauce! I also got the raspberry blackberry coffee crumb cake. It was soooo good! The freshest fruit and the cake was moist to perfection. I love this cute little bakery.
author: Kareesha A.

description: Arizmendi is absolutely phenomenal in every respect!  I live across the street and have tried just about everything they have to offer, and have never once been disappointed.  If you're not stocking up on some fresh loaves of killer bread, get the pizza......UNREAL!
author: Paul M.

description: If you have high standards for employee rights, this bakery is your place. If you want reasonable prices in unreasonable San Francisco, this is your place. If you have high standards for your food, sadly, this isn't your place. The overall quality- texture and flavor- for most of their products is quite poor. A recent cranberry scone had few cranberries and an insane amount of sugar. A corn and salsa verde roll was flavorless and chewy. A gluten free carrot muffin had acceptable texture and crumb but again, an INSANE amount of sugar. The one thing that was good was the pizza of the day (bakery style pizza, not pizzeria style)- not enough of an endorsement for a place that sells so many items.  I'd rather buy fewer pastries at a better bakery than more Arizmendi. Of course, the better bakeries often have insane lines and Arizmendi doesn't but still, short lines, a co-op model, and reasonable prices are not reasons enough for me to want to eat what they produce.
author: Simcha K.

description: Whoa! I got the Pecan Roll and it has the perfect amount of sweetness! Sadly, they do not warm any of their baked goods, but that won't stop me from coming back. This is a must try (:
author: Anne Jolene C.

description:
This is more that just a bakery.
 
Locals know this place as a great spot for a quick slice if their pizza of the day.

The day I went it was a tomato and onion cheese pizza.

They have the usual good croissants and various coconut and butter shortbread cookies, but for those who like pizza at a reasonable price and are in this location, this is a great place to go to.
author: Jackie H.

description: Great food for the dollar! I absolutely love places such as this one where you leave feeling happy and satisfied for the $ you spent. I had the focaccia and my husband had a couple of slices of their daily special pizza - we spent less than $10 totally but had a great lunch! Cute little place in the city.
author: Sharanya A.

description: They use organic flour for pizza. The pizza of the day is amazing. But other pastries are not as good.
author: Paloma L.

description:
Whenever I go to a bakery...I go crazy and I want to buy everything! It didn't help that in the first 30 seconds I had already chosen 4 baked goodies without seeing what the rest of the shop had to offer. I highly recommend checking their site to see what the pizza of the day is :). Sometimes it could be a hit or a miss depending on what you like. They also have an option to have the pizza "lite-baked" so you could bring the pizza home, put it in your oven, and voila! Fresh cheesy goodness. 

Chocolate sourdough croissants are amazing. Enough said. 

I'll be back to try more goodies!
author: Fanny H.

description: This place was very pleasant. The vibe the location had was amazing. You almost felt like you were in a different world away from the city. Great location, staff super awesome.
author: Maria B.

description: Found parking across the street +1. There was a table open for myself and my company, +1. The staff was friendly and helpful +1, the baked goods and pizza were delicious! +2.
author: Kevin S.

description: My favorite bakery in town, hands down. Their scones are amazing, they're as large as my hand and costs somewhere between $2.50 - 3. They sell freshly made pizza by the slice (or a box too if you want). Their menu changes every day for all items. My favorite thing to get there is their cheese scones, which are only available on Sundays. I definitely go out of my way to get there on Sundays to get my weekly dose of cheese scones. They're THAT good. The people are nice and helpful there, and despite the long lines they actually move pretty fast. Cash only below $10.
author: Julia P.

description: Focaccia... Sooooo good! I come in at least twice a week now just for their focaccia. There are different kinds, but they're all good. Anything with pesto is bomb.. Great service, and everything is fresh!
author: Pauline E.

description:
This bakery is about as good as it can get. The first time I stepped in through those doors and saw all the amazing looking and smelling baked goods it was a kid-in-a-candy-store moment for me.

I stopped by 15 minutes before closing and finally decided on a cheese roll, a tomato focaccia bread and picked up their last slice of their chocolate cake with the salted caramel frosting. After devouring what I had purchased, all I can was able to think was "WOW". 

Yes, their baked goods are so worth the extra hour at the gym.
author: Esther A.

description:
Craving for a slice of pizza, I (kind of) drove out of my way from the Asian side of Irving Street to the "white" side for a 3pm lunch as home was way, way in the opposite direction. 

I found meter parking in the little lot across the street with 10 minutes to spare! Jackpot! Sometimes I am feeling extra cheap and look for a meter that isn't blinking red when I have a choice. I"ll even put my car in reverse if that's what it takes. 

Walking into Arizmendi I saw the cutest little boy holding a chocolate chip cookie. It was a picture-perfect moment. Cute kid with a large size cookie in hand. 

I handed the cashier $5 cash in exchange for two freshly baked and crispy slices of triple mushroom pizza (daily special). I gobbled a slice down in my car before the meter ran out of minutes.

BTW, I got a chocolate mint chip cookie yesterday for $2 and just finished the 2nd half two minutes ago. Word to the wise, do not drink cold water afterwards. Your stomach will rumble...LOL
author: Jess W.

description:
This is one of the few places where I am happy there *is* a line so that I can spend some time trying to figure out how to choose among all the tasty scones.  I always like to get a corn cherry and then something more adventurous.  I should mention that I hate corn, but their signature scone never tastes corn-y, thank God.  They should probably rename the corn cherry to something that matches what it tastes like: "flaky on the outside, moist on the inside, buttery everywhere, dusted with sugar and deliciousness."  But I suppose that would be too long and cumbersome.

More recently, I ventured to try their pizza.  Silly me, I should have done so sooner since I didn't realize Arizmendi is a sister co-op to Berkeley's Cheeseboard (http://www.arizmendibakery.org/about)!  Always vegetarian, always served fresh out of the oven, and always delicious!  Last time I tried their mushroom medley, which consisted of no less than three different types of mushrooms, topped with garlic, shallots, and a ginger sesame sauce.  I was worried from the description that it'd be fungi overload, but this pizza really impressed me.  Each ingredient brought something to the table and most importantly, the flavors all worked together.  Arizmendi, how did you do it?!

As with a lot of these local little eateries in Inner Sunset, seating is extremely limited.  I'm not above eating my pizza slice while standing outside or walking back to lab, though.  San Francisco gets cold, and there's nothing like a nice hot slice of Arizmendi pizza to warm you up!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Pecan roll. pecan roll. pecan roll. It is delicious!  Amazing!! It is the perfect, fluffy, sticky bun with pieces of pecans on top. $3 for a roll. Coffee (~$2) and roll is the perfect morning combo.

There tends to be a line, but it goes by pretty fast.  It is a very small little bakery with all the goodies in cabinets against the wall. There is a table for four in the middle, a counter with three seats against the wall and some tables outside. Not exactly a place where you can sit and chit chat unless you're lucky enough to get a table. It is $10 minimum to use credit card, but that shouldn't be so hard with all the yummy options. I need to come back and try the pizza, breads, muffins and scones. Everything looks SO GOOD! I can't stop thinking about it. Must try!
author: Hanhie D.

description: Came in for the first time because my friend raves about how delicious their pizzas are and she isn't wrong! Today was the sweet potato pizza and i loved it! It was nice and hot when I got it and the slice wasn't too enormous. The price was fair, too at 2.25 a slice. It was nice and cheesey and everything was in perfect balance (: I also couldn't resist getting some baked goods so I got the ricollini (??? Idk it was the italian almond cookie) and their kookie brittle (: the brittle was different but it was yummy! I also enjoyed the almond cookie a lot, it was super soft in the middle and tasted heavily like almond which I like (: I definitely will be coming back to Arizmendi's to get more pizza and goodies. Come try it!!
author: Holly P.

description:
Artichoke pizza is good. Bread is chewy but overall well done in balance. 

Chai is good
Mocha is good not too heavy on milk

Sweet leaf lemonade is good too
author: Marc C.

description:
It got such rave reviews, that we just had to try it last Sunday afternoon. We got there early afternoon, and there was a line out the door. We got to the front of line very fast however. We ordered half of the pizza of the day and found a nice place to sit outside where we could simultaneously enjoy our pizza and people-watch.

It seems to be a great place for families to take the little ones in SF... but being a student in UC Berkeley and within walking distance of Cheeseboard and the newly opened Sliver, the pizza at Arizmendi Bakery just isn't special enough. In fact, if I was given all three pizzas blindfolded, I probably wouldn't be able to tell the difference between them (oops). They all serve vegetarian thin pizzas. They all have perfect crust and balanced flavors. And they're all very very delicious. 

On a beautiful day, the wait time isn't bad at all here. All around very cute place, and while I myself may not make the trip here specifically for this again, I would definitely recommend it to folks in SF!
author: Deanna C.

description:
After finishing a half marathon, I was (surprisingly) not in the mood for food...However, my family friends took me here and I perked up a bit at the scent of bakery air and the sight of rows and columns of freshly made goods. 

We were able to beat the crowd and even score the only large table for our party of 5. But, let me tell ya, this place gets PACKED. Especially on Sunday, with the farmer market going on. 

They offer a pizza of the day and it's always vegetarian! Of course, there are pros and cons to this...but a big plus is that your pizza comes out faster because they're constantly making it instead of having to customize. On the day we went, the POTD was 3 Cheese and I was very impressed with it! So simple but so flavorful and wholesome. I may have only had one slice... but that pizza was totally last-meal-on-Earth status.

After finishing our pizza, we retreated back in line to get cookies. They offer a wide selection of baked treats and the portions are so generous. The cookie was seriously bigger than my face and it was so much melty-chocolatey-goodness!

Overall, there's a lot to love about this place. I can't wait to go back (with a bigger appetite next time) and try the rest of what they have to offer.
author: Katherine N.

description: Great workers and overall it is a yummy environment with great options of pastries. I got the special pizza of the day, white cheddar, spinach, rosemary oil, p&p, and artichoke hearts. It was good and I would like to go back again one day!
author: Karen J.

description:
Been coming here for 10 years.  Must get:

1. Corn cherry scones are amazingly moist, buttery and not too sweet.
2. Chocolate Cherry Sourdough loaf is delish.  sounds weird but yummy!
3. Cheese roll - if u have any love or even like for cheese... this is ur heaven!
author: Penny N.

description: Some vegan options, but not well labeled and didn't seem super clean. The Arizmendi in the Mission on Valencia is definitely nicer (more vegan options and cleaner).
author: Josh B.

description: I seriously love Arizmendi/Cheeseboard SO MUCH SO SO SO MUCH. I've never had a single bad piece of pastry or pizza here, I'll be so sad when I move away from the Bay Area :( I've had their pizza A LOT and I've never had one that didnt amaze me. Mostly at the Cheeseboard in Berkeley but they're all pretty much the same (except at Berkeley you get a little sliver extra for free but here, you dont). Yesterday we had the triple mushroom (shiitake, button, portobello) with ginger seasame garlic vinaigrette, and we all agreed it was the very very best one we've ever had. HOLY COW IT WAS SO GOOD. I literally go to sleep dreaming about this bakery and wake up excited to go there. I like all bakeries, but this one holds a very special place in my heart
author: Katie S.

description:
I've passed by their Mission location multiple times, but, due to some ill-conceived notion that they primarily dealt with bread, I never felt compelled to drop in. After realizing they (more than) dabble with pastries, and seeing a lull in the line after brunch at Park Chow, I stopped in to pick up one of their renowned pecan rolls, as well as their scone of the day (a blueberry raspberry one), for $5.50.

Heading home and popping them into the toaster oven for a bit, I can say that both were quite delicious. The pecan roll, albeit a little too sweet (black coffee would have been great), had some great flavor, along with a crunchy exterior and soft interior. The scone was tasty as well, with much more subtle flavors than the pecan roll, and would have been even better with some butter or jam - it was, however, a bit dry, as most scones I've had are (which is a major reason I'm generally not a fan). 

While I think I'm still a bigger fan of Tartine's pastries, Arizmendi offers up a different selection of things, and is certainly worth checking out.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - While the bakery is pretty accessible, the layout of the interior could have been better thought out. As you enter, you'll come across their pastries in three separate display pantries, two along the left, with the second and third forming a corner (which turns out to be a bit of a bottleneck). Some of you may also have some difficulty reaching pastries on the upper shelves, but with so many people around, I'm sure someone will be willing to help.

Bathroom - I suspect there aren't any public restrooms, given the size of the place.
author: Johnny W.

description: Omg. The mint vegan cookie is one of my favorites in the bay. Vegan options are hard to find sometimes but this bakery makes my life easier! Love you!
author: Chase C.

description: Grab a beer across the street at social kitchen and then do pizza here.  Can't miss.
author: Cody C.

description:
Portabella and button mushroom with basil pesto. So good!!! 
I had one then order 4 slices to save for later lol
author: Dao E.

description:
I didn't sample the pizza, but the way people were nomming it I suspect it's as good as the reviews say. I did try are the cookies and brownies and they are fantastic. I got the sampler bag along with an extra cowgirl cookie - raisins, cocoanut, chocolate chips and other stuff that seemed to me like the perfect combination. Nothing I sampled was over-sugared either. I didn't get is the cheese bread. A mistake I regret now. I'm a sucker for pain fromage.

Very cool neighborhood bakery. People who live nearby are so lucky
author: J T.

description: Amazing! Fresh baguettes, pizza, sweets, and much more. Always something new! I love arizmendi, great service and always fresh items. You cannot go wrong. Had the mushroom with feta and red onion pizza and it was great. Also, I'm a fan of the scones! And I've never even liked scones before I tried the gems here. Thanks Arizmendi!
author: Omar C.

description:
I can't five star this place hard enough.

1 pizza a day. Always vegetarian, always delicious. They make their pizza with a sourdough crust that is nice and chewy. They rarely put red sauce on their pizzas but when they do it's a nice surprise.

They have other baked treats too, cookies, muffins, sticky rolls (personal fave), etc.

Stop by and grab something, you'll love it.
author: Daniel C.

description: First time trying this place and it reminded me of Sliver in Berkeley. Sorry to say that I was not too impressed with it or the hype. I would try it again but I have little hope in it. What I really enjoyed though was their chai drink.
author: Joji V.

description:
Late lunch here after a morning at the California Academy of Sciences.  Came here based on the reviews, and didn't have any idea that it was associated with Cheeseboard collective until after I saw the Cheeseboard cook book for sale on their shelves!  

Same deal, only one pizza of the day -- Sunday was red onions, feta, mushrooms, parsley, parmesan.  We came late in the day, around 2pm, so there was no line and the pizza came out pretty quickly.  Got one whole pizza for 4 people.  It was really good!!  Cheeseboard in Berkeley is my favorite pizza place in the Bay, so it's hard not to compare.  IMO not as good as Cheeseboard -- I think the pies are a little smaller, and the crust seemed lumpy (though still tasty).

Weather was great that day, it was super satisfying to recharge in the parklet seating on the street, get off our feet for a while and eat some delicious pizza.  Next time we visit CA Academy of Sciences for a day trip, will definitely have to come here again!
author: Christine C.

description: This place is absolutely the best for pizza, coffee, tea, and fresh baked goods. It's one of the first places I went to after moving to SF, since my sublet was one block away. It never gets old! My favorite pizza in the whole city. And if you haven't yet tried the chai, do it! A recipe developed in house by one of the bakers. Who are, by the way, owners of the bakery. Support worker's rights AND get mindblowing treats!? Yes.
author: Anne B.

description: Me and my mom came here for lunch. We were impressed I am not surprised that this is an award winning bakery. The focaccia is delicious same as the pastries and the service from the staff. I wish I knew about this place along time ago, I will definitely return.
author: Will D.

description: Love their focaccia and pizza of the day. Baked fresh daily and always good amount left to choose from after work.
author: Cody H.

description:
Amazing flatbread, super delicious!  A friend introduced me to this place, so I came by in the morning and there was a line out the door.  I tried the onion flatbread and olive round.   The caramelized onion with cheese is so delicious, to die for no joke!  Nice onion caramelization and tons of melted baked cheese, super tasty!  The olive round was good, but needed more chopped olive, felt it had more onion than olive.  It was good, but that caramelized onion was a definite winner!  

I will be back to try more goodies here!
author: Terence N.

description: I love this place! I have actually never had the pizza, but I love the idea that they have something different everyday, in a coffee shop too! I have had pastries and coffee here and it has the feel of a small coffee shop even though it is popular. I love coming here and will continue to come back!
author: Elise S.

description: GOD BLESS. The triple mushroom with sesame-ginger-garlic vinaigrette pizza is heavenly (sourdough crust!). The mint chocolate cookie was so good that I became slightly enraged while eating it. Currant scone was also very good but couldn't compete with the bar set so high by the pizza & cookie. Can't wait to go back.
author: Lisa G.

description: Quality pizza, perfect crunchy thin crust, not too oily. The price is great also, only $3/slice.
author: Trâm B.

description:
Heard so much good things about this employee owned coop that I did set my expectations high. Once I saw their sourdough chocolate croissant, it set it even higher... however, while this was good, it was not spectacular.

Aside from the bakery fare they also have good pizza by the slide!
author: Stéphanie S.

description:
I seriously tried each and every one of their cookies and they're all amazing the Cowgirl Cookie is probably one of my FAVORITES in the world and it's consistent BOMB each and every time I get it, at both San Francisco locations. This Irving one is sight smaller but there's both indoor and outdoor seating available 

I love their concept of a bakery grocery store hybrid. When you walk in, most of their baked foods are in cabinets for you to grab of you want their specialty pizza, you can order that at the counter and they toast it up nice and hot for you. 

The service is speedy and friendly here. Portions are generous. Prices are amazing. Love this place!
author: Ellen W.

description:
P E C A N   R O L L S   (@)

If you're only ordering one thing from here, you better order the pecan rolls ($2.75)!  OMG! They're sooo good!! 

Other baked goods I tried:
- Apple Walnut Muffin ($2.00) :] pretty moist
- Pluot Scone ($2.50) intriguing flavor
- Cherry Corn Scone ($2.50) :( disappointing, hard as rock, bleh
- Ginger Shortbread ($1.75) :[ sounds better than it tastes

Tips:
- pecan rolls!!
- cash only
author: CeCe C.

description: love the Vegan options- that chocolate cookie passes the taste test!  Everything I have tried here tastes fresh and delicious.  No seating, parking here can be a challenge, it is a take out situation.
author: Lorraine V.

description: This review for the whole chocolate cake. Jr Yelper bought one for Hubby's birthday.  When you pay about $30 for a cake, it should be edible.  The cake inside was OK. The frosting ruined the cake. It had so much sugar that you could barely taste the cake. It literally was enough to kill a diabetic on the spot.  I had to scrape the frosting off on the outside. There was still a layer of frosting between the 2 layers of cake and it was still too sweet. In this day and age when SF has banned soda from school vending machines because of the epidemic of diabetes and obesity, Arizmendi should be more health aware and not use so much sugar in their cakes.  When I inquired why JY went to get this cake. The response was that Yelpers liked it.  I will say that THIS Yelper would not pay any amount of $ for a cake with that much sugar.  That is like poison to the body.
author: Ry T.

description:
3/18/17 @approximately 2 pm-I had a horrible experience here today. I was on line searching for a New York Style Crumb Cake and this bakery was one of the featured locations that carries it.
I went to the 9th Ave. location and this rude salesman tall thin hat on his head with grey hair possibly and glasses (no name tag) began to have outward attitude with me trying to tell me about his coffee cake that he has no crumb cake. He then proceeded to raise his voice and say to me that "THIS IS A SAN FRANCISCO BAKERY" we don't have New York cakes here!"
I was astonished. I told him it was featured online. I told him it was to celebrate my dad who passed aways birthday(my dad loved New York Style Crumb Cake)-he then eluded that again this is not a  New York bakery-I was shocked!! I am clear that 9th Avenue in SF is not NYC I did not require such an asinine reminder and I then proceeded to walk out and express how rude he was. I was so disappointed and he is fortunate that I had my father in mind and did not express my true feelings in relation to his horrible customer service.
NO THANK YOU!
author: J T.

description: I love this place. Amazing pastries, cookies, scones, etc. But the PIZZA! They have 1 pizza a day. You can't customize it. But you don't need to, because it's amazing. And it's a co-op, so it's worker owned. So cool.
author: Ryan Y.

description:
I love love love this place except one thing, its inconvenient location for me who lives in Boston. Why are you not opening a store in Boston?  Please come to Boston, pretty please?!!!!
Last week, I was vacationing in SF so I was able to taste their daily pizza two days in a row and they were amazing. Also, their chocolate chip cookies are the best I've ever had.  They are better than my own homemade chocolate chip cookies and if you've had my chocolate cookies before, you know this is a HUGE compliment coming from me.
author: Judy P.

description:
Delicious food & nice folks!
- Daily pizza slice is an awesome snack or mini-lunch
- Never thought your could make a croissant out of sourdough but apparently you can and its great. The cheese roles are yum too!
author: Tim A.

description:
Small, eclectic bakery within walking distance of cal academy. It's become a go-to for their delicious coffee and scones, but even better - their sourdough vegetargian pizzas are amazing.  $11/$22 for a half / whole pizza. $3.25 for a slice (I think). 

Pizza recipes are changed daily - only one style available daily - no exceptions/substitutions. But they are always delicious. 

The only downside is unless you go early, you miss out on some of the baked goods.
author: ralphie r.

description: I saw a lot of people come in here for baked goods so I followed them inside. I grabbed a paper bag and begin to fill it with the first thing I saw when I stepped in the door, the pizza bread. I picked two different squares - one with mushroom and the other with spinach. At $4.25 a slice what a deal. I looked at the other pastries and was overwhelmed with what to pick. I decided the focaccia bread is all I wanted this time around. I will have to come back another time to try the other pastries. I ate the focaccia as it still warm and it was tasty. The tomato sauce and the toppings go well together.
author: Candace F.

description:
