Checked this place out for lunch because of all the high reviews for pizza.  Parking isn't the greatest in this area I Had to get lucky with street parking a couple blocks away and walk over.  

It's a really small shop. There were only a few people in front of me before i ordered but by the time I got my pizza (which was rather quickly) the line was out the door. I had a couple slices of a Kale Pizza and got Focaccia to go. The Focaccia made a god snack later in the day. The pizza wasn't the best I ever had but it was delicious with fresh ingredients and very fresh. I wish they had more selection on the pizzas.
author: Brandon Y.

description:
Get the pizza, leave the gun. 
Sorry, forget the part about the gun, that is from the Godfather. But this pizza, is really sublime. Thin crust, crispy yet chewy, minimal toppings, but the right kind and all you need. I can go on, but that is it. Their other baked goods are great too, but the pizza.....
author: E. W.

description:
i love the smell of baked goods as i walked in to this bakery. mmmmm all those baguettes and scones, yummy! I decided to try their pizza of the day since a lot of ppl on yelp say it is SO GOOD.

Their pizza of the day was mushroom, red onions, garlic oil, parsley, and parmesan.  

it was okay considering how hungry I was. for one slice of pizza it was $2.50.  I didn't that day's pizza was that great. I wouldn't mind coming back here again and hope i'll get a better pizza. And next time, i'm trying their breads!
author: Cherie T.

description:
Best slice of pizza you can get for 2 bucks! 
Thin, crispy crust, perfectly seasoned, and always an interesting combination of toppings. Wish I could have a slice delivered to me in San Diego everyday!

I love croissants but their pizza is better than their slightly too brown and TOO flaky croissants. I know croissants are supposed to be flaky, but I do not making a mess.

Love that they make sourdough croissants though. Bet it'd make a really good croissant sandwich.
author: Yvonne K.

description:
This place must be going corporate. We were there early to grab some scones and they told us pizza slice will be ready at 11am.  We came back at 11 and they told us unfortunately they had order for 24 whole pizzas  and told us to come back again 15-20  minutes later for slices. Maybe they forget why they open this joint first place  and why people are drawn to this place. 

Even Costco has better system where they have both slices and whole pizza orders at the same time.
author: Mason C.

description:
Hmmm my favorite bakery in the city! My current favorite is the tomato and cheese bialy...one juicy tomato slice surrounded by cheese (not too heavily) topped onto a fluffy pillow of dough. I can't get enough of this masterpiece!

The scones are another experience: crunchy on the edges, soft in the center, fruity and tart overall. I can't make a scone like that yet, but I'm still trying.

If I ever need an affordable and filling meal, I go for the focaccia. I like the pizza as well, but Cheeseboard in Berkeley is more generous with their portions. Cheeseboard gives you two slices plus a mini slice. With Arizmendi's, since there are so many people ordering pizza all the time, they scrimp a bit on portion size, but the flavors are no doubt the best tasting experience.

You can't really go wrong with ordering something from Arizmendi's. Go early though so you get to enjoy your bread while it's still fluffy.
author: Joanne K.

description:
Arizmendi definitely has the best pizza around.  I actually like that they only have one type every day.  It  forces me to experience new and delicious kinds of pizza.  They also have really good scones and brioche knots. They are located right in front of a lovely public parklet.  So why am I only giving 3 stars? Here's why:

1. They are way too crowded on weekends.  It makes it really hard to even get what you want from the cases. I don't know what they could do about this,  but it makes me not even want to go in. 

2. Cash only.  In the age of "Square" there is no reason to only accept cash 

3. Coffee is not as good as I would expect from a place at which everything else is gourmet. 

4. Closed on Mondays, which I always forget about and go there by accident. 

The three star review is not a comment on the quality of their pizza or baked goods,  which are delicious and deserving of 5 stars. The overall customer experience,  however,  is not stellar.
author: Sarah M.

description: Slice of heaven! Came here before a flight and went through the line THREE TIMES to bring back deliciousness. When I am craving a scone, I'll have to catch a flight back to SF.
author: Kate W.

description:
I am late to the game and I think the game has been over for a while??

We arrived on a busy Sunday afternoon for a midday nosh. We picked up some focaccia, cheese bun, crumb cake, and a piece of pizza. I got a cup of drip coffee. 

The focaccia was alright. The cheese bun was overtly oily and not very tasty. It was even on the stale side- hard to bite into. 

While the pizza was good it soooooooo oily. It was dripping into my plate. 

The best was the crumb cake. But nothing really to write home about. 

My coffee was awful. The Ethiopian brand is just atrocious. Couldn't even take a second sip. 

Maybe we got something weird? Maybe it was an off day? But we don't get this place...
author: Michelle I.

description:
After hearing that Arizmendi's a sister bakery of The Cheese Board Collective, I figured it'd be worth showing my friend visiting from Boston =D  Though we just had sushi for lunch beforehand, we still had room for some yummy baked goods:

-Chocolate cake with salted caramel frosting: Delicious! The frosting is unbelievably light and airy with a firm, salty initial flavor that transitions to smooth caramelly goodness.  The cake itself was on the dry side, but it actually worked out well as it contrasted with the texture of the frosting.

-Chocolate thing: Quality dough and chocolate chips aplenty.  Best had with a cup of coffee IMHO.

Next time, it'll be the pizza's turn to be devoured.
author: Eric F.

description:
Folks - check out the lousy health score: 73
 
Inadequate procedures or records for time as a public health control  Moderate Risk -
Low risk vermin infestation Low Risk -
Foods not protected from contamination Moderate Risk -
Unclean nonfood contact surfaces Low Risk -
Moderate risk food holding temperature  Moderate Risk -
Inadequately cleaned or sanitized food contact surfaces Moderate Risk -
Unclean hands or improper use of gloves High Risk
author: R. P.

description:
I decided to pick up a slice of pizza at Arizmendi for lunch today since it's closed to home and because of all the great reviews. While I was waiting for my slice, I noticed a Cheeseboard Collective book and immediately wondered if the two places were related... and indeed they are! A friend of mine recently introduced me to Cheeseboard pizza in Berkeley and I was hooked after the first try. I was even more excited to get my slice of pizza then and it surely did not disappoint! Right out of the oven, fresh, warm, crispy and delicious. 

Just like Cheeseboard, the bakery is a worker-owned cooperative, so each worker is an owner as well. Pretty cool! They only serve one type of pizza a day and it is always a veggie pizza. They post the pizza schedule on their website but I trust that they are all equally delicious. You can get a slice for $2.5 or a whole pizza for $20. Really good value, I'm a def a fan. They also sell a variety of pastries, which I will be sure to try next time. Just stop by and try a slice. Seriously, do it. Even if you're not hungry!
author: Kim N.

description:
Still a huge fan over a year later! Just updating because I recently tried their Cheese Bread and it was NOT poppin'. It was tough, hard to chew, and left me wanting a scone. Well, I would've wanted a scone either way but that's not the point. Anywho, aside from the not-so-great Cheese Bread, this place is still freakin' delicious. We had the foccacia with caramelized onions...NOM. Also had the corn cherry scone (shocking) and tried their seasonal berry nectar scone (NOM NOM!). Their House Chai was also really great---you can actually taste the tea, it's not some sugary bullshit from Coffee Bean. I NEVER wait long as the service is so fast. That still floors me. They've also added a PARKLET http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parklet outside which multiplies the seating a ton! Case and point, I still love Arizmendi. 

*Cool fact, Cheeseboard in Berkeley helped Arizmendi start up and learn the ways of cooperative business. So very SF/Berkeley of you, gotta love it. Also probably why Cheeseboard and Arizmendi remind me so much of each other. One in the same awesomeness.
author: Diane G.

description: Very tasty pizzas. I normally don't eat pizza unless there were no other options.  However, I will go out of my way for the pizzas at Arizmendi's.  My fav is their triple mushrooms followed by the one with artichoke hearts. Although it's vegetarian, I don't miss the meat.  I've tried other items there but prefer their pizza.  Will add the fifth star when I find something else that I like as much as the pizza.
author: R K.

description:
i was recommended by a friend to visit this place and I'm glad i did.
The pizza is just incredible (all veggie).. so thin and crusty and fresh and rich.. ooooh..
the workers/owners are really sweet and patient despite the long lines.
we bought some bread too and I thought they were great.
will visit again, mostly for the pizza!
author: Namrata J.

description: Best pizza crust I've ever had!! Perfectly crunchy and crisp with enough support to eat the slice with one hand while walking. I regret not getting 2 slices. Toppings included grilled artichokes, rosemary oil, parsley...I forgot what else, but the Rosemary artichoke combo was 10/10. Wish I lived in SF so I could eat this pizza all the time!
author: Erica D.

description:
An SF Cheeseboard experience :) AND at the same price ?? Who can complain? 

$2.50 a slice = answer to all your lunch worries, especially for groups! That way people can eat as much as they want. This pizza isn't your typical Domino's though - expect thin crust, one flavor only, ALWAYS vegetarian, and ALWAYS delicious. Service is fast though, because there is ONLY one flavor to order. 

They also offer lots of baked goods: bread, pastries, cookies, scones, etc ... Their strawberry scone and pecan roll and cheese rolls are my recommendations. 

I wish they had a sauce to accompany their pizzas though. 
And if street parking isn't your friend that day - you might just have to deal .... 

Ideal lunch spot after a trip to Golden Gate Park!
author: Ashley N.

description: Always worth the wait! The staff is so cheerful and friendly, they have their excellent customer service down for sure. I've been here about 5 times now and have had a great experience each time. I had their blueberry scone and pumpkin muffin today and they hit the spot! I also recommend their classic "chocolate things" roll  and their pizza any time, they've never failed me. If you're in the sunset, this place is a must! Check out their other tidbits like holiday cookies and the cheese board cookbook on the shelves too! Enjoy :)
author: Janki P.

description:
Really great things: focaccia pizza (in the cabinet, not the made-to-order stuff), chocolate um, muffin? Brownie? Not the vegan thing.

Good things: The made-to-order pizza. Haven't tried the bread but it's probably at least good.

Not so good things: cookies -- they're dry. The vegan chocolate mint one tastes toothpasty and the texture is no good. Like an old meringue.

The line is silly and there's never enough seating. People with a coffee will hog an entire table. Or with just water, even! Also, too many noisy kids.
author: Diane Y.

description: This place has awesome pastries and pizza. They focus on organic and healthy ingredients and menu.
author: Diane V.

description: There's sometimes a line. And parking is lousy on a Sunday morning, but the line runs fast and the food is excellent. I just miss living around the corner from this spot in Emeryville. Each location is slightly different, but offers outstanding quality. The coffee is actually good--but if you like Starbucks you wouldn't know any better.
author: Gnat C.

description:
Ok, this place is a co-op, which = two oversized thumbs up!! A soy latte is something
they don't know how to make, like many cafes they either burn the soy or they aren't using the right type of soy milk(the kind made purposefully for high temperatures). The line is really long, and the pastries and such are fine. The staff was fine.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Definitely one of the best bakeries in SF.  

I came here on a Saturday around 2:00pm.  The line wasn't too bad.  Even though there was a line, it moved pretty fast.  The staff was so friendly, helpful and efficient.

Everything looked amazing and fresh there.  It was definitely a tough decision for me to decide what to get....

Here what I got:

Corn Cherry Scone ($2.50) - I love scone and this is one of the best that I ever had.  The texture was perfect, dense, buttery, crunchy outside but not too dry inside.

Raspberry Coffee Cake ($3.50) - It was so good.  The cake was soft and moist. The raspberry and the brown sugar on the top were so good.  

Pizza of the day ($2.50) - The flavor of the pizza changes everyday.  The one that I got was spinach, red onions, gorgonzola cheese with balsamic vinaigrette.  OMG..the pizza was so good.  It was directly out from the oven, so very fresh and HOT.  The flavor was very good too!  The pizza was not too big so if you are hungry, I think you might need to buy two slices.  

I can't wait to go back for more!!!!!
author: Liza T.

description:
Incredulous!  I have been a member of FAMSF/De Young Museum for the past SIX years and I have only recently "discovered" Arizmendi Bakery. I mean, I knew it was a short walk away from the museum, but what I didn't know was that I was seriously missing out on one more reason to LOVE SAN FRANCISCO!

Do not fear the line trailing out the door of Arizmendi Bakery because the line moves fast. Bring cash for totals under $10...are you human, that is quite some resolve!!??!!

A few of my favorites:
*Seeded sourdough bread $3.25 - so very good the same day with the deliciously golden brown cracker-crisp crust that makes this HUGE mess of seeds and crumbs all over my cutting board and counter. Crust softens up after about two days (paper bag in a Ziploc, with excess air removed). For those who prefer their sourdough sour or extra sour, the sourdough loaf is only subtly sour...
*Blueberry ricotta tart - I love love looooove this deliciously addictive masterpiece of blueberry ricotta and need to be shamed into sharing, because it's big!
*Pizza of the Day $2.50/slice or $20/entire pie - The most recent topping I had was something like mushrooms and pesto. Super yum. Quality ingredients, great crust.
*Blueberry streusel coffee cake - They've got the magic touch. Anywhere else, I would pass on coffee cake, but Arizmendi coffee cake is light and fluffy with tons of streusel topping. It's really good and I want to know their secret!  Hint, hint - publish the recipe!

On the short list for my next visit - pecan rolls...Thanks for the tip and posting a pic of the final bite, Cece C!

If you're running late (around 3 or 4 pm) and want pizza, call them up and if they have any left, they'll save a slice or a pie for you! The food is out of this world, but the stellar customer service earns them an extra star!
author: Liv K.

description:
Expensive but well worth it when you fell like artisan baked goods and faire trade coffee.

My favorite: Corn Cherry Scone and the Pecan Roll

The pizza is not as good as Cheeseboard in Berkeley but it's still unique and addictive!  I prefer their foccacia instead.
author: Yohdaddy M.

description:
This was a quick, reasonably priced lunch spot down the street from the UCSF Parnassus campus. There was a steady line for this establishment on a Friday afternoon but it moves very quickly so don't be alarmed!

There is one kind of pizza prepared daily, but they make a different kind every day! There was a fairly plain cheese pizza today, which was delicious, but I would have enjoyed more toppings - the only reason I give a 4-star rating :) But it was easy to order slices of pizza for an appropriately-sized meal.

There is also a daily rotation of fresh baked breads and pastries. We tried a blackberry scone, which was the scone of the day, and it was just the right amount of sweetness and not loaded with sugar. It was a nice treat with the meal!

When you are next in line to order.. Be ready to order! The employees are rapidly dishing out pizza for your enjoyment and want to keep the line moving. We were a little unprepared but we will be ready next time!

All in all, we spent $13 for 3 slices of pizza, a large scone and a small coffee. We will definitely be returning to try some shortbread and see what other pizza creations they have to offer!
author: Amanda H.

description: Arizmendi rocks. My boyfriend introduced me to this place and it is an amazing bakery. The chocolate thing is great, and the lemon ricciarelli cookies-they gave us some hot out of the oven last time and it was insane. I like to grab some scones for the next morning too-they're all good but I like the oat scone.
author: Amber F.

description:
So, I must write a review. I can't deny a review for this place like others I have done in the past. This place is my favorite place to eat in sf. I love decadent baked goods every once and while. I'm trying to eat healthier but this bakery is my new treat. 

Goods: Vegan apricot cookie, not too overly sweet and Huge slice of vegan Foccacia bread  special: cornmeal crusted, with tomato sauce, greens, and mushrooms

Cost: ($3.75 for foccacia slice) Total: $5.75, worth the price completely

I am planning my next trip back as we speak.
author: Natesa R.

description:
Arizmendi Bakery is 80% of the reason why I live in this neighborhood, no joke. My obsession with Arizmendi is infamous and I compare all pizzas in SF and elsewhere to theirs. Yes, it's vegetarian, no you won't miss the meat. My favorites include their famous triple mushroom with sesame-ginger-garlic vinaigrette, which adds just a pinch of sweetness to the pizza that is perfection. Anything topped with whole garlic is delicious as well.

Other things to try include their focaccia, which rotates on almost an hourly basis depending on the availability of the ingredients and is a thicker version of their pizza. If you're looking for something a little more hearty, a slice of focaccia will definitely fill you up. Their fruits scones, pumpkin muffin, and flour less chocolate brownies are all amazing as well.

They got Square fairly recently, so any purchase about $10 can be paid for by card.
author: Kate M.

description: Had the blueberry gluten free scone, one of the best GF pastries I've had. Texture was soft and crumbly and bursting with flavor. Usually scones esp. GF are dry and chalky but not this. Oh and I brought it home with me in LA 2 days after purchase and still tasted fresh. Must get more next time and freeze them so I can pretend I live in SF.
author: Wendy C.

description: Delicious pizza, and I am pretty sure Yeast Of Eden from Pixar's InsideOut  was modeled after this place! A great way to eat your sadness away crying over Bing Bong's sacrifice  and your lost childhood . However pizza and delicious baked goods bring poignant memories for many people and joy at this Co-op bakery.
author: Brian M.

description:
BEST BAKED BREAD IN THE SUNSET! 

I like the Chocolate Cherry Sourdough bread that they sell here, very unique and delicious with nutella!

The line here is always out the door during lunch time and in the morning. Just thinking about Arizmendi's slice of pizza is making me salivate right now! O.M.G. I'm hungry again! 

Perhaps the only thing I LOATHE about this is the PARKING.
author: Jason C. J.

description:
Love. I keep coming back for more, There is nothing about this gem that has not already been said. Believe every word. There is not one thing that I have not liked, here, perhaps its all the love that goes into their dough. 

You have a cheat day, spend it here, you will be glad you did.

Bravo!
author: Victor L.

description:
CASH ONLY!  Muni N-Judah stops near here so we stopped in on Sat 2/20/10 morning for breakfast treats.

B. got Brioche knots $2.25 ea - it was a bit warm w/ raisin & the top was a tiny bit sweet, rest was bready.  Nice.

Cherry corn scone $2 - it was ok.

Small coffee - don't remember price.

Total $5.75 or so.  CASH ONLY.
author: Ann L.

description: I always come here on Sundays and get a couple of slices of their pizza. They have a daily special and it's yummy.  Their focaccia is also very good when it has just come out of the oven.  It's cash only under $10.00 so if remember to bring cash if you're only buying a couple of items.
author: Arman J.

description:
I live in Sacramento, but when I am in SF I always stop at Arizmendi Bakery for a treat.  I deducted a star because the parking can be an issue.  Sometimes we have to circle the streets several times before we can park, so that is why we try to go off hours.

If you are a fan of corn and cherry, a must try is their Corn/Cherry scones.  Like eating a corn muffin with a hint of cherry.  Great with a cup of coffee.

Go around 11am and try a slice of pizza.   They only have one kind of pizza per day. I like it because the crust is thin and has a nice chewy texture.  Get at least two slices, one will not do!
author: T. G. M.

description: One of those places that's worth waiting in line for. Went for a latte and a pastry to munch on in the nearby Golden Gate Park- ended up buying a grab bag of focaccia, scones and cheese rolls to enjoy all weekend. Can't go wrong here, and the coffee is perfect!
author: Kate C.

description:
Pretty good, but not all that. I'm all about co-ops, using fresh ingredients, and gluten free options at a bakery, don't get me wrong. The philosophy behind the place is good, the workers are lovely, and the outdoor seating is amazing. 
However, my pizza was not good. It wasn't "hitting". Maybe I came on the wrong day. It was the Friday special. I won't be thinking or daydreaming about this pizza when I'm hungry. 
Their sister co-op in Berkeley "the cheese board" is muuuuch tastier. I daydream about that pizza all day everyday. It may be the green cilantro sauce they use there.
So I suppose if you don't have the time and energy to go to Berkeley, come here.
Their mint chocolate chip cookie was delicious! Id come back for that if parking didn't suck
author: Simi J.

description:
A great local bakery in the Sunset that sells amazing breads, baked goods, and pizza that changes its special every day. There's already a small crowd out front during the mornings, and it swells just as pizzas are about to come out at around 11am. 

I've tried almost all of their breads, my favorites are the Wolverine, Foccaccia (changes flavor all the time too) and Sourdough. I've also eaten their scones, cookies, and some of their special breads throughout the week, but their pizza is what go there for. 

If you ever take a day off from work and have the whole city at your disposal, this is one of those places you should plan to hit up. Nothing rejuvenates your spirits better than a fresh pizza with weird mushrooms. Actually, we all know that's not accurate... I can think of a dozen things off the top of my head that one could self-medicate with, but you get the idea.
author: Byron E.

description:
Loved the pear and blueberry scone I had here. So flaky and buttery and HUGE. I spent a Sunday nibbling on this pastry goodness. I also tried a slice of their pizza, which was tomato and asiago cheese that day. Solid pizza with a thicker crust than you'd find at Cheeseboard in Berkeley, but very tasty. Not too oily and I liked that the slice is halved for easy consumption.

Both for just over $5! Perfect place to pick up some baked goods and amble around with them.
author: Kevin L.

description:
There is always a long line when I walk by this place. Today at 10am, no line and the smells
coming out from the bakery were so intoxicating. I bought one of those small ( like a large
danish) cheese and tomato pizza. OMG! It was like a party in my mouth!! All the different
seasonings,the quality of the dough, fresh tomato and top tier cheese was over the top!
I went back and bought a large bag of everything in the store and cannot wait to eat it all.
author: Peter F.

description:
Listen, I love the idea behind this place, so I went on down to the Sunset, (drove around for 40 minutes looking for parking) and we tried it.

- It's busy on a Saturday, they are doing great business wise
- Holy smokes those are bread racks upon racks full of pizza? How the wut?
- Ahh now it makes sense, that's not really pizza, that's bread with stuff on it and sometimes cheese.  

- Can everyone just QUIT IT WITH THE SAGE OIL please?  Stop putting 8 things in a pizza, stop putting sage oil on everything or in cocktails.  Stop the madness!

Goat Cheese and Cranberry with Sage Oil (and like 5 other things) on top of bread is perfectly legal to do.  But it AINT PIZZA AND AINT NEVER GUNNA BE NO PIZZA.  It's bread with a mish mash of too much stuff on it.

Ahem, I must repeat, THAT IS NOT REALLY PIZZA.   There is a reason no real pizza place has 50 prepped but uncooked pizzas sitting on a bakery rack. You can't make pizza like that.  

Real pizza is dough that is stretched, some san marzan tomato sauce, some fresh moz, then BANG! In the oven it must go, immediately!

A real pizza, if left out on a rack waiting to be cooked, or re-heated etc... would either blow up (dough rise) or rot.

We grabbed a random sampling of everything the had in terms of a shortbread cookie here, a muffin there, a bar of something else...

All of it was just ok, I was the only one who actually finished a shortbread cookie, everyone else took one bite and was done with it.
author: Nellie N.

description:
Good "hippy" bakery goods and pizza.

I'm a fan of their corn scone. They use good cheese and other ingredients. Coffee is crap. 

The limited seating is lousy and they do a poor job of keeping the tables clean.

There is "parklet" seating outside on the street. It is also usually dirty and also you are treated with the presence of dirty dogs and their smell.

Lots of people show up in sweatpants, PJs, and hoodies and arrive unshaven, and smell unbathed. Come on, have some self-respect, people.

If they expanded and had more seating (and kept it clean), I'd come here more often.
author: Chuck G.

description:
WHOA! what is this warmly-lit, people-bustling, wood-decored place?! There seems to be a lot of people in line.. I mean I guess I'll have to step in, too. 

Arizmendi's... Ahh. Don't get too intimidated by the line, it usually moves fast since the employees are quick at the cash register. 

The pastries are amazing! Especially the scones! (I've gone back twice already just for them) At 3.00 for the scone of the day, which comes as big as my palm spread out, the scones are just one of the amazingly unique pastries here.

Buttery, fresh, fluffy scone filled with berries, fruit, and just enough of a drizzle of sugar on top. AWESOME. 

I have a lot to rant about, but overall, great service, reasonable prices and great products. Will be a regular!
author: michelle w.

description:
Important: cash only!

Short version: for the 50% of San Franciscans who can't get to all the hipster bakeries in the Mission District, Arizmendi is our little haven of pastry and bready goodness.  In fact, it's so good they even opened a second one in the Mission!

One of our family's favorite things is to walk through GG Park to Arizmendi on a early Sunday morning, get a bag just packed full of stuff, then home for a pastry-filled breakfast.  Family Love Arizmendi!

Their menu is basically broken down into:
Pizza: individual servings on a focaccia crust, perfect for a lunch. the options rotate, but all seem to be quite good.

Breads: honestly, not a huge fan of their baguette.  for the rest, compared to the recent surge in high quality and artisanal bread options in the Bay Area, their options are not in the upper tier, but still better than anything you'll find at a Safeway's.

Muffins and Scones & misc pastries: now we're talking. LOVE the cherry corn scone. Their cinnamon roll is one of my favorites. The cheese rolls are a good savory snack.  Their various cookies are all quite good.
author: Jeremy T.

description: I used to run to Berkeley to Cheese Board Pizza... Glad to discover that the sister co-op of them has been operational in SF (in fact 2 locations in SF - Mission and SFSU). I think there are two main ingredients that make a pizza great - the bread and the cheese, and these co-ops perfect both of them. They don't serve the spicy pesto like their Berkley branch. But still the pizza is really good and I also like their coffee.
author: Sumit S.

description: I thought that I had hit the pizza jackpot with sliver and cheeseboard over in the east bay, since I don't like sauce and love fancy pizza. Man I was wrong, this place is the shit. I had their mushroom pizza with sesame ginger garlic vinaigrette, I've never had such good pizza. Such a good find, I was literally just on my way to an open house! Now I hope I get the place just to come to get this pizza. Perfectly crisp bottom, not oily, and perfect thickness, thin without being too thin. Def coming back!
author: Samantha C.

description: Everything is so DELICIOUS.  Take cash if you don't want to spend more than $11 on a card. I swear , I can taste the love. Their products are consistently exceptional. Spend a couple of hours more working out and indulge. Everything we have gotten from this bakery is so yummy. It is worth the extra carbs. Love it that Arizmendi is around the corner from our apartment. Feel so lucky!!
author: susan h.

description: I stopped by Arzimendi to pick up some pastries for breakfast the next morning but ended up eating the Pecan Roll as a snack the same afternoon. I took one bite and couldn't resist! It's one of the best pastries I've had since I moved to San Francisco.
author: Karen L.

description: Best scone I've ever had! Called, scone of the day, and an amazing bread called, tomato olive. Don't miss out!! I finally tried this beauty after 1 year of living here. Also really great drip coffee. I go with The  Organic Sumatra it's tasty.
author: Tatiana W.

description:
9th street is probably one of my favorite places. 

And this place is a main reason why. Not overly crowded, trendy, or hipster. Just perfect. I love all the baked goods here. I don't know how they do it. Sweet & savory. So fresh & chewy. Not too sweet or too salty. 

Try the foccCia, brioche knot, cookies, get a fresh pizza .. Eat it all!
author: Shanna N.

description:
Absolutely everything is good here!! I always grab a focaccia and the special coffee cake. I'm also a fan of their blueberry corn meal muffins. 

It's great because they are so good, consistent and not like all the other pretentious bakeries with mediocre service and food. This place is all about high quality baked goods and I've always received great service!
author: Kelly S.

description: I was in SF for a few nights. On my way out of town to go camping, I decided to get some bread from here. BEST DECISION. It was so delicious! And fresh out of the oven. I got two loaves of the Rosemary Sourdough. Service was great, although I was only there briefly. I highly recommend this place!
author: Sevrina F.

description: Love everything about this place. Every time I'm in SF I have to come here and buy some olive provolone bread loaves, a cheese roll, and anything else that draws my eye like pizza or some focaccia bread. I think people (women especially) love warm bread and this place feeds that craving.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I love their Bialy. I'd never heard of this before, and I miss it when faced with a bagel and cream cheese in the morning. http://www.foodrepublic.com/2012/10/16/everything-you-need-know-about-bialy-including-rec
Everything I've bought here has been good. Keep up the great work, Arizmendi! There is limited seating inside and a street side area, too! Nice on a rare sunny SF day!
author: YearOf M.

description:
Hipster Bakery without the cupcake :)

The pecan roll is very very sweet. I liked the poppy lemon muffin a lot. 

I was too full to get the pizza.

I do like the take over the parking spot for seating idea. I give that 5 stars.
author: Chris L.

description:
I have only tried one item from Arizmendi Bakery. Before I give it five stars I need to try more of their baked goods. But right now I am a fan. I had to try Arizmendi Bakery because of all the rave review on Yelp. I am so glad I did because their Scone of the Day did not disappoint. Best part was the perfect crust that was just a little sweet. Next time I am in the neighborhood, I will try their coffee cake and maybe a slice of pizza. Also, I was surprised to find them at the Sunday Farmer's Market located in the parking lot just across the street. 

What I recommend: Scone of the Day
author: Andrew W.

description:
Being a fan of The Cheeseboard, over in Berkeley, I knew that I'd automatically love Arizmendi Bakery.  Muffins, scones, shortbread, granola, cookies, and a selection of fresh bread- what's not to love?

And let's not forget about the pizza- the main reason for my last visit ($2.50/slice).  They make just one type of pizza each day and it's served starting at 11:30 a.m. The pizza is thin-crust pizza and the crust/dough is interesting because it's made of sourdough.  

The day I went, the pizza featured: tomatoes, arugula, manchego cheese, garlic oil, parsley and parmesan cheese- it was delicious. You can find the pizza schedule at: http://www.arizmendibakery.org/pizza

The staff is helpful and they all seem to be working quickly.  There is usually a small crowd there, but everything moves along quite quickly because the baked goods are self-serve and the pizza is already made- they just grab you a slice and give you a plate.

Notes:
-There are a few tables inside and a few tables outside too.
-Their website is useful for finding out the pizza of the day and other daily specials. www.arizmendibakery.org
author: Samantha L.

description:
their pizza...so good! i like the sourdough crust! perfection! 

they were out of cheese rolls when i got there...but hey, maybe next time i can try to snag a few. so i grabbed a couple brioche knots and a loaf of provolone and olive bread.

the brioche rolls were awesome! i sliced them down the middle, toasted them and slapped on a pad of butter! perfect breakfast food!!

the provolone & olive bread had the perfect chew with just the right amount of briny flavor from the olives! it also makes a good platform for a grilled cheese sandwich, by the way!
author: Donald G.

description: always good! pizzas never disappoint! i like this location better than the one on valencia.
author: Helen P.

description:
I LOVE this place. Everyday, they have something different. I definitely recommend the pizza, and the focaccia bread. They are made to perfection. They have all different kinds of breads, sweet pastries, etc. 

Bring cash, or it's a $10 minimum with cards.  Overall, I definitely recommend this place :)
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Arizmendi has such wonderful scones and I'm so in love with their assortments of bread. It's so naturally made too. I love the idea that they have many vegan pizza. 
Howeverr I wouldn't come here just for the pizza....I love a LOT of meat and regular toppings but if you're vegetarian or vegan this is definitely the place. The pizza is cheap and yummy. They sell assortments of bread too. I get a vibe of like medieval Europe from this place and I love it.
author: Natalie Charlotte W.

description:
What more could you ask for from a local business? 

Fresh food
Quality products
Local and independent
Workers part of the ownership

Most of all, the pastries and pizza are outstanding!  I still prefer coffee from Beanery, but it's a great combination just a few steps away!
author: Sir Paul L.

description: We had a peanut butter cookie and a chocolate chip cookie, and they were delicious.  I approve of the attitude of the staff. The place was clean and relatively inexpensive, considering. Probably great for outdoor seating when it's not nighttime and rainy.
author: Missy K.

description: 1. The baked goods are dry 2. The pizza is obscenely greasy 3. Everything is overpriced 4. The HEALTH SCORE is not posted (illegal) and its 73. Disgusting. The mission location has a health score of 96. Get it together.
author: Marisa L.

description:
Disclosure: Pizza offered changes daily and there is only one type a day. The day I went, it was an amazing garlic, spinach, tomato invention that made me feel like a vegetarian for the day - in a great way! Pizza slices are about $2.50 each and for the quality, I would say that it's wonderful!

I also opted for a "chocolate thing" which was a chocolate and bread pastry that tasted better than any other chocolate and bread combination I've had in a while. It was so simple, yet so fresh and good - I didn't know how I felt until I was still thinking about it the next day.

Arizmendi seems like an inner sunset treasure, and well-deserved it is. I can't wait to go back and be delightfully surprised with the pizza of the day and some baked goodies!

PS - $10 minimum for credit cards, so bring cash!
author: Junel S.

description:
I am a natural-born carnivore. I love meat. I need meat. I devour meat.
I try to steer clear of Vegetarian/Vegan places - I like to know that I can get meat if I wan meat, even though I don't necessarily eat meat for every meal.

There are few similar places with similar concept around bay area - basically, single type of Vegetarian pizza sold, with menu posted online beforehand. Other than Arizmendi's, there are Cheeseboard (Berkeley) and Sliver (also in Berkeley)
Out of these 3 (which are basically the same thing), I'd like to rate Arizmendi #3. It is really good - and their pizza is absolutely wonderful. Just not as good as Cheeseboad or Sliver. 
If you are in the neighborhood, it's pretty cheap meal (depending on how many slices you eat), and good food :)
author: Christina P.

description:
I love their sourdough croissants. One of the only places in SF that I'll actually go out of my way to get this. 

Also, their chocolate fudge cake (or salted) are to die for. Dense chocolate cake that isn't overload but definitely filling for a dessert. So make sure you save room after you try out some of their pizzas!!
author: Chloe Y.

description:
I was so surprised when I found this place and so upset that it took me so long in my life to know this place existed!

I came on a Sunday and the line was out the door but it moved quick. My bf and I were going to an outdoor concert later that day so we bought a few pastries to go and had a slice of their pizza. 

Cheese bread thing they have there. AMAZING. Also had the artichoke pizza.. Really good! Destroyed that slice of pizza in seconds. We also had a few other pastries and they were good but those two stood out the most. Prices are pretty decent and definitely will be returning to try out the other stuff. 

They have different items everyday so check out their specials. And if you're looking for healthy anything.. Yeah this isn't the place for you. Lol
author: Hepsie C.

description:
It was my last brisk day in San Francisco for a while and my buddy insisted that we stop by Arizmendi for some gourmet baked goods before heading to the airport.

On his recommendation, I picked up a pecan roll and the kind and very helpful staff helped me choose a cheese roll for the road.  I started with the cheese roll and found it very pleasant and had just the right amount of saltiness and savory-ness that I wanted in the morning and pat of butter would really bring it over the top.  The pecan roll was excellent with my green tea and had great gooeyness but wasn't overly sweet.  The recommendations were an excellent start to my day and I can see myself coming in regularly for my morning pastry fix.

Arizmendi is just another example of great San Francisco fare.  All of the breads and pastries are fresh out of the oven and warm as you bite into them.  The service was phenomenal and helpful in selecting from the many choices and I would have been lost in variety without their help.  It's clear why Arizmendi is so popular and I definitely recommend checking it out if you're in the Inner Sunset area.

Food:  9/10

Service: 10/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 9/10
author: Joe M.

description: Great Apple Blackberry scone, dont let the line scare you it moves fast.
author: Eric B.

description:
Tiny place with excellent foods. We tried the cheese roll (mmmmm), the pecan roll (sticky, sweet, nutty), the chocolate mint cookie (decadent), and blueberry muffin. All were worth it, go early for the great selection.

If you are in a meandering mood, they aren't far from Golden Gate Park - go there before or after your meal for a walk or run to prepare or burn off the foods.

Lines can be long, and seating is almost non-existent so don't plan on staying there for a prolonged meal.
author: Megan E.

description:
I really wanted to like this place but the pizza was just...NOT GOOD.  The sourdough dough was different, but left an overpowering spur taste in your mouth.  Perhaps it was the dough, but it was also hard to where it scraped my mouth.  The pesto flavor was good, but the flavor and texture of mushrooms on it were nonexistent.  

I also had a cowgirl cookie, which was dry and flavorless.  The almond bar was a bit tough to eat.  

Oh, the hipsters around the area detract from the feel.  Also, if you drive, be prepared to spend 30 minutes to find parking.  All in all, if you are a hipster on a stupid fixed gear bike who is looking for a food joint that really isnt that good but is hyped to the heavens, then you should come here.
author: Pick S.

description:
Great local quality bakery.  

My favorite  item is the chocolate  croissants.
author: Robert M.

description:
Try the pizza, the focaccia, the scones, the croissants, the chocolate cookies. 
Really, though, you can't go wrong at this place.
FIY parents: The inside is small, so not too stroller friendly. But they do have a parklet, which is nice (and spacious) on a sunny day.
author: Rocio G.

description: There is such an amazing selection at all times. The food is delicious and its hard to order just one item because everything tastes so good!
author: Issy G.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE SO MUCH WITH ALL OF MY HEART.

So much love goes into the baked goods here, especially the delicious, fresh pizza of the day. My favorite is their famed 3-mushroom slice... oh dear. Crisp, chewy, and so flavorful. The blend of shiitake, portobello, and button mushroom with a FANTASTIC garlic-ginger vinaigrette on top of a sourdough crust is....... mind blowing. Garnished with just the right amount of finely-chopped parsley and sesame and parmesan-- omg this slice is perfection. And for veggie lovers like me, ah I fell in love. Fell so hard I had to order another midway my first slice.

FELL SO HARD that I came back the next day to grab more food for the ride back home (LA). Unfortunately they change it up with the pizza selection daily, but at least the selection that day was still delicious. (The triple mushroom though, is a MUST try.)

Their other baked goods like the focaccia bread (mushroom almost tastes just like the pizza), cheese rolls, and provolone-olive bread are just as fantastic. I can't wait to try everything else they have to offer--seriously, everything. 

Love, love, LOVE this place even more for using organic when possible. Simple and pure ingredients -- you can really taste it in the food.
author: Jenny O.

description:
The best scones I've tried... ever))) for 3 bucks - they are big, tasty, fantastic... I only regret I didn't go there every single day in my SF travel... amazing!!!
I've got oatmeal and raspberry scones. Not too soft, a lill bit crunchy, not super sweet (when you feel sugar and butter in your head), but just as it should be.
author: Madina I.

description: Okay so I haven't tried many of their items but their pizza is amazing.  Definitely worth a try if you're in the area.  We also got a croissant which was great but I think I prefer Tartine in this category.  Then again Tartine is a high bar with a ridiculous wait.   Definitely want to try more items if I'm ever in the area.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Have a hard time walking by this place without stopping in to order something. Their pizzas are off the charts amazing and different pretty much everyday. If youre a pizza lover, you must go here and try!
author: Natalie S.

description:
I've come here multiple times on my way home from school - a treat for myself or to surprise my family. The staff are super friendly and kind of do an honor code system, since you put your stuff in a little baggy and they don't look in it, just ask what you got. I kind of like that, so I hope no one abuses it. 

Everything I've tried, which has been limited but I'm hoping to expand soon, has been delicious and fresh. My favorite so far is the short bread cookie - super light and just amazing. I've also had the snickerdoodle and it's nice and soft/moist. As I write this, I'm trying for the first time the sourdough croissant and I am far from disappointed - it's SO good (I'm a sourdough lover). So if in the area and have a craving for something sweet or bread, make sure to stop here.
author: Shira S.

description: All their baked goods are fresh and delicious. I wish I had a bigger stomach to eat everything all at once. Their coffee cake is amazing. Coffee is definitely a great compliment- only $1.00 for refill. Definitely worth the wait if there is a line and a great place to hang out on a lazy afternoon.
author: Grace L.

description:
This is some of the best pizza I've ever had. I like some of their pizzas more than others, and I like all of them better than most other pizza ever. 
The baked items are great. I love their soft, chewy chocolate chip cookies and their moist, flavorful scones. Their shortbreads are cleverly infused with delicate flavors such as lavender and green tea. I often walk by just to see what special items they have that day or what kind of pizza. 
The indoor seating is cramped, but there's a comfortable community feel, and customers ask each other how their food is or for recommendations. The outdoor seating is lovely, casual seating amongst a pleasant driftwood plantscape.
This bakery also uses no plastic. They use aluminum, paper, and cardboard, so it's a decent place for the environmentally friendly.
The only thing to beware of is that the people who work behind the counter, while they are cool, good at their jobs, and funny, they won't take your crap--don't hold up the line for your phone call or touch the baked goods with your hands unless you want to get sarcastically chewed out by the management. For me, this is a plus. It keeps the long line moving.
author: Allxie C.

description:
This is probably my favorite bakery in SF. I particularly love the pizza and focaccia breads. The cinnamon rolls are also excellent. 

Pizza service starts at 11am. The line moves pretty fast. The coffee is just ok, but that's not why you go here anyway. 

I usually eat some pizza and get something for later. Usually I have eaten whatever it was I got for later before I get back to my car. Super tasty bakery!!
author: Griffith P.

description:
I will never view Round Table pizzas as "gourmet" ever again after tasting Arizmendi's gourmet pizzas. I was a little bit skeptical when I read about a bakery that makes good pizza. It makes sense that a bakery would make good bread, but pizza? Nonsense. I kept imagining the pie to have ingredients topped on foccacia bread. But my fears were relieved when I set my eyes on their pizza of the day. This place has a different pizza everyday and they even have a calendar for every month. The pizzas are made hot after 11:30 am so we made sure to get there around noon. This particular location does not have much seating so we were lucky to grab a table for two. Foot traffic was heavy around lunch time, but we got our pizza in a timely fashion. 

The pizza of the day was a tomato, red onion, basil, and pesto pizza. I am a lover of thin crust pizza and believe me when i say that it was one of the best that I've ever had. Not only were the flavors delicious, but the texture of the crust was amazing. Crisp on the bottom and chewy on top and with a sourdough aftertaste? I'm in pizza heaven. At $2.25 a slice and $18 for a whole pie, you can buy as little or as much as you want without feeling guilty of paying more or less because it equates to the same price per slice. I didn't really think about that before I ordered a whole pie, but in the end, it was worth eating four slices each (although two slices would be perfect). I was so full, I couldn't even sample some of their shortbreads. All is well - best pizza I've had in San Francisco thus far.
author: Bailey Z.

description:
An everyday favorite!

* I like the wolverines (raisin/apricot/nut roll) and the cheese rolls the best.
* Their daily pizza is pretty good too.
* If you're a scone fan, they have a lot of them.
* Best of all, reasonable prices!
author: Philip L.

description: Such a yummy scone!! I had the blackberry peach scone and it was huge and filled with big fresh chunks of peach (bakeries that use fresh fruit get big points in my book). The scone was $3 which is a little pricey for a scone but it was delicious and big. There's a big line usually but it seemed to move fast. I didn't try the pizza but they have pre-made slices that look great! I would definitely return, it's especially great to accompany the many great coffee spots along the street!
author: Kylie B.

description: They only have one vegan muffin option but for as incredibly delicious as the lemon poppy was, they should definitely make more options. One of the best vegan muffins I've had!
author: P D.

description:
I didn't realize this was also a pizza place, but I'd unfortunately already had lunch. Couldn't help trying the coffee cake, though. Solid, but nothing to rave about. Even though the line was out the door, it moved very quickly. The place is tiny, after all. The self-serve setup is rather unintuitive, too.

I liked this place enough to probably swing by again the next time I'm in the area. I suspect the more savory breads are stronger.
author: Dawn N.

description:
Dear Arizmendi brownie,

I love you--where have you been all my life?  Crusty on top with a soft middle, like a has-been Oakland Raiderette.  You are yummy!!
author: C L.

description:
Heading to a brunch affair at a friend's house, we were asked to bring some scones.  Knowing that Arizmendi Bakery was close by and having heard they had great scones, it was a done deal.  

Snagging a parking space across the street, we made our way to the bakery.  There was a line about ten deep that stretched to the door.  After a relatively short wait, we made our way to the front where the scones were located.  We got four scones:  apricot blackberry, oat, corn-cherry, and currant.  Staring at all these baked goodies, the raspberry apricot coffee cake was calling and we added a piece to our purchase as well.

The scones were delicious.  Everyone complemented how tasty they were and that it had the perfect airiness and texture with a slight sugary crust on them.  The coffee cake was a hit too as it was moist and not overly sweet.  

So we know the scones are great and will definitely be back to try the pizza and other bakery items.
author: Al L.

description: So glad I found this place! I am a huge fan of Sliver and Cheeseboard in Berkeley and was looking for something in San Francisco that was similar (collective ownership, fresh ingredients, specialty pizza etc). Arezmendi was just that!  I went in and ordered a slice to go, only to find myself coming back 10 minutes later to order another slice. The cashier was so awesome and gave me a slice and a sliver of a slice. Totally my new favorite pizza place!
author: Honor B.

description:
For $2.50 a slice, how can you complain? Arizmendi has one daily pizza special every day and it is always veggie! It's like a match made in heaven. Plus, it's on a sourdough crust! It's thickness is just right, not too doughy, and has a great crisp.

I love how fast and easy it is to grab some baked goodies in here. If you're ever in the area, I would suggest grabbing a slice...or a whole pizza! There is some seating outside or you can sit inside by the window and people watch. 

Will definitely alter my jogging route through the park to try more pizza and grab some breakfast pastries.
author: Stine H.

description:
How can you not fall in love with Arizmendi Bakery? Freshly baked goods and really good pizza. I frequent this bakery after my morning run in the Golden Gate park. They have everything from scones, muffins, Focaccia, cheese sticks, shortbread to cookies. My favorites are sourdough croissant and pecan rolls. 

The pizza is available in slices or wholes. Check the website for the daily menu (only one available per day). 

They use coffee beans from Equator.
author: Saran R.

description: Oh my god, this bakery! I called in this morning looking for Pumpernickel sourdough and they were nice enough to save some for me and it was ready when I arrived. It's very hard to find this bread, and my brother-in-law requested that I bring some to Austin, TX when I planned to see him next week. While waiting in line, a long one which no doubt had its reasons, I saw fresh mushroom focaccia. This focaccia was soooo good I couldn't wait to get home to eat it. My eyes crossed while tasting crispy, chewy bread, warm mushrooms with garlic, olive oil and scallions. I would have taken a picture, but it was too good to wait. I'm not one to hit bakeries often because I cook and try to eat healthy, but this place is a MUST GO!
author: Crystal V.

description: Must go! Just bring cash and go around 11am to 3 pm to get some out of the oven fresh pizza! Yummmmmmmmm
author: Ramin A.

description:
I always come here for their daily pizza. For $2.50 a slice, it is the perfect mid afternoon snack! They make a certain amount of pizzas a day and whenever customers want to order one, they'll heat up a whole one and serve you your slice. Yesterday I went in and waited in line for a good 5-10 minutes and when I reached the front to order my slice, the cashier told me they ran out of pizza. I can't imagine what expression was on my face but he told me it was the saddest look he'd seen all day. He then suggested that there's a lot of other good stuff like the foccacia bread. So I dolefully walked back to the bread shelf and selected one of the many different foccacias available. Then stood back in the long 5-10 minute line again.. and when it was finally my turn at the front, the cashier told me that someone just cancelled their pie order and now there's a slice for me! You can bet that I turned my frown upside down. 

Anyways the point I'm trying to make is, THEIR PIZZA IS BOMBBBBBBBBB. The other baked goods are delicious too, though I've only tried the foccacias and cheese rolls. They also sell scones, brownies, and cookies. And everything is very affordable!
author: Amy X.

description:
I walked in here looking for a slice of pizza since I seen tons of people posting pictures of it here on yelp, but when I was inside, I was a little bit confused to be honest. I looked around in search of a menu posted on the wall somewhere but all I seen was their coffee listed. 

I saw that they had self served bake goods and I thought maybe the pizza will be in there and they just heat it up but instead I found the focaccia bread. I thought to myself, maybe this is what people are posting up. I looked at the price and thought it was strange, it said $5.50 per lb but I was like whatever, I don't have much time for lunch. I waited in line and when I reached the cashier he said place it on the scale and it turns out that slice piece was only $3.30. And I became overly ecstatic because I only spent $3  on lunch. After I left I saw a sign out front listing the pizzas of the day of course. -_-

The reason this place deserve a 5-star rating even after all my rambling about how confused and lost I was (which was totally my own fault) is because that piece of focaccia bread with mushroom and cheese was absolutely delicious. I didn't even heat it up or anything. I was so buttery and had a hint of greasiness. I didn't think it would be anything I loved because there was no meat on it and it really didn't seem like much, but man was I impressed.
author: Mimi P.

description: Scones are probably my favorite baked goods of all time, and Arizmendi does not disappoint! Their scones are big, buttery, slightly flakey/crunchy with just the right amount of moistness. Not too sweet and just oh so delicious. The corn cherry scone taste like an awesome cornbread, but in scone form. The brioche here is really good as well. Buttery, moist, and soft- it is the perfect breakfast with a nice cup of joe. Can't wait to try their pizza next time!
author: Becky W.

description: Almost always a hit, sometimes a miss, but the miss is only my personal preference for the pizza of the day. It sucks that they only have one pizza variety a day, but its usually awesome! The bread is also fantastic so I suggest grabbing a loaf for dinner!
author: Cody M.

description:
I first heard about Arizmendi Bakery from my LSAT instructor 2-3 years ago. If there's one important thing I took away from those LSAT classes it was his recommendation for Arizmendi.

Pros: 
Freshly baked pizzas, pastries, and breads daily! This worker-owned bakery makes the best gourmet pizzas I've ever had. If you're into deep dishes and traditional pizzas (pepperoni, Hawaiian, etc.), this place may not be for you. All their pizzas are vegetarian thin crust pizzas and rarely offer them with tomato sauce (something I really love about Arizmendi). Don't let the veg option scare you away though. They combine their toppings in a way that can convince almost any meat lover to turn Arizmendi into their go-to pizza stop. Their pastries and artisan breads always taste fresh. I highly recommend their focaccia and any flavored coffee cake they have. You won't be disappointed.

I've been going to Arizmendi before they put a parklet in front of the store and I have to say, that parklet is probably one of the best business decisions they've ever made. More customers can now enjoy their meal as soon as they buy it.

Cons: 
Space inside is limited, but don't let that stop you - especially now that there's a parklet! Parking on weekends and peak hours will always be a nuisance (as it is everywhere in SF). Sometimes they'll run out of certain items, such as their focaccia, but can you really blame them? 

Tips: 
If you're local, definitely take the bus (there's a stop right around the corner). Always check out their menu online for their daily breads, pastries, and especially pizza (they only serve one type of pizza per day, but it's a different one every day). There's also a minimum amount you have to purchase in order to use your credit card, so have some cash handy just in case. 

Overall: The best pizza place in the city. Thank goodness there's a location for East Bay folks!
author: Audrey L.

description:
Great bakery to stop by if you're in the area. I never realized that this place also sells pizza, but then again I'm always here in the morning. 

A favorite of mine is the jalapeño bread. It's very savory and soft. The cheese and jalapeño flavors add a nice sharpness and kick to your morning meal. Additionally, the onion bread was just as good. Everything will taste much better if the breads are toasty and warm (I think one can ask them to heat it up? I'm not sure since I've never seen anyone request it!).

This is a self-serve, little bakery. The line in the morning isn't long, but it goes fairly quickly. Prices are good, too. I will definitely be coming back to try the other breads and baked goods here.
author: Christopher N.

description: On my first morning visit -- Bam! -- this became my favorite "baked breakfast goods" place in all of SF. Wow your friends and take them here. Quality & Unique Flavors! Everything is so darn fresh here in the a.m. because it came out of their ovens that morning. I tried a bunch of their scones -- man, these things are "creations". You will definitely not taste a better one in this City.
author: Xavier A.

description:
Go here if you like pizza and/or pastries and baked goods. 

I had one pizza of the day and was disappointed, but then the next time the pizza of the day was triple mushroom with sesame ginger garlic vinaigrette and it was amazing! Now I'm hooked. 

Corn blueberry muffin was pretty good too.
author: Mike G.

description:
Located in the middle of an otherwise typical commercial neighborhood block in The Sunset, you will find Arizmendi. Being a co-op, this establishment already runs against the grain. Their baked good and pizzas are no different with each one I've tasted being great. In particular, I come for the scones--especially if they have cornmeal in them. Yummmm.

If you're in the area and have a craving for something similar to Cheeseboard in Berkeley, give Arizmendi a try. Your tastebuds will thank you.
author: Kevin H.

description:
I love baked goods andArizmendi did not disappoint. 

The cherry coffee cake and dark chocolate cookie we had did not disappoint. There's also a great sitting area outside of the bakery.

Can't wait to try their pizza!
author: Betty C.

description: 5 star for cheap but delicious and healthy pizza. Thin crust plus a combination of great veggies flavours. Just enough amount of garlic and perfectly seasoned. Unique and tasty. The place was cute too. Expect to be in a long line though.
author: Vy T.

description: The slice of pizza was really good and priced right at $2.75. Line was out the door at noon on a sunday. Fresh pastries and even humus for sale. Nice place.
author: Ray S.

description:
You're almost as good as Cheese Board. 

I know that seems like a insult, but really that's like telling someone they're almost as fast as Usain Bolt, or they're almost as smart as Stephen Hawking. It's pretty damn spectacularly good -- just not, Cheese Board.
author: Sam Y.

description: Great savory and sweet pastries and coffee. Bring cash as they have a minimum on credit cards. Their coconut sourdough croissant is nom nom!!
author: Caitlin R.

description:
Even if the line is out the door, it goes quickly - so don't despair!! You absolutely MUST TRY the RASPBERRY SCONE (I died a little bit, I'll be honest. I needed another one the minute I finished it). 

AND you must ALSO try the Zucchini Focaccia (not quite sure if this is the correct name). To DIE for.

We are SO going back.
author: Emily Y.

description:
My favorite here is the cherry scone, with a crusty sugary outside and the chewy, sour cherry.  I often tell myself to try something else and I often regret not going back to my favorite.  The lines are long but super fast. 

The daily pizza specials are great when I come after 11 for lunch. 

My other favorite is the granola and local honey that they stock.

Come on Sunday, grab a scone and coffee then walk across the street for the Sunset farmer's market.    What a perfect Sunday.

Recently they have added a parklet outside as well, making it an even better hangout.

Definitely a must try to get the full local experience.
author: Tony T.

description:
one word: BOMB.

If you haven't tried Cheeseboard (in Berkeley) and don't have the energy/time to travel all the way there, fret not! There's a great alternative right in the heart of SF :) This bakery offers savory pastries, as well as the infamous one-flavor a day pizza! I went yesterday and had the mushroom, onion, garlic aioli oil one and boy it was DELICIOUS. The flavor of the ingredients infuse into the dough and make every bite tasty and delightful!

I had the chocolate thing for breakfast and it was a bit try but that might be because I ate it a day late.

I'd definitely recommend anyone to try this place.
author: Joyce M.

description:
I am addicted to their pizza. It doesn't even matter what day it is or what's on it. It's good. 

And as a lover of carbs, I also enjoy their scones, bread, and those incredibly delicious chocolate things. Mmmm.
author: Loli L.

description: What a great find! The Cardamom Lime shortbread was delicious. Great light taste. The café con leche was wonderful. When I'm back in the city, I'll definitely be returning. Also, the staff was friendly and welcoming which makes any experience much more pleasant.
author: Veronica M.

description:
I too used to wonder why a BAKERY kept popping up on my Yelp "PIZZA" search... well sh**, Sherlock!  

Arizmendi Bakery's PIZZA is RIDICULOUSLY GOOD!  

Everything else I've had here is just "eh"... weird, right?  I come for the pizza only.  The crust is chewy with a perfect crisp at the bottom.  The toppings, no matter how simple, are balanced and flavorful.

Cash only, and the pizza is served up after 11 AM.  The bakery is small but has plenty of inside and patio seating.
author: Diane N.

description: I have been trying really hard to work on my bakery addiction but today I fell off the wagon.  I was really just popping in to kill time while waiting at the vet next door and went to "look" at what was new.  I was pretty sure I could restrain myself but then I saw it - the ricciarelli cookie!  It is truly amazing and the BEST almond cookie outside of Italy!  I ended up buying 4 and was tempted to sit in my car and eat them all but restrained myself and decided I should share with my husband. Luckily they make this cookie everyday so I won't need to hoard them.
author: Elvis S.

description: I've only had one thing from here, but MAAAN was it good! The pecan roll is to die for! Think of the best pecan pie you've ever had. Now think of a delicious homemade cinnamon roll. Put them together, and their heavenly pecan rolls. Although that's all I've had the chance to try (so far) I will say that the place smelled delicious and everything looked so wonderful it was nearly impossible to pick what to get. I'd love to go back soon!
author: Erica M.

description:
OMG Their pizza !!! 
I loved the idea of a place by and for the workers yet didn't fully understand it. 
Their iced coffee was really good as well. 
I am so jealous we don't have a place like this in boston. 
The pizza man, that pizza yum yum yum...
author: Razan A.

description: One of the best bakeries in San Francisco! Fresh pizza daily with unique, tasty ingredients- but whole to share or by the slice. If you prefer sweet, try the brioche!
author: Anna N.

description:
They're selection seems kind of bland after awhile. No new items in years for a bakery full of creative people?

Plus their coffee cups/lids leak. For years as well....

I guess the store makes enough money they can get away with it.
author: Mike D.

description: Wonderful bakery to grab quick breakfast or brunch. It's really got some great cookies and rolls. Very fresh. You might see a queue.Parking could be an issue. I enjoyed Cheddar Jalapeño Stick, X Roll, Sheet Focaccia (Square Cheese) and some hot tea.Will come for more.
author: Priyanka L.

description: Ordered a full salted caramel fudge chocolate cake for a special occasion. All I can say is it way simply divine! Very rich and decadent. It goes a long way so you can serve atleast 10-12 people with a whole cake. It was pricey at ~$30 with tax but it was well worth it. I'm def going to try all the other Arizmendi locations in the Bay Area! Cheeseboard is also a delicious choice for a quick slice of pizza.
author: Manisha S.

description:
My favorite bakery in the area; however, the place is not as good as it used to be. 
The pizza used to taste a lot better before the bakery became super popular. The pecan rolls seem to be lacking pecans--wasn't a problem back then. Nevertheless, still very good.
author: Tommya D.

description:
-Purchased pecan bun.
-Went to dinner.
-Finished dinner and got in car with bf to drive home.
-Took a bite of my bun and said "Shit! Turn around! We need more!!"
-God damn...where have you been all my life...?
author: Heather T.

description: Friends suggested this place when they found out we moved to the neighborhood. They sell pizza dough and for those days when you're feeling lazy, par baked pizzas that you can make at home. Their toppings are delightful. We had a broccoli pizza the other day -  not the first thing I would have picked, but they've been doing it a long time - it was delicious and I've been craving it ever since!
author: Ruchi M.

description:
Oh what Arizmendi can do with flour, butter and sugar!  I've been coming here off and on since it first opened and the baked goods are consistently great!   It takes every ounce of willpower not to stop by here every day and pick up a little something to nosh on.  

The food is fresh, flavorful and high quality.  You can taste the ingredients that went into each item...no shortcuts taken here!  Nothing is too sweet or too salty.  Turnover is pretty high so there's no opportunity for anything to sit on the shelf for long periods of time.

My favorite items are the corn cherry scones and the mushroom focaccia, especially when they are fresh out of the oven.  Their breads, rolls, scones, pastries and pizza are good too.  I haven't tried their cookies so I can't speak to them.  Don't forget to try their salted caramel chocolate cake.  The extra workouts are so worth every bite of that moist and deeee-licious cake.    

The store is on the small side and there's usually a line out the door at 
all hours, but it moves fairly quickly.  Be prepared to make your selections as you are standing in line for the register.  Very limited seating is available inside and outside.  Check out their website to view a list of their specials for the day.
author: Melissa L.

description:
Great selection of different baked goods. Always fresh and very delicious.

Try the different focaccia breads; various types, all worth getting.

Very well priced, and it being employee owned, all the workers are very courteous and friendly.
author: Landon E.

description: Had the veggie pizza. I was not impressed by the pizza as it was soft and was not able to hold the veggies at all. It was slightly warm but the expected crispness of the crust did not materialize at all. Very busy place. Seating is premium. Staff works hard. Street parking.
author: Kitty D.

description:
Arizmendi is the best people watching perch in the sunset. But that's not the only reason I've been going for years. The pizza is always amazing, I can always taste the olive oil and they often use goat cheese and fresh vegetables. They also happen to have some of the best gluten free bakery in the Bay. Arizmendi is worker owned and you can tell that the people behind the scenes care about what they do. I am in support of worker owned businesses and that's where I prefer to spend my money.
I once locked myself out of my car across the street from Arizmendi and they were super helpful letting my use the phone, ect...
author: Kiona P.

description:
Arizmendi is pretty delicious.  I've had some good experiences there and some very, very weird experiences.  Like the time I was standing there, waiting for service and a crazy woman came in, dropped two lightbulbs (shattering glass all over the floor and the bottom of the display cases) and then left.  And then I left because glass + baked goods = hurt tummy.

But I digress.  The place is small (not too much seating inside) and their offerings are solid.  Eating some of their stuff is a transformative experience, but other stuff is just meh.  Example:  their blueberry lemon scone (scone of the day today) was fine, but not incredible, while their corn cherry scone (usually in their display case) was rockin'.  Chocolate Things are good but not great.  Pizza (depending on the type) can be amazing.  As can their cake.  But cookies?  Just so-so.  See?  You kind of have to try everything to figure out what you like and don't like.  Like life.

Why am I so philosophical today?  

At any rate,I think it's best compared to the Cheesboard Collective in Berkeley, and that place edges out this one without fail.  But if you don't want to trek to the East Bay, Arizmendi it is.
author: Lis B.

description:
I like this location the best. I know its all the same recipe but I feel this staff really takes care to produce.
The cheese rolls and foccia just didn't taste the same as the mission district location . 

With that said, get the cheese rolls and foccia and toast them at home. I've gotten the English muffins before those were also good. Not a big cookie fan but their one with chocolate and...walnuts? Had a weird name that I can't remember like..."milk man" or something . Was super good.
author: Rater 1.

description:
I love Arizmendi!

Today, I tried their chocolate croissant. It was made with "sour dough" that I've never had in my life. My friends and I agreed that it almost shouldn't be called croissant -  because by using sour dough, it gives more body and crispiness than classic croissant and becomes something else. But I loved it! 

Their bread is always fresh.

The stuff members are very friendly.

Their coffee is great, too!

I wish they had little bigger space for a cold day like today to eat-in. We were freezing to death, eating outside... 

The parking around there is hard, and the price is on the higher side. But it's worth it.
author: Mariko H.

description:
Best co-op bakery. I come here for their pizza and scones. 

I am actually guilty of stalking their menu for their daily pizza special. It is an extra thin pizza with vegetarian toppings. It has the strangest pizza toppings I have seen, but the most delicious that I have ever had. My favorite one is the mushroom pizza. 

Prior to my Arizmendi experience, I hated scones because scones tend to be so dry and tasteless that I have to wash it down with a glass of water. Here, their corn-cherry scone does not do that. It is flaky and has a good cornmeal and grainy texture. This is the only scone I will eat.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Even though the layout of the place is awkward and crowded and seems super busy, we were quick to pick our pastries and order a few slices of pizza. Our name was called maybe a minute later, and we were out the door in less than five!

Picked up an apple blackberry scone, a currant scone, a bran muffin, and two slices of margherita pizza. Delicious. The scones were moist and soft, and DEFINITELY buttery (they stained their brown bag, stamp of approval!) and the pizza was also really good.

Two scones, a muffin, two slices of pizza = $12.25.

(I didn't really like the scone too much, but probably because it wasn't sweet enough for me. I could use without the extra sugar intake, though, so it's okay.)
author: Jenn W.

description: I have stopped in here several times when I was in the area for other reasons like the farmers market across the street or the vet emergency clinic up the block. Every time I have stopped in here, I have had the same four problems; there has always been a lame selection of baked goods, everything is overpriced (even for San Francisco), the cashier has always been overtly obnoxious, and to top it off - the baked goods are disappointingly bland and stale. So, I am never going back.
author: Ken C.

description:
Fantastic place. All the baked goods look and smell amazing. Everything is extremely reasonably priced. 

Had the pizza of the day, which was caramelized onions, arugula, rosemary oil, etc. It was awesome. Comparable to Cheeseboard and Sliver in Berkeley (I'd say just under those two places), but because the prices don't add on tax (maybe the tax is included, I'm not sure), it's also slightly cheaper than those two places.

The pizza was awesome, though the onions weren't as caramelized as I'd like, but still really fantastic. I guess I'm a little spoiled in being used to gourmet pizza from places like Cheeseboard and Sliver, but this place definitely deserves the 4.5 star rating it has!
author: Lucy H.

description:
Never actually bought anything here myself, but my boyfriend brought me a gigantic loaf of their chocolate-cherry sourdough bread and it was epic.

HUGE chunks of rich chocolate and plenty of moist, tart cherry pieces too (I usually hate dry, shriveled up fruit). The loaf was about the size of my head and I almost finished the whole thing by myself within two days. By the third day, it started getting a bit stale so I sliced up the remaining part, refrigerated it (to slow down onset of mold), soaked it in some custard and used it to bake/fry up a scrumptious french toast over the weekend. Am I a genius or what?

I think the choco-cherry sourdough is only available on Saturdays, which is different from what they have written on their website. Doesn't matter though, just visit the bakery and let yourself be pleasantly surprised by what they have for the day

I hear their pizza is damn good too - another item on the list of things to try!
author: Amanda C.

description:
First time here. The guy at the register was very friendly and helpful didn't make me feel stupid when I told him this is my first time here and asked how their system worked. He kindly explained and showed me. Basically you grab a bag/box and fill it up with whatever you like and they ring you up after. This is what I got:

Pecan roll- my favorite out of all (reminds me of cinnamon & sugar toast)
Brioche knots- okay (not enough raisins IMO)
Chocolate things- meh
Bran muffin- meh
Lemon poppy seed muffin-yum (right amount of lemon)
Blueberry muffin- yum (it had a corn bread texture)
Carrot muffin- yum (kind of like a denser carrot cake without the frosting)
Currant scone- yum


I'll be back for more pecan rolls!!!
author: Jo S.

description:
What a cute place. It definitely deserves all the hype that it gets. Heard it's a sister restaurant to Cheeseboard, and I see the resemblance. These two are some fine looking sisters! 

Unbelievable scones, amazing pizza (different one each day), and friendly staff. I like that the pizza isn't too greasy and doesn't leave you with that "ugh i shouldn't have eaten that second piece" feeling that just weighs your stomach down. It leaves you feeling satisfied and happy, and what more could you ask for? A fun street and cool shops/stores to browse after you're finished eating at Arizmendi? CHECK! :)
author: Tuwie N.

description: Stopped by here after going to golden gate park. We had a nice walk to the bakery from the park. I had a chai latte and lavender biscuit. Both were very understated flavors but still good.
author: Caitlin H.

description:
Amazing, amazing, amazing scones.
