I got both the corn cherry scone and the scone of the day (strawberry pear) and gobbled up both. The textures were just right; the scone had the perfect level of airiness to it. There were large chunks of strawberry and pear in the latter scone - just what I like to see and taste. 

The corn cherry scone, especially, was remarkable! I could honestly eat one every day (maybe every hour...) It was like cornbread in scone form. Being from the South, I have a soft spot for corn bread. This was a combination I could definitely get behind. The tartness from the cherries added a nice(not only textural contrast to the corn flour but also) flavorful contrast. I would definitely get it every time I came by. Everything was fresh.

Will have to try the pizza next time - the pizza changes every day (see website for details)!
author: Ruoxi Y.

description: I go for the gluten free pumpkin muffin, which is amazing! They also have a gluten free buttermilk bread loaf on Thursdays, which is pretty darn good -- it sells out quickly so you have to go early.  Note that they label items as being made with gluten free ingredients, and are quick to let you know that cross contamination is a possibility.  Also, friendly staff.
author: SinGlu V.

description: Excellent bakery with rotating varieties of pizza and decent espresso based coffee drinks. Also, it is worker-owned, which is fantastic and all too uncommon. This means that the workers all share in the profits proportional to the work they put in. Too cool!
author: Frankie S.

description:
Arizmendi on 9th is one of our favorite neighborhood joints. It's wonderful to walk a couple of blocks to pick up some still-warm loaves of City bread, a slice of pizza, or a cup of coffee and a cookie.

We're also very glad they've introduced some excellent gluten-free baked-goods -- a couple kinds of muffin and a buttermilk bread which are great even for non-glutinos.
author: David W.

description:
This place is a hidden gem (but not to those who live in the area.) We were gallivanting the neighborhood, I was thirsty and decide to stop in and get bottled drink. Aside from all of the pastries I saw there was pizza. I grabbed my girlfriend and we tried a slice. Oh my oh my, how FRESH, LIGHT, and TOASTY the slice was. We decided to be gluttons and indulge with another slice before getting some bread to take home.

I would say Arizmendi rivals Cheeseboard in Berkeley. Heck, it better than Cheeseboard. geshh, I went there. It was a bold statement but I will defend it any day.

They also have a plethora of pastries for you to choose from. 

The staff is unpretentious, the atmosphere is friendly (there is not much indoor seating) and a good place to grab some a slice, pastries/coffee, chillax and enjoy life.
author: Tony N.

description:
I only hope to never run into my ex here.  It's his spot; he has a boner for the corn cherry scones.  Sadly, so do I and there's no where else in town that does it like Arizmendi does.  Corn cherry scones: 2.50; specialty scones that rotate: 2.75.

If one goes during the week, then finding a place to sit and enjoy tasty bread products and coffee indoors or out is fairly good.  The place is tidy and small, so seating is limited. :S

Oh, and don't forget to use wax paper when handling the products.  No one wants to see someone's grubby hands grazing the brioche.

Dec.'15 Update: in the intervening years a second SF Arizmendi Bakery has opened on Valencia St. in the Mission.
author: Bea B.

description:
Pizza of the day is ALWAYS delicious, no matter the topping. Less is more usually. I really just get the pizza for the thin crunchy crust. mmm ::crunch::

I am a carb whore btw. and proud 

When i feel like being naughty, Arizmendi is my go to spot.
author: Andrew V.

description:
I used to love this place. But I will NEVER, I repeat, NEVER support any establishment that has a rude attitude and does not value their customers!

Went in yesterday to grab some scones since I was in the neighborhood, living in Santa Clara now so this is a huge treat for me. 

Bee lined to the GF scone: a good 1/3 of the piece just broke off to the ground, since I was in a hurry, I grabbed 2 of the already broken pieces on the tray plus a couple of other pastries. Once at the counter I said: "uh, 1 and a half scone?" Since I was not sure how that would work, the tall skinny guy immediately gave me a look and said in a condescending tone: "There's no half scones, we don't do that here, but you get it this time." The whole tray was full of broken scones except 1 or 2 so I told him that.
"Well, still, you are not suppose to touch them. That's snacks for us later."
WTF?! Are you seriously having a power trip and talking to me like I was 5 years old? I'm sorry that it was so wrong of me to have to forage through your not quite maintained tray just to find a scone in one piece in the first place, and when I did, that piece also broke off. I'm sorry that I spent $12 so I can endure your speech about how I just stole your snack and shame on me for picking a half piece. In my defense I did offer to give them back and I should have not spent my hard earned money on such a unpleasant experience. 
Yeah sure, people love this place but this is the last draw for me and I will not support Arizmendi anymore.
author: Sway M.

description:
I like that the pizza changes everyday but it also creates the possibility that on a day that you really want pizza the only option may contain an ingredient that you find to be objectionable.

Luckily today's bell pepper and goat cheese pizza, while intense tasting was still quite good, so good in fact that I got two slices.
author: Misha T.

description:
By far the best bakery I have encountered. Tons of people flock to this spot for fresh local baked good and pizza. The constantly offer new and delicious scones, muffins, breads, cheeses and pizzas.

The pizzas are topped with the freshness of local produce. Only one type of pizza is offered but you can't go wrong. They all truly taste unreal. You can call ahead to place a pizza order, along with a specific pick-up time.
author: Evan D.

description:
LOVE the pecan rolls! They are like cinnabuns glazed with brown sugary goodness and speckled with caramelzed pecan bits. By far my favorite thing to get here!

Monkey chocolate bread. Pull-apart. Soft. Chocolatey. Good stuff!
Muffins & scones were all very good. Any of their baked goods/pastries are actually surprisingly fililng. Also, everything here is a much better deal than Tartine's, with most items ranging from $1.50-3 each.

Breadsticks: got a couple piping fresh but they were still meh. Far too crunchy for me, but maybe some of you will like that kind of thing.

Foccaccias.. yum. 'nuff said!
author: Andrew T.

description: Great bakery with amazing scones and tasty pizza!  Lines can be long but they move relatively quickly.
author: David H.

description: Good ginger shortbread. Pleasant service.
author: Inigo M.

description: I picked up a piece of pizza and took a bite in line only to find out they charge by the pound for the slices.  It was my first and last time going into this place.  The "dude" working the register made me feel like a total turd.  He added on fifty cents for the bite I took and treated me like a bum.  I felt like I was in Berkeley.  I hate Berkeley and its community local fart sniffing vibe and now its in my neighborhood.  Lame.  The baked goods look good but the vibe stinks.
author: Johnny B.

description:
You know the stuff they have is good. The little pizza buns are different, But I don't go there much because there isn't much variety for a full on bakery. Especially if I don't want to eat 260 + calories in a couple of bites. I wish there were other breakfast / lunch choices like english pies, egg tart, yogurt/fruit/granola bowl or some new invention.

CASH ONLY?
author: Anthony M.

description:
I looooooove these guys!
Fresh baked goodies and the yummiest pizzas!
They used to be cash only but now they also accept credit cards with a $10 min.

They are nice, friendly and locally owned!
Hope they stay in business ForEver!
author: Maryam M.

description:
Oh my sweet heavens the pizza.  The PIZZA!  It's gooder'n grits.

Today's pizza was house-made tomato sauce, Point Reyes bleu cheese, garlic oil, parmesan and parsley.  I waited for the new pie to come out and got a fresh slice.  Oh the crispiness.  That slight chewy factor.  The perfect thickness of the dough.  And that bleu cheese wonderfulness.  The pizza was out of control good.  My friend was contemplating taking a whole pizza to bake at home (a great option they have there).

I also bought a cavity, er, a pecan roll to savor at home.  You might want to eat it at home too, so you could privately hide those funny faces you'll be making while eating it (you know those faces I'm talking about). Mmmhmm.

Although it moves quite fast, be prepared to stand in line.  It can get busier than a moth in a mitten!
author: Rho T.

description: Good bread. Good pizza. Honor system for payment.  They have organic and gluten free bread. Sour dough here is a bit tough but that is definition of a good sour dough. They have some pastries and coffee.  Few people get those.
author: Byron L.

description:
Even though I'm off wheat, their cheesy rolls, chocolate things, and scones are especially delicious, and I did manage to have a birthday cake from here one year that was just divine (chocolate with salted caramel icing). 

Pretty much everyone already knows they do solid, rustic baked goods, with a bit of an Italian influence with their foccacias and other flatbreads.
author: Caroline C.

description: I didn't expect to like Arizmendi as much as I did. I went in hoping they did breakfast sandwiches and was disappointed that they didn't. However, my friend and I split the vegan banana nut muffin and the corn and cherry scone. Both were amazing. The muffin was moist and flavorful and just delicious, and the scone tasted like the best cornbread you've ever had. I can't wait to go back and try more!
author: David B.

description: Pizza here always hella good except when its wierd, they also have like breadz and baked goodz and this crazy cheese wheel, and the best part is you don't have to tip at all since it's a coop or whatever, communism yeaaaah!
author: Paul H.

description:
We were looking for something sweet this weekend and thought we'd stop by Arizmendi.  Unfortunately they didn't have a ton of things that whet our appetite but their pies did look really good.  We instead opted for some breakfast treats for the next morning and they did not disappoint.  I had the coffee cake which was huge but really tasty.

Remember that it's only cash only here as we made that mistake and had to run to get some money.
author: Blake B.

description: Good quality fresh bread/pastries/pizzas at affordable prices. When I don't want to make the trip to Acme Bread Company at the Embarcaderro I come here. Love to get Rye raisin wheat bread for a snack. I only wish there were more locations spread across SF, though I live 10 minutes from here so I can't complain.
author: Jude N.

description:
In the great tradition of Cheeseboard, this place does everything right!
Its worker owned, so each pizza and baked good is democratically made! It really gives thought to how there are different business models to the mass corporatism we're used to in modern day U$A.

Anyway, this isn't a political review...this is a food review!
The baked goods ALWAYS satisfy, whether its their wolverine bread, scones of the day, chocolate mint cookies, or those 'oh-so-good' pumpkin muffins (they're surprisingly gluten free).
Grab the wonderful vegetarian pizzas on any day and it'll brighten up your foggy Inner Sunset day. 

So why the 4 stars??? Well to me, Cheeseboard is my one true love. So to Berkeley it must be for the perfect experience. With its jazz band, grassy median to sit on, beautiful SUNNY Berkeley sky, and wide array of cheese....I really can't give its compatriot a 4 when Cheeseboard must be a 5.
author: Nehal N.

description:
Everyone and their grandma knows that their pizzas are delicious, and their scones, too (I'm dropping corn-cherry scone crumbs all over as I type this). 

However! Right now they have a Green Tea Shortbread ($1.75) that is aaaaamazing. It's buttery, as shortbread should be, but the matcha powder gives it such a wonderful and surprisingly complementary flavor. When you bite into it, it's not an explosion of green tea flavor, it just creeps up on you in a way, which I really like.

Unfortunately, I think it's a seasonal item, so if you're into that type of pastry, go get it! As in right now! Go!
author: Trang N.

description:
Got the Pecan roll, blueberry scone, chocolate sourdough croissant. 

The pecan roll is delicious, sweet caramelly in the bottom, crunchy, and flavorful.

The shine was lacking compared to the other two items, definitely more tame, mild flavor, soft in the inside, crunchy on the outside.not a lot of blueberry flavor.

What I liked about the croissant was it had a super multiple layered flavor crispy flakyness top.That was amazing add you bite into it.

Overall extremely delicious pastry and bike owner/rider discount which made me extremely happy.
author: David L.

description: We stopped for lunch here after exploring the GG Park. The pizza was ok. It would have been nice to have some choices, there was only one type of pizza that day. We got the cherry corn scone because it was recommended. It was "Meh". It tasted more like day old corn bread with dried cherries in it. They really need to do something about the amount of disgusting pigeons in their outside eating area. We ended up going somewhere else for dessert.
author: Trent P.

description:
Still loving this place. Tried their organic peaches and strawberry scones. Yum...I'm not a big fan of scones, but this place does it well. Not overly sweet, with a hint of savory flavor. 

Staffing is awesome too!
author: Mandy D.

description:
Admittedly, Arizmendi was sort of a grower for me. I had already tried Cheeseboard and considered it miles above any other small pizzeria I'd had before. But since Arizmendi is in my district, and Cheeseboard is in Berkeley, I had to make do. And I'm so glad I decided to give this place a shot.

Their baked goods are what really sold it for me. Their pizza is great--they have some really great selections like Cheeseboard does, but offerings like the vegan chocolate mint cookie and chocolate shortbread sealed the deal. The cookie is large and in charge, and the mint flavoring is so well blended into the dough that it stays consistent with the bittersweet cocoa flavor. The chocolate shortbread is great because it is modestly sweet, but contains a real chocolate-y flavor and a true buttered decadence that a shortbread cookie should always possess. 

Of course, classics like the corn blueberry muffin should not go unmissed, nor should their various focaccia slices, which are even more filling than the pizza slices. 

They are cash only, so come prepared. If you're stuck, there are a lot of banks nearby.
author: Rachel F.

description: I AM IN LOVE WITH THIS PLACE!! I always have to make a stop here when I'm in the sunset area.  the pizza is deeelicious. and if you're like me and obsess about carbs, then yes, this is the place for YOU.  olive bread, cheddar scones, you name it, they have it!  love love love everything here.
author: Christina K.

description:
If you haven't been to this co-op bakery, drop everything you're doing and go NOW! All the workers in the bakery combine their creative forces to come up with "the best of the best" baked goods in town. Salty and sweet, breads and cookies--you name it, they have it!

Their cheese bread baked daily is amazing. Their sticky buns will have you licking your fingers for more. Their cookies are soft and chewy, the way all cookies should be IMO. Oh and their Daily Pizza special with creative ingredient combinations--you can't stop at one slice, you have to at least have two (or more).

So what are you waiting for?!...go go go!
author: Andrew S.

description:
Oh man - this place is a new vice for me (in a good way). I don't live super close to an Arizmendi location, however the inner sunset location isn't too far by bike. 

Being lactose intolerant, I love that they always have a vegan option or two on hand. On my most recent visit, they had a vegan poppyseed muffin and a chocolate/mint cookie. I bought both and was pleasantly surprised to receive a 10% discount when the cashier saw my helmet and asked if I had ridden a bike to the shop.  Totally unexpected and awesome!

These guys are a great part of the inner sunset neighborhood and a now a delicious part of my diet as well!
author: Tim N.

description: Best breads ever. Everything's still delicious even days after baking/buying. I always make an effort to come here or Cheeseboard if I'm in the area.
author: N Z.

description: This review is based on what i got to try. When I went the only vegan option available was a lemon poopyseed muffin. It was awful and tasted strongly of oil and not much else. I could not eat it.
author: Nona T.

description: We LOVE this place. The pizza is always delicious, their mint chocolate cookie is my absolute favorite, the chocolatey things, the almond cookies, all of their scones, muffins.. Literally everything is amazing. Also, try the focaccia. I wish I could eat here every day :)
author: Jackie K.

description: Wow! Wonderful pizza, great scones, delicious focaccia! Great prices. They had a special pizza when we came - shitake mushrooms, garlic oil, caramelized onion, and awesome cheese (don't remember the name). Definitely eat here!
author: Logan S.

description:
I guess its different when you actually see it...

Serving / Handling Food when handling money to me is bad practice.  If you use the appropriate utensils then coolio but if you use your hands thats been handling money its a no go for me.  I use to love this place.
author: she q.

description:
Friend kept telling me how great the breakfast pastries were. Then he rambled on about their terrific pizza and focaccia. I agreed to go there with him just to take a look.

That's when I spotted the cookies! I love cookies!! Friend said he had never tried the cookies there before so I decided it was time we did. We got the chocolate shortbread, the kookie brittle, the chocolate chip cookie and the mint chocolate chip cookie.

When we walked out of the store I decided to take a nibble completely ignoring the fact that my friend likes to take pictures of the foods he eats. That chocolate shortbread sure was good because when friend opened the bag he found that I left him a quarter inch crumb. I would have eaten that too had I known it was there!

The other cookies were delicious too after friend took photos of them, of course! Next time I'm going there alone, and I'm trying everything! Thanks Arizmendi!!
author: Sara A.

description:
There pizza was so good today that I actually stopped while walking with it and moaned out loud. The person with me nearly had to drag me away to stop me going back to buy more. Simply amazing pizza. And this has been very consistent. Each time I go there the food is spectacular and the service is great. Sometimes there is a short wait for a the pizza but this is understandable. 

Also, I really enjoy how they bake the ethnic breads for holidays like the crown challah and Pan de los muertos.
author: Daniel C.

description:
I love this place. Everything is fresh and inexpensive.  The focacia bread is always great, the pizza is filled with flavors,  and the muffins are almost perfect. Everything is pretty much healthy so u dnt feek like shit after eating it.
To sum things up:
1. Cheap
2. Yummy
3. Great service
4. Short lines
author: Reiko n.

description:
I enjoyed the sour dough croissant.  It was not as fluffy as a traditional croissant, but still good and unique.  

I had a cup of coffee, and it was not notable.
author: Ben M.

description:
Yes! 
You tantalized my family, with your homemade organic goodies, giving Tartine a true run for it's bakery money and opening them up to a new flavor adventure.
In particular, the buttery and delectable pluot-blueberry scone - the unique cookie sort of thing with complex/layered flavors - and the pecan-crazy pecan roll, which was just perfection.
This is the type of place that makes San Francisco a true foodie capital! I am very worried how their opening in the Mission will affect my cholesterol and waistline.
author: Andrew K.

description: Quality pizza at a great price. I ordered two slices of their pizza with the cherry tomatoes, spinach, Parmesan with garlic oil and it was amazing. It hits the spot especially if you want hearty pizza without feeling too heavy after. I also got the chocolate mint cookie and its tasted like Girl Scouts thin mints but even better because it was soft and had little chocolate chips in them. All for $8! Can't wait to go back!
author: Jaclyn N.

description: I don't believe the pizza was as incredible as most say. I would come back to try more of their baked goods if I am cruising by and notice that there is not a massive crowd as their usually is. I like to start my day relaxed and this being a morning place, the hussle and bussle is not my style. Gets too cramped waiting in line.
author: Skye J.

description:
I am a huge fan of Cheeseboard in Berkeley. So imagine my pleasant surprise when I discover that there is another "collective" here in the city that also make special pizzas of the day with fresh, vegetarian ingredients. The pizzas are also amazing because they use sourdough, which is amazing with the pizza. Each pie is $20, half-pie $10, and slice $2.50. Cash only. Come during lunch when the pizza is especially fresh (but they do freshen up pizzas in the oven before serving it to you). Seating is pretty limited so expect to get it take out or take it over to Golden Gate Park 2 blocks away and have a little picnic. 

Note: if you plan on getting a pizza later in the day, it may be in your best interest to call ahead and "reserve" a pie.
author: Dan K.

description: At $3 for a pastry made of flour, water, sugar, and a couple of nuts I've never been more confident of the bubble of San Francisco. I gladly dropped by garbage on the street with confidence that my hard earned money would not go toward cleaning the neighborhood.
author: Anthony S.

description:
Amazing selection of scones, muffins, and other carbalicious goodies!

My favorites:

chocolate thing: cross between a chocolate-chip cookie-scone-bread. YUMMMMMMMM! i drool at the thought of it. 

corn-cherry scone: super good if you're craving a scone. i think this is the scone that most ppl yelp about so  check this out if you haven't been here before!

cheese bread: REALLY good when it's fresh! It gets a bit hard and tough if you let it sit so definitely consume the entire delicious bread in one sitting (which shouldn't be hard:)) 

they also remodeled the sidewalk/patio in front of this bakery so feel free to grab some breakfast (or snack), chill out, and enjoy!
author: Patricia K.

description:
Really delicious bakery..you get engulfed with the aroma down the street!

Parking is obnoxious as always in inner sunset but it's a nook in the city that I still frequent n love..

Gourmet pizza regularly changing (one type each day and only one type)


Recommend it to anyone craving pizza or pastries

ps- tasty chocoloate chip cookies
author: Naveed B.

description:
GET:
corn and cherry scone
currant scone
chocolate thing (no really, that's it's name)


SKIP:
granola (bought a bag and by the time i got home it had soaked through with oil.  appetizing.)


HEADS UP:
cash only! bofa atm is right around the corner


really friendly,down-to-earth people. love this place!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I love this place! My mom always brings back lots of goodies from here, bless her heart. There's nothing like a slice of pizza fresh out of the oven from Arizmendi's. I love anything with tomatoes, olives, artichoke hearts, mushrooms, or spinach. Check their website to see the pizza schedule. I've had their tea breads and scones, but their pizza is what gets me drooling.

The line tends to be long on most days, but particularly on the weekends, so be prepared!
author: Audrey T.

description: This one of the all time great bakeries in the city. You can see that from the line out in front on the weekends. Scone of the day never fails. You swoon with the great smells as you walk through the door. Plus the staff are warm and always helpful. I love that this is a cooperative... They have pride in their work- as well they should!
author: Bill V.

description:
Inspired by the amazing Cheese Board bakery collective in Berkeley, Arizmendi sells some of the same tasty breads, bakeries and pizzas. 

But alas, the high-quality product doesn't translate quite as well across the bay. This bakery is just OK.
author: Shanan D.

description:
I only come here for the corn-cherry scone!

Super bomb. Get it! That is all.
author: Daniel S.

description: I decided that I wanted to be surprised by the pizza of the day but was disappointed when I got there. Mushrooms, mushrooms, mushrooms, with sesame-ginger-garlic vinaigrette????? Not a combo that I was excited about.  I was totally impressed by the taste and even more by the crust.  My plate us usually filled with pizza crust carcasses but not today! I ate it all and it was delicious!  Their macaroons were pretty tasty as well.  Best pizza I have had in the Bay so far.
author: Melissa R.

description: I've always been a fan of Arizmendi because of their baked goods! We were having a fam day out and stopped by for some pick-me-up coffee and snacks. We ordered a chai tea latte, mocha, and hot chocolate. From the front we tried a garlic bread, tomato/eggplant pizza, and cheese roll. The cheese roll was the freshest and still hot, the garlic bread and square pizza were cold... but I'm sure they would have been just as delicious if they were fresh! Always a great place to stop by for some quick coffee.
author: Elaine N.

description:
Omg I've been calling this place ArZImendi for the longest time. I will never get used to saying it the right way.

Bought 2 slices of pizza to bring home for myself and a friend. Both ended up in my belly before I reached home. Sorry not sorry, friend.

I love the corn-cherry and scones of the day. My bf likes the pecan rolls. Dat caramel drizzle (or whatever it is). Sticky and delicious.

I ordered a soy au lait and the guy told me to fill up my cup with however much coffee I desired, wait for them to steam my milk, and they fill up the rest. I believe they use Equator coffee. Really good!

2 thumbs up
author: Bianca Y.

description: Why haven't I tried this place before??? As soon as you walk in, you immediately smell all the fresh baked goods. Beware, making a choice is tough. I left with a chocolate croissant and a "chocolate thing".... You must get this amazing creation. I need to come back ASAP to try everything else!
author: Charlie D.

description:
My girl lives down the street so I've made a habit of stopping by Arizmendi either before, after, or during one of my ventures to the Inner Sunset. All-time favorites are the pumpkin muffin, berry scone, and of course the daily pizza special. You also can't go wrong with a simple $0.75 sunflower wheat roll (it makes a great sandwich). Although the line can be discouraging, it moves fast and is worth the wait. Arizmendi has never let me down.

Next up: I must try their granola. It looks fantastic and $3.50 for a small is a decent price!
author: Scott S.

description:
Arizmendi is the best bakery around. Yes, better than Tartine.

IMHO.

I really can't even tell you what my favorite is, because it's all delicious.  I will say that this is the only place where I've met a scone that I actually liked. They're out of this world. And they don't use a ton of butter (hence my proclamation above). Also, while they do have great pizza, try the focaccia sometime. It's usually on the bottom shelf, already prepared, and equally (if not more) delicious.
author: Courtney M.

description:
Three words: Walnut Sourdough bread.

We initially found Arizmendi Bakery somewhat by accident on a trip through San Rafael. We were there on a Thursday, as it happens, and that's walnut sourdough bread day. (Some of the baked goods are available any day of the week, others only on certain days.)

If you like walnuts, the walnut sourdough bread is excellent. It freezes well too.

As we live on the Peninsula, we were most pleased to learn that there are two Arizmendi locations in SF. This one, near GG Park, is in a neighborhood we know well. We drive in to shop for bread (and sometimes cookies), grab lunch at a nearby restaurant,  then take a walk through GG Park before returning home.

The deep dark double chocolate cookies are yummy too!
author: Vicki B.

description:
The Pecan Rolls are amazing! 

I am lucky enough to live just a couple of blocks away. However, don't forget that they are closed on Mondays.
author: Joey L.

description: Arizmendi is one of my favorite bakeries in SF. It's got something for everyone -- from sweet scones, cookies and muffins to cheese rolls, breadsticks and hot slices of their daily pizza. I've never been to the legendary Cheeseboard in Berkeley, but I'm told that the pizza here is just as good, so I'll take it. The specials are always something to look forward to! Best of all, the prices are SO reasonable for the quality and size of the baked goods. I could come here everyday and not get tired of the selection. Even though there's usually a line, it moves pretty quickly.
author: Jenny N.

description:
Well well, vegetarian pizza. You've fooled me into eating something delicious without meat in it! Especially pizza! 

Okay blahblahblah pizza was delicious. But the thing that really surprised me everytime is how amazing the crust still is after a few hours, when it's not hot anymore. The crust is FRESH. It doesnt turn all soggy & oily after a while, it's still delicious later on. 

Their pastries are fresh too. Never tried the scones though, but i will next time.
author: Connie Y.

description: I loveeee this co op!! Their pizzas are always bomb along with their pecan rolls (which runs out quite often), corn meal cherry scone (even though I pick out the cherries), cheese rolls, and their focaccia breads!!!
author: Janet Z.

description:
I just can't fangirl enough about Arizmendi's pizza and for me to do so in proper detail would lead to disastrous results because I really need to be studying for my Constitional Law midterm . . . but bring up Arizmendi pizza and I WILL gush for days on end about their delicious, thin sourdough crust, perfectly melted cheese, and the colorful, gourmet veggie toppings. I certainly know and love it more dearly than whatever the hell Marbury v. Madison established. 

So, basically, if you haven't had it yet - here's what your week's plans should entail:

http://www.arizmendibakery.com/pizza

Yeah, you're welcome.

Other notable baked goods they have are their scones and savory breads, always a fresh and delicious treat to walk out of there with, wrapped in the crisp wax paper and as you venture into the Inner Sunset (speaking of the Inner Sunset though, parking is really not fun there.)

Also,  cash only. And, they're a worker-owned co-op! Support them. :)

PS. No offense, John Marshall, really.
author: Betty W.

description:
Did you know they removed the word "superfluous" from the dictionary? Sorry, I just learned that. So now, I am going to redefine the word.

The bread. The chocolate. The treats. My wife, my daughter, and I make Arizmendi our special treat every Sunday, after the Inner Sunset farmer's market.

Everything is super delicious. Nuff said - I don't want to be superfluous
author: Chris C.

description:
The things I love about this place: 
The Pizza. (no matter what it is that day)
Pecan Rolls.
Blueberry Cornbread Muffins. 
Bread sticks. (the real deal! thin and crispy!)
These are just a few of my favorites, you really cant go wrong with anything here.
author: Matt K.

description: I'm over my head because I still haven't tried their pizza yet, and which is why I'm holding off on another star. I usually buy their some here and they have great selection to choose from, including blueberries, strawberry, chocolate, etc. line are efficient and you pick as you move up in line. I'm drooling just thinking about their pizzas: mushrooms, sweet potato, manchego cheese, spinach, etc. I love creativity!
author: Connie C.

description:
I have enjoyed every single thing my mother brought home from here and they get five stars for ALWAYS treating her like a lady (not just an old lady). 

Respect is rare and patience is key in this small, but busy store. Thank you. I'm proud to wear your T-shirt.

**bonus points for vegan options :3
author: Ziggy J.

description:
It's kind of awe inspiring / absolutely disgusting how much food I can eat. I'm pretty sure I was on my way to or from an actual meal when I stopped by here to pick up a casual half pizza to eat. 

The flavor of the day was a wild mushroom with a ginger/sesame vinaigrette. I'd never had a pizza with such a great combination of salty, sweet, and tangy. It was also made to order so it was super hot like molten lava - which I love.  On top of that, I bought an additional potato focaccia and pecan roll for "later" which really meant like 10 minutes later while I was still sitting down.

Although everything here seems to be carb-y and oil-y at the same time, it's worth every last ounce of fat and shame.
author: Jeff T.

description: These guys never disappoint! I'd order 2 slices of pizza any day, without even knowing what it is - it's always THAT good! And you can't go wrong snagging some of their baked goods. I'm a huge fan of their Pumpkin & Lemon Poppy Seed Muffins - and their Cheese Rolls. So good!
author: Allie P.

description: I simply cannot get enough of their pizza. Normally I disdain eating pizza on a regular basis, but these artisanal slices are far too delectable! And the fresh bread is the best local bread!
author: josh a.

description:
The equivalent of Berkeley's Cheeseboard Pizza, except it's in the Inner Sunset in San Francisco.  There's nothing new I can add here that hasn't already been said, but here's some little things I personally like about them.

+ Worker-owned co-op is a pretty awesome (and very Bay Arean) thing.
+ The Inner Sunset is filled with life, close to the Park, lots of children (this, I especially love), and other decent restaurants.
+ The pizza is good, albeit extremely greasy.  It is a delicious slice of thin crust, and they'll nicely heat it up for you if it's warm, but after two bites, I was starting to feel like it was a bit too greasy for me.  Still, though, a well-made slice of pizza with quality ingredients.
+ The two benches in the store!  I love benches!  I love places with benches!  Very cute. Very lovely. They make me happy.  
+ You can have lunch/dinner for $2.50; that's how much a slice costs.

Oh, and they have a great collection of crusty and drool-inducing breads.  I haven't tried any yet, but will do on my next trip here. 

I'm glad I'm just at 10-minute bike ride away. It's a solid Inner Sunset staple, and it's well-deserved.
author: Vivian C.

description:
Unfailing on their scones. Everything is fresh. The pizzas are to die for. They don't try to over complicate anything. Just good down to earth carbohydrates ready to welcome you with their open arms.

I try to come early enough to be able to grab a quick breakfast and then catch the MUNI. The only problem I have is making sure I don't eat from here on a daily basis because I pastry count has now gone up to two with every visit.
author: Joanne S.

description:
Super delicious bakery in the Inner Sunset.  The cheese scones are a must to try.   I always love the different Pizzas they have each day.  They are pretty affordable too. 

For the sweet tooth, try the pecan roll.  It's loaded with pecans, super soft and delicious.  I've taken it home and microwaved it for a few seconds and it takes it to a whole different level.
author: Patti L.

description:
This place is my daily morning stop on my way to work. Great scones and pecan rolls. Try to get here early in the day, otherwise many of the baked goods will be sold out by mid-afternoon. Yeah their bread and baked goods are that coveted in the sunset district.

On top of the baked goods, this place also has good pizza with a new daily flavor to keep things interesting. 

To top off my review, this bakery also serves Equator coffee. The same organic coffee served at the French Laundry and other notable bay area establishments. You can't ask for anything more.
author: Joseph N.

description:
I loved Arizmendi then, and I love it even more now that they've added a charming street patio out front. My recommendations:
- Pizza. Foccaccia. Of course.
- Garlic cheese sticks. Long, thin, crusty sourdough spindles. Chewy as all hell, they activate my TMJ like no other food can -- but I'll bear it because they're so tasty.
- Shortbread. Oftentimes they have herb/floral flavors, like lavender or rose. Yum.
- Chocolate mint cookie. Incredibly decadent chocolate, wonderfully refreshing mint. This is the ULTIMATE in chocolate and mint flavor. DIVINE. FLAWLESS. ETC.
author: Julie D.

description:
I'll need to Arizmendi my pants when they bust from eating all the top notch baked goods from this small bakery.

A breakdown...

Pastries: fresh and excellent.
Pizza: fresh and excellent.
Service: fresh and excellent.
Tears falling from people with Celiac Disease: fresh and excellent.

All of the pastries are wonderful, though I'm particularly fond of the brioche twists and scones. Not the cheese ones though, I'm watching my figure.

They make a different type of pizza every day, all with tasty and interesting flavor combinations. And a lot of the time, your slice is right out of the oven. Seriously, the pizza is really great.

On weekends, the place often has a line. And seating is limited inside unless you are willing to sit on strangers laps (perhaps to sneak bites of their pizza?).

Luckily, right outside is one of those new fangled parklets built on top of an ancient indian parking spot.  On a sunny day, you won't even notice the car ghosts haunting it.
author: Nik D.

description: Pizza is out of this world yes it is does contain gluten, but I made an exception since I was lost and forgot to get breakfast. It was worth the cramps but I'm not your physician. It didnt have any sauce and I will not try any pizza besides specialty ener agin. I guess thats a good thing but also a bad thing becasue I might just starve is dominoes is the only thing left in the world.
author: Ariele L.

description:
This place is good as fuck.

I'd go here if I were in the neighborhood for pizza and other baked goods. The pizza is different for a change of pace and with the bread that is being used for it...oh you just can't that kind of stuff any place else. No sir~ree.

They also have people who are on diabetes. So this is also a good place for you to buy your stuff. Give it a shot if you're around here.
author: Jacen W.

description:
Love this place! I've been to a lot of bakeries and this one really is one of the best! 
Freshly baked goods and brewed coffee everyday. They have good-sized portions, each baked piece is pretty generous. 

Things I love: 
Peaches-and-cream scone
Blackberry & raspberry scone
Ginger shortbread 
Chocolate-chip cookie (not only with regular chocolate chips, but also has little flecks of chocolate as well, every bite is chocolatey goodness!) 
Ricciarelli (Italian almond cookie) 

Seating: few tables inside and a new seating/bench area outside

Note: cash only 

Parking: street and a small lot nearby
author: Evangeline W.

description: A quick stop to get a bite lead us here -- grabbed some case pastries -- cheese and tomato was decent, poppies and onions was much better, though if you've got to talk to people after eating it, check yourself in a reflective surface of some kind ... chances are you'll have some poppy teeth.
author: Joe A.

description:
Inner Sunset (and lower Irving especially) has a lot of great places.  One of these great places being Arizmendi Bakery on 9th and Irving. They have a different pizza baked daily and when I read it was comparable to Berkeley's Cheeseboard Pizza... I had to pay it a visit. You can grab a slice or you can buy their "lite-bakes" where you can finish baking it at home. Today it was mushrooms, fontina cheese, parsley, parmesan cheese, and rosemary oil pizza! I instantly noticed something different about their pizza - sourdough crust?! It's as good as everyone says. I don't normally enjoy vegetarian pizzas but Arizmendi just may change my mind.

It's a small bakery with a lot of other goodies as well. I also picked up focaccia (5.25/lb) and a pecan roll for $2.50. This plus the pizza came out to be $7.50 total. The pecan roll is dense, super sweet, and will probably give me cavities. That's how I know it's good!
author: Samantha L.

description:
Arizmendi's offers a good variety of savory and sweet baked goods, and pizza that almost never disappoints.  Some of my personal favorite sweets include the pecan rolls, their scones, the chocolate mint cookies, and the brioche rolls.  For savory, I really like the cheese rolls and focaccia, especially if you can heat them up at home or catch them super fresh.  Finally, their pizzas are always amazing, and totally worth the price.  
My only gripe is that I wish the pastries were a little bit cheaper.
author: Max L.

description: Parking in the area is terrible, but totally worth it to get an indulgent carb filled meal of pizza and cookies :). The seating is limited but turnover seems to be pretty quick since people just scarf down their slices and go. The pizza of the day when I went was a deletable combination of mushrooms, pesto and I don't remember what else but I'm looking forward to trying more varieties!
author: Juliana C.

description: Wow can pizza get any better? I don't usually go gaga for pizza but they really know how to make them here! I'm a poor student on a strict strict budget who never eats out but I have to go here every once in a while to indulge. It's only 2.75 so that helps. As an added plus the people who work here are always really friendly. If you're in the area don't miss out!
author: Khanh H.

description:
A beautiful sunny Saturday morning on Irving - 11:30ish

Usually I hate coming to this area because it sucks looking for parking, esp. on the weekends. Luckily, I found a couple of meter spots available, but even better.. one right in front! SCORE!! My lazy a$$ doesn't have to walk far for some buttery treats to feed my a$$! 

Decided to walk down to BofA first and overheard some girls saying they might open an Arizmendi in the mission? oooooO... I overhear another couple behind me talking about Arizmendi. Seems like Arizmendi is the talk of the town, or block!

Scone and pizza of the day are displayed on the chalkboard outside.  When you walk in, you instantly smell all that bakery goodness, which makes everything tempting and that much harder to choose from the self-serve, free-for-all treats. Foccacias, breadsticks, muffins, scones, wolverines, breads, cookies, cheeses, coffee, and pizza, o my! What to try, what to try..

Chocolate things!! I love all their chocolate things! Get their chocolate thingamahjig ($2.25)! I've had the chocolate cookie ($2)- Good size, big chocolate chunks, perfectly chewy and buttery, just how I like em. Vegan mint chocolate cookie ($2) - Minty fresh like an Andes! and OMGG.. they have chocolate cake with salted caramel frosting. Their chocolate's yummy, big chocolate chip pcs, not chunks, or teeny weeny chips. They're not stingy with the chocolate pcs. either as there's a nice chocolate-to-thing ratio with everything. If you love chocolate like me, that's an important factor. 

Pizzas really good and flavorful with a sourdough crust. You can get half baked ones and finish it off at home.

There seems to always be ppl hustling and bustling in and out of here, reminiscent of a typical Saturday on the streets of Irving. Even though theres usually a line, it moves pretty fast and the workers are always friendly and efficient. I ordered an Americano, and my cashier made it immediately after I paid. Another worker quickly swooped in to ring up customers and I got my coffee in like 2 mins. Definitely not a spot for dilly dallying, unless you're lucky enough to get a seat. They only have 2 tables and some benches inside, and a few tables and chairs on the sidewalk. Nice for ppl watching.

If you wanna be a true hardcore Arizmendi fan and schedule your days around their bread and pizza menu, check out their website for the bread and pizza calendar.  

Worker-owned coop.
GO SUPPORT THEM!!.. during these hrs:
Tuesday - Friday: 7am - 7pm
Saturday - Sunday: 7:30am - 6pm
Not on Monday though- they're closed.
author: Angela W.

description:
Randomly stumbled upon Arizmendi & I'm hooked! 

I am a baked good aficionado.  I would gladly keep up any sweets for baked goods, and Arizmendi has some great baked goods in both the sweet and savory department. 

One of my favorite things to eat with bread is cheese and just like some comment say, the cheese breadsticks are indeed AMAZING.  That particular visit, I was able to get some fresh ones and it was just bomb.  I also had their flavored shortbread [rosemary] and it was delicious.  

Being from the Southbay, its rare for me to visit Arizmendi and that makes me sad.  When I get a subpar cheese stick or shortbread from other places, its Arizmendi's fault. I make it a point to visit when I'm in the area!
author: Catherine S.

description:
On cold and rainy day like today, a slice of their crispy and crunchy mushroom, fennel and Parmesan pizza sure hit the spot.  And of course, for later, (like a few minutes later), a chocolate thing; it's long gone but not forgotten.  

I love this store's work collective effort, amazing pastries and tiny but laid back bakery.  After a day @ the DeYoung's flower show, this was a very affordable and tasty treat. Looks like they have a nice parklet in front, which is great to have more pedestrian friendly outdoor green space but maybe when it's drier and warmer.

5 pizzas stars!  Cash only.
author: Jen L.

description:
I believe after a few more trips here, it may be 5 star worthy.  But based on my first trip, it deserves a solid 4 stars.

My sis and I ordered a 14-in pizza $20.  Today's special was spinach and fennel pizza which had a great thin crust and cooked perfectly.  It only took 4 minutes to bake, since we took the option of having them bake it for us.

We also ordered an olive/cheese bread which was the best.  And I ordered caramelized onion and wilted arugula foccaccia  which I honestly didn't care too much for.  It had a lot of flavor, plenty of toppings which is actually layered UNDER the cheese!  Just not my favorite.

Overall, the place had a nice vibe, efficient service, and to me, a nice, yet limited assortment of baked goods.
author: Kimberly C.

description:
What's not to love? Pizza is great (and the toppings change daily), granola is to die for (my mom on the East Coast has me ship it to her), and everything else is incredible as well. Don't believe me? Try the pecan sticky buns. YUM.

I guess the only downside is that it's cash only. But it's part of the charm :)
author: Amy B.

description: Their focaccia is really good! It was $2/each and all the different types are on one tray. I didn't know that so I picked up the one behind the sign "olive focaccia" and the guy at the register told me I had grabbed their poppyseed one. He was kind enough to let me go back and exchange it. It's self serve so if you use the wax paper to grab it, it's okay. Today's focaccia was a little oily and a bit tough... I got it at 3pm, perhaps it wasn't fresh. I've had it in the past and it was better.
author: Emma H.

description:
Get a pizza slice or one of their scones for a bit of food heaven. :) nice staff too!

bring cash though! some locations only take cash.
author: Hello G.

description:
LOVE their cheese rolls!!!!! OMG! total orgasmic! 

All their pastries/bread have been yummy! Love the idea of the co-op and people there look and act like they love being there. Wonderful service and awesome food. 

I can eat ten of their cheese rolls in a roll and still crave more. Their cookies are to die for and their granola is addictive.

In fact... as I write.. I am already digging into my bag for another roll (that I had originally promised to save for my brother).  Oh well... he snooze he lose... LOL!
author: Mei C.

description:
OMG chocolate cake with salted caramel frosting...I hate you.  Omnomnomnom. :)  My sister and I split a slice...and there were still three bites left... Moist cake, with delicious sweet and a perfect touch of salt.  

Ohh, I never knew they were related to Cheeseboard...makes sense re pizza ravings. :)  I've got to try it sometime...

And next time, I'll try their brioche knot...and not be tempted by delicious evil cake...

Get yourself down there, armed with cash, and buy some dough! :)
author: Fannie S.

description: Solid coffee, Parmesan scones that taste like cheesy biscuits, pizza that changes daily and crispy English muffins that are great to buy in mass quantities..yum!
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
Just as good as everyone says!  This is a neighborhood bakery gem and a Sunset favorite.  We often go before the Farmer's Market Sunday morning and there is sure to be a cute pup tied up outside and fast-moving line that wraps around outside the store.

TO GET:
-THE PIZZA (It's not available until 11am but it changes toppings everyday--you can check the schedule online)
-The focaccia
-the fruit scones (flavors change but if they have pear do yourself a favor and buy)
-the corn/cherry scone (always available)
-the almond croissant
-the coffee
-the wolverine bread


TO SKIP: 
yep, haven't had anything bad there
author: Meg M.

description: I came for some pizza and coffee. Pizza, yes. Coffee, no. The pizza was good/fresh, but the coffee was bland/tasteless. It's pretty much like Cheeseboard in Berkeley where they make one type of pizza all day long so the lines will go quick since everyone is getting the same thing. But is it better than Cheeseboard? I don't think so. The pizza was pretty good and I wouldn't mind coming back sometime just to try another one of their recipes. However, I don't think this is really a "destination spot" and would only recommending coming if you're already in the area.
author: Marlon T.

description:
Those 5 stars are self explainitory. 

But if you're at all skeptical, walk by it one day. Anytime of day will work, as long as they're open. I promise you'll know exactly why I said that those 5 stars are self explainitory. Happy eating!
author: Emily D.

description: Came here with a friend and am so glad I did! It is simply fantastic. SO YUMMY. Had their slice of the day and a chocolate mint cookie--it was $5. What!? I would pay twice that for how good it was. I'll be back.
author: Sarah S.

description: my go-to place to get coffee and a muffin when i don't have time to make breakfast before work. LOVE the gluten free blueberry scone....omg. I think i just grabbed this without even looking bc there was a $10 minimum and had to pick some other stuff for coworkers. Nothing here is bad. You can walk in with your eyes closed and pick anything, and I'm sure you'd like it. Quality is great, staff is so sweet and seem to really enjoy their job. I will miss you Arizmendi's, as I am venturing to a different area of the city to work.
author: Bat V.

description: amazing pizzas!!! visiting from Phx, and highly recommend this restaurant. went twice in two days. they have different pizza specials everyday!
author: Tisha C.

description:
Their scones are legendary among Bay Area foodies, hipsters, soccer moms, rich and poor folk alike. Whatever kind of scone i get here, i will always know that it is high quality stuff that will satisfy my tastebuds everytime. 

Yes, parking can go suck a donkey around here, especially with the advent of sunday meters being activated. But, please do not let that deter you from stuffing your fat face full of scones until your tummy is the size of Moby Dick.
author: Jerry C.

description:
Thank you Arizmendi Bakery. You are what makes this city special.
Your pizza is soo darn good. Your oat scones are oh my gosh so tasty.
author: M E.

description:
Pros:

Crunchy pizza
Crunchy blueberry muffin rim

Cons:

Not that cheap 

******
Busy with customers. Pleasant area.
author: Kona B.

description: Pizza of the day was killer! Didn't get a chance to try any of the other baked goods but everyone seemed to be enjoying them--line out of the door!
author: Sharon P.

description:
This place is an original. I like the new outdoor seating design, very clever use of sidewalk space. Have not been to this place in a while. I had the olive focaccia role. Tasty, as I like olive loafs, etc. Yet the cornmeal used in the baking process was too gritty and not easy on the teeth. The pizza and other focaccia bread varieties looked delicious. I forgot that their menu changes frequently. And, one must be eager to try new items as the staff only bakes what they bake for that day. 

I want to go back in a few days because they will be serving fresh hot cross buns for Easter. 

Oh and their coffee is delicious, my cafe late was just right. Milk froth was thick and creamy. Yummy!
author: Jonathan F.

description:
I've only eaten here once and it still haunts me to this day. I still don't understand why I haven't gone back here. 

The pizza is phenomenal. I hear that they have something different everyday which I think is awesome. I haven't tried any of the other things (like I say, I've only been here once), but everything smells heavenly inside.

My only (very small) complaint? Seating isn't the greatest, especially when it gets crowded, which by then, you can forget about it.
author: Daniel K.

description: Always popping in when I'm around the area. I was never a really big fan of scones but I LOVE ALL OF THEM here. The cookies are really good too
author: Kieran B.

description:
I can only speak to their pizzas as I've never tried their bread and baked goods. The daily special changes (check website) but it is always vegetarian and it is always SO good! Sometimes it's a little on the oilier side but they put together these healthy recipes of ingredients I would never have thought to put into a veggie pizza and they make it work.

This is a co-op/worker-owned which warms my heart a little as I pay for my food. Everyone is super friendly and genuinely likes working there. One time, as I was buying a slice of pizza for a friend, the girl packed an additional smaller slice with it. Mmm... I am already craving for their pizza again!
author: Liana L.

description:
Love love this place.though the coffee was a bit weak today, I know that happens sometimes. 
My family and I went there this morning before our drive back to LA and was so happy. Maple orange scones, pecan rolls were top of my list. Focaccia made with corn meal was very interest and good.  A little more flavor would have been nice.
author: Tarit T.

description:
I love bread. Sweet bread, savory bread, sourdough, seedy, wheaty, fruity, buttery, yeasty, yummy yummy yummy! 

I've been meaning to visit Arizmendi for the past 3 years, but have been afraid to do so because of this passionate love of bread that I just mentioned. (It's so hard to say no to good bread...) But when a household need for pan de muerto (bread of the dead) arose at the end of last week, my visit could wait no longer. And oh, the wonders I found!

It is my understanding that Arizmendi has bread of the dead available on October 31, November 1, and November 2 each year in honor of Halloween and Díá de los Muertos. Their version is shaped like a little body, the dough flavored with candied orange and anise, sprinkled with a fine sugar. And oh, it is delicious! They make a limited quantity, so calling to reserve a loaf or two in advance is a good idea.

While picking up my bread of the dead, I couldn't help but also take home a "chocolate thing," a lightly sweet yeast roll with chocolate chips. It should have fed two people at tea time, but there was no one else home to wrestle it away from me. (I'm not complaining. Yum!) I so appreciate a bread that is not overly sugary or buttery, but rather has yeasty, toothy goodness...and chocolate. That combination is surprisingly hard to find!

Maybe my favorite thing about this bakery, aside from the obvious deliciousness, is the fact that the bakers are all making more breads right behind the counter while you stand in front of the cases of rolls, loaves, scones, and muffins. There is nothing about bread that I love more than seeing how it comes together at the hands of an expert. 

Cash only, and bring extra for the unexpected scones, pecan swirls, and baguettes that leap off the shelves and into your bread-lovin' arms. (And P.S., their lattes are quite good as well! Can't wait to try the pizzas sometime.)
author: Liz E.

description: Delightful place!! I highly recommend the chocolate croissants! Plus who doesn't want to make loaves, not war?!!
author: Kate S.

description:
Everything about Arizmendi is so amazing I'm not sure where to start.

Worker owned, always friendly, fair prices, fantastic selections that change every day... and everything, EVERYTHING, in this bakery tastes great. From their breadsticks to their slices of cake, I've never had anything here that I regretted buying. Their coffee cakes and scones do things to me that I don't even want to describe in public for fear it may ruin my future political career.

Their pizza deserves it's own paragraph because it is just that amazing... I'm a ridiculously picky eater, and yet I find myself eating things on Arizmendi's pizzas that I would never touch with a ten foot pole on other foods, it's just that good. Plus the crust is perfection, perfectly toasted with fresh olive oil, man I can't even,

All in all, Arizmendi was one of the main reasons I moved to Inner Sunset. No joke. And now that I am gone, I am left with only my fever dreams of this wondrous place, from which I wake every night screaming in pure agony of my loss.
author: Jenna I.

description:
Really i want to give it 4.5 stars, but that's not an option.

Anyway, good experiences at Arizmendi.  Very happy and friendly staff that sets the tone for relatively friendly customers.  I care about those things as I hate being served by people with bad attitudes and I also hate eating next to stuck up snobs.  I am a native San Franciscan--we value friendliness.

The pizza is is delish, although not necessarily my favorite.  I also think that the slice is too small.  I notice most people get 2 slices.  

I like the baked goods I've tried.  The chocolate cake was moist and delicious.  The blueberry corn muffins are my FAVE!!  The almost croissant tasted good and wasn't dry, but it was a bit too fat and hard for my taste.   Oops, that's what she said!!!  Haha!

In summary, great employee-owned bakery, highly recommended!
author: Kandi K.

description:
Arizmendi is pretty awesome.  It's a co-op, so the workers are all owners of the place.  I actually went on a tour of the "kitchen" once with a group of 3 year olds.  That was pretty cool.

It's always crowded when I walk by and it always smells delicious.  I love the corn blueberry muffin.  It's the yummiest.  I also like their mint chocolate chip cookie.  It's huge though, so don't expect to finish it all in one sitting.  Well, I can't anyway.

They're closed on Mondays, so don't bother stopping by.  Oh, and on Sundays, they also have a booth across the street at the Inner Sunset Farmers Market if you want to skip the lines.  They just have some of their baked goods, but I don't believe they have the pizzas.
author: Kris L.

description:
This place is amazing, definitely one of those hole in the wall places that probably the locals know about until the word got out. I only came here once, but I stocked up on everything that looked good (I ended up with a bag full of goodies and got a large pizza to share with 2 other guys).

Another plus to this place is they are environmentally friendly, they try to reuse their utensils and down to their take out pizza cartons. They encourage recycling so double "green" thumbs up!

For people who needs to eat a lot to get full, the portions they serve here is not for you since they serve vegetarian thin crust pizza (unless you get a whole pizza for yourself). They have different special toppings everyday of the week and each one of them looks, sound, and is delicious. Don't forget to check out their baked goods too, I recommend their scones and muffin, they are baked to perfection!

The only minor fallback is the lack of seating, very small space. But then again, I think it gives a great "where everybody knows your name" atmosphere surrounded by friendly faces. I will definitely come back as often as I can!
author: Elaine Y.

description:
5 STARS FOR THEIR DAILY PIZZA -- HANDS DOWN

My favorite is their shitake, button and portebello mushroom pizza with sesame-ginger-garlic vinagarette. UGH IT IS TO DIE FOR. My second favorite pizza is anything that comes with "basil pesto" that does not have goat cheese. I dispise goat cheese -- yuck.

BUT OH MAH GAWDDD ARIZMENDI PIZZA IS TO DIE FOR...!!

So for those who take the N to and from work, you knowww how difficult it is to wait for the N to come and frankly, it may never come. I always check their daily pizza menu on my phone going home and if it's one that I want to try, I hop off at 9th Ave. and get a slice or two. That's how much I looove their pizzas -- I'm willing to wait for another N to roll by (if it ever does) so I can get a slice or two of their pizza. For meat lovers, no pizza at Arizmendi has meat so SORRY! 

Btw, CASH ONLY.
author: Heidi C.

description: The people who work here are absolutely the best, and the pizza is just as fantastic. Cozy neighborhood vibe and warm fresh breads. One crazy woman made a scene because they don't let you pay with a credit card unless you spend more than $10, so fair warning. Overall, one of the best cafes/bakeries I've been to in SF. I would definitely stop by if you're in the area or make the .5 mile stroll from UCSF hospital.
author: Zoe J.

description:
This place is fantastic: all of the food is amazing, the staff is great, and the fact that it's a co-op is really cool. It seems like they use really good ingredients and take pride in producing an excellent product. I love how everything is so fresh and that the sweet items often incorporate seasonal fruit. I highly recommend this place over any of the other local bakeries. 

Favorites include: 
daily pizza selection 
foccacia
the "special scone" of the day (always delicious)
the coffee cake (usually incorporates seasonal fruit) 
basically all of the cookies but esp. ricciarelli, which you can't find everywhere
the chocolate cake (probably the best chocolate cake I've ever eaten)

There's seating inside and on the sidewalk in front, or you can take your treats to GG park just 1.5 blocks away.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: It's the Italian version of 85 degrees (or any of those self serve Chinese bakeries). very good breads, and VERY good pizza, just a tad bit too oily for my taste.
author: Janice L.

description: great pizza. fantastic bialii. The cookies were okay. Not the best.
author: Stan W.

description: It took me a long time to go back, but I still go to this Arizmendi on occasion  because i love their food AND most employee-owners are very nice. However the employee who I talked to after the experience always will try to bait me when I do come in. He makes snarky comments to me even though I have done nothing to bother anyone there. I now pretty much only go when my husband is with me. I just go and buy my scones or brioche knots or whatever. Dude, I like your food and I like most folks who work here so I'm going to keep buying your products.
author: Roberta D.

description:
AMAZING bakery. Everything you could want...scones, bread, pizza, muffins MMM. Usually Ill get a coffee and scone or some kind of breakfast item but it was a gorgeous sunny late morning so i decided to try their pizza for the first time. Button mushroom, pesto, and cheese. I usually hate mushrooms but this sounded too delicious to pass up. Pair it with a cold aranciata soda and prepare for the most delicious treat. 

CASH ONLY.
author: AL S.

description:
It is somewhat hard to find parking if you come during the weekends so try to take the bus there if you can!

Really, everything there is good. Bread is so fresh and the pizza focaccia is tasty.

If you love cheesey breads, go here!
author: Amy Y.

description:
On Yelp you'll find some places receive a ridiculous amount of reviews because they are truly truly delicious! Yelpers flock to these places, go home and write said ridiculous amounts of reviews, only to make that place even more popular. 

If you're looking for Ice Cream, a Yelper might tell you to visit Bi Rite. If you're looking for Fine Dining, a Yelper might suggest Gary Danko. If you're looking for a Bakery, chances are a Yelper would tell you about Arizmendi Bakery. Ya see, Arizmendi is kinda a big deal on Yelp...

Their baked goods are awesome, to say the least. Their pizza is unique and delicious. The frantic shuffle of bagging and weighing your items is enough to feel like your apart of a "locals only" operation. Arizmendi has all the right things, and deserves the praise. 

I suggest the cheese rolls, they're a hit with me. The pizzas are pretty bomb, too... served after 11:30 am. Go check this place out if you haven't already- Tell em' Yelp sent you.
author: Greg G.

description:
I think this place is purely AWESOME!!

For one thing, their a collective so everyone owns an equal share and their pizza's are very innovative and taste very similar to Cheeseboards in Berkeley (also a collective) 

Besides the daily pizza flavors, they also offer delicious pastries, scones, breads, teas and other specialty items. I noticed they had a Tres Leches dessert in their fridge and you absolutely HAVE to try their chocolate cake. It really IS that good! They also have a caramel version with sea salt, which I still have yet to try. The original chocolate though also seems to have a interesting subtle hint of saltiness to it in the aftertaste. I normally wouldn't like that but it does compliment the extreme richness and sweetness of the cake.

Arizmendi's is my new favorite hot spot to go to after work to relax and grab a unique slice of pizza with sourdough thin crispy crust. It also helps that I live in the Sunset now!

Bottom line: You're nuts if you haven't tried this place yet!!!

BTW..remember to bring CASH since their cash ONLY!
author: Petra S.

description: Delicious pizza for $2.50 a slice. I think they have different pizza everyday. I didn't try anything from the bakery so my review is just for the pizza.
author: Richie C.

description:
A friend told me about the "chocolate thing" and sparked my interest, I knew I had to try one for myself.  So one Sunday morning I dragged a friend to the Inner Sunset location.  Walking in I was overwhelmed with all of the amazing looking baked goods.  Somehow I ended up with a cheese roll, chocolate thing (brioche knot that is filled with chocolate), and a piece of mushroom focaccia.  Fortunately I was with others so I couldn't go too overboard...

I had the chocolate thing for breakfast and was quite satisfied.  Not the healthiest choice I've ever made, but quite tasty.  My friend had a strawberry and chocolate scone that was delicious (I may have stolen a bite).  The focaccia was absolutely amazing and more than enough for a meal.  

There is some seating outside, but it fills up quickly.  And remember to pick up cash before going in since they don't accept cards at this location.  I will definitely be returning!
author: Michelle K.

description:
I really like their gluten-free muffins. They're always moist and flavorful. This place is a good pit stop for those that are walking through the farmer's market on Sundays.

Note: cash only.
author: Jang K.

description:
If you're a carb lover, this place is your nirvana.

Had to stop in as I was running by the place when I got a whiff of delicious, yummy, freshly-baked bread. I doubled back very quickly and was greeted with a smile by the friendly staff behind the counter. I browsed around for a bit before selecting two different kinds of focaccia bread and a carrot muffin to go. 

The muffin was amazingly moist, hearty, and had some kind of fruit puree in the center aside from the generous chunks of grated carrot. It was enough to delude me into thinking I was eating something moderately healthy despite the fact that it was a muffin. Absolutely finger-licking good.

The foccaccia bread likewise did not disappoint. I had the mushroom and the asiago with Roma tomato. The cheese melted on the asiago focaccia was SO GOOD. Crispy cheesy goodness baked into chewy, doughy bread sprinkled generously with sea salt. I devoured that thing in a second and did not even feel a moment's remorse for completely blowing the calories I had just burned off from my run. Will definitely be back again soon!
author: Bianca P.

description:
Baguette, brie and coffee for breakfast.
Pizza and ginger soda for lunch.
annnd oatmeal cookies, shortbread, and breadsticks any time of the day.
Fabulous prices, local, and great staff/owners.
author: Maggie U.

description: Just amazing, great selection of scones, muffins, artisan breads, cookies and cakes. Simply delicious and so great to support a coop where everyone is an owner. I had the dried mushroom focaccia and it was so great!!!!!
author: Mindy F.

description:
WHYYYYYYYYYYY do you run out of pizza?!

:(

sadness
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Arizmendi Bakery: Holy Baked Goods + Cyclist Friendly

After every one of my longer training rides, I make it a point to stop by Arizmendi for a couple pieces of baked goods. Invariably, the day turns into a full Tour de Fat with my appetite and the delicious offerings that Arizmendi provides. Walking into this small, almost hole-in-the-wall establishment, you'll find three display cases full of goodies and tasty treats. The one on your immediate left is usually filled with savory goods and a random assortment of rolls. The one on your left as you enter more into the store usually has general breads that range from savory to sweet to "plain" (I only use plain for a lack of better flavor descriptions, but they're definitely far from plain). As you hit the display that faces the front of the bakery, you hit the motherload: all sorts of pastries ranging from scones to cookies to muffins.

My favorites from here must be the scones and focaccia. The scones are moist and decadent with a nice crunchy topping to contrast the soft and delicious bottom. Arizmehdi serves their scones in huge portions so one block is more than enough. Filled with items ranging from cherries to cranberries  to apples, these fruity scones will never disappoint. As for their focaccia, I never knew I could love such a simple piece so much. You'll forget all of your preconceived notions about focaccia after trying one from Arizmehdi: the bread is just perfect and the toppings aren't just relegated to merely sauce. You'll find items ranging from three kinds of mushrooms to caramelized onions to roasted garlic to homemade pesto on the ones served here.

An added bonus for me as well as other cyclists is the 10% discount for riding a bike. It may be harder to convince them without appropriate gear, but I always come in my kit so it's never an issue.
author: Frank Y.

description:
This bakery is great to go for a little snack. I have been to this bakery a couple times after eating lunch/dinner in the area. I wanted to get a cookie after dinner the other day but they closed at 6! so don't go too late! lol

They have great vegan cookies as well as vegan muffins!! They have different kinds of vegan muffins on different days. I happened to go when they had the lemon poppyseed muffin which was really good! I also had the vegan chocolate cookie... i forgot what it's exact name was. That was also really good!

Arizmendi should start making vegan pizza! =)
author: Anthony H.

description:
Yum! I love this bakery! My favorite items are:

- Scones (especially the berry ones); they aren't too dry, they have the perfect ratio of fruit to scone. 
- Chocolate things - I love the texture, and that they aren't too sweet for something chocolate
- Pumpkin muffins - so delicious, moist
- Cheese sticks - best to eat these fresh
- Pizza and foccacia - great flavors and options. Not overly cheesy, so you can really enjoy the fresh ingredients
author: Pam F.

description: I love this place.  They have a great combination of savory and sweet baked goods.  Arizmendi is a must anytime I am in the Inner Sunset.  I suppose my only complaint is the pigeons.  They have outdoor seating and it really bothers me when pigeons are around me, especially while I'm eating.  Also, you have to walk through a flock of pigeons to get to the bathroom in the back.  What can I say, I hate pigeons...but this has nothing to do with their product so it's still 5 stars in my opinion.
author: Shala M.

description: I would give this place five stars because the pizza was incredible, the guy behind the counter was charming, and the 'hood was vibrant, including the mini-"park" outside where you can eat. BUT - SOMEONE PLEASE CLEAN THIS PLACE. If I have to literally shovel other people's food particles off my seating area and chair, then you need to pay someone to clean so it does not feel like I'm eating your delicious food in a garbage can.
author: Morris R.

description: Hands down the best bakery in San Francisco! So happy to live close to them!
author: dub g.

description:
Great prices, and everything I've had here is delicious.  Their focaccia - the toppings are fabulous and the bread is this amazing combination of crunchy and pillow soft.  Very greasy - bring a plastic bag or you'll get grease stains on stuff.

Bought some gingerbread tonight (in a loaf pan).  Incredibly moist with a rich ginger flavor.
author: Alexandra D.

description:
This is the best bakery ever. I have absolutely no complaints. 
I have tried and love: lavender shortbread, brioche roll, various daily pizzas, fruit scone, foccacia. 
Everything tastes fresh and delicious, and the staff are sweet. 
The sunset location doesn't have much seating but it is one block from golden gate park.
This place is cheap too! Yeah!
author: Rachel G.

description: We were on vacation from Portland and I can't really think of a better way to experience baked goods in San Francisco. It's a co-op so I felt like I was participating in the community by coming here and everything we tasted was delicious. The pizza, the savory focaccia, the scone... All was amazing. My only sadness was that we only had the chance to visit once but the memory lives on!
author: Alyssa E.

description:
It's a really cute and nice place to go.

I've been there 3 times so far. First time, I got the a scone, and well I'm not really into scones. Oh well. Have to try something else I suppose. 

Next time I went, I got their pecan roll and DAMN, it's so sweet, but so amazing. It's like heaven in a bun. 

I went again today to try their pizzas because I thought a review for Arizmendi wouldn't be complete with trying their pizza and it definitely reminds me of Cheeseboard. It's a really nice slice, hot and delicious!

To be honest, I can't really judge the two unless they used the same ingredients, but I'll be back to get some more pizza! YUM.
author: Nina Y.

description: The chocolate thing is really good, they put a lot of chocolates inside, which makes suer every single bite has chocolate inside. And the scones are really tasty as well.
author: Sunny J.

description: Arizmendi I love you so much. Bakeries always make me sad because I can't eat gluten so I purposely stayed far, far away from Arizmendi. But recently I heard that they have gluten free goodies so I stopped in on Sunday and found that they have three AMAZING gluten-free choices: blueberry scones, brownies and ricciarelli. I've had all three now and they are the BEST gluten free pastries I've ever had. The best one is definitely the ricciarelli. I've been missing the almondly flavor of bear paws and this was perfect. I didn't have any reactions so for people who are gluten-intolerant - Arizmendi's is a-okay!
author: Alli Q.

description: The Focaccia they make with basil and cheese is so good, the veggie pizza is excellent as well. This is one of the best places to grab a slice, sit down and not to worry about a large bill coming at the end of the meal. One of the things I like a lot as well is that usually there is no wait here and I can eat fast when I am in a rush or when I do not feel like waiting for my food. I always live a happy and with a full stomach in less than forty minutes.
author: Jessica R.

description:
My sister introduced me to this place and I can't stay away!

Pros:
Everything is baked fresh and taste fresh and I have to roll my eyes each time I bite into anything they make there!
Daily scones are my favorite .... They are creative and will put different flavors together to combine an excitement for your taste buds.
Everything is organic!!!!
They trust their customers.....never experienced that in SF.
Granolas are so delightful but unfortunately not "light" in calories. 
Scones are so good we ship them to our friends and family that do not live here.  Or actually, they "ask" for us to send them!
I have never liked scones until I tried these scones.

Cons:
Closed on Mondays (but I understand).
Not enough seating area  (but I understand....I would stand just to taste their fine products). 
I have gained a few pounds from my visits. 
Breads are ok... I have had better bread from places at the Ferry Building.
author: mimi c.

description:
I used to have my hair done at Mary Anne's and then have a snack at Arizmendi.

But ever since I have heard about the unethical way they have gotten their new table and chairs in the street (called a "parklet"), I have stopped going.

Also, the staff is often arrogant -- especially the freakishly tall guy with the silver hair! 

I hear from Mary Anne that she had to fight the "parklet" at a hearing and that people were telling lies.

She and the other businesses seem very upset about this!

If you are a customer, please ask them to behave responsibly towards their neighbors!
author: George B.

description:
Ordered a full pizza (special of the day).  Delicious and affordable!  Cheeseboard-esque (but didn't quite reach the same peak).

The bread here is where it's all about.  Order the daily specials (pick up a menu so you know which ones to get).  Delicious.  I brought my girlfriend the chocolate raspberry sourdough, and she devoured it ;)

4**** + 1 for being a cooperative!  Definitely worth a trip ...

... every week.
author: Timothy Y.
