description: Tried the roasted Yukon Gold, roasted garlic, and basil pesto pizza here today. It was decently yummy and very flavorful! It was freshly baked, but a bit oily. I somehow secretly still like Cheeseboard pizza more.... But this is a close second! :)
author: Michelle L.

description: Oat scone is my favorite. Pizzas are good. Lots of selection and variety if you go early.
author: Carrie W.

description:
Everytime I walk in here, I feel like a cool hipster. I like their unique pizza's of the day (last time I had sweet potato something and it was a surprise in my mouth) and of course, the baked goods.

I'm a sucker for pecan rolls! I came in once before they closed to buy a pecan roll and the cashier asked if I was eating it for dinner or breakfast. Unashamed, I did eat it for dinner. Their pumpkin muffin is especially moist and has a surprise filing in the middle. (Maybe it was just mine which means I am super lucky!) When I bit into it, I felt like a fat kid long reunited with his cake. The blueberry scones are also mui excellente and you can taste the sugar they sprinkle on top. 

Breakfast, lunch, and dinner baby.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Best pizza in the city, bar none. Today was so good, I had to write it up. Tomatos, mushrooms, scallions, dubliner cheese and garlic oil...and yummy, yummy, yummy crust. 

Here's the thing: Arizmendi is 5 stars every day. Today it was way, way beyond that. 

And the employees/owners are awesome and friendly as well.
author: Ankur M.

description:
I went here TWICE today.

I rolled in at around 10am to grab a cappuccino and nibbled (or more like GORGED) on their tomato focaccia. While leisurely enjoying my late breakfast, I overheard a handful of customer inquire about their pizza. The cashier politely told each patron that pizza was served at 1130. I saw on the board that a marinated mushroom and spinach pizza would be served today and judging by the quality of their focaccia and coffee, made a mental note to come by later. 

430pm rolls around and even though I have already stuffed my belly full of Park Chow's lamb burger, I was still determined to try Arizmendi's pizza. (It's just down the street!)

Let me tell you, I finished that slice of mushroom spinach pizza in less than a minute and it was on a full stomach. I can only imagine what heavenly cheesy goodness can be on an empty stomach.

I can not wait to go back.

Oh, I think it should also be noted that the birds know how good the baked goods are and will snatch up any crumbs you drop!
author: Grace C.

description:
I heard about this joint on a yelp search for gluten free pastries.  Someone said it was always sold out early in the day for gluten free but they had everything in stock when I went there at one in the afternoon in a busy Sunday with the line out the door the whole time I was there. The pastries were, as reported, fabulous! The line goes very quick!

Totally coming back!  No parking so..you know what to do.  

As an aside, to the person who said ppl with gluten free eating restrictions are a pain in the ass...one day you'll have a health problem too and I hope you're prepared for people to make fun of you about it. :)
author: L. E.

description:
If I'm anywhere in the Sunset District of San Francisco in the morning, I make it a point to make a stop at Arizmendi Bakery. After my haircut on a recent Saturday morning, I lucked out on a parking spot (with a full meter!) across the street from Arizmendi. 

This must have been meant to be, because as soon as I entered the store, one of the staff was refilling the shelf with the cheese rolls and breadsticks. I grabbed a couple of bags, a tissue paper, then grabbed 4 cheese rolls and 4 breadsticks. The cheese rolls were so fresh out of the oven, that the cheese on top was still soft and stringy. The sourdough taste of the bread complimented the tangy cheese. 

The breadsticks, with the corn meal dusting, and rock salt topping were also fresh. There was a nice hard crust on the outside with a very soft and warm interior. 

A line to the cash register was starting grow out towards the door, and I hesitated in looking for more baked good to buy. The hesitation didn't last long, and grabbed another bag and tissue, and picked out 4 cherry-corn scones, and 4 blueberry and strawberry scones (special of the day). I especially love the cherry corn scones, made with dried red cherries, and with the grainy corn meal dough. All of the sweetness of the scone comes from the corn meal and the dried cherries. 

Before I arrive back home, one of the breadsticks and one of the cheese rolls didn't make it home.....they ended up in my stomach!
author: Steve L.

description:
5 STARS for The Bakery

- 2 STARS for Mr.Tall Guy sporting-goatee-you-are-so beneath-me-but i-guess-I-could wait-on-you. Dude-GET REAL!

I've been to Arizmendi maybe 300xs. I keep going back because they have the BEST chocolate cookies ever made. Because I LOVE their chocolate things. Because everything is flakey and lovely and beautiful. I do think their pizza is a little oily, but still yummy.

AWESOME PARKLET-- Thanks Adam!!!
author: Lisa C.

description:
oooooOOoOo I have a lifelong love affair with carbs and will NEVER EVER GIVE IT UP.

pizza? YES.

lemon poppyseed muffin? YES

CASH ONLY!!!!!!!! that's the only thing that bugs me. I rarely carry cash so it's hard for me to buy everything I want at once so stop by an ATM beforehand if you're a non cash carrier like me..
author: Susy C.

description:
BIg of fan of Arizmendi :D

I tried the Italian almond cookie, and i was absolutely AMAZED at how much I loved it. The inside was gooey, the outside was a little crispy and tasty, and the flavor was YUM!! I feel like it tasted more coconutty than anything, but that could just be my crap taste buds. Basically, I really liked their Italian almond cookie :D

I'll probably update my review once I try more things- I've only begun to scratch the surface of this bakery!
author: Jade R.

description:
Was passing by here with a friend and decided to stop by. I was very impressed by their selection of baked goods. A nice balance of savory, sweet, morning, afternoon or anytime treats. Everything looked really fresh too! I had some of their pizza of the day and a tasty looking baked good to-go for later. Everything was amazing. Service itself was great too! Friendly and informative staff. We wanted to try out their amazing looking pizza but due to my lactose intolerance I asked if they possibly had one without cheese on it. Since they are prebaked, that was not an option. However they chose a pizza pie with the least cheese on it for us. How kind! No tummy ache later so YAY :D

Their pizza was crispy thin crusted with the perfect amount of toppings. No slipping and sliding of toppings and cheese here. The pizza dough itself had a slightly sour flavor reminiscent of sourdough bread. I liked it. It's different. 

I'm definitely a fan and will be back again soon!
author: Tracy N.

description: Delicious homemade goodness. Be prepared for a line. Small place inside. Try the hot chocolate for a rich flavor. The pizza is delicious esp in the colder climates. Try the apricot cookie!! It's delicious and freshly baked. Friendly staff!
author: A K.

description: The line here is always crazy long, but don't be intimidated, it goes by pretty quickly. Service is awesome. Honestly, everything here is amazing, and not at all pricey! The bread is so soft and fluffy. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. All their baked goods look incredibly enticing, and taste just as delicious as they look! If you're a fan of Cheeseboard or fresh, warm baked goods in general, you'll love Arizmendi.
author: Rowena J.

description: Just eat the pizza. Game over. Sourdough crust, organic when possible, and great on the wallet for bootstrapped startups. All pastries are on point.
author: S Z.

description:
We decided we wanted to do a daytrip up to Tomales Bay to get some fresh, delicious oysters with some friends - so we started the day early and drove up to the city to meet up with them.  We, of course, had to stop for some breakfast, and decided to try out this bakery they recommended near their house.  

I totally went overboard there, and bought TONS of stuff.  I literally chose the largest bag they had and grabbed almost everything that I could with those tongs.  My favorite thing there was the blueberry corn bread, but everything I had there was good.

Downside was that it's cash only - luckily, I BARELY had enough cash to cover all of the baked goods I put in my bag.  I snacked on all of them throughout the day, and they were delicious.
author: Jenna L.

description:
It's funny when you come across a place you've never seen before and think "oh, this place seems kinda yelpy." Then you get to the front window and see a "People Love Us On Yelp" sticker in the window and find 917 reviews on the listing. That's when you know doesn't just seem kinda yelpy. It *IS* yelpy. Really, really yelpy. 

Now, what might ask: What does being yelpy mean? Well, it has varying definitions depending on the establishment, but in this case, it means being uber-local, so much so that it's employee-owned. It also means having bad-bum bakers making your goods and enticing edibles for the hoards of folks coming through your door to eat-not to mention wicked turn-around time for processing said hoards of folks to keep 'em happy. That's the magic sauce that is Arizmendi Bakery, and whatever goodness they put into their pecan rolls. That's gotta have some token of magic sauce in it too.

It seems their claim to fame is slices of pizza, which are, for the most part, pre-made and ready to grab from one of the bakery shelves by the front door, unless you want a 'slice of the day'. I didn't happen to grab myself some pizza this time around, but I could hear all the nomnom sounds of the people around me enjoying them. I made my nomnom sounds over that pecan roll. It's gotta be a might healthy than a cinnamon roll, right? I mean, it's got pecans after all....
author: Wendy P.

description:
You can find me at Arizmendi at least 4 days a week (and only because it is closed on Mondays). The aroma of delicious baked goods tempts me from a block away. Never have I ever been disappointed with Arizmendi. Ever.

My breakfast rotation consists of the scone of the day (especially if it has blueberries in it!), the brioche knot, and the corn blueberry muffin. Fresh with actual fruits in it? WHAT A NOVELTY!

I will see you there at 7:45am (but please don't stalk me) :)
author: Christine L.

description:
all that needs to be said about this place:

1. great service!
2. OM NOM NOM

seriously the best pizza, cookies, you name it- that i have ever had.
author: Katherine M.

description: The pizza here is good. I am a confirmed carnivore but even after eating a slice of their pizza, I can say I am not wishing there was meat on the slice. The crust is thin but crisp but there is still so tenderness to it. The toppings are all holding hands and singing kumbaya because they work together so well. The rolls and the focaccia here are pretty packed with flavor. I still love the focaccia at Liguria's Bakery but when I want a focaccia later in the day and served with a smile, I come here.
author: Eve C.

description:
Sometimes I think about when I'm going to leave San Francisco for good, what will I say is my favorite place in the city, and I'm certain my choice is going to be Arizmendi. The store is a little cramped, and it can get hellishly crowded in there and it could be really frustrating and I've waited in a line that's been out the door before on a Sunday morning because everyone just wanted to buy biscuits and all I wanted was 1 muffin. It was worth it. It's worth it every time and the line can move quickly, it just looks scary. 

Every single thing they make here is delicious. Like, "Screw you, how could you do this to me?!" delicious. 
I have to refrain myself from eating a pecan roll every single day. It's basically a giant cinnamon roll with raisins and pecans COVERED in caramelized sugar. It's the most amazing thing i've ever eaten. Pumpkin and Banana walnut muffin: A +. English muffin: Cheap and A+, all their cookies: A++. I just can't stop with this place. I'm addicted. I even bought a t-shirt. I wear it at night to revitalize me through my sleep so I can wake up and have the stomach room for coffee and a pecan roll the next morning. 
This is my favorite place in the city, i'll never forget it once I can't afford to stay here anymore and move to some boring city somewhere where there are no Arizmendi's.
author: Catface G.

description:
I just don't get the love people have for this place. 

Been here a few times now as it is near my favorite entrance to the park and I've never been impressed. Baked goods are ok and the cold pizza was ok. The $2 cookies aren't exactly a bargin but they are easy to pass up as they don't really look that good anyways. The spread out self service racks and coolers are pretty annoying as you can't really see the choices without pushing around a bunch of people. You can however watch the other customers rummarge around in the racks touching all the baked goods though which also isn't very appetizing. Add on some surly service at the register and I'm just not coming back here anymore.
author: Charlie S.

description:
PIZZA!!!
I don't even like mushrooms, but for some reason my favorite pizza there is the triple mushroom. It's unbelievable.
author: Laura K.

description:
Mmmm! When you walk in you can smell the fresh baked pastries and homemade daily pizzas. It's in the perfect part of town and close to Golden Gate Park. 
I'm in love.
author: Michelle A.

description: Today I went over and ordered a quick slice of pizza togo during my break. The pizza was hot, tasteful, and delicious! The slice was rather small for $2.75 but hey it was rather tasteful and delicious. The only downside was that the pizza was really greasy.
author: Amanda D.

description:
I've lived in SF for over 10 years, and this is the first time I walked into Arizmendi Bakery.  I have always heard good things about this place, now I know why.
I had the ginger pear scone.  Yum!  I don't even care for scones.  This one was crisp on the outside,and just the right amount of moist in the inside.  Not too sweet, can eat with jam or alone!  Will come and try the pizza next time as I saw several people eating it.
author: Ro R.

description: Freakin' delicious pizza...  The crust is perfect-- doughy and has a sourdough tang to it.  The toppings are fresh and interesting and perfectly paired.  It's awesome.  They have one pizza selection a day, $20 for a pizza, call to reserve in advance so you can be sure to get your pie, and they come half baked, so you choose when to have your steaming hot, delicious pizza in the comfort of your home.  We live in San Mateo, but it's worth the trip to get an Arizmendi pizza or to pick one up whenever we are up in the city!  Just as a heads up, most of the pizzas are not made with tomato sauce, so don't be surprised.  However, this is the best news for a pregnant woman who is obsessed with pizza, but has terrible heartburn from tomatoes (me).  They post their daily pizzas online so you can see in advance what is on the menu (they post the entire month's menu if you are a planner :)).
author: Alison S.

description: Always on point. Fresh muffins, breads, pizza, scones, cookies, cake. You name it, a neighborhood resource worth supporting.
author: S S.

description: A plethora of tasty baked goods - cookies, coffee cakes, rolls and breads.  But the highlight (for me at least) is the vegetarian pizza (daily) that  is fresh and so far from boring (surprising ingredients).  Incredibly tasty every single time!  Oh, and it's a cooperative, which I respect. :-) Minor deduction because the workers aren't the friendliest (not mean, just straightforward) & because I have never been able to find a seat outside - it's not always fun (rain) to walk to the park.
author: Gev M.

description:
I used to go to the one in Emeryville, so I was happy to see this one in San Francisco where I live one day walking in the Inner Sunset.  So, I finally made it there for lunch, and I had a slice of pizza -- mm, I was giddy from the goodness of the ingredients: artichoke hearts, marinated mushrooms, parsley and more - awww!  :)  I was smiling from ear to ear!  

I also bought some baked goods to take home:  bagel pieces, chocolate thing and a chocolate chip cookie.  I'm sure everyone on the N line ride home was sniffing up the baked yumminess in my bag!  Plus, I got a mocha w/ soy to go!  Awwww!  :)  I will definitely definitely be back!!
author: Maile N.

description:
I've been to this bakery a few times before but my most recent visit was the best. We ordered the pecan roll and the blueberry cranberry coffee cake. Both were DELICIOUS!!!!

The pecan roll was sweet but not super sweet, the pecans were fresh, and the roll was soft!

The coffee cake was layered with tons of blueberries and cranberries topped with crunchy buttery oatmeal crumble. Soooooooo good!

Service was fast and friendly and prices were good! Parking in this area is difficult but extremely close to the N Judah line.
author: Janet E.

description:
For full review with embedded pics see Blog

The interview day was half over at 11:15 and the tram to the VA was scheduled to leave at 12:05 - plenty of time to run the three blocks (this time in dress shoes) to Arizmendi Bakery - having missed The Cheeseboard on my trip to Berkeley and reading about the small worker-owned co-op with their amazing pizzas, morning pastries, and artisan breads I knew that the experience would be worth the walk.  Walking past the small craigslist.org building I had to chuckle at the neighborhood and at first I actually walked past Arizmendi despite its rather obvious sign.  Entering the doors I was instantly greeted by the smells of yeast, sugar, and garlic and wondered how I managed to walk past given the large crowd waiting inside.

Browsing the myriad selections I must admit that everything looked good, but knowing my foodie agenda for the day was to be pretty gluttonous I promised to reserve myself to one savory and one sweet.  Watching the numerous bakers toss pizza crusts in the back while others rolled out dough and brought out warm baked goods from the back to reload the quickly diminishing supply the first item that caught my eye was the fresh/piping hot Forcaccia with Roasted Garlic Sauce and Cheese.  Charged on a "per pound" basis, the single slice cost $4.40 and weighed in at a hefty 11oz - an 11oz that I greedily inhaled on my walk back to the bus.  Creamy Mozzarella, wonderfully ripe tomatoes, and whole cloves of whole roasted garlic - Amazing and filling...and thank goodness I had a pack of Orbit Sweet Mint with me since I had more interviews to go!

For my sweet, the brioche knots and Wolverines originally caught my eye but my love of cornbread quickly won out when I saw the words cornbread and scone in the same sentence...along with the word cherry.  Cherry Cornbread Scone - done deal!  Sweet yet hearty, soft yet with that characteristic cornbread texture, a bright balance of the lightness of a scone with the density of a cornbread - all enhanced with wonderfully tart black cherries.  Hands down the best "designer" cornbread I've ever tasted - and a better "dessert cornbread" than the pseudo-famous Cornbread dessert at Symon's Lola.

Friendly (and clever) servers poked fun at my photo taking, but not in an obnoxious way - one even offered to take a picture of me with my pizza (I should have accepted) and prices were a bargain for the quality.  While I will admit that the cash only policy ended up costing me $30 the next day when I didn't have cash to pay the "toll" to Napa (What an asinine rule that is - who carries cash??) I certainly can't fault Arizmendi for that - I only wish I could've spent that $30 on some more of their baked goods!
author: Michael U.

description: Become my fav pizza place since the first time I visited..fresh and crispy...Sooo yummy...They make different flavor of pizza everyday aswell
author: Nga N.

description: Arizmendi reminds me of little neighborhood bakery that that all the locals go to for their baked good. The employees are friendly and the goods, at the focaccia, are excellent. I went here for stop number 3 on my individual grub crawl through SF and was looking to pick up some focaccia to take home with me. I was a little disappointed when there were only two chunks left in their bin, but tossed them in my bag and got in line to check out. The employee at the counter told me some more was coming out of the oven in 10-15 minutes and told him as much as I would've liked to wait I was on a strict schedule and had to leave. I'm not sure where he grabbed them from but he reached behind the counter and threw in two more chunks of focaccia and let me know one of them was on the house. Acts like this will have me going out of my way to come back to this place. Once I got home I put the focaccia in a nonstick pan and toasted the bottom of it for about 5 minutes. It tasted almost fresh out of the oven. Areizmendi is 100% worthy of their yelp reputation and great reviews. I will be making a special trip back to try their other goods.
author: David L.

description: Maybe good for the area but not in comparison to real bakerys. Reasonably small selection. Nothing special.
author: Billy A.

description: Do you like dry, dense scones? Me neither! This place gets them right everytime! Also applies to their pumpkin muffin and lemon poppy one too. Such a great place to get a little treat after a long shift at the hospital. Thanks Arizmendi!
author: Ria V.

description: Ricciarellis are amazing. Make sure to leave one for me :-) Also, I want house made tomato sauce every day, but I'd settle for just 2-3 times a week.
author: Benjamin R.

description: Tons of great baked goods here.  The sweet pecan roll is a very good pastry and the cookies pretty good.  The main reason I come here though is for the pizza.  It's delicious and comparable to The Cheeseboard Pizza Collective in Berkeley.  Like Cheeseboard the pizza menu changes daily and they only make one kind of pizza each day.  In my opinion Cheeseboard still tops the charts, but Arizmendi is the next best thing when I have a hankering for some tasty artisan gourmet vegetarian pizza with a sourdough crust and when I don't feel like crossing the bridge to visit my old college stomping grounds in Berkeley.  4.5 stars.
author: Erich D.

description:
This bakery has been around for as long as I can remember but I'm shooting myself in the foot for not trying it sooner. Even my dad has been here before! The bf and I visited for the first time a few weeks ago to grab some goodies for breakfast before heading over to the Alemany Farmer's Market. I grabbed a raspberry and rhubarb scone and he grabbed a slice of coffee cake. The scone was moist and tart with the perfect amount of sweetness on top. The coffee cake was sweet and paired well with the coffee we grabbed at Drip'd across the street. 
     We returned again today to grab a quick bite for lunch. He got me a slice of the pizza of the day which was tomato, feta, garlic oil, parsley and onion and he grabbed a slice of the foccacia with roasted potato, onion and mushrooms. Both items were tasty and fresh out of the oven. The pizza had a nice bite to the crust. The foccacia had a slight sourdough taste to it which was nice. I can't wait to come back and try more items because everything has been amazing so far.
author: Sarah L.

description:
Get here at 7AM, when everything is hot out of the oven!

Best items: pecan roll, corn cherry scone, and the "chocolate thing", which is both fluffy and chewy at the same time. (see my photos)

Their espresso is top notch: it has a creamy smoothness, with a strong note of chocolate; makes a great macchiato.

Items to skip: English muffins (too chewy/dense), cheese roll (hard as a rock).  The brioche knot is ho-hum.

The focaccia is a disappointment, because they don't use focaccia dough: they use the same "bread roll" chewy dough that they use for everything else.
author: Scott F.

description: Great scones and pizza for a quick snack if you're in the area. Everything baked looked absolutely delicious, especially since they bake everything in-house. Minus 1 star for poor service. We were kicked out in a rude way the minute they closed, instead of politely being asked to leave.
author: Karina L.

description:
Amazing baked goods!

Nothing beats coming off a 12hr night shift than to be greeted with still HOT coffee cake!  The fruit makes it so moist!
author: Leilani I.

description: Great selection of savory and sweet baked goods. Pizzas are so fresh and crispy.
author: Melanie H.

description: Fantastic. One of my favorite Arizmendi's. I'm still prowling for berry "slippers" that they used to make that were out of this world. But, get absolutely anything - you really cannot go wrong. And I say this as a former professional baker.
author: Marco M.

description:
I go back to this place and get pastries for my family (to go) whenever I visit SF (and eat a slice of pizza of course).

Their pizzas are delicious. They have one selection of pizza per day. The pizzas seem pre-made but every time I buy a slice, it's warm and the crust is crispy. Yum....

Also, their muffins are awesome! They are not too sweet. My favorites are carrot, lemon poppy seed (very fragrant), and one muffin I had with apples in it. 

I've had the blueberry scone and it was not sweet and not dry. It was buttery and good. I didn't like their oat scone too much though. 

The white cookie balls (I forgot what they are called) and sweet and melts in your mouth. 

There aren't many places to sit and eat though. 

I would give this place a 4.5 if I could but I rounded up. ^^. Definitely try this place out.
author: Kimberly G.

description:
I know a lot of people love this place but I definitely had better. I got a slice of pizza and a cheese role and was not impressed. I know their pizza is suppose to be really unique and fresh but it was so small and kind of bland. The cheese role was not that great either because it was a little hard and they wouldn't heat it up for me. 

If you like places like this, you should try cheeseboard in berkeley. It may be worth the drive.
author: Pin X.

description:
Super meh. They only take cash for charges under $10 (what is this, 1999?), and the cheese roll I brought home to the dude was tough to eat by the time he got it.

The almond cookie (with some snooty name) was really, really tasty.

If their stuff were fresher and they had Square, I'd go back.
author: C S.

description:
Note to self: 

The currant scones here are so yummy! Plenty of currants and buttery but not too dry.

I usually love the creamed current scones from Peets but this type of scone at Arizemendi is now my favorite!  Thanks Denise for buying me one!
author: Jboogie L.

description: Love this place!! A great local bakery with always fresh goods in the morning and different pizzas throughout the week so you can get a different thing every day. I love their focaccia and the breakfast rolls the cheese rolls.  It's been around for almost over 15 years so they must be doing something right and our neighborhood loves it and people still come back.
author: Nadia N.

description:
Me: "Hey mom, I'm heading out!"
Mom: "To where?"
Me: "To Arizmendi Bakery on 9th!"
Mom: "For what?"
Me: "A scone."
Mom: "You're going all the way over there for a scone?"

*30 mins later...*

Me: "Mom! I'm back! You wanna try some of this scone?"
Mom: "Really? Sure! Here, let me try. Oh...WOW! This scone is amazing!" 
Me: "Hey mom...?"
Mom: "Yes?"
Me: "Can I have my scone back now?"
author: Stephen C.

description: This is my favorite bakery in the Sunset. It takes a lot of willpower not to walk in every time I pass by and buy a cookie, or 4...  All the ones I've tried are really good, esp the almond, and chocolate mint! I also love their focaccia breads, enough to walk down from work just to buy one for lunch. So good, esp if you warm them up!I have yet to try their scones and muffins because I always let guilt prevent me from doing so, but I definitely will one of these days. I'm sure they're just as delicious as anything else they have.
author: Stephanie G.

description: I hadn't been in a while and was visiting some friends and letting them sleep while I took their 6 month old on a walk to get some pastries.  I was so excited that they had gluten free items that I could eat.  I got a blueberry scone and a carrot muffin.  The carrot muffin was my favorite but both were the best gluten free pastries I had ever had.  I am definitely stocking up on my next visit.
author: Liz C.

description:
Coming to Arizmendi is like some sort of cruel test. As soon as you step in, you're greeted by mounds of delicious breads and sweets, and it's only natural to want to start grabbing one of everything. Just remember: They're testing you. You can take one -- mayyybe two -- of those fluffy focaccia breads or gigantic warm scones or freshly baked cookies, but don't forget about your primary objective: the PIZZA. They make only one kind each day, but rest assured, whatever it is, it's going to be deeeelicious! Everything here is good, but the pizza is truly memorable.

For those who are even moderately capsaicin-sensitive, stay away from anything with jalapeno here lest you want to douse your tongue in gasoline and set it on fire! The tomato/jalapeno focaccia definitely delivers more heat than I think most of us are ordinarily used to getting from a jalapeno these days. Spiciness aside, it lacks sufficient flavor to be thoroughly enjoyed on its own, but would be a nice accompaniment to a soup or salad. The caramelized onion and goat cheese focaccia was tasty, although a bit light on the cheese. 

Love the cute, warm interior and friendly service. Be warned, this place is cash only!
author: Pauline D.

description:
UH OH, I'm in trouble.
Mint Chocolate Chip cookie is VEGAN and freaking delicious and it's two doors down from my work! I think I've gotten it a few times this week already. $2 for a huge cookie.
I also get City Sourdough bread. It's good but gets hard pretty fast. $3 a pound.
author: Justine L.

description:
Great Bakery.

Co-Op (support your locals + give back to the community)
Fresh ingredients
Delicious Pizza & Baked Goods.
Cheap
If you like Cheeseboard in Berkeley, similar style think of it as the SF version. 

I tried the cinnamon roll. A chocolate chip cookie and some other goodies.

Recommend:

- The Pizza ( thin crust, fresh veggies, perfect balance of sauce) 
* The selection varies every day so make sure you check what they are offering (for the daily pizza flavors 2-3 a day, and the baked goods. 

- Blueberry corn muffins: blueberry heaven in your mouth
author: Justin R.

description: One of my favourite bakeries. Love the pizza and the carrot muffins.... Love the crunchy sourdough baguettes. I will always go back to Arizmendi.
author: Yan P.

description: Try the chocolate mint cookies and croissant . There are delicious. Coffee is also good, they will make cappuccino by whole milk so if you want half&half or non fat milk, you should ask them.
author: Angie N.

description:
Today I happily stumbled in here to find it's a sister company to The Cheeseboard in Berkeley! I haven't lived in the East Bay for a few years now and the biggest complaint I had about my move out and into the city was that I had to give up my favorite bakery... BUT NOT ANYMORE! Thanks Arizmendi!

Try a Wolverine roll for a little piece of perfection. A bigger-than-fist sized sourdough roll densely packed with pecans, golden raisins, dried cherries, and dried apricots. And they're vegan! Yay!! So everyone can enjoy!

They have great daily pizzas that you'll absolutely drool over. Or if you wanna quick grab-n-go that's pizza-like, there are pre-made bialys (awesome rolls topped with onions and poppyseeds) or ever-changing focaccia breads with absolutely delicious toppings.

It's also a worker-owned business, so you'll feel happy in your tummy AND your heart after getting your breads and yummies here.
author: Cara T.

description: Good Bakery!  I love that this place is the neighborhood's local business.  Very fresh!  Don't get to go here to often, trying to cut out some carbs :)
author: Julie K.

description:
Great place to go after a visit of Golden Gate Park and the museum
Their pizza is fresh and delicious
So are the deserts with many gluten free of vegan options
Staff is very friendly
It has to be a nice day though as seating inside is very scarce
Definitely recommend it for a lite bite
author: Joanna B.

description:
as always...  the best...

such great service, tasty breads and treats, and even good coffee.

keeps me coming back.
author: William G.

description: This is a short review, I'll get right to it. Tried and true: Focaccia pizza bread = amazing. Generous pieces for almost 6 dollars (1 lb, goes by weight) Friendly staff. If I worked in the city, I would come here on lazy Sundays!
author: Ally W.

description:
I used to work up in UCSF so let me use my experience to help you out with this bakery...
What should I get here? Scones.
What kind of scones? Any of them. They're all delicious. In fact, do what I do when I can't decide and get all of them.
author: Lena N.

description:
I was doing some roadwork around the Sunset area and I landed at Arizmendi for lunch. For a guy who infrequently come to the Sunset District, I was amazed by the possible dining places I can choose. 

("Obviously, Matt don't go out often!") 

"Well, some people like myself do have a busy schedule...you know." 

MMMM...you can smell each baked item being baked from blocks away. Every pastry item is baked fresh from the freshest organic ingredients. With the "cold" Sunday Morning and the oven continuously going, the bakery does feel very warm and comforting. 

The bakery is also best known for their pizzas, but I'm not a pizza-enthusiast. But upon my arrival, the lady just put out a pan of Vegetarian Foccacia slices. For $5.25 per pound, the thick and bulky slice has slices of mushrooms, onions, bell-peppers and olives on top of a sourdough flatbread. The slices were very warm and ready to eat. One bite of that Foccacia slices makes me consider to eat pizza again. The two fat slices of Foccasia totalled to nearly $7.00, but worth the prices. 

From my visit, I paid cash; assumingly that is all the bakery accepts. With great tasting and fresh pastries and other baked goods including what I bought, I see why, this bakery is a favorite of Yelp and one of the hottest businesses.
author: Matt G.

description: Their scones are one of the best I've had. And the pizza I ordered (shiitake, portobello and button mushrooms, sesame-ginger-garlic vinaigrette) is unique and has intense flavors. It's one of my favorite places to go when I'm in the area.
author: Calvin L.

description: I'm moving to the Inner Sunset in 2 weeks and I don't think my taste buds have ever been so excited for a move (and my waist line so terrified). Arizmendi is definitely a reason for that excitement. I had their mushroom pizza with a soy-ginger glaze on top that changed my perception of what a pizza could be. The slices came right out of the oven and went right into my belly. The mushrooms were varied, crust was delicious but also unique and the glaze sent it over the edge of amazing-ness!! The only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars is because there is a $10 card minimum, so if you're just ordering a slice, make sure to bring cash. Good news is there's a BofA ATM on the corner so you'll hopefully never have to leave hungry!
author: Emily K.

description:
I will do anything I have to in order to eat another corn and cherry scone from Arizmendi Bakery. They are so good it's scary. 

But there is a problem. The tiny, front portion of the store, where the bins are placed, the incoming folks form their queue, and the tables are filled with satisfied customers is a major bummer. It's stuffy. But not just any stuffy. It's stultifying stuffy. It's the dizzying kind of stuffy, where ovens hard at work emit oppressive heat, lots of people mill about in a very small space that has the feel of a rugby scrum, and pungent, scented waves of air hover menacingly, as if they're out to bake you! Combined with the lack of any meaningful ventilation, the effect borders on suffocation. Such is the miasma that greets those who step into this cauldron; you've really got to want it! 

Arizmendi is in dire need of an overhead fan, or softer lighting, or some combination of modifications that will make this area more comfortable. I'll even settle for tolerable. Until they do, however, wear a t-shirt, flip flops and shorts when you come here.

Otherwise, Arizmendi Bakery is outstanding.
author: Michael J.

description: To die for pastries. Cash only. I'm not sure how they do it, but its amazing.
author: Pratima M.

description:
This place is so insanely delicious. I'm super sad I am not working in this neighborhood anymore as it was my favorite breakfast spot.

For just a few bucks (cash only) you can get some really great treats. Their focaccia is AMAZING. And so is the pizza. Their staff is super super friendly and they are even trying to make the outdoor seating better. 

Tasty tasty treats!
author: Jess T.

description: Love this bakery.  They have delicious breads and yummy cookies.  What I love best is their daily pizzas.  They only have one type of pizza (always vegetarian) and it's amazing.  You can feel the freshness of the ingredients and each slice packs tons of flavor.  There's always a crowd around this place and they don't have a lit of seating so expect to stand.  A lot of times they'll have pizzas with toppings I'm not a huge fan of (kale, spinach, goat cheese) but those same pizzas are often the ones that become my favorite!  They really do an amazing job.  Highly recommend.
author: S G.

description: Do eat their daily Pizza and the Heavenly Scone. Simply out of this world. The pastry not only taste good, it also smell good. Do breath in/out when you eat to enhance the aroma.
author: Dui N.

description: Love this place! Lines stretch out the door regularly. Stop by early before the good stuff goes.  Cookies and scones are great. Pizza is too. They also have some vegan and gluten free items. Come and support a local business. It's worth it. Make loaves, not war.
author: Brian C.

description:
The pizza is wonderful and worth more than $2.50 per slice.  They only have one flavor per day and the  flavors are always inventive  - my two recent favorites included sweet potato with sage and goat cheese, pesto, mushroom!  I love how when they cut the slices they'll give you a mini slice on top of your slice.  

The breads I've tried have also been really yummy.
author: Elana R.

description: I've never tried all the breads and pastries here but the pizza is to die for!!  Always extremely fresh and hot, using natural ingredients.  You don't select your toppings like most pizza places, they have one set of vegetarian toppings for the day and they're always amazing!
author: Ubz D.

description: Superlative baked goods. Outstanding, innovative pizza. Is their pizza the best in the city? Not in my opinion. However, it's incredible and usually fun. I'd say it's the best pizza made by a bakery in SF.
author: Michael S.

description:
Oh man. The pizza here is heavenly. Grab a slice of pizza ($2) and it'll sure put a smile on your face.

On the day I came in for lunch, the special was roasted yukon gold potatoes and basil pesto pizza. One word: divine.
author: Annie S.

description: This is such a great spot.  Local ingredients, worker owned.  Amazing focaccia and pizza in particular.  I hope this is the future of all businesses.  No corporate fat cats here!!
author: Jon I.

description: Love this bakery and its wonderful baked goods made with quality ingredients.  Delicious breads and cookies.  One of my favorites was the corn blueberry muffin at a time when I could eat gluten.  My main objection and frustration with this Arizmendi is the extremely limited selection of gluten free items.  They are always the same.  They offer only ONE type of scone.  They do have a selection of 2 muffins (carrot, pumpkin (excellent).  That's it.  I am gluten free thus this is frustrating.  And no gluten free bread.  I have voiced my opinion more than once with no results.  The Valencia bakery offers way more.
author: Dina L.

description:
Nom nom nom. I had a few bites of my SO's pizza and it was yummmmy. Arizmendi is apparently a sister store (or whatever you call it) of Cheeseboard, and like Cheeseboard, there is only one type of pizza per day. Not sure if it's always Vegetarian, but it is similarly thin crust. The slice wasn't very big ($2-3/slice), but was quite tasty.

It's also nice to be able to fill up on the other goodies at Arizmendi. We got a breadstick after (it was okay), and took home two delicious focaccia breads. One was pesto and tomato and the other was topped with lots of spinach and artichoke hearts. They tasted delicious warmed up at home.
author: K W.

description:
This place has the best scones I have ever tasted in my life.  It's fair to say that Arizmendi has created a new category of scone --comparing Ariizmendi scones to any other scone is not an apples to apples comparison, they are that good.   If you only get one thing from Arizmendi, make it the currant scone.  Incredible.

I'm knocking one star off my review for one reason and one reason only: NO CREDIT CARDS ACCEPTED.

Many smaller, employee-owned businesses are starting to accept credit cards via new methods like SQUARE (where you swipe your card across the store's iPad to pay).  

If Arizmendi took credit cards, I would be there more often and would buy a larger variety of stuff.  I can't tell you how many times I've walked by, scratched for cash in my pocket, shrugged, and moved on.
author: Dan H.

description:
I absolutely love this place for a couple of things: pizza (changes every day, interesting toppings, great chewy sourdough crust), chocolate things (huge chocolate chunks, slightly sweet dense bread), cheese rolls (very chewy, great cheese) and focaccia (the varieties they make change often).  The coffee is good too.    

It's always crowded here because everything they make is really good (though I tend to stick with my favorites because those are the things I like best).  The chocolate things are my favorite - a must try.  It's also nice that you can serve yourself vs. wait around and have someone get you what you want.  

They make cookies, coffee cake with fresh fruit, scones, granola and tea bread.  Check out the refrigerated case of artisanal cheeses.  

 The pizza toppings are simple , fresh and flavorful.  They don't overload their pizza with toppings.  My mouth is watering as I think of their pizza with "roasted eggplant, ricotta cheese, garlic oil, fresh basil" or "shiitake, portobello and button mushrooms, sesame-ginger-garlic vinaigrette."  It doesn't take much to make a great pizza.  You can buy it by the slice ($2) or take home a whole pizza.

Check out the bread schedule and the updated pizza schedule on their website: http://www.arizmendibakery.org/bread

Pick up a chocolate thing and a drink and then stroll over to Golden Gate Park to enjoy them.  They do have some seating but it's limited and the long lines make the place feel very cramped.

UPDATE:  They now have two kinds of basic cupcakes ($2.75).  I had the vanilla cake with vanilla frosting.  The cake was good and fresh but pretty dry.  The frosting is thick and on the harder side and sugary.  I wasn't too impressed but it's good to see cupcakes everywhere.
author: Lolia S.

description:
Cute and yummy little bakery with some indoor and outdoor seating. My favorites:

Mint Chocolate Chip Cookie (vegan)
Chocolate Cake with Salted Caramel Frosting
Foccacia
Chai Latte

Their Chocolate Thing and Pecan Rolls are also good.
author: Jen S.

description: This place is great!  I love stopping by for a slice of pizza with arugula, delicious cheese and a thin sourdough crust which is at the same time chewy and crispy.  Any of the coffee cake I've ever had there was delightful.  From savory to sweet, it will have you covered.  If you're ever in the Inner Sunset, don't miss giving this worker-owned bakery a visit.
author: Claus C.

description: Bread bread bread bread.... HEAVEN! Stopped for A few breadsticks and some pastries to take in GG park, and YUM! Hit the spot!! A great grab and go spot!!
author: stacey S.

description: One of the best cookies I have ever eaten that will leave you with sweet chocolate dreams! Even my non-vegan friends said so. Get the Vegan Mint Chocolate Chip Cookie! Two dollars make you holler! :)
author: Tina B.

description:
I don't worship this place like my roommate but it is pretty damn good. Their fresh pizza is gourmet and tasty, their bialy tomato things are good, although they dont really taste like a bialy. I also love their vegan mint chip cookie. Yum!
I wish they had some non-sourdough bread options as well but I guess that's their thing. It's pretty crazy in here as far as tiny space and elbows trying to grab stuff as soon as you open the door so its much more of a to-go spot.
author: Lainy C.

description:
Not only does Arizmendi have bangin' baked goods, but they're an effing awesome collective.  Folks who work there own the place and make decisions collectively.  Yes, I am a total geek: democratically-operated businesses get me all worked up and I will NOT apologize!

Excellent pizza-by-the-slice, with interesting topping combos, like Asian-style shiitake sesame.

Quality bread, with a nice selection of accompanying treats like local cheeses.  

Interesting sweet treats, especially the cherry-cornbread scones and lavender or cardamom shortbreads.

The Mission location would be perfect--if it had some outdoor seating.
author: X-topher B.

description:
This place is amazing. I love and hate the fact that I live so close to it as every time I go by I have to force myself not to stop for a pecan roll. Their Pizza is always amazing, Pecan Rolls are a must try, Apricot Almond Cookies are delicious, and the Baguettes are super solid.

The people that work there are always super nice and friendly too despite the hoards of customers consistently pouring in. Wish this place had a Tip Jar.

Price might be considered on the bit higher side but you get what you pay for. Great ingredients, fresh, and delicious. If you ride a bike in they give you a 10% discount too which is awesome.

My only complaint is that they are closed on Mondays which is one of my days off and I am always disappointed when I get psyched up for a pecan roll and they are closed. They also are Cash only but there is every bank you can think of a block away. 

If you haven't eaten here, get on it.
author: Hawk S.

description: Well I brought some sour dough, currant scones, some blueberry coffee  cakes to say the least. Again it was crowded. Had a nice chat with some of the people in line.
author: Victor J.

description: Love the bread an pastries hate the confused bumbling with other customers when there is a line. Eat the cheese rolls when they are hot and try everything else once. The scones have gone downhill though hardly any fruit and dry used to love them.
author: Kalie J.

description:
What a great place to have an afternoon snack or a quick lunch. ALSO they have a very clean restroom in the back which is almost 5-star worthy. I only witheld one star because the grease that stains the paper bag regardless of what pastry you get gives me anxiety that the contents of my purse will get greasy too. 

One pizza flavor each day and I'm pretty sure this is displayed on their website so you can come on days that appeal to you moreso than others. Frequenters of Cheeseboard in Berkeley will be familiar with this setup.

They have a plethora of savory and sweet baked goods that come in a variety of shapes and sizes. I never get the savory ones so I have little to say about them. I could go on forever about the sweets though! 

The cornmeal scone is a must-try. It sounded a little strange to me at first, but is unique and satisfying. The only problem is that it is a lot more crumbly than normal flour scones so beware of where you decide to devour this little ball of buttery goodness. On any given day there are at least 3 scone selections to choose from.

I recently had the corn blueberry muffin which was excellent! I'm often wary about blueberry muffins because they tend to be way too greasy or sweet but this one had achieved the perfect balance of flavors and textures. I especially enjoyed the cornmeal element. Alas it still left some nasty grease spots in my brown bag. Other muffins are good too and there are usually a few options for you. 

The cookies are also delicious. They usually have the basic flavors although my favorite here has been the double chocolate chip mint or something like that. There is also a wide selection of shortbreads which is pretty unique. 

There are also bigger loaves of bread for you to take home and also they sell coffee so you can enjoy a nice cup of joe while nomming on a pastry in their store because let's be realistic, how long can you wait before tearing into a fresh, aromatic pastry?
author: Lydia W.

description: Not quite as delicious as Cheeseboard in Berkeley, but a close second. I highly recommend their Chocolate Things and Cheese Rolls, as well as their daily pizza. The staff is always friendly and courteous as well.
author: Amanda F.

description: I love this place. The staff has always been really helpful and friendly every time I'm in there. We get bread here every week, and I'm absolutely addicted to those cheese rolls!
author: Morgan R.

description:
The arugula/bellpepper/pesto pizza was delicious! 

Had the pecan roll and potato bread, tasteful and great quality!
The employees are super friendly!
will definitely be back
author: Tammy K.

description:
one of my all time favorite bakeries in the SF!  I have yet to leave disappointed. 

some of my favs:
Corn/blueberry muffins have chunks of blueberries with a smooth cornmeal texture

kalmata olive bread is always fresh like it was from an italian restaurant

the pecan rolls are gooey but not too sweet

i use the chocolate/cherry bread for french toast, yummy with maple syrup!


the staff is always friendly which helps since there's always a line
author: Lola L.

description:
I am over the moon since this bakery opened on Valencia St. I feel like now its okay to get to work 10 minutes early, just so I can swing by and take advantage of the early morning goodies.

on a recent visit I fell in love with their brioche twist. Oh man. The pizza is always good too! 

This place is super popular, so be prepared to make your order to go.
author: Hilda Z.

description:
I have found my happy place of bread.  I was referred to this fabulous bakery by my father in law, who had recently been at UCSF Med Center.  Trouble was, he only could remember that it was near the hospital and near a veterinarian's office.  Thanks to Yelp and Mapquest, I found it and in finding Arizmendi, I found Bread Nirvana.

My husband often tells me that I exaggerate, but when I say that Arizmendi produces some of the best bread I have ever tasted I am understating the point.  WAY better than Gayle's in Capitola and Gayle's is the bomb.  

Today she was serving her marbled pumpernickel and rye was what I sought for my dear spouse.  Samples were available and OMG I couldn't believe it.  Rye bread is often dry and too sour.  The marbled pumpernickel is moist, with a beautiful crust.  And the taste! SO GOOD.  As soon as I tried it, I ordered another loaf for the freezer.  But that was not all, oh no--not by a long shot.

Also amazing is the foccacia--today it was tomato and mushrooms and spinach/feta/onion/olive.  Slightly crunchy crust from the cornmeal, very moist and tender--I know what I'm having for lunch.

Also tried cheese rolls--divine-and purchased a straight-from-the-oven walnut wheat bread that smells sooooo good.  Just to round things off, I got a couple of breadsticks--pleasantly chewy, flavorful and well balanced.  Just to be fair to my sweet tooth, I got a coconut shortbread cookie (haven't tried it yet but I have no doubt it will be perfection) and a rosemary cheese scone.  Definitely the best scone ever had, crumbly but not dry, rich and flavorful. Perfect with a cup of steaming hot coffee, which I enjoyed on my drive back here to Silicon Valley.  Only complaint:  No South Bay Arizmendi.  Waaah!

My companion has another appointment at UCSF in a month and I gladly volunteered to drive, so that I can come back and restock!  Viva Arizmendi!
author: Nora R.

description:
Amazing pizza! This place is quite small and has an old town vibe. The staff is extremely nice. Each slice is $2.50 and a whole pizza is $20. Cash only too! 
I've heard a lot about Arizmendi which prompted me to try it out. Their pizza is light, but unique and the flavors are strong and subtly sweet. Nothing heavy and drenched in tomato sauce here! 
I had the shiitake, portabello and button mushrooms with sesame-ginger-garlic vinaigrette pizza. It is amazing and a little sweet. I'm a huge fan of mushrooms on pizza, so if you're the same way, you'd love this!
Another one that I had was arugula, portabello mushrooms, smoked gouda cheese, garlic oil, p&p. This one I find more suitable for me because I'm not too fond of sweetness on pizza.
I ordered a lite-bake whole pizza here, which is convenient to just finish baking in your oven at home if you are not planning to eat the pizza right away! 
Reserving a pizza is easy and it's never too busy!
Great indoor seating, and great selection of baked goods as well. 
Definitely recommend trying this place.
author: Veronica L.

description:
This place gets busy, but is so yummmyyy! 

I love bakeries so much.  All the baked goods here looked amazing.  They have scones, breads, muffins, cookies, rolls, coffee cake, sticky rolls, pizza, and I can't even remember what else. 

I knew I wanted to come here for breakfast one day and today finally got to go and try it out.  We got one of the pizza's (soo good and they give such large pieces!), a raspberry and apple scone, and blackberry coffee cake.  I need to hit the gym hard tomorrow, but it was so worth it. 

Cash only though!
author: Michele P.

description:
4.5 stars 

Got their baguette and the most friggin amazing cheese roll ever. Chris loved the baguette -- it was relatively thin but warm with a great crust and still soft insides. (he's was really into the crust - said it was "wonderfully crisp without being overly crusty" [he's a poet...(no he's not, but he could be)]) 

As for that cheese bread -- ohhhh sweet lord it was good. Cheese-o-rific, doughy, cheesy, salty wonderful why-can't-I-be-skinny goodness. 

Next time I'd like to try something sweet. Their cookies look a little to crunchy for me (I like doughy ones) but I'm sure I could find something!
author: Heather W.

description: Love their cheese rolls and pizzas!  Staff is friendly and location is great.  You can walk to Golden Gate Park from there and have a picnic.  On Sundays there is a Farmers Market across the street.  Five stars all around!
author: Ron W.

description:
This review is only for their pizza.

FREAKIN DELICIOUS. I work near this amazing bakery and frequently stop in with the little human that I nanny on our way back from Golden Gate Park. The workers are always so kind and the unique pizzas are consistently delicious and flavorful. I was thrown off at first that they only served one kind of pizza a day but quickly learned that this is a great decision on their part because with only one kind of pizza a day, they are able to really make these pizzas taste amazing! 

When i walk by on mondays and they are closed, my heart breaks a little. But then I go home and visit their website where they have conveniently placed their pizza schedule so I can drool over my computer and look forward to tuesday's slice of heaven.
author: An-Nhien L.

description:
Oh yeah, cheese things and pecan rolls oh yeah shortbread. 
Cowgirl Creamery Red Hawk cheese on the west side yum.
Plus a discount if you ride your bike! Well worth it to ride the 24 deathtrap laden blocks from chez moi.
And it's a co-op! Support your local Socialists!!

note: CASH ONLY
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
Parmesan Rosemary scones on Thursdays! Officially addicted! 

Oh, and their pizza is amazing too.
author: Julia L.

description:
Best british style (read: not over hard american biscuit with no flavor) scones in the city.  They have a great scone of the day.  My favorite are the peach and strawberry varieties.  They are what got me addicted to this place in the first place.

Everyone loves their pizzas, which are tasty, but sorta exemplifies my only complaint about Arizmendi:  the all taste pretty much the same.  Also the pizza has no tomatoe sauce (if you care).

The sourdough bread is excellent and the salted carmel chocolate cake is good too!
author: Zack S.

description:
I decided to try this bakery after looking at all the wonderful reviews on yelp. Despite going in with high expectations, I was not disappointed. 
As soon as you walk in, the smell of cheesy delicious bread hits you. It almost made me want to try one of the more savory breads but I felt like the corn cherry scone was more appropriate for breakfast. It tasted like a butter cookie on the outer edges with a corn bread center. If I had the opportunity, I would definitely try it again before I leave San Francisco.
author: Kristen Y.

description: Loved the spinach and artichoke pizza. The short beard and coffee was delish. I can't wait to come back and try a different pizza -- love that the menu rotates. Plus it only took a few minutes to find parking in the Inner Sunset.
author: Nabila S.

description:
I would give it five stars, but the person who waited on me was a little cranky.

The baked goods were like heaven on earth. I went out of my way to visit this place on a friend's recommendation, and am I glad that I did!

Get the Provolone Olive bread on Tuesdays. Before you buy it, put a stick of butter out to soften. Get some roasted red peppers, some salami and a little wine. Repeat and repeat.
author: Beth F.

description:
I really wanted to love this place.  I've been desperately searching for a good bakery in San Francisco without much success, most likely because my standards are very high:  I grew up in the Northeast, where good bread is sacred, inexpensive, and easily procurred.

I've tried various breads and rolls from Arizmendi.  I gave it a good shot.  But I concluded that all of the people who rant and rave about how great this place is have never been to a bakery anywhere in NY.  They don't know why the brioche here makes me sigh as my taste buds' hopes are dashed, why to me, the rolls are almost-but-not-quite, the bialys are just so-so, and why I can't quite get into their chocolate cake, which while admittedly moist, has a weird and icky after-taste, telling me that either inferior quality products were used to make it, or bad proportions.  The prices are high and the quality is just okay, nothing special.  This place is no more special than, say, Noe Valley Bakery, which is also over-priced and lacking a certain something.

And as a  former East-coaster, it's hard for me to get into a place that's so incredibly preachy and boastful about the quality of their products.  When you go to a bakery in Brooklyn, no one tries to unload any hippie crap on you.  You pick out your bread, you pay, you go.  But here, the guys behind the counter gushed to me about how I had to try their chocolate cake, how it'd been rated really highly online.  So, like an adventurous culinary fool, I did.

The chocolate cake is not great.  You can get a better slice at the bodega on the corner of 20th Ave. and Irving, and it'll be cheaper, too.  

I know my chocolate cake.  It's probably my favorite food.  I could give a long list of places in San Francisco where you can get better chocolate cake.  Sadly, this just isn't one of them.

Don't believe the hype on this place.  It's great if you live in the neighborhood, are offended by the notion of buying your bread from an actual grocery store, and have never been to a bakery in NYC.  But otherwise, your taste buds will probably need a support group afterwards to help deal with their disappointment.
author: Amy L.

description:
I tried to like Arizmendi.  Boy, did I try!  I tried the brioche (ick, yellow raisins!) and I tried the cheese roll (I couldn't even bite in it was so chewy) and I tried the bialy style bread with cheese with tomato (not very flavorful) and I tried a scone (too chewy).  Afterwards I felt sick to my stomach and wished I hadn't tried.

Arizmendi is the people's bread.  I really, really wanted to like the people's bread!  I am the people!  I was raised by hippie parents who made the people's bread.  I even lived in a co-op in college and made it myself.  I get it, I get it.  

But guess what?  I hate it.  There.  I said it.  It's too bready, too kneaded, not carefully enough considered.  And if I'm going to carbo-load, I'd rather enjoy myself.
author: Cassidy P.

description:
Was let down by the raving reviews. My standards aren't too high. I just expect bakery bought goods to taste better than ones I make at home.

Stopped for a quick snack/lunch part 2 (part 1 left my stomach hungry and my credit card slightly violated) and a restroom stop. Was planning on buying pizza but the slices were tiny. Would have had to buy at least 4.

Pecan roll, $2.75: Balanced pecan to dough ratio. Looked sexy but not the gooey, sugary knockout punch I was banking on.
Red onion, gouda, feta focaccia, $3.75: Unctuous: paper bag was sweating grease by the time I reached my car a few blocks away. Flavors melded well and onion was caramelized. Picked it for my something savory because it was bigger and more colorful than its neighbors. Not as satisfying as expected.
English muffin, $0.75: Plain and unassuming. These are the boring second cousins of the buttermilk ones I made, which are inedible because they're too strong for my liking. Warm when purchased but wasn't able to enjoy with fried egg because don't live nearby. Will slather on jam to make it palatable when I eat it later today.

Staff was the right amount of friendly. To reach the bathroom, open the door on the left side by the display cases. Bring cash if you aren't planning on buying at least 4 items because there's a $10 credit card minimum.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
Sometimes you just don't realize a good thing even when it's in front of you.  I always see Arizmendi when on the N-Judah, but never tried it before. And how did I not realize they are related to the Cheeseboard in Berkeley?

We ordered two large lite-baked pizzas to-go for Superbowl Sunday, and I'm definitely a fan...organic sourdough crust and organic veggies. In celebration of the Superbowl they were offering two flavors that day- triple mushroom with sesame ginger garlic vinaigrette and the spinach roasted garlic feta lemon-thyme oil (my favorite because of the chunks of garlic).  The lite bake was easily prepared by putting it in the oven for an additional 8 minutes or so.

Arizmendi, I'll be seeing you soon!
author: Lisa C.

description:
They have good gourmet *opposite of Domino's* pizza here.  You can take a whole half-baked pizza home for about $20.  Sometimes the topping are a little too weird- or too gourmet for my taste but you can check ahead here:  http://www.arizmendibakery.org/pizza

The MAIN attraction here, for me- is the Auntie Mabel's Cookie Brittle!  Like a chocolate chip cookie only 10 times better...loaded with chocolate chips & nuts and super crispy.

I've glanced over at the Salted Caramel Chocolate cake many a times while in line...and had been skeptical...but now I am convinced!  Salted Caramel and Chocolate- gooooooooooood combination!  Yummmm!
author: Judy K.

description:
my friends were raving about the pizza but i never got a chance to eat it

its supposed to be really really good

the coffee was good and pretty strong

the baked goods are why everyone flocks here

all the scones are great, and the pecan roll is really good too

went here twice last week!

both times the place was completely packed
author: Hemesh P.

description:
I don't see why this place is that great. Maybe I didnt get the right thing but I did try the pecan roll everyone on here is talking about. And that roll was like a brick. even if I heated it up it was still a bit dry and I would just rather get a cinnamon roll from somewhere else. 
Also got the soda bread, I like the one from tartine? in oakland muchhh better.. 
My friend bought some other items and he was disappointed too. 
We both split half a pizza which was like a vege pizza, it was very fresh tasting but the dough was a bit raw tasting. 

I'm sorry that is just what I've experience. My friend and I spent almost $40 here and we don't live close by either.
author: Erica L.

description:
Warning:  Don't go there - or you'll become addicted!  I've been going for years & can't kick the habit.  OMG I'm so glad they're closed on Mondays  - 1 less day to indulge.  

Everything is baked fresh & you can't go wrong with the daily pizza.  My favs:  Pecan Rolls, Scones, Muffins & especially Shortbread (lavender is tops).  The only disappointment was the "Chocolate Things".

Bring cash & exercise restraint - you'll want to buy everything.
author: Kim S.

description:
Having been spoiled by Cheeseboard while I lived in Berkeley, I had to look for a replacement when I moved to the city.  While I still make sure to make a few pilgrimages to Cheeseboard to savor the thin-crust pizza that I would probably pick as my last meal on earth, nowadays I get my fix from the much-closer Arizmendi.  If somehow, on my last day on earth, Cheeseboard was closed (because it was a Sunday, perhaps), then fine, I'll die if I can have Arizmendi instead.

It's just a shade less delicious than Cheeseboard, which is to say, STILL VERY FREAKING NOM.  It's also nice that they have their flavors planned out a month at a time, so you can also plan your days accordingly, because god forbid you schedule a baby shower on the day Arizmendi has a roasted fennel pizza.

Their other baked goods are also quite good.  I really like their scones (apple-cranberry? amazing) and cookies.  Also, the sweet potato pie I brought home for Thanksgiving was quite seasonally delicious.
author: jon y.

description:
I come here specifically for their pizza of the day. The crust is thin with an almost sourdough taste, while the toppings are not over the top, but bursting with flavor! Simply put, their pizza is delicious, they vary by day however. 

I wish they had more variety and more drink options, but the workers are extremely pleasant and helpful. 

Their baked goods are very decent, their chocolate chip cookies are interesting but pleasant, hard in texture but full of chocolate goodness! their focaccia bread is great!! Sooo good!
author: Katie L.

description: Loved their pizza of the day! A must go if you're in the inner sunset! It's Cash only by the way so bring in that mula!
author: Ronnie P.

description: This place is FANTASTIC. The scones are delicious and the pizza is mouthwatering. Plus it's in the Inner Sunset, a neighborhood that is fun & full of cool places. The prices are also good. The chai I had I was not a fan of but the food is great.
author: Heidi D.

description:
I found myself this morning, craving carbs like a mad woman... damn ovaries again!  When I got to Arizmendi, I felt like I had stepped back into the womb ... but not in a damp and gross way.  Arizmendi is cozy (i.e., packed with other hungry people who had returned to the womb) and smells heavenly!!

There is something very nourishing and hearty about every one of the SIX items that I (and the bf) unconsciously stuffed into paper bags and carried up to the counter.  You will find no pansy-ass, flaky pastry at Arizmendi.  These goods are not for delicate eaters; these are like Tonka truck-grade baked goods.  I will not have to eat for days, I'm sure (although we all KNOW that I will, anyway...).

Here is what I got for $10.25 (you can see the pix I posted, too):

* Chocolate mint cookie: dense, rich dark chocolate with a cool mint aftertaste.  So-so...
* Hazelnut shortbread cookie: finely chopped hazelnuts in a buttery host.  So-so...
* Chocolate brioche:  brioche not to scantily laden with rabbit pellet-like chocolate jewels.  So-so...
* Raisin brioche knot: brioche laden with plump golden raisins knotted with a light sugar glaze.  Pretty good.
* Cheese roll:  whole wheat dough roll topped with asiago (?) cheese.  Mighty tasty! Would be a fabulous base for a sammich...
* Peach-raspberry scone: Golden crunchy outside encapsulating moist bits of peach and raspberry in buttery goodness.  Amazingly delicious.  I couldn't stop saying "oh my god... this is so frickin' good" the entire time I was eating it.

"Heaven... I'm in heaven, And my heart beats so that I can hardly speak. And I seem to find the happiness I seek..."  at Arizmendi!!

3 and a half stars.
author: Jenny K.

description:
Yes this place is where too go.  
II almost don't want to tell you about it.  I will leave it at that.
author: Colin M.

description:
As much as i want to give a better review, I can't seem to get something that I like here. So here's my apology first because I hate giving a low score for an eco-friendly (not mentioning local) business

I went here several times because the reviews were so good and I may not order the right thing. But I did try their scones, muffins as well as the savory stuff... something just didn't click and they taste awful for me personally. I couldn't finish those usually and ate them little by little for days just because I wouldn't want to waste the food.

An extra star for being eco-conscious business tho
author: Cliff T.

description:
They offer one type of specialty pizza that changes everyday. So when I saw their sign for "Triple Mushroom Pizza" I was a little disappointed...considering I don't like mushrooms. To be honest, I don't even prefer thin crust pizza (which is what they offer), yet I Loved their thin crust triple mushroom pizza :D It was full of flavor and cheesy goodness with a light crispy crust. 

For the ride home, we grabbed a mint chocolate chip cookie (super rich and spongy) and kookie brittle to snack on. 

Arizmendi's is definitely a solid 4.5, but their banner that stated "Make Loaves Not War" won me over :3
author: Agent X.

description: Delicious indulgence. The cookies are amazing. I also recommend the mushroom foccacia. Oh, and the scones.
author: Kris F.

description: They were out of a lot of breads and baked goods by the time we got there at 1:30-2 p.m. so we had to settle for a coffee raspberry crumble cake, which was still delicious. My only complaint was that you definitely need coffee or tea to make it perfect! The sitting area is a little tight so we ended up eating it in our car. I would definitely come back for their other baked goods and pizza!
author: Allison S.

description:
Why have I driven past this over a thousand times, not knowing one of the best pizzas is located just minutes away from me?! I've heard about this place for awhile now and finally gave it a try. BABY JESUS! The pizzas are delicious! A different pizza is made daily, and there's practically just that one choice to order off their menu. I had the artichoke, blue cheese.... somethingsomething. I don't know what in the world it was, but it is cheeeesy to the max and mighty delicious!! Enough to reel me in to try a  different pizza every day!  (If parking was not such a bitch.) I think the secret to this pizza is the foccocia with crusts crisp to the point. 

Their freshly baked cookies are great too!! The variety of pastries and bread was overwhelming. Too bad it was CASH ONLY. I had to limit myself to all the greatness. Nummy numnum.
author: Rosanne L.

description:
Best pastries in SF period. 

Love the chocolate thingy, pecan rolls, and cherry corn scones. The savory breads are also delicious. The cookies are good, but I think Specialty's cookies are better. They don't have anything fancy like tarts, so you'll have to go to Tartine or La Boulange for that. They do have a chocolate cake with a salted caramel frosting which is very good!

Tip:  They make coffee cake too, but only on the weekend. Another one of my faves!
author: Nikki R.

description: I just love their half baked pizza! ... and their almond cookies.
author: Frances G.

description:
Get in my mouth, this place is delicious!

I love everything about this place; the pizza, pastries and cookies.  Everything is always delicious, and I'm very impressed how affordable this joint is.  The staff is always pleasant, and I've gotten a few free cookies which puts a bigger smile on this Yelper.

One of the biggest perks of this place though is grabbing a slice and cookie, and heading to Mucky Duck for beer and liar's dice.  Can't ask for a better after work activity.

Teensy problem, cash only. ATMs are close by though.
author: Laura H.

description: This place is delicious !!!!!!!! Love their pizzas ))) everyday they have special type of pizza and its always good.
author: Tetyana G.

description:
There're plenty of items at Arizmendi that you just can't get anywhere else, so you can be easily tempted to buy and try just about everything in the store.  I love and hate that feeling.  Love it b/c it's like being a kid standing in a baseball card shop w/ shelves of packs staring at you in the face...glorious.  Hate it b/c if you can't figure out what to buy quick, you'll be standing in a line w/ 30+ ppl waiting to pay.  A line that rivals Golden Gate Bakery in Chinatown.  

The pecan roll was mighty fine (similar to a large cinammon roll w/ pecans mixed in) and the corn cherry scone wasn't far off.  Their pizzas are tasty also, but not as good as Cheeseboard in Berkeley.  Stick w/ the baked goods here; there's a huge array to choose from and all are fairly priced.  The breads are super fresh and look scrumptious as well, except they're pretty expensive (at least $7-8 a loaf).  Definitely one of the best bakeries in SF, if not the best.
author: Jeff S.

description: I think the food here is good. The few times I have been in here, everything has tasted fresh and decent (so my avoidance of this place has nothing to do with the quality of their products). However, I can't bring myself to go in here most days - especially on weekends. There are only so many shoves and pushes by oblivious people or baby strollers that I can take. I understand everyone is in a mad dash to get their food, but I just wish this place wasn't so tiny. For living a few blocks away, this is not a place I'd consider going for a quick snack or pickup. It ends up turning into a big production just getting in and out of this place.
author: H C.

description:
When I was new to the neighborhood, I was STOKED to know that Arizmendi was right around the corner. I started my love affair with their shop based on their pizza, but now it's really because of their COFFEE! I get a latte almost every day.

Minus one star because of the small space (although a possible future parklet may alleviate some of that pain) and the sometimes sky-high prices. I know the goods are made with top-notch ingredients and lots of love, but come on...
author: Jenna H.

description: Wow! Just wow... Their pizza is amazing! Thank you for turning my bad day around... Delicious!
author: Anne L.

description:
One of my favorite parts of living and working in the Inner Sunset is having easy access to Arizmendi. 

I love the pizza menu. I love the blueberry muffins. I love pretty much everything that I've put in my mouth that originated at Arizmendi. Seriously nom nom nommmmms. 

Everyone in there is so friendly, even when I go in with a Terrible Twos Toddler who viciously lunges at the blueberry muffins and tries to shove them in her mouth before I can even get my pizza order in. Sorry about that, by the way.
author: Leah W.

description:
Very fabulous delicious bakery. When you walk by it you can smell the fresh treats baking. Lots of butter used. They have cookies, scones, cakes, breads and pizzas. I have yet to try everything (i want to) but my favorite so far is the mint chip cookie or the oat-friut scone. The pizza is always very original (its a coop owned by the same people as CheeseBoard in Berkeley). 

Coffe is good too, but a little expensive for what it is. Only accepts cash, so it got knocked down a point. Also, there isn't much sitting/lounging room, so when it gets crowded in the mornings, its hard to find a place and you end up sitting awkwardly with strangers. Otherwise it is a great!
author: Sirina K.

description:
Arizmendi Bakery is so good.

I walk by all time and there is always a line. I have only had their pizza and it's delicious. Great selection of fresh ingredients and you can really taste it. I love that they use a lot of garlic and olive oil; It gives their pizza a Mediterranean taste. Their pizzas are huge and great to share.

Yum!
author: Denise S.

description:
Just simply amazing.

Delicious pizza, amazing Lavender shortbread, tasty chai and helpful staff.

Love it! And can't wait to bring my friends here!
author: Lital K.

description: Review only for the King Cake.... Doesn't taste like a typical New Orleans King Cake. I am from New Orleans and have one every year. Taste more like a pecan cinnamon roll.
author: Melissa B.

description: WOW, absolutely great!  1 Pizza per day--I happen to get cherry tomato, arugula, and cheese brushed with tarragon olive oil--delicious--and did I mention $20 for a whole pie?  The rest of the baked good are similarly wonderful and fresh--all done with sourdough--though I only actually bought one.  I like that it is employee owned and it reminds me of the Cheeseboard in Berkeley in that way as, well as in the way of its quality and freshness.
author: Joseph J.

description: I really don't know why this location gets such high reviews. The space is small and cramped, the hours are inconvenient, and it has the slowest staff I've ever seen. More than half the time, they are out of their only gluten-free options.. even if it's early morning. I've given up trying to go here and wind up purchasing something from the market instead.
author: Jeri J.

description:
One of the best bakeries in the city!!!

Definitely worth stopping by to get a blueberry coffee cake or any roll of bread deliciousness.  Cheap and tasty.  

It's all about grabbing and going here.  It may be packed, but the line moves quickly.  One downer is that I have never been able to get a seat any time I've gone, but that's okay given all there is to see in the neighborhood.

Carbs are your friend and Arizmendi is making friendships happen every day.
author: Christine K.

description: This place makes wonderful goods and some things are very reasonably priced.   I would spend more money here, but I find, there is something so pretentious about people who run coop businesses, I can't get past it.
