The snobby holier then thou, because I am part of a coop attitude,  leave me cold and my money goes to business who have a concept of good customer service.
author: Stephanie N.

description:
Couldn't believe it took me so long to find this great neighborhood bakery.  I had no idea a bakery could serve such great pizza.

They have very, very good pizza.  There is a different pizza made every day and is available starting at 11:30 a.m.  They are vegetarian, but even carnivores won't have a problem with pizza this good.  Often times, you will get a slice that is still piping hot.  Other times, you'll have to wait a few minutes for the next one to finish baking.  They also serve half or whole partially baked ones to go.  Check out the monthly pizza schedule online or for the pizza of the day posted at the door.  My favorites are anything with mushrooms, artichoke, or eggplant.  I'm guessing that there are seasonal toppings, since some combos seem to disappear for months.    

Other favorites of mine: Corn cherry scone, pecan rolls, and some of the muffins.  Also good are the various foccacia and the cheese rolls.  
Haven't tried most of the cookies or the heavenly looking cheesecake, yet.

Keep in mind, they are closed on Mondays.  And can be very crowded with a line out the door on weekends.  But, don't worry, the line moves really fast.  There is some indoor and outdoor seating available.
author: CE Y.

description: I really love the caramel pecan rolls.  Typically, I explore new things, however, at Arizmendi's I'm in a rut...a pecan roll and their Ethiopian coffee is my wunder-rut!  once per week, I'm there!
author: Larry D.

description:
Whaaaat?  Why did I start going here more regularly the last 2 months of my 6-year SF stay?

I really like their pizza.  I'm a meat lover, but their vegetarian pizzas sure as heck beat the pizza place across the street.  Their pastries are really tasty, and the variety is awesome.  I used to go strictly for their breadsticks, but I decided to branch out to pizza too because of the awesome Yelp reviews.

They recently started taking CC for over $10 so more of an incentive to buy more pizza and pastries!

Btw, please use those tissues or tongs to get the pastries.  You don't need to stick your bare hands in there.  Come on now...
author: Steve H.

description:
I am stuffing my mouth with their cheese bread as we speak... And just an hour ago, I ate an asiago roll.  Oooh, I'm in cheese bread heaven!  Honestly, like all the other people have said, this is one awesome bakery with breads that surpass any I've tasted anywhere else!  Wait, scratch that.  

Arizmendi's breads are like no other, so there is no comparision. 

Okay, much better. I only wish I lived closer to this wonderful establishment.
author: Joce A.

description:
Now that I am back in a healthy and wonderful relationship and have rejoined Team Eat with the necessary re-induction fee of 15 happy pounds, I am allowed to eat carbs again.

Arizmendi, god help me, makes these most amazing, most delicious, most fattening Brioche Knots full of golden raisins and bits of heaven that  make me tear up a little.  Mostly because I cannot stop myself from eating the one I bought for now and the one I bought for much, much later at the same time in upsettingly large mouthfuls, in my car, alone, where I think no one can see me, but they can.  And I am sure they feel sorry for me.

I just smile and wave and crumbs fall all over my sweater.  

They also always have delightful Organic coffee.  This mornings was from Nicaragua.  Now, I have been to coffee farms in the middle of Panama and Costa Rica and drank freshly brewed, steamingly hot, dark cups of coffee while still on the farm, and strangely this coffee at this small San Francisco bakery is far superior.

Maybe it's not the coffee.  Maybe it's just being back on Team Eat again.  Everything tastes and looks brighter, happier, better.... and much, much fatter.

Cest la vie!
author: Rachel G.

description:
Favorites that I have found...

Homemade garlic bread sticks
Blueberry muffins
Cherry cornmeal scones
Foccacia
Funghi pizza (shitake + sesame/ginger/garlic sauce = "O" face)


...Trying to find...

A way to make my room smell like Arizmendi's so I can swim in an ocean of baking goodness!
author: Brian L.

description: Always enjoy coming here.  Everything is good.  Friendly service.  Minimal sitting and no parking, but worth the trip.
author: Joel M.

description: Cheese Roll.  So Good.  All sorts of other baked perfection.  Just an all around Awesome place.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS BAKERY!  We are regular customers and we love the freshly baked bread, hummus, oat scones, and pastries.

We would love it if they added the following Dutch cookies: Speculaas stroopwafels, and vegan nutella.

Howard, Betsy, Erin, Eddie and Tanya are so welcoming and nice to our daughter and she loves going there to say hi to the bakers.
author: Christina C.

description:
Pizza, win. Coconut shortbread, win. Focaccia, win. Really, you just can't go wrong here.

FYI - They're always closed May 1st for International Worker's Day. Seriously.
author: Ken L.

description:
My friend loves the bakery here so I had to check it out. The line was out the door so it has to be good right? Looks like they also serve pizza but I had already had a light lunch previously so baked goods is good enough for me. I go for my staple, a pecan roll, and I also try the recommended cherry and corn scone.

The pecan roll was surprisingly, amazingly delicious, perfect crunch and gooey-ness. I didn't actually eat the scone until the next day, but it was absolutely melt in your mouth delicious still with the pieces of cherry and the corn scone reminding me of the best cornbread I've ever had. Even after sitting out for a day.

Pure baked heaven.
author: John Paul P.

description:
This is one of my favorite things about the Inner Sunset (9th/Irving) shopping area. Delicious breads, great vegetarian pizza slices and unusual cakes that we've used as dinner-gifts ever since we moved to the area. All very fresh and just the right level of sweet. I don't think I'm ever going to buy another bakery item from Safeway anymore.

Pity - we're moving out of San Francisco. I'll always remember the pecan-rolls after a run in the GG Park.
author: Pablo R.

description: Easily the best pizza I've ever had. We always buy an extra one to take home for later.
author: Cam C.

description:
Amazing amazing amazing!! :D

LOVE me some Mendi!! 

I already wrote a very long review for the arizmendi in Oakland on lakeshore ave so i don't have energy to do it again haha

best pizza EVER! Hands down! Healthy, local, sustainable, amazingness!!!!!! =D love it! Pizza is amazing every day and nver has let me down, only made me smile! 

one kind of Veg pizza daily that even meat eaters will go crazy for! And great baked goods and cheese as well! Yum!
author: Lauren S.

description:
This bakery really doesn't need any more reviews after having 1099 already. That being said, I wanted to be the 1100th review for this place.

I'll admit to not being a good Yelper by posting a review sooner when I first became addicted to this place's baked goods (literally have never had a bad item, and that's after eating what seems like 1000 pounds of their daily pizzas, focaccias, cheese rolls, breadsticks, muffins, brioche knots, coffee cakes, provolone onion rolls, cakes, and cookies). The straw that broke my metaphorical camel's back to have me write this review is my discovery of their apple pie, a seasonal treat for holidays such as July 4th. I balked when the register rang up $28 for the whole pie but the moment I took a bite, after nuking it for 1 minute, I realized I could've paid $40 for it and still be satisfied. Every bit of the crust, which we all know is the best part of the pie, was buttery. The key to knowing this was a delicious pie was that I was also eating the apple stuffing, which in most pies I pick to the side because I only like the crust. The place has found a way to make the apple stuffing taste like the crust. I admit to devouring almost 1/3 of it within a 24 hour period. Do not let a holiday go without getting a pie from Arizmendi. And having typed all that, I can now go to eat the other 2/3 of the pie.
author: Gwen L.

description:
I could have sworn I had written a review for Arizmendi... but that was probably because I come here so frequently since it's right near where I'm at. 

I always get the pizza that is displayed near the door and their chocolate chip mint cookie. I have also tried their well known chocolate cake with salted caramel frosting (delicious!) as well as the one with just the chocolate frosting (go with the salted caramel, not that the chocolate one is bad). It could get busy here depending on the time and day you get here. 

They accept CASH ONLY but there are plenty of ATMs/banks on Irving.
author: Eugenia G.

description:
LOVE! Arizmendi puts a lot of bakeries in the OC to shame. I would never have thought to enter this unpretentious bakery while visiting SF if it wasn't for Yelp. 

The brioche knot was ridiculously good. I gobbled that thing up like I hadn't eaten in weeks. I dipped some pieces in my coffee :) I would not mind eating this for breakfast everyday!

Marinated artichoke and spinach pizza... fucking good. The only pizza I have in the morning is yesterday's cold leftovers from Pizza Hut after a hangover so this is a major upgrade. The artichoke was delicious and it made me feel good having some veggies for breakfast. Hey, throw in a little spinach and the guilt goes away quick. Spinach dip? Oh, it's fine. There's spinach in it. It's good for you!

Multigrain baguette. There isn't too much you can say to describe a multigrain baguette but all the little seeds made this taste so good. There was a perfect amount of sea salt on it. 

Cherry scone. I'm not a big fan of cherries unless there's a maraschino in my Long Island, but I had to try this because of the billions of reviews about it. It was so good. It was Joe's favorite. Scones tend to be rock hard and dry and just not pleasing but these scones were really good. Again, dipped in coffee and you're good to go!
author: Linda Y.

description:
When you're in the mood for pizza, only a really good slice will do.  Arizmendi satisfies your pizza craving, it's rustic crust supports an amazing variety of cheeses and veggies, my favorite the simple goat cheese, pesto and sage.  The slices are usually generous, but sometimes they do skimp a little.  That is my only complaint.
An excellent, authentic slice of pizza!
author: Kristin R.

description:
I was walking through the Mission District and saw a bunch of peeps standing outside this bakery, shoving single slices of gourmet pizza!  This place is great!  Totally understated and delicious, unassuming, and an all-together great place :)  This place reminds me of Cheese Board Pizza in Berkeley - thoughtful combinations of ingredients, simple, fresh, and delicious every time.  The only reason they're not receiving 5 stars is that some of their pizzas are better than others... i've also tried their other baked goodies, and their corn scorn is off the hook!!!  SOOOO good!  Their lavender cookie was too fragrant for my taste, but all in all, their other goodies are pretty damn good!!  I also like their service, very unassuming and earthy, which is great... I do wish, however, they had more places to sit... 

All in all, I would highly recommend this place!
author: Michele J.

description:
There isn't a single thing here that isn't going to blow your taste buds into heaven...I think. I've never had the pizza but they look (and smell) so inviting that I can't wait to. 

My toddler loves the brioche knots and the potato bread rolls. 

The blueberry corn muffins are the best!! No, really, the B-E-S-T.
author: Hanster P.

description:
The pizza is made with sourdough daily, with one menu. You can smell the pizza a block away. 

Bring Cash.

Enjoy this place is nom nom nom- pizza goodness.
author: Valerie B.

description:
It's a little pretentious.  You buy pizza that is not warmed up .  And they can't heat it for you. 

There is no water
Bicycle discount but not Muni discount (our way)? WTF.

Not worth a trip at all.  Too bad we walked out of the park at 9th Ave to get some nice quick food.
author: Jordan G.

description:
Betty W. comes home every weekend from LAW(L) school in davis just to eat this pizza. Well... i guess to study also. But really, it's that good! 
Arizmendi is this little cooperative bakery that puts out a LOT of different bread products, ranging from muffins, pastries, foccacias, breads, etcetcetc. but most importantly... pizza which changes daily. 

If you click here... http://www.arizmendibakery.com/pizza
They have a schedule of what their pizza will be everyday of that month. Their dough is amazing and something I have never tasted before. Its a sourdough crust and I feel like anything they put on top of it tastes 10x better. Their toppings are usually simple... never any meat (i think..). I like it when they put artichoke hearts on it! oooh, and fennel. oooh, and mushrooms. 
My mouth is watering. 

I believe one slice is about $2 something, which may sound pricey for just a slice, but let me tell you, its worth it.
author: Tim B.

description:
I've been going to Arizmendi for years now..had a lot of their goodies-- bran muffins, chocolate things, pecan rolls, scones, various pizzas etc.. but not until the other day have I been truly impressed. 

What was it?

Their Chocolate chip cookie.

Simple as that. it's made with milk & dark chocolate chunks. But what makes this cookie truly special is the fact that you can taste chocolate in every single bite--imagine if you will a chocolate chip cookie with chocolate shreds throughout=Amazing.

Crispy on the outside, soft, buttery on the inside. Sooo delicious..the best chocolate chip cookie I've ever tasted!  Wish they were open right now so I could stop by for one!! I guess I'll have to head over early tmw morning!
author: Jessica h.

description:
Great pizzas.  I've brought them to many a party and it was a hit.  I think I still like Cheese Board a little better but this is still pretty darn good.

Pastries (muffins, cookies, etc.) all good as well.  You can't go wrong really.  Unless you're looking for meat or a place to sit when it's rainy.  Perfect stop across from the Inner Sunset Farmer's Market on Sundays.
author: Ken L.

description: OMG!! Hands down the most delicious slice of pizza I've ever had! And it was just a mushroom pizza. Scone of the day was good as well:).
author: Thuy T.

description:
Arizmendi is part of the reason why I moved to San Francisco. That and the fact that I'm getting married to a man who lives here.
But let's get back to the important things. This bread is the most amazing stuff. The foccacia pizzas are to die for. Their loaves of rye and sourdough and so so so good and make for the best toast. Those little cheese rolls, fantastic. The scones are actually properly made and packed full of deliciousness. I love the variety of seasonal flavors and toppings they offer. I haven't even had a chance to have their pizza yet but I'm pretty sure it's good. I would love to eat this entire bakery someday. 
It's bustling in there so try to go at an off time. Run in, get some breads and you will be happy.
author: Lisa K.

description:
Other reviewers have already said it all. This is an unbelievable bakery. Minus one star for having such a ridiculously cramped space that it's a complete mosh pit every Sunday when the Mrs. and I swing by for our weekly fix.

The only thing I've had that disappointed was their 'Chocolate Thing.' Everything else has been toe-curling-to-die-for good.
author: Todd H.

description:
I find myself checking the Arizmendi pizza schedule nearly every day. The sourdough crust makes all the pizzas great, regardless of toppings. The one pizza per day idea is fun, I never find myself eating the same pizza twice. 

The bread is just as good as the pizza. The City (sourdough) and Suburban (WW sourdough) breads are staples with many other tasty breads baked on a rotating schedule. 

To top it off, Arizmendi is worker owned so I know I'm supporting a good group when I buy there. 

5 stars because I've never had a bad experience at Arizmendi.
author: Grush K.

description:
There's nothing more disappointing then heading out to Arizmendi in search of their delicious dairy-free focaccia to find that they have FOUR types of focaccia, each covered in a different type of cheese. This has happened every time I've been there in the past 4 months. I'm close to giving up.

You can't taunt me with delicious artichoke/basil/tomato or rosemary/potato focaccia and then never have it again. You don't even need to have it every day -- how about you post your daily varieties online every day to save me the effort?
author: Alex F.

description:
Three words: pecan rolls ... fantastic!

Variety and price make this place very good.  However, it is cash only as many have mentioned.

They've got pizzas, pastries, and warm service.  I've been coming here off and on for about two years.  Be warned, it's always packed and seating is limited.
author: Jennifer Y.

description: Been shopping here for years, but less so since moving across town. This is my favorite arizamendi, love all the pizzas. The provolone olive bread is as beautiful as it is delicious. I'm a big bran muffin fan and these are rich with fruit and nuts. The seeded baguette is my all time favorite bread for pairing with cheese and salami. Hubby is fond of the cheese buns and the chocolate cake is moist and rich without being oversweet. Try the cookies, i like the mixed bag for cookie variety. All the products are excellent, service is efficient, you can call ahead for pizza or pies.
author: Kelly K.

description: The triple mushroom with ginger-sesame garlic vinaigrette is really flavorful and delicious.  There is very limited inside and outside seating.
author: Aliyah M.

description:
This location and the lakeshore one in Oakland probably tie for "best Arizmendi location". Parking is generally impossible during daytime hours. Lucky for me, I walk from my boyfriend's place a few blocks away! 

This one is the smallest Arizmendi but it's also the comfiest/coziest, I would say, to enjoy a book with a baked good of your choice. Make that baked goodS. My staples are always the strawberry scone and the blueberry corn muffin, however all their scones classify as amazing. And the chocolate chip cookie! Don't miss that either. 

Their pizza is usually always a hit for me! Sometimes their choice in cheese is not my favorite (they always ALWAYS have goat cheese for some reason), but I love their style of pizza. I also really like the mini slice they always include in your order - its a nice touch! 

This is probably my favorite bakery of all time just because of the scones. The only scone that can compete is the apricot one from Bakesale Betty, but their hours are so impossible for the normal working person. And they always run out on the weekends... but that's for another review. Anyways, Arizmendi is so reliably there for me!
author: Janey L.

description: YUM!  Crusty, glazed scones and flaky pastries make it a must-do stop. Parking would be a nightmare but its steps from the N-Judah line. Grab your pastry and walk on down to golden gate park.
author: North Girl M.

description:
Pizza is always good!  It changes daily with fresh ingredients.  On a rare occasion I buy the par baked pizza and cook it at home. It doesn't taste as good as when they bake it, but still very delicious.

My favorites:
-pizza (of course)
-zampanos - it's a savory bread roll sprinkled lightly with cheese and pepper. I
-focaccia breads
-scones

It's a co-op and worker owned!

occasionally the line gets long, but moves pretty quickly.  it's closed monday too.
author: Alison N.

description:
Yummy. Let me be honest. I have no idea what I got. But it was DELICIOUS. I don't remember because it was weeks ago and I went to literally dozens of place in the span of 2 days, so this one is kind of mixed in there..but I remember it was really really good. And hey, unless you hate bakeries that are really good (shame on you people) that's useful enough. Come come!

PS - "Good for kids"? That's a loaded question. Sure it's tasty for them. but kids shouldn't get used to the idea of eating fattening but delicious baked goods..they should know it as a reward. So this is a loaded question, maybe a trick question, and the good people of yelp will not get an answer from me . Sorry.
author: Edrees H.

description: Arizmendi is everything you would want in your local neighborhood bakery....and more. From the moment you walk in the door your senses are heightened by the sweet aroma of freshly baked goods. "Make loaves, not war" as their saying goes and I couldn't agree more. This place serves up a fresh loaf of love with every scone, foccacia and slice of pizza that's ordered. The place is "cozy" as they say so if you're one of the lucky few to snag a seat near the window than you're golden, if not your pastry is just as good to go.
author: Kristy M.

description: Each of the three items I've picked up at Arizmendi, on three separate trips, have been the best I've ever had of that particular food.  Blueberry scone today, apricot scone last time, and cheese roll the time before.  Not sure what black magic these bakers are using, but it's delicious.
author: Neal N.

description: Great place to pick up healthy, unique, yummy pizzas! I love checking their menu to see what the pizza of the day is. You can pick them up hot or have them cooked halfway and finish baking at home so its always fresh!!
author: Alyssa M.

description:
There is a reason why this is an award-winning bakery. Endless variety from sweet to savory, bread of every crunch level for your satisfaction guaranteed. When you crunch down, there will be crunch music in your ears. Seriously. The crusts of many of the breads that I've tried--incredible. 

The long line moves quickly and everything is fresh, fresh, fresh. 

Boudin, what? It really doesn't get better than this.
author: Baviera K.

description:
Ok, now I'm kinda embarrassed that I've been telling all my SF friends to make the drive to Cheeseboard in Berkeley for good pizza, when Arizmendi is right here in the city! Arizmendi and Cheeseboard are apparently "sister" shops, which makes sense since these 2 places serve the best pizza on the west coast.

The day I came, they had mushroom, basil, and pesto pizza. IT WAS AMAZING. Even better than Cheeseboard! I never completely liked some of the toppings Cheeseboard would put on their pizzas, like corn or dried limes. However, Cheeseboard does have fancier cheese. Still, Arizmendi knows how to pair up their toppings much better, and the result is amazing. Another plus, Arizmendi has much much shorter lines, but it'll take forever to find parking...weird huh?

Their bakery items are good too. I had this buttery asiago cheese bread/pizza thing, and provolone olive bread. Delicious, but not as much as their pizza. GET THE PIZZA. You must.

Oh and even their pizza crust is good. Normally, I don't waste my calories on dry, tasteless crust, but this was like the best sourdough crust I've had in a while.
author: Kate Y.

description:
Yum! I just discovered this place and now I go like 3 times a week. It's delicious! All the Vegan muffins are AMAZING and the cookies as well. Try the vegan onion/poppy seed breads they make. To die for!

More vegan options please!
author: stephanie l.

description:
ive been obsessed with this place ever since my first bite.
thinking about it frequently, even on the weirdest occasions. it's just that good.

the cheese rolls are SO good. its like a cinnamon roll but with cheese. 
when its warm, its even better. i love how crispy and savory it is.

and the cheesy breadsticks are amazing. (my boyfriend got these from the arizimendi on valencia so im not sure if they have these at this location?)
i ate a million of these as dinner one night. i think about them at work, in the shower, everywhere! 

their chocolate chip cookies are yummy too. soft and everything you'd expect and more.

i cant wait to try everything they've baked up. everything looks amazing here.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Arizmendi is Cheeseboard's sister bakery conveniently located in the City.  Arizmendi has converted this meat-loving, thin crusted pizza-eater.  I generally opt for thin crusts whenever I have pizza because pies come to doughy for me.  Arizmendi, however, knows how to make good bread.  Crisp on the outside and only puffy goodness on the inside.  

Pizza of the day was: "spinach, red onions, feta cheese, lemon and thyme oil, p&p."  I opted for half of an "light bake" pizza which came out to $9.  Came home and popped it in the preheated oven at 400 degrees for 5-8 minutes and viola! -- Fresh baked Arizmendi pizza to be enjoyed in my humble abode right smack in the center of the ghetto.  Better known as the Tenderloin, the TL, the Loin, the Elles, or crackhead central.  If I, an avid eater of anything that has four legs and can be grilled, can enjoy a vegetarian pizza from Arizmendi and Cheeseboard, you can too.
author: Bert N.

description:
Chocolate chip cookies should not be rock hard. At least not in my book. 

I got both the vegan mint chocolate chip cookie, and the regular chocolate chip. Both were good taste wise, but the texture (ie crumbly and hard) was just not my style.

I may be back but will probably stray away from their cookies.
author: Roxane W.

description:
I have read and heard so much about this bakery that I just had to try it. I came here on a Friday morning and luckily it wasn't crowded at all. Although I have heard their Pizza is their specialty, I was a little to early so I opted to get a pecan roll and an oat bran muffin.

The pecan roll was really delicious. The perfect amount of cinnamon with pecans and the roll made this one of the best cinnamon roll's I've had. Highly recommend this.

The oat bran muffin wasn't really anything special. I should have expected that due to it being an oat bran muffin, but it just wasn't good.

I also like the fact that you just walk in and grab whatever you want as opposed to telling people behind the counter what you want. 

Overall I like Arizmendi a lot and can't wait to come back and get their pizza and sample some of their other pastries.
author: Thomas D.

description:
I am a huge Cheeseboard fan, so I had high hopes (and standards) for its sister store. Unfortunately, the pizza is not quite up to par. The topping seemed the same---pure vegetarian ingredients like mushrooms, tomatoes, herbs, etc... Yet, I wasn't wowed by the pizza as I normally am at the Berkeley pizzeria. If I didn't know that this was Cheeseboard's sister store, I still wouldn't think much of their pizza. It's not awful but there isn't a ton of flavor either. One thing that is the same is the price. I doubt I'd pay $20 for the whole pizza again. Maybe, I'll just get a slice next time if I'm in need of a bite and I'm on the go.

3 stars.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
Use to go here all the time when I went to the gym (i know, a little counter productive). Their desserts were amazing! Especially their chocolate and princess cake. I also liked their sandwiches and salads, which they always made fresh in front of me. Nice people.

There is a cc minimum, so just bring cash!
author: Kristin S.

description:
as i write this review i am filled with regret. why, you may ask? WHY is exactly right. WHY did it take me so GD long to finally get a pizza at Arizmendi? i could have been eating this deliciousness regularly for the past year and a half. i am a failure as a san franciscan, a pizza lover, and a human being for taking so long to venture over to the inner sunset to partake of this cheesy delight.

Arizmendi is everything The Cheeseboard is and was for me in Berkeley. the Mecca for pizza lovers. if you don't like this pizza, i don't think we can be friends. their creative daily offerings and chewy sourdough crust cannot be beat. mmm.
author: Rachael S.

description: We bought a  whole pizza for $20, each slice still worth 2.50. It's medium sized. The pizza was very gourmet- thin, and very nicely flavored with tomatoes, red onions, garlic oil.  I also liked how green the bakery was- no paper plates or plastic utensils. The only downside was that there were 3 tables inside only. And the table we had was next to a the huge window, which they wouldn't let us close despite the cold winter chill.
author: Tes Y.

description:
Now they offer the cake with salted caramel frosting as an option. What could be better?!
One thing I would like to see change is for them to offer more whole grain options.
author: Iguana G.

description:
Yum! My bf took me here to get a quick snack and kept raving about how much he enjoyed this place when he lived around here. Personally, I wasn't hungry and I wasn't in the mood for bread but yum yum yum.

We got the coffee cake muffin and their pizza. Their pizza was delicious! You know it's good food when you're not even hungry and you still think it's super delicious. It's not a huge piece but it was definitely flavorful and not your average run-of-the-mill pizza. 

Yum yum yum.
author: Diana Y.

description: I could not love anything more than their corn cherry scone. It's pure poetry, especially being devoured while watching a Marilyn Monroe flick in my Grandma's living room.
author: Natasha P.

description:
It's been two days and I still remember exactly how amazing the pizza tasted! Drizzling a sesame-ginger-garlic vinegarette on top of the shiitake, portobello and button mushrooms generously scattered around the pizza was an act of pure genius and the crust was lightly browned to perfection with the sourdough bread adding some great flavor.

This place is poised to become my favorite pizza place in the city!
author: Krystle S.

description:
What can I say...you had me at PIZZA.

Two slices, five bucks, two minutes, and you're out with a great meal.
author: J P.

description:
I really like this location in the Mission and the extra space compared to the 9th Avenue location. The banana nut muffins are my favorite here along with the Apricot Almond cookies (sooo good!) which I  have gotten at 9th Avenue and am not sure if they're here, as well as the provolone olive bread.

Some corrections on your web site needed: It says " Visit all the delcious bakery cooperatives in our Association." You need an extra "i" here. Also, you need a "y" for the San Pablo Avenue location you have listed as "Emerville."  :-)
author: Ara R.

description: This place rocks! I love this place, always freshest ingredients used, friendly kind people own and operate this business
author: Leslie E.

description: 5000x better than anything you've ever eaten at your local coffee chain store. I wasn't going to be sharing any of it with the ducks at Lloyd Lake.
author: Jan P.

description:
I used to live up the street from Arizmendi, and I'm sort of glad I don't anymore. I think my blood had become pastry-fied...

But my husband and I have siblings in the neighborhood and visit every chance we get. The line out the door usually moves quickly. 

I've liked pretty much everything I've ever tried, but my favorites are:
-Brioche "lovely brick in your stomach" knot
-Fruit scones (and I'm not a scone person)
-Pizza (which is more like yummy bread with toppings)
-Wolverine loaves (power bar bread)
-Chocolate cake

Their coffee is pretty good, too. But you can also walk a couple doors down to get really amazing coffee at The Beanery. Then just keep on walking all the way to GG Park to enjoy your breakfast in the sun (or, more likely, the fog.) 

Parking can be problematic, especially on a Sunday when the farmer's market is in full swing across the street. This business is a co-op, so it sometimes keeps odd hours / observes bizarre holidays.
author: Madeline W.

description:
Superb bakery.  I'd still give Tartine the edge, but this bakery produces high quality, delicious goods.  The pecan rolls are superb and their coffee is great too.  Haven't been there for lunch - yet!
Bottom line: recommended, get the pecan roll.
author: dan s.

description: This was #4 and last on our SF visit progressive food run. This is a "sister" place to Cheeseboard Pizza, so my expectations a lot higher than they should be. The pizza wasn't too great. It looked good, but the sun dried tomato was overpoweringly sour. You couldn't taste the arugula and gorgonzola cheese. If I tried the breads, I think I'd like this place more. They had a pretty fiberous hearty apricot cookie that tasted like a dense bread. It was pretty good though!
author: Arnold W.

description:
"Make loaves, not war"

This alone screams the reason that I love this place! I'm so sad that I found it when I'm moving to another neighborhood! =(

We walked by this morning to go sign the lease with my new landlord we were planning to meet at The Little Roaster That Could and couldn't resist the smell. SOOO F-ING AMAZING. 

I had a Chocolate Thingy. Really good, still warm!!!! and not overwhelmingly sweet like most breakfast pastries. Super sweet staff and even the customers were awesome (the guy sitting outside spent two minutes trying to encourage us to give into our senses). 

I shall return!
author: Alita M.

description:
After a day in Golden Gate Park, we made our way to Arizmendi for some gourmet pizza.  I didn't realize that their gourmet pizza schedule rotated so heavily but you can definitely see it for yourself on their website.  My gourmet pizza consisted of: house made tomato sauce, arugula, garlic oil, p&p.  It was very fresh and good value gourmet pizza, and I would love to go back as I see some options on their pizza schedule that I think I'd like even better.   

If you're looking for meat on your pizza, you're going to the wrong place.  I also really enjoyed the green theme they have going as there are designated places to recycle your pizza boxes and other recyclables.  With so many different options on any given day, Arizmendi gives you reasons to go back again and again.
author: Albie F.

description: Very rude man behind the counter barked at me cause I walked in on Monday not knowing they were closed on Monday and he said rudely WE'RE CLOSED ITS BEEN THAT WAY FOR 11YEARS... are you kidding me .... maybe you should close your doors so people wanting to buy over priced bread wont get barked at. I will never go back and they will miss out on my biz .
author: Scott G.

description:
I thought this place was just like Cheeseboard in Berkeley. Then I read on their menu that Cheeseboard is a sister establishment. Their selection of cheeses consists of a few Cowgirl creamery cheeses and a few others in a mini refrigerator but it's okay. They make up for it with their pizza. 

They only have one pizza special daily and yesterday, it was mushrooms with fontina and parmesan cheese and rosemary oil. Pizza was fresh and I loved the mushrooms and cheeses. The crust, oh the crust was sourdough, SO good! What? This slice of pizza didn't have meat? I didn't even notice! I didn't check exactly how much a slice of pizza was but I estimate it to be $2.50-ish. Little me finished the slice pretty easily so next time, I'd have to get at least 2 slices.

I also bought a "Chocolate Things" to go. It wasn't anything special. It tasted like a Noah's chocolate chip bagel but softer.

I'll back come for the pizza, thank you.
author: Tina T.

description: Yummy bakery treats. Ran in (because parking is so fierce) to grab a few baked goodies. I've only tried the blueberry scone so far, but am enjoying the tastiness of it without the overload of sweetness. Can't wait to try the pecan roll and the carrot muffin!
author: Natalie S.

description:
The blueberry banana muffin is AMAZINGGGGG... wow. I literally took a bite and it was a moist and flavorful explosion of goodness in my mouth. :)

I actually got a piece of whole banana at one point, which  makes me very very happy because I enjoy when the fruits are fresh and prominent in my muffins.

The apricot almond cookie wasn't as good as I remembered it. A little bit dry and burnt... but probably just a bad batch. The staff is a little flaky and forgets to get your drink a lot of the time, but the food makes up for that!!
author: Danielle H.

description:
I've been a bad, bad girl
I've been careless with many a delicate pecan scone
And its a sad, sad world
When a girl will wake up at 7AM on a weekend and all she can think of is their coffee with a corn sherry scone

... umm... thanks, Fiona.

Anyhoo, simply THE BEST bakery I have ever been to and I get to live only a hop-skip and jump away from this fantabulous establishment! 

BREAD:
- Great baguettes
- Savory foccacia
- Delicious cheese rolls
- Warm bread sticks
- Muffins, pecan rolls (DROOL!), scones (DOUBLE DROOL!), shortbread, cookies (Please, can I have some more?... and more?... and more?) and tea bread
- My favs are the Irish soda bread, kalamata olive sourdough, molasses bread, apple-sage sourdough and garlic sourdough

PIZZA:
- Hot or lite baked and half or whole
- Gourmet
- Different one for every day of the week
- Made on thin, sour dough crust with seasonal vegetables
- My favs are the shiitake, portobello and button mushrooms, sesame-ginger-garlic vinaigrette pizza and the arugula, roasted red bell peppers, manchego cheese, garlic oil, parsley pizza

COFFEE
- Nothing like starting my weekend off right with their delicious coffee

STAFF
- The friendliest, nicest, coolest, laid back"est" peeps in town

LOCATION
- Take the N, 71, 6 or drive or walk or run or crawl... its worth it all!

PRICES
- Cheap, reasonable and again... its worth it all!

Like Fiona said... I've been a bad, bad girl...
author: Amit S.

description:
I loved the mushroom-trio pizza. Definitely going back to try other varieties sometime.
2-3 pieces is mighty sufficient and its 2.50$ a piece or 20$ for the whole pie.
author: Aussfchi R.

description:
YUM!

Every time I've walked by Arizmendi, there's a line out the door. I finally tried it with my friend J on a rainy Saturday morning, around 10:45am. The baked goods, sweet and savory, are in glass (plastic?) cases. You get a bag, some wax paper, and serve yourself.  

We were able to get in, serve ourselves, pay and get a seat in a few minutes. We were lucky; chances are you won't get a seat. Small space, only a few tables and chairs. I got their scone of the day, blueberry: berry-licous. J got the lemon poppy seed muffin. It was amazing with real lemon taste! Not just "flavor".

I came back later with my sister F on a weeknight. We shared a slice of the salted caramel (chocolate) cake, ~$4. Generous slice and so dense and rich that you definitely need someone to share with. Even my massive sweet tooth couldn't conquer it alone. They should include a glass of milk with it, lol. Now I just need to try their pizza.

Check their website for their baked goods of the day.
author: Yan E.

description: Tried yet again, and still no fruit in the fruit scones of the day. I'm not a fan of any of their regular scones (the oat, the corn-cherry),so I used to look forward to the scone of the day. There are large bits of fruit on the outside, but none inside the scone. What is going on?? A friend brought a blueberry scone from Tomales Bakery last Saturday, and we went to Arizmendi to buy their scone of the day. Sure enough, fifth time now, no fruit inside the Armizmendi scone! I've posted a photo, #231, of both scones side by side for comparison. Sorry, we're going to look elsewhere for our scones. It's the only thing I buy at Arizmendi, so I won't be going back. I love that they're a workers' collective, but I'm not going to pay for fruit-free scones anymore.
author: J. R.

description:
Arizmendi gets four stars alone for the simple fact that the guy who rang up my order said I was gorgeous. My guess is that he says that to every woman who walks in alone to buy an armful of baked goods, but I'm not complaining. 

I tried every flavor of their shortbread as well as their very well known chocolate cake with salted caramel frosting. The shortbread was great. The cake - eesh. I love the addition of salt to sweets but truthfully, I found it to be too salty. I was so disappointed because the cake was great and I could tell that the frosting was redeemable at its core, but it was just over salted. 

I'll give them the benefit of the doubt that someone was just a little overzealous with the Morton that day.
author: Aubrey O.

description: Best bakery in SF. Worker owned, and the staff is friendly. Delicious breads, cookies, foccacia and of course pizza. Favorite pizza is the St Patricks day one with Irish cheese. Love the chocolate cake too.
author: Ce Ce M.

description:
My neighborhood bakery! I come here for their foccacia, broche knots, chocolate things, scones, pecan rolls, cheese rolls and granola. Well turns out I go here for everything. But that's because it's all good! Great daily vegetarian pizza (although they're not nearly as good at Cheeseboard...).  

Really small place. A few seats inside and a few outside. You pretty much pick up what you want to eat and then head to Golden Gate Park to enjoy it comfortably. Co-op run by really nice people. It is CASH ONLY! But don't worry there are 3 banks and plenty of atm less than a block away. 

Oh and please people, the pizza isn't ready until 1130. Come back then. Thanks.
author: Tina Y.

description: Great gluten-free blueberry scones, more flavor than any gluten free bakery item I've ever had. A real whole grain flavor. Friendly staff and a parklet right outside.
author: Katharine H.

description:
The first time I came here I came with a friend. She wanted to stop by here to buy some breads. I tried the cheese roll she offered me as we left the store and I cant help but smile.

This time I decided to come here and buy some cheese rolls too. The outside was crunchy and hard but the inside was soft and light. Even my cousins liked it when I gave some to them. I think I will have to go there again tomorrow. Hopefully I'll try something new too.
author: Jen M.

description:
OMG Focaccia!

But seriously, beyond generous portions of focaccia topped with awesome cheese and vegis.  1 slice of focaccia is a meal!  They serve much better focaccia than the Valencia branch (at least in the 2 times I have visited each). 

One of the top bakeries in the city (along with Acme).  They are so popular their residential neighbors upstairs have put up signs trying to get people to stay away, but despite their protests still has great bread and a large number of customers to prove it.
author: Matthew F.

description: Can't say enough good things about this place. Almost a daily stop for us when I was pushing my son in the stroller, on our way to GG Park.  Heavenly pizza and bready things.  Don't even walk by this place if you're on a diet.
author: Susan Z.

description:
Friendly, uber delicious, and all at a reasonable price.  Possibly the reason why we moved to the inner sunset from the lower haight.

Pizzas are always good and I love the urban (forget what the full name is?) sourdough bread.  Chai is decent, though not as good as my dad's.
author: Shila S.

description: Best scones! Made with fresh fruit and not so sweet, just the way I like them. Can't eat just one
author: Heather N.

description:
Stumbled upon this place (Oakland one) while bumbling around. I made a vow, no matter what happens, you'll always have my heart Arizmendi.

EVERYTHING, I REPEAT, is well-prepared and seasoned.

P.S. Someone make a listing for Arizmendi Oakland?? I'm too lazy.
author: Kendra S.

description: Super yummy! We got the corn blueberry muffin and the specialty scone, raspberry plum. They have a $10 minimum for debit cards so make sure you have cash, or just grab another muffin for later!
author: Heather B.

description:
Legitly delish!

fresh, amazing pastries and pizza. Damn that pizza is good. I love that their specialty pizza changes daily and was soo excited to come on a day that they had the "Triple Mushroom Pizza". It was extremely flavorful with a crispy crust. Gives my fav mushroom pizza joint -- Posto in NYC a run for it's money. 

I had to grab their lavender shortbread cookies and the mint chocolate chip cookie for the road. Just HAD to!

I know it's pizza and carbs and all, but it doesn't leave you feeling weighed down, so I don't feel the least bit guilty eating it. I wish i ate more!!

I'll be back!
author: Tammy S.

description: I have really only tried their pizza here which is delicious- especially if you get it there when it is fresh and warm! After looking at other reviews I will have to try some of their pastries and cookies soon (which always look delicious!) I would recommend this place to any one craving something sweet or a healthier piece of pizza!
author: Natalie G.

description:
You really need to be convinced? Hit the bakery and check out the line out the front door.

Best pizza I've ever had.
author: Kyle M.

description:
This bakery is AMAZING!

I started going here every Sunday after shopping around the Farmer's Market on 9th ave. I've had their sliced pizza, which comes out freshly baked with great topping, as well as their sourdough chocolate, both of which tasted great. You can tell the quality of their baked goods just by the heavenly smell that stretches outside onto the street.

My only complaint is that you need to make a 10 dollar minimum purchase if you're using a card, which can be a pain if I just want something small and a coffee. Besides that though, highly recommend!
author: James F.

description: Soooo good!!! Their "chocolate thing" is to die for! An their baguettes are delicious.
author: Jennifer J.

description: My review is pretty much going to be in line with most others. This place is pure joy. Pumpkin muffins are some of the best I've ever had. Coffee is good but maybe could be stronger. Long lines move quickly.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Buying bread* at Arizmendi is a difference between traveling coach or first class for the same price. Why would you settle? 

I used to buy Milton bread at TJ or Oroweat at Safeway. Sure, they last longer - hence the preservatives. I came to Arizmendi from a recommendation through a co-worker. I use my bread for french toast, sammies, egg-in-a-hole,  ..... it's simply delectable! Supposedly, they are known for their pizza. 

Don't forget to keep your stripper cash handy, because it's CASH only.

*Freeze yo' stuff if you need to save it for later!
author: Enji L.

description:
obvoiusly a popular spot in town, this place was busy from the minute the doors opened.  This I know, because we got there 30 minutes early and had to wait... but it was worth it!  We ate cheese rolls and blueberry muffins and the staff was so friendly.  When I'm on vacation, it's places like this that kill me: I could eat every meal here, and know I'll get something yummy, but I'd miss out on all the other new eating adventures around.  

We've already eaten two meals here today.  We stopped again after the farmer's market for some foccicia.  Haven't had it since I was Italy, and it was just as delicious as I remember it being over there.
author: Anne W.

description: Haven't been here for a while since their pizzas used to be $2/slice, now $2.50. Whenever I'm here after 1130 always must get their pizza. You can't beat their always vegetarian pizza on sourdough crust. Came back the other day, still good ol Arizmendi. Always crowded during the 7am rush, when everyone's getting their morning pastries. My favorite is their basic, cheese roll, if something sweet, I get the pecan roll. I believe they're expanding too, soon there's going to be one in the mission.
author: Robin L.

description: I'll admit it. Some days, I find myself daydreaming about Arizmendi's wolverine bread. Best bread I have ever had. I love taking it home, toasting it, and slabbing some Tomato Basil Hummus from Trader Joe's on it. Plus, Arizmendi's is a cooperative----can't help but respect them even more for that!
author: Valerie F.

description: Great Ricciarelli - a delicious Italian almond base biscuit / cookie originated in Sienna (Tuscany).  These cookies are usually available during Christmas time in Italy but you can find it year-round at Arizmendi.  I always get 4-5 ($2.50/piece)  when I'm in the neighborhood.  My Italian BF loves eating it as breakfast food.
author: Veritas V.

description: They have good bread here but I think it's overrated. Good, yes. Outstanding, no.
author: Eater S.

description: Great place! Exactly what I would want from a small local bakery. And the pizza is delicious.
author: Cynthia P.

description: A Co-op to me is pretty cool, and Arizmendi Bakery has to be one of my favorite ones to visit. Their blueberry coffee cake is just to die for, the crust is so buttery, and just crumbles in your mouth. And if you like pizza, their focaccia bread is a nice option for lunch, or dinner.
author: Mars F.

description:
There's not much that I can say about this place that hasn't already been said. Everything I've tried has been amazing, in some cases, still warm from the oven. I'll just go over a few main points.

Try the pizza. It doesn't matter what flavor it is, just try it. I've never been disappointed by the pizza, especially if it has goat cheese on it.

Get a loaf of bread while you're there. The city bread is my favorite. Simple, chewy sourdough that's perfectly executed, it's delicious with a generous swipe of butter.

If you like cheese, try a cheese roll. I like to warm them up a little in the toaster. Yum!

Next time I think I'll check out some of the sweet offerings, especially the shortbread cookies and the chocolate cake!
author: Melanie V.

description:
Wow, 820 reviews in, and I'm just finding out about this place?!?! How can it be? 

But just as the reviews say, Arizmendi's is awesome. Everyday a sign outside the shop indicates the daily pizza, bread, scone, and muffin special. 

This past Sunday, the combination of sunny Sunset weather, a tiny table outside, great company, and a splice of button mushroom, spinach, and goat cheese pizza just blew my mind. So cute, so humble, so fresh, and so tasty. The crust on the pizza was just as I would have liked it, if they sold crust sticks, I'd be all over it! It may be 2x the price of a Costco pizza slice, but it's so worth it.
author: Nicole L.

description: Everything is delicious, eat everything here. If you have to choose, I recommend the pizza and the scones (but really, eat everything).
author: Rachel L.

description: Pizza of the day is awesome. Love the crispy cornmeal crust. My favorite is the shiitake with the sesame-ginger-garlic vinaigrette.  I got a slice, walked to my house a few blocks away, ate my pizza...and it was so good that I walked back and ordered another slice. Around 4pm they used to make a fresh batch of cheese rolls, sooo goood!
author: Caroline D.

description:
I'm about to make more disclaimers than I ever have for a five-star review.

To wit:  I've never stepped foot inside.  I've only had their pizza.  I've only had one kind of their pizza.  I've never paid for what I ate.

So I might not be very well qualified to write this review, but I will say that the two times I got the same kind of pizza from here it was amazing.  Very amazing.  It had baked whole cloves of garlic.  The crust was perfect.  I almost don't want to come here anymore because I might ruin the perfect image I have in my mind of this place.
author: John S.

description: I made French toast with brioche knots from Arizmendi Bakery. Delicious!
author: Eli S.

description:
An artisan bakery co-op in the heart of the Sunset (and soon the Mission).

There's lots of thing here that other bakeries have, but I go for the cheese roll and wolverines. Haven't found anything that matches them in the city.

Either with a cup of coffee in the morning and the day will be a good one.
author: Boris C.

description: Absolutely amazing. I love this bakery! My favorites are the corn-cherry scone and pecan roll. They also make delicious granola. It's toasted to perfection with the right amount of sweetness.
author: Sophia B.

description: Spinach, feta, kalamata olives thin crust pizza = great snack.  If I lived near here, I would stop in here once a day.
author: Derrick C.

description:
The original location, THE best!
My favoriate Sunday spot!

Pecan sticky bun not so good anymore. But you gotta try their focaccia pizzas squares.
Coffee cake squares delish but could use more fresh fruits inside for moisture & texture contrast. 
Scones good but not deadly
author: Keiko C.

description: Incredible fresh baked goods but I LOVE the pizza here, they post a menu on their website and everyday there's a new flavor, all with super fresh vegetables! When I come to the city, this is the place I go to!
author: Julia R.

description: Delicious currant scones! I would go back over and over just for those! They are light and moist, and have a great crunch sugar crust. The other things I have tried (cookies, bran muffin, and sourdough bread) are all fantastic as well. You walk in grab what you want and put it in a bag. When you get to the register you tell them whats inside the bag. I really appreciate how they trust the customers to tell them the truth. It kind of restores a feeling of trustworthiness amongst neighbors.
author: Riley L.

description: The way I found out that they close for the Holiday's was funny.  I had a craving for anything!   As I approached another person was also going towards the door.  I think we both realized they were closed.  Yet we both looked through the windows in hope a miracle (was the season to expect a miracle); would occur and there was someone in there baking.  I still recall we both slowly looked at each other and again turned to the window with loud sigh!  The staff does deserve a vacation because they (as Tina would sing) Simply the BEST.  I am lucky to live walking distance way!
author: Karolyn H.

description:
Delicious! 

Came here last week with some coworkers for lunch. Every day they feature a different pizza of the day, which is what we came here for! We checked their online calendar to see what pizza would be served that day. We were coming in for the pizza featuring arugula, tomatoes, and balsamic vinaigrette (mouth watering!). It would be an understatement to say I was excited. Haha. We parked in a small metered lot across the street from the bakery. Outside, the sign displayed the pizza that was being served on that day. The sign actually said a different pizza than the one we had read on the calendar. I was a little disappointed that they weren't the same but luckily the featured pizza still sounded delish.

The pizza we had was topped with spinach, fontina cheese, green olives, lemon and thyme oil. I loved it! The toppings are so fresh and flavorful, everything was just right. The crust is light and thin, my favorite! We enjoyed our pizza there along with other customers snacking on pizzas and other baked goods. This seems to be a pretty popular place since at time the line got pretty long. Aside from pizza, they sell a variety of baked goods, such as breads, muffins, scones, cookies, etc. Everything looked REALLY good but I resisted my temptation to buy something for later. 

Arizmendi Bakery is a quaint and delicious bakery and definitely worth going to. I can't wait to go back! 

PS: Don't forget cash, no plastic!
author: Janine K.

description: I love Arizmendi.  The staff are friendly and recognize all of the regulars.  The coffee is delicious and the scones are amazing.  It is dangerous to live near here because I am tempted to go every day.
author: Christy L.

description:
One of the things that I miss the most about Berkeley is the amazing food.  Berkeley is a foodie's mecca, no matter your price point.  And among the most notable Berkeley foodie experiences is Cheeseboard, a delicious pizzeria/bakery/cheese shop that serves up a different unique and mouthwatering vegetarian pizza daily.

So imagine my delight when I found out that Cheeseboard has a sister restaurant!  I've been to Arizmendi twice now, and I have been QUITE pleased each time.  Arizmendi is not exactly the same as Cheeseboard (and I must admit, I DO still prefer Cheeseboard), but it's pretty damn close.  It has a similar daily selection of unique vegetarian pizzas, but Arizmendi, unlike Cheeseboard, uses tomato sauce in many of their creations.  Tomato sauce definitely creates a different kind of pizza than the kind that Cheeseboard serves up, but Arizmendi executes its tomato sauce-based pizzas quite well!

Also, Arizmendi has a nice selection of yummy baked goods.  We bought the blueberry corn muffins and the apple scone and were very happy with both (and stuffed - they're HUGE!).  

Can't wait to try more of the baked goods and to sample more of Arizmendi's delicious pizza creations!
author: Julie S.

description:
Okay I finally get what foccacia with topping is supposed to taste like, and this is it. After being dragged all over Philly and New York in search of this mythical sustenance, after never having heard of Arizmendi's except on Yelp, I can now say Aha! I get it. This is the place if you want that kind of Italian "pizza" that tastes just as good cold or a day old. 

Having said that, I wouldn't want to set foot in this place ever again if I could help it. When we walked by the first time, there was a line out the door. When we went back later, it was crowded, loud, so we got our food to go and still got bumped into by eager customers on our way out. 

Service was friendly and efficient, but seemed surprised that we didn't order more (!). The coffee was the good kind (Equator) but they don't have lids for the cups and the sleeves they have are too big if you only want a small (It was afternoon!). 

I'm conflicted about whether I hope the one in the Mission is better, crowd-wise. I will be eating too much of this if it's at all possible to get in & get food quickly and painlessly.
author: Sam Z.

description:
Delicious wheat bread. Cheap and flavorful granola ($3.50 for a bag is a steal). Outstanding chocolate chip cookies. Excellent pizza.

I've gone twice and tried them all. I now understand why 700+ reviews later, Arizmendi rocks a solid 4.5 average review. Well, well deserved.
author: Jason B.

description:
This is a review by a vegetarian

Five stars for the pizza crust but not for the overall product.  The day I was there it was "arugula, roasted red bell peppers, manchego cheese, garlic oil, parsley". Now just look at that for a second... it's all sour. This pie really needed a sweet or salty to balance it.

Also had a "chocolate thang" which was accurate naming. It was a sort of sweet yeast bread with chocolate chips in it. Really boring , dry, with little sweet hard bits.

Things are a tad pricey. The bagettes looked good. Maybe next time.
author: Bob R.

description: Super Deliciousness!!! Absolutely heart the gluten free pumpkin muffins!! Staff is great also.
author: Isis W.

description: Okay if I had to base this review on taste this place is a 5 star no questions asked. They have the most amazing pizza, simple but packed with great flavor. I have been here several times and is are go to spot before shows and all night dance offs. So you might be wondering why I did not give this 5 stars? I am not ashamed to say it, this place give you the WORST gas. Maybe its the oil the cook with? Or maybe its too much yeast?  I have asked several people who come here and they have all had the same issue.The last time I came here was before a graduation and I  had to sit in excruciation pain for three hours. Dam you Arizmendi. I love and hate you at the same time.
author: Mitchelle M.

description:
Definitely a must-try in terms of bakeries.  Perfect for an on-the-go breakfast or lunch.  I got a slice of the spinach artichoke pizza my first time here and was so satisfied with it that I went back in and ordered the whole pie to take with me back to school.  I also tried one of each of their scones that day and enjoyed each one.  I cannot wait to go back and try more of what they have to offer.

Another thing to note is that on my way out of the bakery, I saw one of the workers coming back with boxes of fruits from the nearby farmer's market in the parking lot.  This led me to believe that all of their ingredients are fresh, making me like this place even more!
author: Andrew M.

description:
Man I almost don't even want to write this review seeing as the lines for this place are getting long enough..

I love bread and they do me well here.  (crunches on an Arizmendi baguet)  Scones are moist, flat breads delish, but the pizza.. gets me everytime!  Come by most any time of day and you will find pizza slices floating out the front door, to the front patio area and beyond.  Come around 6 and pizza boxes shuffle past with people making their final stops prior to heading home.  A unique pizza is served every day.  I'm never quite sure which type to expect but it's suffice to say that I have NEVER not treated myself with a slice.  Half-baked pizzas are good for those with long commutes and they sell their delicious sour-pizza-dough for those with ambitions of awsome homemade pies. (tho, could use a tinny-tad more sour IMO)  Pizza breads are bomb as well.  Love this place, pray it never go away.

EDIT: JK don't come here(:
author: Jason L.

description: I don't like cheese, but I can eat cheese on their pizza. I tried their pizza of the day and a focaccia bread. Both were delicious! I just wish I had eaten them in the store, as the pizza lost some of its crispness after being wrapped in aluminum foil. The pizza was so flavorful and well rounded. Delish!
author: Elaine L.

description:
Came here on a whim one afternoon with a friend to check this place off of our yelp-to-do list.  Had a tomato and cheese bread.  It was really good with a nice cheesy crunchy crust.  Then had to get the chocolate chip cookie, which was quite the delicious little dessert.

Decided that we should come more towards the morning next time for more fresh-baked bread.  Also noted that they have some amazing cheeses in their little refrigerator.  Noted!  Will be back to buy, unwrap and devour all the cheesy goodness soon enough!
author: Jane K.

description: The pizza of the day is a great option for a quick bite if you're in the area. It's always served fresh and there's usually a line out the door for it. They churn out slices as soon as the pizza leaves the oven. And don't be shy to pick up a couple of pastries on the way to the cashier.
author: John D.

description:
I've tried a few more of the breads. The rye and multigrain are both good, along with the walnut sourdough I talked about before. The baguettes however are not the best; they don't seem to get enough of a rise, and the scoring and shaping is uneven. I go to Thorough Bread and Pastry for baguettes now (or just get Acme baguettes at Whole Foods).

I've had a chance to try to pizza. If you call them before 10am, they will make one without cheese. I did that, and wow it was good, but then caramelized onions are one of my favorites, and that was the topping that day (with tomatoes and balsamic vinaigrette).
author: Earl K.

description: The cherry scone alone warrants this rating - and I am not even a scone fan!  Breadstick was tasty, albeit on the chewy side.  We also grabbed a cookie sampler bag, which was outstanding (ginger snaps were my favorite!)
author: Doug C.

description: Everything I have tried was very good. I especially love the pizzas, focaccias, and shortbreads. Mmmmm!
author: John W.

description:
I finally had a chance to try this place over the weekend. I frequently visit 9th and Irving area for lunch or dinner, but I've never seen Arizmendi Bakery. I don't know how I even missed this place because the line is out the door and the smell of fresh baked goods looms the exterior of the bakery.

The scene:

Did I mention the place is packed? The bakery makes everything from coffee cake to focaccia to fresh baked bread to pizza. Customers pick out what they want from the bins and bring it to the register to pay. The pizzas are behind the counter and you can buy it as a whole, a half or even by the slice. Arizmendi also has a baking schedule that lists out what type of pizza and bread they will make daily.

The food:

There served 2 types of pizzas that day. A triple mushroom with sesame-ginger vinaigrette and a gorgonzola with housemade sauce. We got a slice of each and the total came to $4.50.

Triple Mushroom w/Sesame-ginger Vinaigrette pizza - The crust is thin and crunchy, the toppings are hearty from the loads of mushrooms and the sauce has the perfect hint of Asian vinaigrette that gives the pizza some pizzazz.

Gorgonzola with housemade sauce pizza - I have no idea what the housemade sauce is, but it's good. This pizza was my favorite of the pair. The potent gorgenzola and the tangy white sauce will make any cheese lover give a thumbs up.

I'd love to go back to try the coffee cake. That seemed like the popular item at the bakery.
author: Sam L.

description:
Three words: Blueberry Cornbread Muffin.

I love this little shop. I stop here on the way to word whenever I forget to eat breakfast. Everything here is good, but my favorite is the blueberry cornbread muffins. yum!
The coffee isn't anything to write home about, but everything is organic! I haven't tried their pizza, but I have had their scones, and rolls and buns...my mouth is watering just thinking about them.
Most definitely worth a stop!
Sadly, I don't think they are open on Mondays for that Monday morning wake up rush. But that means an extra stop on Tuesday morning.
author: Krystal W.

description:
Between my desk job and the indescribably euphoric scone of the day, I wouldn't be surprised if by next year I turn into a short round waddling person who can barely squeeze into that narrow little green door. Sorry Mom, I knew you wanted me to look decent for Josh's wedding.

And yet I assure you, dear reader, that I will still be beaming with utter, utter contentment as I fall to the ground from the inevitable cardiac arrest induced by Arizmendi's whole-milk mochas and glorious hot chocolate.
author: Kat A.

description: I wanna work at Arizmendi for 1 week just so I can steal the recipe for that olive provolone bread.  My GOD!!!  It's soooo good.  I have achieved culinary perfection.  You get the olive provolone bread and warm it for 10 minutes at 250.  Then slice it and put salami and mortadella on it.  Mmmmm!  It's a good thing I went to the gym today.  Oh yeah don't forget the pinot noir!!!
author: Poochie M.

description: I have been coming here since they opened.  I love the their pastries and the Chai Tea is my favorite in the city.
author: Ted S.

description:
Try anything here!  I bet it's going to be great.  If there's better bakeries in the City other than here and Tartine, I dare someone to tell me about them.

I like to get the savory focaccia items, but choosing just one item each visit is so hard.  They have a terrific selection of seasonal items.  

Great location next to Golden Gate Park.  If you visit the De Young or CA Academy of Sciences, take some time to stop by Arizmendi before or afterwards.  

Closed on Mondays but delicious every day after that!
author: Colleen C.

description:
This place is one of my favorite places to visit in San Fran. I love getting a slice of pizza for lunch and taking a pastry home for dessert. Their pizzas are sooo good! I had a spinach, goat cheese, mushroom, and artichoke pizza and I really had to try to eat it slow, which was virtually impossible, cause i wanted to savor every bite.

If you haven't tried Ariz Mendi, you need to!!
author: Irene K.

description:
I started coming here for the cherry corn scones, but now I go for the bialys. I love this place! It is part of my weekend routine. I go at least once per weekend and pick up something for breakfast on my way to The Beanery for coffee, and then Golden Gate Park to sit and enjoy.

Anyway, the bialys have been my baby for about a year now. I love them and think about them mid week. They are that good! Salty, oniony, poppy seedy. Yummy.

I'd give five stars, but for a few reasons. I'm not a fan of their loaves of bread. It's just not that good. The crust is always this weird texture somewhere between crunchy and tough. I just don't like it. They're also really inconsistent. Sometimes the bialy's are delicious and look great, but other times they are totally inconsistently sized, oily, or over/under salted. Get a recipe--you're professionals. The product you sell shouldn't be different every time you make it. And third, their coffee sucks! Seriously, worst coffee ever.

But overall, they're my favorite bakery! Everyone is so nice, and the things I like are delicious, even if they're inconsistently delicious.
author: Adriana A.

description: Freidnly service. Different special pizza on the day is great. On Good friday, I stopped in while running some errands & had a slice of pizza spinach with feta, olives spinach & sundried tomatoes-yum! Only thing is its a bit pricey-$2.75 a per slice. they had lots of other yummy looking scones, foccacia, pastries & even challah. I'll definitely stop in again!
author: Maria T.

description: This little bakery is great! Fresh baked goods, the place smells amazing every time I walk by. I used to frequent Arizmendi at least 3 times a week (before I found out I have a gluten intolerance) and they always had something new. So much goodness in one little place, really friendly staff too! This place is a 5 star bakery, but I put 4 stars because I really wish they had gluten free and sugar alternative goods. That would make this place the PERFECT little bakery, in my opinion!
author: Lia S.

description:
This place surprised me. It was incredible, fresh and tasty. nuff said. And it didnt really have that doughy feel to any of our buns. Very light and decent. You guys rock.

And by the way, definitely get the scones and the rolls for breakfast. You will not be disappointed.
author: Kris K.

description:
Only 685 reviews? Oh...I need to add one then.

Love the bread...don't care so much for the pizzas. Sure wish it was less expensive so when I'm buying a bunch of stuff I don't need to pull out multiple twenties.

HATE the lines. If there was a better way to handle the honor-system payments, I'd dig it. I know how much my stuff is, as do many customers when they get up there. Most give tips anyway and just pay, turn and walk out. So get rid of the 5 minute line wait and just give me a big bucket to drop my cash into so I can be on my way.
author: Scot B.

description:
wolverine!

that's really the only word you need to know for a 5 star experience at this fantastic little bakery. but i could also include words like "pizza," "cookies," "rolls," "coffee," and "everything." all of those words would also lead you to a 5 star bakery experience here. gitchyoself sum.
author: Theresa P.

description:
I moved to San Francisco without having ever been here before.  My boyfriend and I came on a whirlwind tour to pick out apartments, very quickly settling on our abode in the Inner Sunset.  My boss said, "Oh, that's a great spot.  I have friends who choose their apartments based upon their proximity to Arizmendi."  I smiled and nodded and thought, "Huh.  Good bakery, I guess."  That turned out to be the understatement of the century.

There's really nothing I don't love about Arizmendi.  I love the physical space: bright, happy, natural-looking, and typically squashed full of people.  I love the cute little benches and tables outside and the cute little birds nomming up every crumb.  I like the sign that sits just outside the door featuring the pizza of the day, that features a loving hand-painted rendition of said crumb-nomming birds.  I love the pots full of coffee, the fridge full of cheese, the racks full of freshly baked whatevers.

I love the people.  I love the patrons, of course - the hippies, yuppies, families, people of all ages and races stuffing their faces with astoundingly similar expressions of glee every time I pass them on the street.  I love being sandwiched inside the bakery with all of these different people and feeling the quiet guilt and camaraderie of a shared addiction.  I love the people who work at Arizmendi, who have been nothing but kind and informative to me, and who seem to really like their jobs.

And (you knew this was coming) I love the food.  I love that there are favorites produced daily that are reliably delicious, I love that there's a weekly rotation of some items to mix things up.  I love that there's a different pizza every day and I love that I get to go on their website to determine the most mouthwatering selections, and heartily declare those days pizza days.  I love that there are even specialer specials around the holiday.  Strawberry rhubarb pie for the 4th of July and hot cross buns on Easter.  I love wolverines.  Those little wads of sourdough stuffed with dried fruit are my go-to breakfast when I want something substantial to nosh.  They're like raisin bread on steroids, and they're delicious.  I love their focaccia: a little salty, a little oily, but with enough vegetable matter to make it worth my while.  I love their Asiago cheesyrollthings.  I don't even have to tell you why, do I?  And I love their pizza for its creative toppings slathered on generously atop a crust that's thin but still deliciously doughy and chewy.

Mostly, I love what Arizmendi represents.  It represents the power of neighborhood ties, the uniqueness of local businesses, and the idea that it's worth making everything with really good ingredients.  And maybe they don't need my five stars - you've probably read plenty of drooly reviews.  But they are ever worthy of said drool.  I'm really glad I otherwise like my neighborhood, because I think I need to make sure I stay close by...
author: Becca S.

description:
Great place for baked goods in the Sunset.

The daily pizza is is constantly revolving.  The crust could be a bit lighter but it still is very good.  So when your favorite favor comes up, you can stuff half a pizza in the freezer for that lonely night.  Believe or not it's even better re-toasted in the oven.

Another thing not to miss out on, the chocolate tea bread...mmm!
author: MTBer I.

description:
My go-to bakery for extremely fresh(most of the time still warm!) baked goods. 

The blueberry corn muffin is my favorite breakfast. Cherry corn scone is also delicious. Just slightly sweet and I'm on love with the cornmeal crunch. 

I also love their focaccia. My favorite so far was the carmelized onion and goat cheese. Soooo good. Today I had a warn tomato/mushroom-very good. They also had a ridiculously tempting dessert foccacia covered in blueberries, nectarines and strawberries-must go back for that. 

They have good quality coffee and my fav orange San pellegrino as well.
author: Julie M.

description:
Spiritual sister to Berkeley's famous Cheese Board and Pizza Collective, this place offers fantastic breads, pastries and a changing daily flatbread pizza that is almost always delicious.

Its tiny and cramped and parking is difficult, but I can suggest stopping by after a nice bike ride through golden gate park or hop on the N-Judah street car to get here.

The pizza is unique in that there is a single offering; it is always vegitarian; there is rarely tomato sauce; and cheeses tend towards exotics instead of mozzerella.  So its more of a flatbread, but its fantasitc and healthy.

Pastry-wise, I would highly recommend the cherry-corn scones which are light and fluffy with a bit of sweetness from the corn.  Fantastic stuff.

Overall....not quite as good as cheeseboard, but its still great.
author: Matthew B.

description: I heart you Arizmendi for your delicious & fresh top quality baked goods, friendly service and cheap prices! Worker owned too. All around terrific!
author: Rachel D.

description:
Love the food. Love the idea. Love the shirt I bought there 5 years ago. Great pastries, pizza and everything else, including the way they treat their employees.

Short and sweet, just like Arizmendi. Go here. 700-odd people probably aren't wrong.
author: DJ G.

description:
Always delicious. Always packed, but manageable. Always CASH only. This is the only reason I don't go as often as I'd like. Sometimes I gotta save my cash for some fresh veg from Park's - which is more valuable than a Bialy. My favorite little baked good EVER....

SO thankful to live within a block of this place.
author: Elizabeth Z.

description:
yeah honestly i dont get it.

i try to limit my intake of refined carbohydrates, and i probably haven't bought a loaf of white bread in years. so when i go to a bakery, i expect it to be be damn good. 

arizmendi was not that. in short, it wasn't worth it. not worth the price, not worth waiting in line for their pizza, not worth the trouble of going to the ATM to get cash.

yes, it was not BAD. but how can any combination of flour, butter, sugar and cheese be BAD? it wasn't as good as the hype.
author: lily c.

description:
Love this place good thing I don't live close by or I would gain 10 lbs every week eating here. Good for a snack or a quick bite on the run.
So many things to choose from all fresh and delish.
author: Chris S.

description:
Arizmendi's oat scones are so good just like country side bakery--Chiroru--in the old-town Kiyosato Japan.  I get so nostalgic from eating the scone at Arizmendi that I start to cry happiness and was moved by the memories of all-natural Jersey cows eating the fresh grass and making the delicious milk.

Also, Arizmendi brand coffee is sooo good and delicious that I want to share with all friends and tell the world.  Maybe next time I can bring a big bucket and they can sell to me 10x large so I can bring the bucket as an omiyage gift--enjoy the taste and deright of beautiful San Francisco people!
author: Chi C.

description:
Rant: why don't you take credit cards?? I understand the small Asian markets and their aversion to anything non-cash, but you do such a high volume of business I hope in the future you reconsider. 

Arizmendi is my standby bakery for coffee+pastry when I don't have time to eat breakfast at home. The pastries are BIG and will definitely fill you up. My current fave is the corn blueberry muffin- like cornbread but sweeter! Yum!! Also tried the cheese roll (not my style), sourdough+olives and tomatoes (soooo good. Savory pastries should be offered more often!), blueberry scone (what can I say? all scones are pretty dry and crumbly), wolverine (brioche with chocolate).... the list goes on. 

Arizmendi also has BIG pizza slices for sale by the lb, but my only attempt to try one was thwarted when I realized I didn't have cash. Sigh. I'll get over this tiny annoyance because I love their pastries so much. The employees are all so nice and welcoming when you come in, it warms the hippy in my heart to know it's a co-op.
author: Amaranta C.

description: Loved this place during my visit, the Strawberries n' Cream scone was delicious. The cheese roll was also really good, nice location near Golden Gate Park, so you can buy your snack and then take a walk.
author: Sydney K.

description:
