With the lack of service is sort of disappointing, but understandable. I have never seen more than two people working  there at one time, and the line is often out the door and being understaffed doesn't stop this place from being a great place to grab bite to eat on the way to work. I implore you to try it out you won't be disappointed.
author: Spencer G.

description: I came in here expecting it to be up to par with the Arizmendi by Lake Merrit in Oakland. Not even close. It was just another dry scone to the mouth and a burnt coffee to slurp it down. I''ll give you another shot but you should change your name to Arizemendi (not to be confused with the better one in East Bay).
author: R J.

description:
love this bakery. favorite items: 
scone of the day, huge square shaped foccacias (take them home and retoast in a toaster oven - super delicious!), round brioche things w dark chocolate chips, sliced pizza of the day. 
best to come right when they open when theses babies are still toasty warm.
author: C A.

description: Arizmendi serves muffins, scones, pastries, biscuits, foccacias, the list goes on. I first came here with my cousin who lived close by at the time and must have not thought much of it because the experience wasn't memoriable. Now that I live close by to the shop, I think there's a lot of hype, not saying that the baked goods aren't tasty, but I much prefer Tartine bakery. I will say that the pizzas are awesome because the dough is nice and sticky and it's cool because they change each day. As a person who generally likes thin pizzas, I would like the pizzas here more if they increased the topping to dough ratio. The other items are only okay. I recommend to try the pizzas here or just get anything that was baked freshest (they bring these out throughout the morning).
author: Justine C.

description: I have to say that I prefer the Oakland outlet of this wonderful bakery. I love the coop vibe and the sense of pride everyone involved shows in what they do. Pizza is seasonal and creative and the scones are out of this world. I guess it is just navigating that part of the sunset that pulls a star from this gem.
author: DyAnne F.

description: Great place to go for a cup of  coffee and some pastry in the morning. Personal favorites are their blueberry coffee cake, strawberry scone, and  almond cookie. Grateful to have Arizmendi Bakery in our neighborhood.
author: jjj j.

description:
When I was working across the City, I loved to stop here in the mornings for coffee and a baked treat before transferring buses. Since being laid off four months ago due to economic downsizing, I have been back only once and I am craving their scones, coffee and just the atmosphere there. 

Yesterday I stopped by but it was different because it was noontime, the highlights were mostly foccacia and pizza. I bought my scone of the day and a slice of pizza anyway. 

The good: The first time for pizza (but definitely not the last);
The bad: I missed my coffee.
author: susan t.

description:
:] just thinking about that slice of pizza i had at this place brings a smile to my face!!!! it was so.... refreshing to have a really simple yet outrageously tasty slice of pizza. I love their crust! It's a thin crust- crunchy, but not too crunchy... it's indescribable! :sigh: its too bad my flight back to LA leaves in a few hours or else I would totally drag my luggage there. 

good bye SF!  Good bye Arizmendi! :tears:
author: Ana M.

description:
This is my favorite bakery in the city as well as my most frequent lunch destination. I work in the neighborhood, so I often need to grab a bite fast. Their Pizza of the Day is to die for. Every day it is different and delicious. My favorite is Yukon Gold Potatoes with roasted garlic and pesto. No, it's tripple mushroom with sesame-ginger-garlic vinaigrette. But I really love artichoke heart, red onion and tomato. $4.50 for two slices then a salad from Crepevine or Plutos makes a damn good meal.

The bakers are friendly and efficient. The scones are the best. I love you Arizmendi, thank you.

Also, their scone and pizza menu is available online. I check it out every morning before work so that I can look forward to lunch that much more.
author: Roseann B.

description: What can i say that wasn't already said. Not much but the scones and pecan roll are top shelf. I don't even like raisins that much, but the pecan roll draws me in every time. They get you in and out quickly with wonderful tasty treats. Even the pizzas are wonderful and make fresh daily. Go here for breakfast, for a snack and don't be afraid to hover and wait until they bring out something hot. Whatever it is, grab it, you will like it. Its a little bit of a zoo, but best americanish bakery ever.
author: Nate S.

description:
Amazing mushroom pizza with garlic oil that just makes your tastebuds dance. I love the sourdough pizza crust they use. Their baked goods are good as well. However, their scones are not the moist and buttery type that I prefer. They're the dry and crumbly type. I thought the brioche would be more of e dense, buttery bread, but it's more of a slightly sweet eggy bread. It's great to have this place in the Sunset though.

Note: Yes, sometimes the line is long. Yes, even if you're buying some prebaked pizza and only need $2 change, you still have to wait in line just like everyone else. Don't get all huffy about it. Everyone else has to wait too.
author: Crystal L.

description: My friend and I was there at around 4 pm on Thursday, April 11, 2013 to buy a whole pizza. We asked them to help us divide the whole pizza into four bags so we can share it with some of our friends who have never tried it before. When the male worker was cutting the pizza, both my friend and I witnessed that he gave two slices from our whole pizza away to another customer and cut the remainder of our pizza into eight slices to give to us. When we brought this issue up to the female cashier, she questioned the male worker if he gave two slices of our whole pizza away. The guy lied and stated he did not. The cashier stated if there's eight pieces in the bags then there's no missing slices. We checked all the slices before eating and found out that four of the slices were half a size of a regular slice. Since they are an employee owned business, I'm not sure if they are trying to cheat people to gain more profit. I have been a supporter of them for many years and now I have to think if they are worth supporting. So be careful of what you buy there.
author: Ben H.

description: Yummy homemade granola, delectable pecan rolls, amazing focaccia, and the pizza, yum!  Pretty much you can't go wrong with anything at Arizmendi.  I'm almost glad I live further away from Arizmendi than I used to because the temptation to have their pastries or pizza or bread all the time might be too much!  Every once in a while, my boss at work brings in a big bag of goodies from here and it all gets swooped up in seconds.
author: Lauren H.

description:
this place is everyone's favorite.  huge selection of fresh pastries..  muffins, cookies, fresh loaves from sourdough to cinnamon raisin goodness..  scones and cakes and made-to-order gifts and unfortunately sometimes a line out the door because of it.  

It's a nice place to get bread for home or grab a snack to go with your coffee..
author: dule i.

description: My first time at Arizmendi I was overwhelmed.  There are 15 people are scrounging around in these bins where you apparently pick out your own delicious pastery.  I picked out a pecan sticky roll thing and it was SOOO good.  The craziness in accessing the yumminess was well worth it.
author: Michelle L.

description:
their chocolate chip cookies are amazing.. but pricey... their double chocolate tea cake was delectable... but too crumbly! their focaccia was... not so good and their pizza selection... yea not so good either, i mean, you don't have cheese pizza? just one flavor for the day? ok.. fine... i'll come back on a better tasting day.

I have cravings for those chocolate chip cookies though.
author: A. H.

description:
Go get thier Pizza!!!

Half bake you can take home.....real good also.

Best bakery in town.
author: Brendan R.

description: My friend introduced me to this bakery before our hike yesterday and I immediately fell in love. The chocolate things, scones, and muffins are all very good. The pizza is amazing, and the lavender cookies are my favorite. Everything is organic and freshly made...if you're in the area I would definitely recommend stopping in for a quick bite!
author: Cindy C.

description: O man its busy maybe I can just jump out real quick and you circle the block and pick me up. O wait I see someone backing out of that spot back there, OK back up, cool! got it, now find quarters for meter, Oh man I found just three we need to hurry then. Hey look it says free on the meter. It must be free on Sundays, awesome! Then we walked in. At this point I'm saying I am so glad we found Yelp and started exploring. This place is the bomb, yes I said bomb and I don't care. We picked two items each and everything we picked was delicious and oh so fresh. I love the self serve cases and the politeness of the staff which surprised me given how busy it was. We really enjoyed our experience at Arizmendi bakery so much that we are planning a trip to SF just to eat there.
author: Mandy S.

description: Oh, Azrimendi. You combine my love of rock & roll looking boys, strong ass coffee, & all the beautiful things yeast has to offer us. Who knew all those together could equal such perfection? And you're a co-op too! Just one more reason to dream of moving into the idyllic land of the Inner Sunset.
author: Maria D.

description: I'm not sure how it is even possible that I have never reviewed Arizmendi Bakery. While I don't like in the neighborhood anymore, I did for almost two years and Arizmendi was my favorite place to go, whether for their delicious gourmet pizza, or the sweet cookies, or their savory scones. I don't recall every buying anything here that I was not in love with. Even now that I live in another part of the city, I still trek over to 9th and irving to have some of their delicious pizza, there is just nothing else like it in the city.
author: Allyson S.

description: I was so sad when I moved out of the Sunset because I was leaving this delicious bakery.  Whenever I needed a pick me up, it was time to go to Arizmendi for pizza and chocolate kookie brittle.  And I tell you, it worked every time.
author: Stacy R.

description:
Mmm fresh veggies n cheese on a crisp thin crust while chillin on a Saturday (or was it Sunday?) with the BF....perfect.

Hmm, this sounds familiar. Ah yes, reminds me of Cheeseboard (http://www.yelp.com/biz/cheeseboard-collective-berkeley#hrid:4jRvg9iyqt0rB0RPjvEzgg)! Arizmendi is Cheeseboard's sister and I'm so happy it's close by!! The BF took me to Cheeseboard on one of our early dates....that time, we ate maybe half the pizza in one sitting. Now that he and I are quite well established, the true Christine comes out. Seems the same goes for him cause we finished that whole pie. Being that Arizmendi only has a few seats inside and outside, all of which were taken, we couldn't eat there, but don't you worry! I had a slice out and in my mouth before we took two steps away from Arizmendi's door. And another slice in my tummy before I parked and walked into my house. Few minutes later, good bie pizza pie. Mmm. The only sad thing is that they don't give you a couple of extra slices when you buy a whole pie like Cheeseboard does :( It's ok. I forgive you Arizmendi. Because I like your pizza.
author: Christine L.

description: The pizza ranges from good to great (although not as good as the Cheeseboard), and you'll never be disappointed with the quality of the ingredients.  I've never been thrilled with the pastries, however.  They tend to be a little bit more dense than I'd like, but some folks might like that.
author: Ernest S.

description: Love their cornbread blueberry muffins - sooooo good!  Great pizza, but not always a fan of the flavor combinations, but just personal preference.  The pizza crust has a nice sourdoughy taste and chew to it.  They also have vegan baked goods for the vegans out there.
author: s z.

description: The cheese roll is super delicious, the foccacia is wonderful, and the lavender short bread is perfect.
author: Lauren M.

description: I've been meaning to try Arizmendi for years. Finally, thanks to a nearby appointment, I tried the pizza. Incredibly delicious, although a bit oily (nee greasy) for my taste. I'm relieved I don't live any closer, or I'd be eating way to much pizza.
author: Seth B.

description: I USED to love this bakery up until the day I found a mouse poo on my cheese roll! HORK! I cringe EVERY time I think about the fact that I almost put that sh*t(literally) in my mouth! And HOW did I know it was poo you ask? Well, as I was biting into this delicious softness, I saw this thing in the shape of a little turd sittin' on top of the roll. So I pick it off and examine it to find lil fluffies on it! EW! I throw away the turd and look at this delicious roll as the pig in me asks "can i continue eating this?". But the food monitor in me says "HELL no, WTF are you thinkin'??! THROW that sh*t AWAY!".
author: Christina S.

description: I struggled between 4 and 5 stars on this one.  I have to say, their stuff is amazing.  I love the apricot almond cookie, and everything is fresh and homemade- plus the cooperative set up of the business is a plus.  The coffee is fantastic-organic fair trade.  the line gets a little long around lunchtime (because it is so good) and the homeless man outside is irritating (although not dangerous).  Also, plan for cash only, its irritating if you forget.
author: Jojo R.

description: YUM. the pizza there is really just as good as everyone says it is. this is a quaint little bakery - i've also had their breads, muffins, scones,.... ALL GREAT! definitely recommend it. im' surprised its not more packed all the time
author: christine c.

description: A little too earnest crunchy whole grain hippie bread for my taste but there is no denying the quality and flavor of Arizmendi's baking. Breads stand out over pizzas and sweet things.
author: patrick g.

description: We are unabashedly sweet tooth people so when we ran across Arizmendi bakery we spied and immediately ordered the Salted Caramel Chocolate Cake. It is beyond belief good! Everything else in the place looked good too and the staff if just great. We'll be back!
author: Jim M.

description: Egad this place was mediocre.  Needed breakfast near the park.  This place had good yelp reviews.  I was scared when I picked up a scone and it weighed about 3x what I hoped it would based on size.  I only finished it because I needed the calories.  The brioche roll I got was a bit dry, dense, overly sweet and not-at-all buttery.  Bleh.  Only good part was the foccacia pizza slice my SO got.  Bread part was good, veggie toppings were reasonably well cooked and seasoned.  I didn't even dare try a muffin, they looked like from a box recipe(!)
author: Jason R.

description: I have been a regular to Arizmendi for more than 3 years. I stopped by lunch today and bought 2 slices of pizza for $5.  Mind you I know that normally their slices are small, but today the cashier gives me two meager slices of pizza that were the last of a pie. He passes it to me in their basket and I look at them and glance at him.  I smiled and asked "aren't these slices unusually small?" and he smiled back and said that that is supposed to be normal and the other slices they give are meant to spoil us.  I look at everyone else eating in and their single slice of pizza is almost as big as my two slices combined. I asked him if I could wait for slices from the next pizza but he just stared at me blankly.  I mistakenly took them as I should have gotten my $5 back to get a proper lunch. It took me less than 2 minutes to eat as I basically ate one slice of pizza cut in two. If they started weighing their pizza slices like they do for most of the other items then my two slices would have been $2.75 based on weight instead of $5 and everyone else's single slice would have been $2.50. It was obvious to both of the workers standing at the register that I was upset eating my pizza. They look at you as if you have nothing to complain about even if they are ripping you off. They should have offered me a smaller than normal slice of pizza to compensate for my slices being so tiny. They obviously don't care about customer service or try to rectify a situation if there is a problem.
author: C L.

description:
what else is there to say...
pizza-incredible!
scones-out of this world
provolone olive roll- cheesy chewy delicious
wolverine roll-fruit+nuts+dense bread=excellent
pecan rolls-worth every fattening crumb
vegan cookies-surprisingly satisfying, I dare say you wouldn't know unless they told you!

add a great selection of teas and coffee...PERFECT!
author: rachel c.

description: Awesome scones, bran muffins and other breaded goodies.  There is a little nook with benches you can sit at and chat with the friendly patrons while munching on your treats.  Awesome addition to this neighborhood.
author: Rick H.

description:
My son and I go to arizmendi practically every day..the scones are to die for, the pecan rolls--YUM! My son is particularly in love with the brioche knot. The baguettes and cakes are probably the best I've ever tasted
 Today we went and got accosted by a homeless person so I think our visits will have to be less frequent..A shame but our safety is just too important..
author: Simone H.

description: Cookies, cookies, cookies.  I'm 5 years old with a  chunk of frisbee-sized peanut butter cookie in my mouth, and a bag full of chocolate chip and chocolate cookies for later, ensuring I'm going to need at least two more glasses of milk.  Honestly, this is the only way I know how to ensure I get my daily calcium.
author: Hugh B.

description: One of my favorite places in the city. All of the baked goods are fresh and delicious and the staff is always friendly. The Pizza! Oh the pizza is simply amazing. It's 2 bucks a slice for organic, sourdough chewy crispy crust topped with locally grown and inventive ingredients like shiitake mushroom and sesame vinaigrette, or  blue cheese and parsley oil.  It's a rotating menu of all vegetarian (though you'd never miss the meat) combinations in perfect portions with great seating. Simple lunch on 9th rounded off with a lavender shortbread cookie. Perfection.
author: Nadia P.

description:
Amazing baked goods, awesome staff, good prices! I've never had anything here I didn't adore, so though my tastebuds protest, I don't frequent this place nearly as much as I'd like to. If I did, my butt might not fit through the door!

Love their scones, pizza & chocolate cake. I could eat their brioche every single day.

Long lines on the weekends but don't let them deter you. Lines move very fast.
author: Lisa M.

description: super baller. every day the baked goods are amazing.  pizza, rolls, cookies, bread...even the coffee is dandy.  you must eat the foods here.  the employees are happy, too.  but not overly happy to the point that it makes you question your own life choices and wonder why you don't work at a bakery.  they will bring the perfect amount of happiness into your life.  dig it.
author: Ben C.

description:
yay! this place is a yumtasm. the pizza is GREAT though the slices are v small. people have no idea how to queue here, but nevermind that. everyone behind the counter loves their job (so it seems) and they also tout the best coffee in the neighborhood. i should know as i've completely replaced water with coffee and booze.

avoid wearing fur here. it is frowned up and i am surprised they didn't throw berry compote on me the other week.
author: Candice R.

description: Yum, yum, and yum! I live in the city, have always drove by this bakery on my way to the park, and never ever made a stop. I know, right?! This time around, I decided to check out the goodness in the goodies that people are biting into. I walked in and realized that you get to choose what goods you want on the shelves in the glass case, place it in goody bags, and take it to the register to pay (yes, I know! I used the word "good" several ways in my sentences, mind you! Ha!). FYI, they don't accept credit cards! So far, I've tried the cheese bread, blueberry scone, spinach focaccia, and the chocolate mint cookie. They sure were all fresh and scrumptious to the last bite. Their customer service is great as well! :) I shall return to try their slices of pizza's next time!
author: Honor J.

description: Unbelievable pizza!!! The pizza of the day when I went was spinach, feta, tomato, garlic oil and parsley. It was phenomenal. In terms of pizza that I have had in San Fran, this is rivaled only by the one, the only, Delfina
author: Evan S.

description: Needed a quick lunch before hopping into a bar for the world cup. Caught this cute bakery's eye and ate their pizza and now I must go back for more pizza and more doughy goodness. Their pizza is the best I have had in California. $2 a slice it changes everyday and is always vegetarian. I can't wait to stock up on treats to eat for breakfast. Going back soon ...
author: Sari G.

description: Everything I've had here is delicious!   From the muffins to the pizza (which you can smell from blocks away), each item is made with organic ingredients by the co-op members.  Hippies can cook.
author: Bert M.

description: woah. just had their chocolate cake with salted caramel frosting. get it.
author: Lucy M.

description: Not surprised to see so many 5 star ratings here. Arizmendi is an absolute Inner Sunset gem. They get a 5 star just for their corn cherry scones, which are fantastic.  I'm also a huge fan of their pumpkin cheese cake, which is always a hit with guests. A pain in the ass to park if you're driving, but right in front of the muni stop if you're using public transportation. You'd be silly not to check this place out, especially if you're in the area.
author: Lucas M.

description: I know everyone raves about this place, but they need to work on ventilation.  When they bake something with cheese, everything tastes like cheese, whether it's supposed to or not.  I really don't want my currant scone to taste like asiago cheese.
author: Paul S.

description: Arizmendi is both a baking bonanza and one of my favorite places to experience european neighborhood food.  They understand artisan baking like few other places in the Bay Area. They serve the gamut of baked goods from foccacia to cookies to muffins to breadsticks and pizza.  The pizza is vegetarian thin crust and rotates incredible ingredients everyday. Go for a slice for around $2 or the the pie for $16.  They also have artisan cheeses that are not to be overlooked.  Bring one home with your bread and thank me in the morning.
author: Phil M.

description: Everything is delicious, but the pizzas (which are so fresh they almost seem healthy) and the coffee cake are my faves. And you can feel good about supporting them because it's worker-owned. Great place.
author: Tamara M.

description: This is my favorite bakery in my hood. Some of my favorite things from there are- Berry coffeecake (only on certain days, check menu for specifics), chocolate things (delicious choco chip bread like things), the bread, the pizza. You get the idea- just about everything is good. The chocolate cake and the chocolate cake w/salted caramel is amazing. Cash only, so bring your bills with you.
author: Mistress E.

description: The bakery goods here look good.  But this stuff will make you body fat and wallet skinny.  Since I am fat and have a skinny wallet this is the perfect spot for me.  I usually come here before I eat lunch or dinner down the street.  I need an appetizer tyo get me in the mood to eat.  I tried a $2.50 cheese roll that was cold.  It was just ok.  The pizza here is pretty good.  They have different types of pies everyday so check out their website before you go.  One of these days I want a slice with sauce on it.  They tend to make their pizzas sauceless.  I like sauce.  Can't you tell?  The next time I stop in about a year I might try the focaccia.  They charge by the pound so I was scared I was going to ring up a $10 piece of focaccia.  I need a new job.
author: Fatty A.

description: Cherry-cornmeal scone. Breakfast of champions. And when you order a hot chocolate you can be happy that you are getting organic milk. yippee! because breakfast doesn't have to mean breast cancer. (high five)
author: Jessica W.

description: They've got these big chewey pretzels that are all you can eat five dollars? Get out of here!
author: Molly E.

description:
.
                                                     cheese bread
                                                       olive bread
                                                      gourmet pizza
                                                    chocolate things
                                                      brioche knots
                                                    wolverine bread
                                                  corn cherry scones
                                      ---------------------------------------------
                             ARIZMENDI BOOTY  equals BIGGER BOOTY
                                                  (happily earned)
author: Pelle Y.

description: Like cheeseboard in berka-lee but in good ol' SF.  Smells so good when you're walking by in the the hood.  Everything I've had there is delicious, from their coffee cake and breadsticks to their pizza which changes everyday.  Great place to stop by beforehand if heading a block over to Golden Gate Park and you want to have a picnic.  They have a fridge there w/ a small selection of cheeses.
author: Dik Shun K.

description: I love this place... too bad it's not around the corner from my home.  My bf goes there nearly every morning.  He'll get up at what seems like the butt crack of dawn & will drive 15 min. just to get their scones... which come in different flavors (usually at least 3 to choose from) & will have just the right amount of crusted sugar on top.  Their pizza breads don't just look delish... they are.  Everytime I go in for a pastry (their cookies are yummers too), I always debate about taking a pizza home for lunch or dinner.  And, I've never had the cheesecake, but it sits there on a throne atop the counter just as you're paying, and one of these days, my tempation will take hold of me, and I'm gonna get a slice!  The line can be long, but it goes by pretty quickly...
author: Christine O.

description: If and whenever I am in the Sunset in the morning this is hands down my favorite place to grab a cup of coffee and om nom nom nom on some pastries.
author: daniel m.

description: Oh my.  Have you ever tasted a more perfect scone? Baked fresh, on site, just for me.  I also need to mention that I haven't had such a good latte in a very long time.  Friendly staff, great product, and outdoor seating to enjoy the inner sunset drizzle while you sip your hot bevie.
author: Sarah S.

description: Why a five u ask?  To start the best scones and muffins in town period.  Oh and if you haven't heard their pizzas are just dripping with goodness.  They use different toppings daily and just kill it with the perfect amount of subtle ingredients and tasty veggies.  I think i will be there tomorrow morning.
author: omar b.

description: You feel good walking into this place (patroning worker own co-ops makes me feel warm and fuzzy.) But you feel even better walking out because in your hand is a comforting slice of rustic pizza or a sweet baked treat.
author: Kathryn T.

description: Even the crumbs are worthy.  Super place, super vibe.  One trip the gal at the register commented on my wolverine roll that I purchased, "that's all you're getting??  YES!!!  It is my favorite...oh so is the bran muffin, oh, so is the oat scone...  I can't really think of anything in here that isn't tasty.  A true gem that I have yet to find any comparison in San Francisco.
author: ERICA E.

description: Best bakery in town. The cheese rolls are the best anywhere. I would recommend this to anyone!
author: John D.

description: This place is great. I used to buy bread from here from time to time. Then, my friends started bringing pizza's from this place to our Mahjong parties and I fell in love. I am a serious meat eater but I love all of their pizzas. I would recommend this place to anyone.
author: E P.

description: When I die I will be buried clutching an Arizmendi Sweet Baguette.
author: Conor C.

description: This bakery is a fusion between your baby boomer mother's hippie-granola type baking and grandma's good old fashion heart unhealthy baking. This "granola"-coop bakery makes fabulous pecan roles, cheese bread, and save some cornbread blueberry muffins for me.  They could stand to "granolafy" some their recipes such as the scones, pizza bread, coffee cake. and even their granola.  Still I give them a five star rating for the recipes they got right.
author: Ryan S.

description: If nothing would happen to my body, I would eat all the baked goods from Arizmendi bakery EVERY DAY!  Kookie Brittle and a cup of earl grey (totally hit the spot after walking around with a good friend).  I love the bread and baked goods schedule.  One would need it considering they sell out FAST!  I LOVE this place!
author: Dorothy S.

description: This place is DA BOMB. They also threw in a discount after they saw that my gf and I were on bikes. You can't get better than that. The "pizza" is to die for. THey sell bomb Brie cheese and all their breads are fresh! I always think about it and crave it. It's too bad they don't have one downtown.
author: Nir B.

description: The chocolate chip bread thingies are dry, definitely skip those.  The apple/rasberry scones are moist and just the right kind of sweet.  But definitely the thing to watch out for is the brioche.  As I sat down at the N stop to break into the knot, I wondered, why is everyone so up on brioches?  Then I tore into it and thought, Oh! that's why.
author: CAKE E.

description:
my car got towed .. i called a cab to take me to SOMA to pick up my car ... the cab driver asked me "do you mind if we make a quick pit stop?" 

i was thinking "is she fo' real??" .. here i am in a rush to pick up my car, having JUST realized that it was gone .. and the cab driver wants to make a pit stop???

she then explained "i just want to pick up some things from Arizmendi's" ...

i said "well hell yeah! what are you waiting for?" .... Arizmendi! who wouldn't want to make a pit stop there if you're in the neighborhood? on the clock or not.
author: Anvy A.

description: Some nights I dream of Arizmendi pizza.  Unfortunately these nights happen to be on Sunday, and every Monday I am shattered when I arrive salivating at their window, realizing I can't have any til Tuesday.  But Arizmendi that is A-OKAY with me.  You all work so hard making the best breads and pizza this city has to offer, take a day off and rejuvenate your soul.  I'll come back Tuesday for another delicious slice.
author: Ashley W.

description: Love it!  The coffee cake on the weekends is full of fruit, moist, and delicious.  The scones of the day are fab too.  And for dinner, grab some cheese breads.  Delish.
author: Heather B.

description:
OK - this place is so yummy that even though I live on the Peninsula I check the pizza schedule often (even if we don't have to go to the city) so that we can drive up for lunch! They make one type of pizza daily (check website) and we haven't had a single one that wasn't absolutely delish! Really fresh ingredients and the best crisp crust. 

They have unusual topping combinations (you won't find pepperoni if that's what you're looking for) but they are so tasty and every combination is bursting with delicious flavor.  Many are drizzled with garlic or herb infused oil and topped with parmesan cheese and parsley. mmmmm.
 
It's a cozy a little bakery - just a couple of small tables - so if you're lucky you might get one - if not, you can take your stuff to go.  GG Park  is just a few blocks away.  Always a line out the door, but the staff is very efficient and it moves quickly. We also LOVE the cherry-corn scones and often take several home to enjoy with hot coffee the next morning. All of the baked goods I've tried have been amazing.

If you try it you'll be addicted - so beware!
author: emily b.

description: The scones are some of the best I've ever had. Easily worth the bike ride across town. Particularly the cherry scones. Yumm.
author: M S.

description: It's cute, it's quick, it's cool. Arizmendi is a small local bakery near the Golden Gate Park. I stopped here for a quick bite and drink on my way to the King Tut exhibition. I had some sort of pizza which was delicious, and some Honest Tea ('Sublime Mate', super tasty). The cashier was very friendly and initiated a short conversation, which is always welcome in a place like this. Seating is limited but it's still a nice place to go to.
author: Martin B.

description: I like the idea that it's a co-op. Like the challah rolls.  Not too crazy about the fruit tart thingy's.  The pizza's been good so far.  I think people love it most because it's an SF thing no?  I just thought I would orgasm as soon as I placed the brioche in my mouth.  Well, at least I didn't barf.
author: Joyhan S.

description: This place is pretty good for pizza's and pastries. The only drawback is that it's quite small and it's not an ideal sit down and eat type place. They have managed to draw in popularity of extreme proportions and I'm not sure why. Location perhaps?
author: Jafar Amir Hanovic Ismailov M.

description: The best way to start a weekend morning ... a cup of organic coffee (you don't even need the fluff to make the coffee taste good) and a great treat from Arizmendi's. The scones are incredible! But be warned ... they are closed on Monday's.
author: Amanda L.

description: This place is amazing I wish i had more stars to give it.  Everything I've ever purchased here was spectacular.  Also, for a busy place the people working there are pretty darn friendly.
author: jack p.

description: I'm getting closer to the Sunset lately and digging new amazing spots like this co-op bakery. Their chocolate "thing", although heavy as uranium, is delicious and really helped my morning. As far as I've been told, their pizza is great too. I'll check it soon!
author: Dario B.

description: My family is really snobby about bread (like half of San Francisco), and Arizmendi is always up to task. I haven't eaten a bad thing here. The breakfast pastries are terrific and unique (try the corn-cherry scone, the "chocolate thing," or if you prefer something savory, the cheese roll). They offer a different delicious pizza every day, as well as perfect focaccias. The variety of shortbreads is also wonderful. Now that the Burger King that formerly operated next door is gone, your appetite can go untainted by its questionable scent. And should I mention the cute queer girls that work here? I think I should.
author: Janine M.

description: Legit as fuck(pardon my language). Cornbread Blueberry Muffins...yes. Pecan Rolls...yes. Snickerdoddles...choice. And it's so wonderful that it is a worker-owned cooperative...share the love! I didn't get to try the pizza but it looked wonderful! Yum yum mf's!
author: Alexander A.

description: So good. I've got little to add except come here, find a pastry that looks good, buy it, eat it, be happy. It really is that simple. What a great little bakery.
author: Jake W.

description: Stopped in for a loaf of sour dough after a full day in the park after the great reviews. It hit the spot for a late snack.
author: Brooks G.

description:
Very yummy bakery goods. Especially like the chocolate birthday cakes that I have gotten there. Also, they have donated much food to my childrens' school auctions. They are great!
Oh yeah,  there  also seem to be  a lot of cute babies there especially on the weekends.
author: Avril S.

description: Huge fan of this place.  Best pizzas ever, if you can get there before they sell out.  Gorgeous baked goods.  Cheese breads never disappoint.   Quick, friendly service no matter how busy.
author: Anna L.

description: Once, a girl with a shaved head made Caroline H. and I watch her bike while she bought breakfast at Arizmendi. As soon as she was out of sight, we sold it to a drug dealer so that we could buy more pecan rolls.
author: Ben P.

description: My favorite bakery/pizza in SF, not only for the baked goods and pizza but cause they're also a co-op. Like every snobby San Franciscan I enjoy supporting locally-owned and run businesses that care about their workers and quality of their products. The pizza is reliably good, that even though there's only one type of vegetarian pizza on the menu (changes daily ), you don't even have to think what about what to order, but just how much.
author: Merri K.

description: This place is saaa-wwww-eeeet!   Their employees always seem happy and I always feel welcome, which in turn makes me spend more money.   Not near my apt but I take an extra bus just to get to this place at least twice a week.  Well worth it.  Anyone who hasn't tried this place is missing out.
author: Ellie S.

description:
obviously amazing. 
i recommend the following:

walnut wheat bread.
pecan rolls. 
pizza of the day.
anything with their foccaccia.
bran muffins.
english muffins. are the best ever.

it's all real home-made "the kind of stuff you wish you're mom actually made" baked goods.
and it's a co-op. 

awesome. for days.
author: lucy m.

description: Oh mama this place has some tasty treats. I wanted to have a pity party for myself so thought I needed some treats to drown my sorrows. I walked by and like Pavlov's dogs started drooling like nobody's business. Must of looked crazy staring for hours trying to figure out what to get. I wanted to exercise some restraint and just get two things. Oh if this was my biggest problem , I'd be a happy girl. But alas, I settled on a humongous sticky pecan roll and a cinnamon shortbread. I swear the sky got bluer at that moment and frickin birds started singing. Life isn't so bad after all
author: Sophia C.

description: Am I the only one who doesn't consider this place cheap? I haven't tried everything, but what I have tried is soo delicious. I always get the poppy seed and onion focaccia! I wouldn't say the prices are cheap, but they are reasonable. Arizmendi is my favorite bakery in the sunset! I just wish it was a bit bigger, so there would be more tables to sit.
author: Bets Y.

description: Hands down my favorite bakery in the world!  Delicious, wholesome, baked-in goodness!  You really just have to try it to beleive it...and you might as well go every day of the week (except for Mondays) because they bake something new and different each day of the week.
author: Alena G.

description: Cheese rolls, oh how I love you... thank god I moved away from this place and can't just walk around the corner to get them all of the time, because that was really dangerous.  The baguettes they sell are also great... Pretty much everything is good, but sometimes it's a little annoying in the shop because people don't understand what they are supposed to be doing, and it's a serve yourself type place, so you can feel like you are in a corral and I often find myself wanting to bash someone with a baguette.  It's especially annoying if all of the people who can't understand what to do are dressed in Renaissance garb -- stay away if you see that!
author: robyn s.

description: My favorite place for pizza in the Bay area. No question. I love the simplification. I love that the only real question is how many pieces. I love the creativity in cooking and in business practice. I just wish there was an Arizmendi in the Mission...
author: Jennifer C.

description:
hmmmm. cheese rolls.
and pecan rolls.
and fresh, beautiful pizza.

i have to forget they are here or i would gain about a thousand pounds. 
so once a week is all i get, if i'm good.
i've tried just about everything and have never eaten something that was just ok. everything is really, really good.
author: Melody O.

description:
wow, am i a fan. 

sometimes if you go early enough you can pick a bran raisin muffin with muffin top that is as big as my asian head. how wonderful.

sometimes i walk around the city unknowingly with poppy seeds in my teeth because i had the best pastry/bread topped with poppy seeds and onions. 

sometimes their breadsticks are so good that i wonder why i didn't grow up eating this and instead ate nasty cheesy breads from little Caesar.
author: curi k.

description: I like going here whenever I can but if I don't get there early in the morning - forget about it. The parking is not great. And now that they have those park chalets in front, it sucks even more. Damn transplants ruining our city with those things. Go to the park if you want a park bench but don't take away parking right in front. A couple of tables in front of the place on the sidewalk is fine. Anyways, the food is good. everything in the place tastes great and is always fresh.
author: Opie D.

description: Man, you gotta love the breads this place makes. If you are like me (read, from the East Coast) you are probably sick of getting Sourdough everything out here, and Arizmendi's provides a great place to sate your taste for delicious carbs. Try one of the Wolverines, and you'll be good all day, even if you run the Bay to Breakers. Also, their little bialy-like things with sun-dried tomatoes, olives or garlic really hit the spot. But do NOT miss the cheese breads. Scrumptious!
author: Benjamin L.

description: I love this co-op bakery, and luckily for me, it's one block away from my apartment!  I would recommend trying anything that looks tasty to you.  My favorites include the pecan rolls, pizza, olive bread, and cheese bread.  I also enjoy their variety of tea breads---I just had a nice blueberry cream cheese loaf a couple of days ago.  Great prices, quality ingredients.
author: Eli N.

description: Went in to grab a few cookies, but darn their pizzas and bread all look so good too.  I'm definitely going back when an emtpy stomach here one day.
author: Kim N.

description: I always have the Chocolate Thing for breakfast. There is always a line for pizza during the mid-day. Big and fresh made. yum yum
author: Chiqui H.

description:
I am really on a hunt for a real bakery with real flavor. A lot of of my friends have heard my gripe of not having the real fresh baked goods.
So I was pointed in this direction, and I really was hopeful... but I wasn't satisfied. I was pretty bummed. I tried about 5 different baked items, from muffins, cookies, a loaf of bread, a cheese mix bread to the irish soda bread. Maybe it's the flour or it's the SF water but the flavor and freshness was still lacking. I was bummed, because I am sure that I hyped it up from the my extened expecations. Sometimes I got there tooo late or on the wrong day, my fault. but it raise my anticipation higher and higher. But I do like what they are doing there and the service is great even with the high pace and demands from their multitude of customers. I did love the irish soda bread the most, and have found myself treking all the way over there just for the soda bread. What can I say other than I am spoiled from living in Europe where you throw out your 1 day old bread and head down to the bakery just at the end of your block for fresh fresh, did I say fresh bread.
author: e.s.s. A.

description: Brown sugar & organic apple scone?  Yum.  It's like apple pie in a scone!
author: Oliver C.

description: my favorite pizza joint in sf.  simple, fresh-tasting ingredients everyday.
author: Ethan L.

description:
Over the past few months I'm not sure that I've let a weekend go by without swinging into Arizmendi.  Now that my roommate is purportedly allergic to baker's yeast, wheat and dairy, I've had to make these trips on the sly, which gives me an excuse to wander the neighborhood and the park while stuffing my face with pastries.

The real test is whether or not you can get in and out of this place with a single pastry in hand.  The longer I stand in the long line, the more I long for even more!  I rationalize that I ran today.  Or that I'll try to save the second item for tomorrow.  I always grab a brioche knot.  I can't help myself.  Light-seeming and warm and filled with raisins and subtle sweetness.  It's in my hand before I even think about it.  I resist the "chocolate things."  I eye the suburban bread, knowing that we devoured our last loaf of the wheat sourdough in a single evening.  I contemplate the pecan rolls and occasionally let a pumpkin muffin slip into my bag.  And then I get to the final case of goods: the scones.  I've trained myself to resist the coffeecake here; it's big and dense and not as good as I want it to be.  But the scones.  Corn-cherry is my go-to.  But I'm sometimes swayed by the oat or the currant, or even the fruity scone o' the day.
author: Megan K.

description: Whenever I walk in this place I get all hot and sweaty, and nervous, and... well, it's not unlike being in love and not knowing how to make the first move. Should I get a loaf or a bun of the olive-Parmesan bread? Do I want 2 or 4 chocolate-chocolate chip cookies? (that darned husband is sure to eat two in one sitting!) Should I wait for the corn pizza or just get a couple slices of tomato-artichoke foccacia? Do I want the raspberry-apricot scone or my favorite favorite cheese scone? I'm usually wishing I was a cow... you know, with the extra stomach and all. And all the while, I block traffic and keep imagining that the bakers behind the counter are rolling their eyes at me and thinking, "it's just bread, lady! pick something already."
author: L. M.

description: Those cherry corn scones are out of this world!
author: Allie C.

description: My my, I love the corn cherry scone.  The recipe was in the food section of the chronicle a few months ago, and I made it for everyone and they love the recipe now too! However, I obviously still go to the store, theirs somehow tastes better.  It has the great crispy edges from the corn meal, and plump tart cherries.  My favorite scone in the world? Yes, indeed!  (btw..The pecan roll is sooo yummy if you are craving something really sweet!! Everything I've had is delightful though.)
author: Markell M.

description: Arizmendi is a great small bakery in SF on 9th Ave that offers different and interesting pizza by the slice or the whole pie.  The have a calendar of Pizza on their web site.  I used to love their Curry Rolls, only offered on Sundays.  But, they didn't sell as well as the staff wanted and so they stopped making them.  I have since stopped going out of my way and driving across the city to visit this bakery.  But, I would still recommend it if you are in the area on the weekend.  Get a corn/cherry scone from Arizmendi.  But, get your coffee a few doors down on 9th at the "little roaster that could" coffee shop.  Great coffee roasted in-house and great beans to-go too.
author: Matthew T.

description:
yummee baked goods ..................the dark chocolate chip cookies (super yummee), the granola & the pizza (love the shiitake mushroom pizza) 

nice, bright bakery, small space, so gets crowded  easily on the weekends...............
author: Cindi N.

description: I guess I expected a little more out of this place. Maybe I should have gone for some scones instead of cookies. The only thing I really didn't like that I had was the green tea shortbread. It was a bit too rich. The place is really small so you feel really cramped when trying to pick out your pastries. I would have gotten pizza if I hadn't just eaten before going here because it smelled really yummy! Warning: cash only.
author: Kristen R.

description: Wonderful breads and pastries!  I go for anything with chocolate in it.  The staff is pleasant.  It can be crazy on weekend mornings, but still easier to manuver than Tartine.  A gem in the Inner Sunset.
author: Funk G.

description:
Cool place. Super fast considering I stood in line with a cool crowd for 5 minutes. Got 2 pieces of the balsamic vinegar pizza, went and ate it in the park. Good pizza, flavorful because of good ingredients (rather than just lots of cheese and sauce).
Oh yea and $4.50 for 2 pieces of pizza is a good deal.
author: T J.

description: always get the pizza of the day! one day they ran out, so they gave me free gingersnaps! winnnerrr!
author: Jojo H.

description: grubbin little bakery.  I was kind of blown away at all their muffins, rolls, breads and goodies.  I had one of their provolone and olive rolls.  God damn it was a nice and tasty treat.  I will definitely stop in again for some more.  I only saw two types of "serve yourself" coffees.  That seemed a little off to me, but maybe they just focus on the baked goods.  If you want your gourmet joe then head next door....but if you want the real deal holly baked lovin then check out Arizmendi.
author: Jonathan R.

description: I am probably the last person on earth....ok, San Francisco... that only discovered Arizmendi Bakery this year.  So until I can figure out a way to hire one of those planes that specialize in aerial advertising, this will be my forum to alert others as to how absolutely scrumptious the various goodies baked at this little co-op truly are.
author: Rebecca G.

description: Wow. I can't say enough good things about this bakery. This tiny co-op has a great location with a strong, loyal customer base. Their bread is baked daily on site and their schedule changes depending upon the day of the week. As soon as I tried their Provolone-Olive Bread, I was hooked.  Forget Boudin's and the SF Bread Co. - This places offers the best bread in San Francisco.
author: Michael A.

description: Such a good bakery... Love their cornmeal and dried cherry scones...  Just thinking about them made me happy! No frills; no ego; Just good bake products. People go hungry, lines for selecting and lines for buying get tricky, but no one gives you attitude.  OK one guy once did, but he did not really seem to fit in--it wasn't the trendy outfit, just the uptight attitude. Good bakeries rule, rude people suck...
author: Ana d.

description:
homemade fresh sourdough bread. so good it's like you never even ate real bread before.

delicious mint chocolate chip cookies. can't go wrong here!
author: Amy Z.

description: It makes me happy just thinking about it. Arizmendi... you truly are a gem.
author: Andrew S.

description: Looks like 99% of the Yelp reviews for this place are positively glowing, and I absolutely AGREE!  I'm a giant savory carb-o-holic and this place does not disappoint.  The focaccias, pizzas, cheese breads, bread sticks are amazingly tasty.  For those with a sweet tooth, don't miss the "Chocolate Things," looks like a scone, but much much much much much better.  The Chocolate Things are soft and pillowy, dotted with dark chocolate chips.  I also tried a cherry corn scone, which also delightful.  Like a corn bread scone with dried sour cherries. SO good with some whipped honey butter, if you have it.
author: Beth K.

description: I think I'm writing too many positive reviews, but it's hard not to with so many great places to eat at in the city.  I have never once had something from here that I didn't like.  The coffee cake, flat breads, muffins, scones, pizza, everything is amazing here and pretty cheap to.  I wish I could still walk to here in the mornings.  I also wish they were open on mondays.
author: Paul W.

description: Truly amazing.  I have been twice.  The first for a "Wolverine," a beautifully-baked up sourdough mound packed with nuts and dried apricots.   Heat, apply butter, enjoy.  The second time for a notorious pizza-of-the-day, a thin crust masterpiece with feta, tomato, and spinach.  The various chunky cookies on the bakery racks basically jumped into my bag.  I swear.
author: Eric S.

description: LOVE their stuff! The pizza is a must try. Everything there is amazingly delicious from the pecan rolls to the muffins. Must try everything!!!
author: Katherine C.

description: those lemon snowballs are just the greatest thing ever created!! Someone sent us a small can and I've been eating it one a day w/ a cup of hot tea.  It's the best thing for winter.  The shortbread is also delicious.  Actually, to be fair, I've never had a 'bad shortbread' before.  The chocolate snowballs are great, but not as good as the lemon snowballs.  I will def. come to this bakery to try their other goods.
author: AhLin C.

description: I have only had their pastries and cookies, but they have all been yummy. There is this pastry that's like a roll with chocolate chips in it, this is the best thing I have had here, I would recommend it. Why not 5 stars? They only take cash and it is very small. Also, you sort of feel like you are unwelcome if you are not so cool that your jeans are so tight they are cutting off your circulation.
author: Flippy F.

description: when you're nearby it's almost a sin to not hit this place up for a delicious slice.
author: Ameer N.

description: Love this place.  I grab a bag and fill it up because I can never decide on just one thing.  Wonderful shortbread cookies. The "chocolate things" are another favorite.  It is like a roll with dark chocolate chunks baked in.  I sometimes circle the block several times to find parking but it is worth the effort.
author: Mary H.

description: simply delicious. warm pecan roll with coffee. salted carmel frosted chocolate cake.
author: Jenn S.

description: This place is really cool. They have delicious foccacia breads with different toppings.. cheese, tomatoes, olives, etc. Once I even had a yummy corn cheddar bread! Their scones are also wonderful. PIZZA here is outstanding, but get there early if you want a full pizza. Check out www.arizmendibakery.org to look at the pizza calendar. My favorite one has potatoes and goat cheese!
author: O K.

description: Bakery heaven.  NEVER at a loss to find something that was just what i was craving.  Only problem is you gotta remember if you eat somewhere else first, to save room for desert.  Really, from breads to cookies to salty, sweet, light, rich, chocolatey, cheesey, seasonal, classic, whatever, I can always find something right up my alley.  Not much room to eat inside (can't recall any really), so it's a to-go kinda place.  But if you want to sit down, there's plenty of coffee shops to match it up with.
author: Today Y.

description: Excellent stick-to-your ribs breads--wolverines, cheese breads, and various whole-grain breads.  I just wish they would slice these!  I take them home for toast and sandwiches and they hold up well, retaining good taste and texture.   I'm a little less enamoured of the brioches, scones, and muffins--these are all a bit heavy-handed.  The flavored shortbread cookies are wonderful.  Pizzas are nicely experimental, although a bit on the oily side for my taste.  The coffee is fair trade, organic, reasonably priced and most importantly, EXCELLENT tasting.  This place has a nice ambience and I always feel good about myself going here, even if I do eat a bit too much.
author: Lola K.

description: Now *this* is a bakery. You walk in, it's about 15'X15' in front of the counter--and you're up to your eyeballs in racks and racks of the freshest, scrummiest, most to die for pastries EVER. And so cheap. Get yourself a shepherd's pie for $1.10. Go ahead, get one.
author: Cate F.

description:
i just can't get enough. i love arizmendi so much that its mere existence nearly convinced me to move to the sunset. now that's powerful.  

mouth watering pecan rolls. 
perfect veggie thin-crust pizza. 
deliciously crusty yet moist cherry-corn scones.
amazingly vegan chocolate-mint cookies.
haven't tried the chocolate cake, but looking at it tickles my pickle. 

ugh! i want!
author: stacy t.

description: That double chocolate tea loaf has made me drive across town. The pizza bread is fantastic. The cooperative vibe gives it SF street cred.  Wish it were closer to me!
author: Lala B.

description: It's such a cute bakery in a great neighborhood. Coming in there for the first time was a little overwhelming because I didn't know what to do, so I just grabbed a Chocolate Thing and paid. I definitely want to go back and try all the other great breads and pizzas I saw and heard about so much.
author: Katrina C.

description: The breads are good, but not necessarily great.  It's slightly overwhelming to think that one has to eat a shit load of bread, just to find the one that they would like.  There's something for everybody there, but it's just a shame that, really, there's only that something (as opposed to many things) - I recommend the cheese roll.  I appreciate the soy milk being out for lactose intolerant coffee drinkers. I appreciate the earth conscious hub-bub that goes so well with the rest of the "granola-esque" patrons.  I even appreciate the cyclist discounts.  But what I don't appreciate/understand is the not being open on Mondays.  Random...
author: Darkie L.

description: This place is perfect.  Everything I've eaten here is amazing.  Even when there is a line out the door I'll wait, and it goes pretty fast. I also really appreciate the quality ingredients whether organic, local, etc. My favorite is the corn cherry scone and the bialy.  Cookie brittle is pretty darn good too when I want something super sweet.  And they have Point Reyes Blue cheese...delicious.
author: Matt S.

description: I love Arizmendi!   The bread and pastries are the bomb, seriously!  The pizza and granola are great too.  My favorite is the banana walnut muffin.  Definitely a must-try if you are in the area.  If I lived next to this place, I would probably become fat. LOL!
author: H. A.

description: Delicious, unique pizzas. I love how their pizza menu changes daily but that does mean some planning ahead and looking at their pizza calendar.  This isn't a sit-down-and-have-a-meal sort of place but on a sunny day, it's nice to sit outside and have some coffee and a pastry. It's worker-owned...that's neat!
author: Alayne H.

description: The pizza is amazing, the brioche is lovely, and the attitude is to much. It has a general get out my way hectic kind of feeling. If it is slow time of the day, and I really want a brioche I will pop in for a treat. Maybe I am spoiled by the cafes in Italy where the coffee and pastries are always perfect and if the people are rude they at least have a little more panache.
author: Deva G.

description:
arizmendi's scones are always my fav. not too dry and not to moist..perfect. pizzas are great too. 
peanut butter cookies is the best,,,too bad they don't make it that often (or not anymore ??)
author: Suki S.

description: Despite my Chicago roots and high marks for deep dish pizza including Zak's in the East bay and Little Star in the city, Arizmendi and Cheese Board may, in my opinion, have the best pizza in the bay area.  Each day they offer one pizza on a thin crust.  I love thick crusted Chicago style pizza but the Arizmendi thin crust is just sublime with a more sophisticated set of ingredients.
author: John S.

description: so one weekday morning i went in here after it got best bakery in the sf weekly and ordered a couple of things, i got the chocolate thing and a cranberry corn scone,  the scone was insanely good, the thing was also pretty good. This place is definately not the best bakery i have ever been to but it was very good, the scone was perfectly made, very moist on the inside and full of flavor, the staff was nice, i kind of hate the line setup, i definately feel a bit rushed having to look in all the display cases while in line but its a minor complaint and i recommend this bakery to anyone in the inner or outer sunset or the haight. i wouldnt travel far for it but it is very nice.
author: Sean B.

description:
If I could go to Arizmendi everyday I would.  Their homemade breads are out of this world.

The scones are to die for... the selection always includes currant, corn-cherry and a special of the day (like strawberry-plum, or blueberry-pear).  Delicious.

Their "chocolate-thing", pecan rolls, cheese rolls, homemade english muffins, curry bread, and olive-provolone loaf are also fabulous.  Actually, its all good. It's be hard to go wrong with any selection.
author: Julie D.

description: Everything I eat here is magnificent. I've eaten most things they make and they've never missed. It's all amazing.
author: Erik S.

description: I don't think this is the best bakery I've ever frequented but I still keep going out of my way to go there.  They make a great apricot almond cookie sweetened with fruit juice and the pizza is always terrific.  I just bought the chocolate thing and the molasses spelt bread today and both are very pleasing.  My socks are never knocked off by this place but I still really like it all the same.  It's kind of cozy inside too with a couple seats inside and a bench outside.  Like I said, it's pleasant here.
author: Lalu B.

description: I came in here after having my favorite Vietnamese clay pot at Sandy's down the street (gotta love that Chinese sausage!). I was expecting a bakery type bakery, but it was mostly savory bakes goods and breads. There were some cookies and coffee cakes (the chocolate chip was amazing). The pizza of the day looked really good, as did all of the breads and brioches. I may go back for lunch now knowing what it actually serves. And I love that it's co-op!
author: Amy B.

description: Yes, the baked goods here are awesome, really, truly amazing.  But the people who work here are such snotwads it really ruins the joy.  I've been in there at least a dozen times and each time I've gotten a "holier than thou" attitude from whomever is "helping" me.  Baking bread is great, but for goodness sakes people, get over yourselves!
author: Kathleen B.

description: This is my favorite bakery in the city for baked goods. LOVE the oat scones. Great breads. And the pizzas are amazing. Different varieties each day and you can get them prebaked and finish them off at home. Those of you going low carb, smell 'em and weep.
author: Pam D.

description:
soooo lets say you live in the sunset and your often lameface (read douche-y) buddy who lives in north beach says you aren't as cool cause you can't just walk everywhere and therefore he's a a REAL city boy.

remind me again why i hang out with this fool.

so he's feeling like he wants something new and tasty and i challenge him to a who knows the best pizza in sf contest. 

and lets say you take him to arizmendi which is SHOCK in the aforementioned "we-may-not-be-able-to-walk-everywhere-but-we-have-the-effing-n-judah-bitch-please" sunset neighborhood.

and let's say you win.

he should pay up right? right?

moral of the story: go for the pizza. come back in the morning for the pastries. get your friend to pay you your winning bet money. and then get more pizza.
author: verna b.

description: I know a lot of people rave about this place, but I just didn't care for the pizza too much, the sourdough crust requires some getting use to.  When the pizza is warm, it's nice and chewy, but once it got cold, it was a bit tough and doesn't reheat very well.  I also picked up some other items, but was not impressed.
author: Twist' D.

description: 4 stars. i'm not usually a fan of pizza, but theirs is quite good and uses quality ingredients. i heard of this place from a friend who was obsessed with it, and though i have not reached that level, i can understand why. this is a must-get every time i venture out to the sunset...too bad i didn't discover it when i was still living there!
author: Suana W.

description:
Very good bakery with great pizza. Not as good as Cheeseboard in Berkeley but similar style. 
Slighly overwhelmed by all the bicyclists and strollers on the weekend but it's a great neighborhood bakery without a lot of space so to be expected.
author: Nate S.

description: Wonderful neighborhood bakery. Fun to pick up assorted baked goods and a daily special pizza.
author: MyMy B.

description: i stopped in without knowing too much about it and all i had was a slice of pizza, but that was enough to know that this place is legit.  there was such depth in the flavors on the pizza but the star, as it should be was the crust.  can't wait to go back.
author: ari b.

description:
i had high hopes for this place. everything here is good if you get it fresh. the bread can be kinda hard to eat (mostly the cheese roll) when it's cold. but i can't complain. it's cheese bread! how can that be bad? 

they have PHENOMENAL pizza and i think i have just been lucky to get there right when they take them out of the oven cause i have never had a bad one. 

also i'd like to add that i think it's a cult. or run by communists. or people from Berkeley.
author: Tin-Tin E.

description: SHEER JOY.  That is what I felt when I discovered Arizmendi.  No kidding, one of the things I missed the most when I left my hood in North Berkeley was my regular of scones, muffins, and pizza slices from Cheeseboard.  I didn't know I could get the same in SF!  EVERYTHING is amazingly delicious.  I never did quite get to trying every item at Cheeseboard but now I have a 2nd chance to continue the task at Arizmendi...muffin of the day, you are next!
author: Debbie Y.

description: I've worked at UCSF for a few years now, and I love going down to Arizmendi for a special treat. The little savory foccacia breads: tomato and cheese and the chocolate things especially.  Yesterday I had the sweet potato pizza for the first time, so amazing, hot and a little crispy--perfection. Wish it was more frequently on the menu, instead of just once a month.  A great place.  The line has never been long, but I usually go in the late afternoon, probably not their busiest time.
author: Helen H.

description: Awesome neighborhood spot.  Perfect for a breakfast muffin or a mid-day snack. I love their corn cherry scone and their pizzas of the day are outstanding. Great selection of organic foods and vegan treats. I've been meaning to try their chocolate fudge cake. I'm sure I'll become an even more regular fixture in this joint if the cake holds up to the rest of their goodies. My only complaint is that it is often packed so I've never been able to snag a seat. Good thing Golden Gate park is a few short blocks away. Definitely a great way to start your day.
author: Laura H.

description:
hello my friendly local co-oppers, 

i apologize for semi-boycotting you because your pizza isn't exactly like cheeseboard. i love cheesboard pizza and i thought that yers would be the exactly same but it ain't. something tastes different. so i refused to visit. but i tried the coffee cake, currant scone, summer fruit scone, cheese bun, blueberry corn muffin, and chocolate chip cookie this weekend over the course of two days and i must say they are all top notch!

your scones are everything that i've ever wanted in a scone! crunchy exterior and a soft, buttery interior. not too sweet and not too heavy. they are juuuuust right. 

i can't wait to try the leetle bialys? or round focaccia? the tomato and olive bun looks like a face like this :O the cutest bun i've ever seen.
author: Jacquee P.

description: Good Lord!  What could be better than warm, soft brioche and a rockin, organic coffee at 7am?  What?  What I ask you?
author: James Y.

description: It's not the cheapest bakery, nor does it offer the lowest-calorie treats, but it does make up for the above by providing daily fresh-baked goods and by the sheer fact that it's a co-op.  My favorite sweet in the house is the aptly-named Chocolate Thing.  (One suggestion:  that they also bake a similar roll monikered "Chocolate Thang" using RAW sugar).  Their chocolate chip cookies are a cut above the rest, too.
author: Momo R.

description: My mom and I are going to make a ritual out of walking to Arizmendi Bakery, buying breakfast pastries & juice/coffee, and sitting down in the Music Concourse in Golden Gate Park for breakfast. Deliciously fresh, generously sized baked goods (I eyed the pecan sticky bun rolls and got one, but got full after eating apple & blackberry coffee cake.) Will have to go back to try the pizzas of the day, too... perhaps on another trip to the deYoung?
author: Marisa L.

description: When I first discovered this place it became an obsession. I can honestly say that I no longer have an obsession but it's still a really yummy treat every now and then. I highly recommend their gourmet-type pizzas.
author: Stacy F.

description: Although they're especially known for their pizza and snazzy democratic agenda (we're a worker cooperative!), I love the breakfast items, ie: scones, muffins and the like. My favorites are the Chocolate Things and the traditional brioche, sweet enough without being overpowering and the right amount of butter for richness, not nastiness.
author: Kat C.

description: All because everyone else loves it doesn't mean you can't love it too.  So go get a slice of pizza, a scone, a cheese roll, a chocolate thingy, sit in the park, and have a nice day.  Thank you.
author: Nora B.

description: Two slices of pizza, piping hot from the oven. Marinated artichoke hearts, caramelized red onions, garlic oil, cheese and parsley. Sticky pecan roll. Shockingly good parking spot right outside. Midweek blues are history. Now all you need to do is control yourself on the way home, because this aroma can drive anyone to madness.
author: Purnima M.

description:
a good friend of mine rides his bike six miles to arizmendi at four AM, five days a week, just to bring me arizmendi's pecan rolls, which are the only thing i've eaten for the last six months as i recover from a serious case of work stress.

simply put, arizmendi is transcendent.
author: Chris B.

description: Reviewing Arizmendi is like crack in the Tenderloin - everyone's done it. You think it's great, I stalk their employees in my free time (it's that good). But I feel like I have a special right to put in my two cents, if only to add it to my list of neighborhood eateries. Because seriously, their triple mushroom pizza is orgasmic. MY GOD. I write mushroom pizza day down in my calendar. And there is no greater sorrow than planning an Arizmendi excursion... on a Monday. CLOSED???
author: Laurel H.

description: I love this bakery! It's  a self- serve, completely down to earth, feel good kind of bakery. I've tried most of their breads, and would highly recommend the olive bread with poppyseeds and onions! I was a bit skeptical at first (olive? poppyseeds), but turned around to purchase some to go after taking a bite, even though my N judah had arrived. I also love their scones. You can actually taste the quality of the cheese in their cheese breads. The pizzas here are crisp and fresh, and I love the unique toppings. I tried the spinach artichoke pizza the other day- delicious!
author: Carmen L.

description: I tend to stay away from vegan baked goods like the plague, but you would never guess that Arizmendi's apricot almond cookie ($2) belongs to this class of pretend indulgence.  It is TRUE indulgence.  Chock-full of crunchy nuts and chewy apricots and oats, this cookie is a pleasure to eat.
author: Ana L.

description: 985 reviews and 4.5 stars??? Guess it's a must try bakery. We were planning to go golden gate the past Sat but of cos we have to stuff ourselves before 3 hours walking. We stopped by this place and got Scone, coffee cake and cheese/tomato roll. They are delicious. I love their scone as it's very moist inside and the crunchy outside. Coffee cake is not sweet at all and just about right. I wish they can heat up my cheese roll. Overall, very good bakery. Will go back for sure.
author: Phe M.

description: There is nothing here that isn't good.  Morning:  Go for the delicate & sweet Brioche knot with a cup of strong hot coffee.  Afternoon:  go for the pizza of the day (or if that doesn't suit you, try the foccaccia) .  Take home a  baguette or some sourdough for tomorrows lunch.  Oh and grab a cookie for the walk home.  Ah yes, with these simple steps you too can be an Arizmendi worshipping fat ass too!
author: Carmen R.

description: I'm glad that they're a co op. They need to do some cleaning of the seating area/the outside.
author: Laura B.

description: Answer the damn phone. I have stopped up here many times wanting to buy cherry chocolate bread. I get there, they tell me they are out. Cashier says call next time. I've called numerous times, looks like I am headed to Noe Valley bakery, where they actually answer the phone.
author: Pug P.

description: I had a cheese roll here today, and it was pretty magnificent.  At only $2.25, the price was pretty reasonable, too.  I'm not totally amazed by their selection, but based on that magnificent cheese roll, everything they do have is probably pretty magnificent.
author: Ariel S.

description:
really, truly wonderful. but somewhat out of the way. i mean, tartines country loaf destroys every single bakery concoction in this entire arena of culinary exaltation. i mean, yah know, it gets kind of ugly. DEM SCONES THOUGH, BBBBLLLLIIIIIIISSSSS. loud, very loud.....

update: Yeah, they have officially reached the upper echelon of the bakery tier. Their english muffins are unquestioned bastions of incendiary leadership capabilities, along with the corn oat bread and the WHOLE WHEAT sourdough loafs. Get your ass to mars.....and then to arizmendi, for a carb hummer.
author: Christopher J.

description: It's ALL good here.  nice folks, the right mission (read it online--hearts are in the right place), and everything is tasty and relatively healthy for you.  So given all of the above, what are you waiting for?  Your friends will ask you where you got the yummy baked goods.  You tell 'em, Auntie Em!
author: Ken H.

description: Tourist or resident, president or pope...ya gotta try this place.  Oh by the way ride your bike there and wear your bike helmet see what happens.
author: bob r.

description:
"make loaves, not war" =)
the line is worth the wait...and if it's too crowded to find a seat, I usually just take my warm rolls of cheesy deliciousness to gg park and fight off the rabid squirrels. The sweet potato topped pizza is the best!!!
author: Kat L.

description:
This bakery is the most unique place in the city.  there are bums outside that greet you as you enter and then ask for money on the way out.  

their stuff is great and always always fresh.  their blueberry muffins are the absolute bomb and the best i've eaten and i've eaten alot.  Thank God it doesn't show.  

The downside, yes, there is one: Blueberry muffins are not a everyday thing
author: kenny l.

description: Absurdly delicious food. Nothing bad to say about this place, but now that I can't walk there anymore, it's annoying to circle and circle looking for a parking spot... though it is on the way to SFO for me.
author: Diana D.

description: One of the best bakeries every !!! delicious pastries and great service .. Would highly recommend !!!
author: Nara M.

description: When i'm in the neighborhood I can't resist.  My favorite pizza is the one with artichoke hearts.  I'm also in love with their coffee cakes and pecan rolls.  I would also highly recommend their shortbreads. yummmm-o
author: Joanne H.

description:
I came here with a friend who is very familiar with "The City" -- good thing 'cuz I'm not!  Wow, wow, wow!  We had just eaten at Park Chow (yum!) and came here to Arizmendi for some cookies for dessert.  The whole walk there, my friend was talking up the vegan mint chocolate chip cookies.  Now, when I think "vegan", I immediately think "bland".  H-E-L-L NO!  Not this place!  I am as opposite of vegan as one can be and I freakin' LOVE these cookies!  Not too minty either!

I will definitely be back...if I can find it again!
author: Bryann R.

description: Today is the last time I pay nearly 5 bucks for a piece of cake only to receive not even a nod of recognition from the tall grey haired guy who was on the cash register. Learn some customer relations, I'm spending my money at your business.
author: brian d.

description: great pizza, bread, shortbread, cookies, wow. could be tough to find parking in the area. but this place is worth the effort. the pizza of the day is a can't miss item. good use of fresh ingredients like sun dried tomatoes, feta cheese,  carmelized onions, various mushrooms, kalamata olives. you gotta try the pizza. I am getting hungry just thinking about it.
author: Jeff W.

description: love the pecan roll!  satisfies all the expectations of a sweet tooth!
author: Janice M.

description: Stopped by during the morning of bay to breakers and was greeted with a line of eccentrically dressed racers.  All the baked goods looked amazing - ended up trying a muffin, corn cherry scone, and shortbread.  The muffin and scone were both a bit dry but tasty enough.  The unassuming shortbread was surprisingly flavorful and rich.  Will have to return for the pizza.
author: Jeremy C.

description: I have finally found that local feel bakery that I've been looking for! For whatever reason, my neighborhood, and other neighborhoods I've lived in, don't seem to have one. The moment you walk in this place, you know its good. People are ogling over the pastries and verbalizing their hunger right then and there. I had never been before, so I just watched couples come through the door and agonize as to whether they were going to bring more cheese rolls out; fortunately, they did and I go one, it was the bomb. Also had one of the fruit scones and the coffee cake - amazing! Makes me want to go get some right now. I've also heard that the pizza is delicious, but they dont start serving it until 11:30. Can't WAIT to go back!
author: Jenica M.

description: Pizza here is great! So are all the baked goods. Also I appreciate that it is an employee owned co-op.
author: Flora B.

description:
wow, their breads are *amazingly* good.  i love going early on saturday morning when everything is hot and fresh out of the oven.  there's something incredibly charming standing in line with a half-dozen other san franciscans passionate about getting their weekend fresh bread fix!  the coffee is also quite good.

update 10/27:  i just had some of their pizza, and i daresay it's the best pizza i've had in sf (of the same caliber as cheeseboard in berkeley)!  today's flavor consisted of caramelized onions with ricotta cheese and pesto on sourdough crust.  mmmm, good stuff!
author: Roshni R.

description: It's all about the muffins, brioche, currants, and the scones!  All soooo good.  I also heard that they serve a damn good coffee...
author: Mark D.

description: If I lived close to Arizmendi I'd be seriously gaining some weight. When I first came here upon the advice of a good friend, I felt like a kid in a candy store. So much good stuff and so little room in my tummy. The pastries are great and so is the pizza. I could use a slice right now! The staff is also very friendly. I'm tempted to give it 5 stars but haven't been there in a few months and need to refresh my memory...will update this review after I try it again.
