author: Mellie D.

description: What else can I say about this gem?  Simply the best bakery I've been to.  Ever.  I've moved away, but when I come back, I make a real effort to try and come back here.  I love it so much.
author: Brian A.

description: I'm really mad at myself for waiting more than 4 years to finally try something from Arizmendi.  I'd walk by all the time and say, "That smells soooo good!" or "The pizza today looks awesome!"  None of this was enough to convince my stupid ass to actually go in and EAT something from Arizmendi until recently.  As a non-vegan I really liked the vegan cookie I had.  And their pizza?  Every bit as good as it smelled all those years.  I will say I think their strength lies in the savory over sweet but both are well worth a trip.
author: M M.

description:
wow well let me tell you a bit about myself: first, I love pizza I could eat it for breakfast,lunch and dinner and now that I ve tried pizza from this bakery there is no going back to the rest, unless I want some meat on my pie...
 well let me get back to the pizza: now it was with mushrooms,asiago,lemon-thyme-rosemary oil and finished off with parsley and parmasan just baked to perfection with a nice thin crust just perfect .
author: Chris D.

description: Amazing pizza and bread. The best pastries in San Francisco!!!! I love Arizmendi Bakery! Everything looks so good in there. They have an amazing cookbook as well
author: Hannah S.

description: I love their pizza. And just this bakery as it is. So great.
author: Barbs J.

description: This is the ultimate San Francisco pizza, and one of my favorite slices in the entire city-- sourdough, thin crust, crisp bottom but slightly chewy overall with interesting toppings like shitake & garlic parsley, potato & dill... just the smell... drool!!
author: Amy D.

description: You just can't go wrong here.  You'd be even luckier if you lived near the Oakland (Lakeshore Avenue) coop, where the pizza and other daily goodies are even better.  Don't mean to start an inter-coop battle here, and I'm not dissing the good folks on 9th Avenue either.
author: Alfonso E.

description: Awesome baked goods, but my favorite is the pizza -- unless it has toppings that I don't particularly like, of course, and there's only one variety each day. I don't like potatoes on my pizza, for example. But the crust is great, medium thickness. When I worked nearby, I used to like to pick up half-baked pizzas, bring them home, and finish heating them in the oven. Yum. The bialys are also pretty good, and I used to love the decadent cookie brittle.
author: Tara M.

description: I love every pizza here but Portobello mushroom/balsamic vinaigrette is my favorite.  I think the one in Emeryville has better toppings though.  For example, I always pray and pray and PRAY that the SF one will make the Arugula/Gorgonzola/Red Onions/ Balsamic Vinaigrette/Toasted Walnuts one but they won't.  And then I have to venture over the bridge on the right day just to satisfy my taste buds.  I love Arizmendi's though..their pecan rolls are amazing.  I got all my friends hooked on this place.  And I don't even have to feel sinful when I eat this kind of pizza, haha.  Just don't come here on a Monday!  I've done this like 3 times forgetting that it's CLOSED ON MONDAYS!  There's Yumma's right around the corner which is my backup, hehe.
author: Joellene B.

description: Pretty much my most favorite pizza ever! I'm obsessed with this place and have been for about 2 1/2 years now. I live on the other side of town but when I can get over to the inner sunset I always stop in. Good place to eat your pizza and read the paper, that is if it's not busy. FYI, I believe they're closed on Mondays and they don't start serving pizza until 11:30am. BTW, did I say that I eat my pizza for breakfast?....yea, it's a great brunch kindof a snack.
author: Natalie H.

description: The cookies and muffins make my mouth water. Sister to Cheeseboard in Berkeley, Arizmendi offers a great variety of baked goods on top of the daily pizza.
author: Teresa Y.

description: I had no idea that this place was Cheeseboard's sister bakery. Didn't try the pizza but it looked just like Cheeseboard's. Picked up some of their amazing English muffins for some homemade breakfast sandwiches. Definitely gonna head back soon for some pizza and other delectable baked treasts.
author: Brian J.

description: The comparison to Cheeseboard on Yelp set a high bar for my expectation of this bakery. I was NOT dissapointed. I came here with some girlfriends before we hit the YSL exhibit at the Deyoung. I was famished so I went overboard and bought the slice of the daily pizza and the cheese sourdough and went to town. The pizza was piping hot and delicious because all the individual flavors stood out. None was too dramatic as to overshadow the other ingredients. I am a fan and will return, this time to get the infamous chocolate thing.
author: Diep N.

description: chocolate cookies.  it's like crack. but better.
author: Kelly H.

description:
This place is awesome and not just for the bread.
The tabouli is a hidden treasure - so yummy!
Also I have a crush on one of the employees.
author: anne m.

description: i love arizmendi's pizzas.  one item menu that changes daily.  they always come up with great toppings and are delicious!
author: Helen T.

description: The corn muffins and scones are the best morning pastries on the menu. Beware of a line on Saturday/Sunday mornings. Also, it's cash only, but there is a B of A down the street at 9th and Irving. Coffee isn't half bad either.
author: Lauren M.

description: Their pizza is my weekend ritual...definitely my favorite pizza in SF.
author: Yasmine G.

description: I love the pizza -- one kind each day -- vegetarian only and always yummy. And the baked goods and coffee are great, too! Chocolate things and brioche and cheesy rolls! And it's a co-op! I love it! Also in Emeryville and Oakland.
author: Dana B.

description: I was always sad to be a bridge ride away from Cheeseboard in Berkeley, but I recently discovered it's sister store, Arizmendi Bakery, in the Inner Sunset.  What I mostly missed was the pizza, savory, thin crust, and only one option offered each day (always vegetarian). I heart you, Arizmendi, even for your communistic ways!
author: Lisa L.

description: You don't need to go to a pizzeria for a good thin crust pizza.  Absolutely delicious.  Just know they only make one toppping a day.  We lucked out on our first pie, spinach, kalamata olives and feta.  Can't wait try another.  They get 5 stars for the pizza (I've only tried one other item which was okay).
author: Debbie T.

description: This is one of the best bakery's I've ever been to!  The pizza is really good, reminds me of cheeseboard in Berkeley.
author: Rupa P.

description: Oh the yummy calories in store for you here.  Arizmendi makes some of the greatest breadsticks that have been lovingly and diligently buttered/oiled and generously salted on the planet.  The breads, pizzas and scones don't disappoint either.  The clientele are part of the fun too: if you're looking for a cross-section of the crunchy, crunchy wannabes, terminally single 60 somethings, street people, bakers with a cause and the occasional stray yuppie, this is the place to watch it all collide.
author: San B.

description: Best pasteries, bread, and pizza around.  Great workers, always smells great, never had anything bad here.  The special cheesecake and the fudge cake are also amazing.
author: Benji J.

description: I LOVE their scones! never have i found a more perfect scone than at arizmendi's. Nice and moist, just the right texture, and so goddamn delicious. a perfect pairing for a great cup of coffee. their other stuff - pecan rolls, breads, and pizza -  is also precious and at a reasonable price.
author: Faye P.

description: The Carb-lover's wet dream. Love their coffee cake and pizza slices! Ooooh I hate that they're not open Mondays, but man; if I could- I woldn't work mondays either!
author: G W.

description: Yummy good bread. I like the cheesy bread. Mmmm good. A appealing bakery has good baked goods, friendly people.
author: Kristina S.

description: This place is ALWAYS packed, and right fully so! (Well when i go in, anyways). I love the pecan rolls, and they come up with some pretty interesting pizzas (sweet potato for  toppings!). I really like the feel of this place,  very... independent. It sort of reminds me of that girl's bakery in "Stranger Than Fiction"...only less anarchisty
author: Yvonne Q.

description: this is one of my favorite bakeries in sf.  their breads and scones are wonderful, and you can't miss their pizza!!
author: minty b.

description:
finally, i've found good bread.  i'm really surprised at how long it took me to find the exact type of bread that i feel is good, but nonetheless, i've found it and now can move onto other things.
the sourdough baguette is not really sour but somehow all of the components come together nicely and can support the cheese i need to put on the bread to start my day properly.
we also picked up an olive something bread which was tasty but not necessary. it's this baguette that will now become the staple.
no plastic though so remember to have cash on hand.
author: Tammy N.

description: If I hadn't fallen in lust with its sister bakery in Berkeley, this would've received 5 stars. Great bread selection, good pizza, very convenient location off of the N.  I always grab a chocolate thing and a wolverine when I'm here.
author: Charlotte M.

description: The whole-wheat fennel and fig sourdough loaf should be reason enough, but they also have amazing challah and at the right time of year, you can even get baby cake! (King Cake for that mardi gras holiday) Arizmendi is always the first stop for gathering brunch makings - our french toast is the best when it's made out of a fresh loaf of their bread - plus nothing beats a few slices of pizza on a your train ride to the beach.
author: Danielle D.

description: Cheeseboard-caliber pizza.  Cheese rolls.  Really, what more do you need?
author: Wayne K.

description: This review is based on the pastries that my GF bought me. She bought me the chocolate and peach scones. They smell sooo yummy and taste so good!!  I couldn't resist but to eat them both! Maybe next time, I'll go there and try their pizza.
author: Daisy S.

description: SO good!  Fresh breads and pizzas.  Very like Cheese Board.  Run by super great staff.
author: beverly l.

description: Totally deserves 5 stars because 1) the special pizza of the day is usually STELLAR, 2) they're baked goods are delicious! and 3) it's a co-op! I love coming here even if the line is long, it moves pretty fast anyway. They're breadsticks and scones are delicious as well. The chocolate things are famously delicious and especially if you're craving a chocolate bread thing (hence the name). They also have some nice cheese and yogurts in the fridges and their coffee isn't bad either. The granola and honey also looks good and from local farms. It's a total gem in the Inner Sunset!
author: Gina R.

description: Bread bread bread! Don't come here looking for a regular old danish or cinnamon role. Come here for sweet blueberry corn muffins and brioche rolls or savory cheese rolls and pizza. I save up my quarters so that I can have a tomato and olive focaccia role once a week. They have a different pizza each day. The last one I had had fontina cheese, tomato, and roasted garlic--best slice of pizza I'd had in a while.
author: Allison M.

description: Been coming to this bakery since it has opened..  I have never been disappointed!   My favorites are the Cherry Corn Scones and Pecan rolls..  Very yummy!  Just a side note..  if you ride your bicycle to the bakery..  there is an additional discount!
author: Lester S.

description: I have never liked scones at all until I tried them here. The cherry scones are unbelievable. The cheese cake is good as well. The pizza is interesting but the only reason for me to write a review is for the best scone that I have ever had in my life.
author: Dee D.

description: This is a great bakery and a coop to boot. Have never had anything bad there. The coffee cake is seasonal and always great. The worst thing about this place is overdosing on their stuff! Best to do takeout... the place is kind of messy.
author: Ari T.

description:
best cornbread blueberry muffins in the freakin' world.
their chocolate cake & pizza are slammin too!
author: Tiger Lily ..

description: The worst parts about this place is that it's hard to buy just one thing, the parking sucks, and you have to have cash. Other than that, it's an anti-Atkins butter lovin' haven.
author: Bridget W.

description: I heart zampanos. It's only like 1.25/1.50 each can't rembeber. So, I can get a meal for $3.00. Then I always add some more kosher salt and red pepper flakes to add more flavor. The pizza's pretty good too. They serve one type of pizza everyday, and sadly for the carnivore in me, the pizza is only vegetarian.
author: dI c.

description: My girlfriend says I have some of the strongest willpower she has ever witnessed.  Arizmendi is one of those places that can quite easily break my willpower down and, via the aromas flowing out the door, convince me to purchase pizza, cookies, scones, and other items that always provide a party in my mouth.   Morning walks to the muni from my old apartment a few blocks up the street were often interrupted by quick stops to Arizmendi.
author: Morgen N.

description: Ahhh Arizmendi... Best scones in the world... Sadly my hips don't agree but it's worth an extra mile during my workout for their scones of the day. :)
author: Jocelyn B.

description: The pizza here is so goooood. Only one flavor is offered every day, but the ingredients are so good that theres nothing to complain about. Some other favorites of mine are the scones and the...well I was gong to be more specific but everything I've had there has been excellent.
author: Robert C.

description: I LOVE their daily pizzas. You'll love them too if you like thin crust, more non-American pizzas. Their baguettes are awesome too! And I am so addicted to their cinnamon rolls with all their gooey goodness. I forget what they're actually called though. You MUST try if you are in SF.
author: Food L.

description:
Are you kidding me? It's a bakery with bread and sweet stuff. How could it not be good? But it's not just good, it's f'n great!  I LOVE arizmendi cheese scones. If I meet a man that I enjoy this much, I will do anything for him.  Seriously.  I live 4.5 miles away. I walk 9 miles round trip just to have 5 minutes with the cheese scone. I have yet to meet a man for whom I would do anything close to that.  I have loved the cheese rolls in the past, but not so much recently. They seem to depend on the baker, and my last few visits they were too hard, actually hurt my jaw eating them. And too small. And not enough cheese! 
But the Olive-provolone bread? oh YEAH! And the chocolate things? Yep. Yumma yumma. I love bread. I love sugar. I love bread and sugar. And cheese. They have it all.
The pizza does not appeal to me. I like traditional pizza, not fancy topping stuff without tomato sauce. But they occasionally have something called "lunch lady" pizza in the focaccia case that I like. It's mostly bread with some tomato sauce and cheese. My kinda pizza. Mmm mmm. 
Ah Arizmendi, I love thee. 
I just tried the new one on Valencia last week (on a cheese scone day, of course. I looked it up to make sure). It's a nice space, but the counter person was not nice.  She was not pleasant at all. And while taking my money she started talking with her coworker and reading something. She was about to close register without giving me my change, and when I said something, she gave me the nastiest shit-eating look. WTF? 
Well, that's hipster Valencia for you.  The cheese scone was not as good there, either. It was...different. Maybe the baker fell of his/her fixie that day? I dunno. I'd go there if walking by, but I'll continue my 9 mile hike to the inner Sunset when I'm hankering for some good baked goods.
author: Allucaneat G.

description: Everyone loves Arizmendi. The service is always really friendly and the baked goods are awesome. I usually just get the chocolate chip cookie with a slice or two of pizza. The pizza is, of course, the highlight of an Arizmendi experience, although the goodness sometimes ranges from just good to really amazing. That's probably just because of my own personal taste preference more than the quality of flavors on the pizza though. I just wish they had a tip jar.
author: Michael M.

description: arizmendi is consistently tasty for their scones and this is my go to place for tasty pizza. i have tasted most of their variations of vegetarian pizza (save for the mushroom pizzas, because i hate mushrooms) and my absolute favorite is the yukon gold potato pizza, because it's such a comfort food. sure, you might think potatos and pizza don't belong together, arizmendi will prove you wrong. it gets pretty crowded during the weekends, and yes it's cash only but everything is so affordable a quick run to an atm close by is never a problem for me. plus, all the workers are always really friendly.
author: annie y.

description: This is a lovely little bakery with fabulous pecan rolls and scones. The coffee is good. But the scones would make any Brit feel at home. I look forward to trying their savory pizzas.
author: E J.

description: I've been hearing about this place, lots of rave reviews but in a casual tone so I didn't put much thought into it. I'd always pass this place walking around the neighborhood after going to the gym on 9th and Judah. Sigh, I am so dilly dallying because I CRAVE the pizza from this place! I went in on a Saturday morning, right about 11 ish, made sure I had cash and ordered my first slice. When the guy at the counter asked me in a serious manner, only one? I shrugged it off, waited for the pizza de jour and had it to go as I strolled around the corner for coffee. I think I inhaled that slice after the first bite, right before I got to the corner. If you've seen the movie Ratatouille, I was the food critic taking his first bite of the main dish, I was lost in flavor and nostalgic bliss. After I got my cup o joe, I came back with an almost sweaty fervor, like a junkie waiting for her next fix. I damn well could have ordered a whole pie, I settled for two more slices, I did just go to the gym and ran in the morning, no need to feel entirely guilty. The crust from this place, it's amazing, crunchy on the outside and soft and giving like a sourdough loaf on the inside. The flavor they were serving that day was a lemon infused olive oil with thin slices of red onion and black olives. It sounded so simple and boring, oh, far from it, I got lost in a train of thought, so the flavors change everyday so I'm giving this place 4 stars...until we meet again pizza-my-heart. Might I add, they sell the pizza dough by itself if you wanted to take it home and create your own little pizza heaven.
author: Natasha C.

description: It's been a while since I've gone to Arizmendi, but that's because I've gone off to college. However, I can't forget the first time I went to this place; I had the pizza of the day- tomatoes, gorgonzola, and spinach. My friends did not find it as good but what do they know anyway. When I visit home I find myself down on Irving a lot, but whenever I walk by Arizmendi somehow I' find that I've already eaten but that doesn't stop me from enjoying the really great smell coming from the bakery and ovens. Love it
author: Arthur L.

description:
Maybe I came in on the wrong day of the week, but the selection of breads didn't excite my salivary glands. I entered craving a chocolate chip cookie, but they only had gingerbread cookies with cardboard-like texture. So I settled for a slice of the day's pizza, which was spinach, tomatoes, goat cheese, and garlic oil. It hit the spot, right on, but the crust was too chewy for my liking, and there wasn't enough flavor, enough spice. Costco has ruined me for all other pizzas, except perhaps Kashi's.

I might come back here a lunch of foccacia someday. Thanks to everyone who's reviewed Arizmendi, I'm desperate to taste the secret.
author: Anita L.

description:
I have been living down the street from this place since July and just tried it after reading the reviews and being convinced by a coworker. What was I thinking waiting so long!!?!??! While I have only been 3 times so far, I have had the pleasure of trying their chocolate chip cookies, focaccia, pecan roll, and the "chocolate thing." All of them are amazing. I am dying to try their muffins, scones, and pizza, as they all looked yummy too. I am a fan!

They did lose one star though for their chai tea. I took one sip and had to throw it away. I'm not even particularly picky (ok maybe a little) about my chai, but I couldn't even finish it! Let's hope it was just a bad cup....
author: Annie L.

description: Awesome co-op.  I love the sour dough wolverine in the mornings I've lost my sweet tooth.  The cornmeal cherry scone is terriffic as well.  Great service and great people.  Decent pizza too.
author: Branden T.

description: Cookies and pizza....  Yum.  This place knows how to do it right, and pretty much blows other SF bakeries out of the water.
author: marie m.

description: The lite-bake pizzas are rediculous! So yummy. You can call ahead, order them for a specific time, and then finish cooking them at home. Check out the calendar online. My favorite is the roasted kabocha squash.
author: Rae Q.

description:
when im too lazy to head to acme bread, i'll come here.  this is the only decent bakery in the sunset.  i had their goat cheese mushroom pizza the other day - that was pretty yummy - thin crust.  i also had this tomato foccacio that was great.

this place seems to be crowded everytime i go.  for the best selections, i would recommend getting there earlier in the day.
author: Dorothy L.

description:
Favorite things:

1. Corn cherry scone
2. Pizza of the day
3. Cheese bread of the day

I LOVE THIS PLACE!
author: Ali W.

description: This place is the only reason to wake up early and get out of bed on a foggy Saturday morning.  You beat the crazy lines of parents with strollers and get warm Chocolate things, muffins, etc and incredible coffee (who knew!).  Being closed on Mondays is a painful thing as it would start my week off so much better.
author: Blair F.

description: This is the best bakery in the city!!!! The olive breads are to die for. They also have great cookies, many vegan.... I have never been disappointed by this place. Its everything you could want in a bakery! I just wish they were open  Mondays...
author: Emily S.

description: Mmmmm...freshly baked, warm cheesebread! Oh, oh and fresh scones! Oh, oh, oh and fresh shortbread! Oh, oh, oh, oh, so many more amazingly delectable baked goods here. Go early morning, when everything's fresh out of the oven. Sooooo yummy.
author: Fern D.

description: This place is pretty tasty, I was really impressed because it tasted so clean. I wish they had salads and more of a cafe setting. My little pizza thing would have been better with a little green salad and lemonade - but hey you can buy a couple of the pizza things by the front door take them home and make your own meal - so that is okay. It's pretty cool that it's a co-op too. They have lightly baked pizza's that can be taken home and heated up. The rotating menu is great - certain day's you can only get certain things. It is no frills organicy and a little on the hippy dippy side, that is okay by me - OHHH they totally have a cheese fridge with all sorts of lovely things and they make their own hummus.
author: melissa h.

description: You can get really fat here. No really, I mean it but your stomach and taste buds will thank you. Come here any day and at anytime,  you'll find a queue. The coffee is very good too. I think the last time, they were serving Nicaraguan coffee. Trust me, eat here and you will leave happy.
author: Phillip T.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE, pizza is delicious and bread is great. Plus its in a nice neighborhood.
author: Pat T.

description: The Coolest Worker owned and operated Co-op Bakery that I know of.  I go here at least twice a week since I live up the street.  Gourmet Pizza done right!  Pear and blueberry scones, Cherry corn muffins, The best Sourdough Wheat bread I've ever had!  My friend gets his Challah here every week.  Different breads, pizzas, scones, etc.  daily.  If you get there when they open I think around 7 you can get your hands on fresh out of the oven scones.  High Five!
author: Dave M.

description: This bread bakery is very good. Great snacks and the pizza's very tasty, you never know what you're gonna get, unless you memorize the monthly menu.  Any of the mushroom pizzas are worth a try.  The cinnamon shortbread and the carrot cake are excellent, when available.  The staff (owners actually, it's a co-op) are nice, sometimes a little frazzled because it can get very busy and crowded in there.  The one down side is that it's a "help yourself" for many of the items and it really bothers me that some people "touch and squeeze" before they choose one.  Also, leave your strollers outside, it's crowded enough as it is!
author: Sabrina L.

description: Really very awesome amazing carb-loaded goodness! Tasty, fairly inexpensive and the daily variety changes. It's a surprise every time I walk in the door.
author: Dustin H.

description:
My first review ever on yelp has to be for this YUMMYYYYYY-licious place. 

Small shop on 9th, smells like carbs yards a way, you see lots of people holding brown paper bags walking along Irving and you HELLA know they went to Arizmendi....also because they are stuffing their faces as they walk by too.

 There's sometimes a little line that goes out the door (but goes by very quickly) and it's cool to see white hippies making my food. that's the way I sometimes like it. 

cheese rolls are what i fantasize about when i know i'm coming to the city...i bring people here for the baked goods (corn cherry scone, chocolate-y goodness). It's like orgasms in your mouth. Darn, I wish I had one right now...cheese roll come to me!
author: Jess N.

description: delicious scones and breads. my favorite are the ones with cheese all up in it and on it, like the olive/onion and some kind of cheese breads.  worker owned so extra goodness points if you support this business.  if not too crowded and the seats by the window are available, this storefront is a quaint location to catch up with old friends over coffee and bread.  i believe they make challah here too.  Challah!
author: tacos-n-beer g.

description: I just discovered this bakery, even though I have lived in the city for 6 years.  It is amazing.  Everything I have tried has been good, but I definitely recommend the brioche.  Yummy!
author: Suzanne E.

description: I've only had the pizza and it was gooood.  Just like Cheeseboard, without the trek to Berkeley.
author: Val U.

description: I live for their scones, especially if it has pear in it. Bialys, brioche knots, and their shortbreads are just sublime.
author: Charles C.

description:
best bakery ever.

best pizza slices ever.

sometimes too crowded - the only gripe.  but the staff is efficient and moves the customers through quickly, unless they are standing at the trays trying to decide what they want.

bonus 10% discount if you're on a bicycle; but I live around the corner so I'm usually not on my bike when I go.
author: Bruce W.

description: Friendly staff.  Yummy pizza, the only draw back is mine was under done because they were so busy and there was lots of people waiting,  I guess when you are good, you always have lots of customers hungry for the pie.  Even when it has raw dough it tasted really good. Their ingredient is fresh and tasty.
author: Mar H.

description:
Scones = amazing.  try the cherry corn and the blueberry persimmon.
Pizza = delicious but slices are kind of small.  
Coffee = awesome.  way better than i expected and they give you a discount if you bring your own cup i think.
author: A K.

description: I'll be damned if the chocolate chip cookies here aren't a little bit weird, but boy are they tasty.  Alot of people come here for the pizzas, they are absolutely right in doing so.  This place adds alot of character to my hood and I'm glad to have it there when I need a cookie fix or a fun, interesting pizza.  They also have vegan options which is nice if you're into that.
author: Matt P.

description:
cheese roll is the most celebrated, and i like their oat scone.
the focaccia is a bit too oily to me, but pizza is good especially when it serves hot!
author: Florence C.

description: I can't sing the praises of Arizmendi enough.  Take your most carnivorous friend and I assure you, they will not miss the absence of meat, the pizza (and other baked goods) are so effing delicious you just can't resist!  A weekend tradition with the boy, I like to get the daily slice (or sometimes a whole pizza if I'm feeling ambitious).  With GGP mere blocks away, it's hard to have a more satisfying weekend afternoon (or morning).  Not a big place but that's sort of what I like about it and while it's not the cheapest, the quality is top-notch and totally worth it.
author: Suzanne V.

description: Their english muffins are the best.  Try to get them when they're still hot out of the oven!  Add some butter and honey and you have the world's best breakfast.
author: Samantha J.

description: This is an excellent American bakery.  No croissants or even a bagel to be found.  We're talking blueberry muffins to chocolate chip cookies made with the finest ingredients available and cooked to perfection.  FYI it is a CO-OP which seems to be working very well.  So if you make it past the "change..." guy out front you're in for a real treat.
author: Joe G.

description: i'm not really sure why this place got so many high reviews.  either i came at the wrong time of day, or everyone in sf has different taste from me lol.  we were in the area in the late afternoon n decided to grab a quick snack before dinner.  i guess i'm more of a sweets person, and dont' like dried fruits too much, so none of the stuff really appealed to me...it was all to healthy looking, bleh!  we just got one piece of pizza, which was cold, and the dough was too floury.  eh, prolly the wrong time of day.
author: Angie L.

description:
SOOOOOOOO good, so very good. *Drool drool drool...* thinking about Arizmendi.

Am a fan of their pizzas, their scones, cheese rolls, cheese sticks, bread loaves...

However, eating space is a problem!
author: E M.

description: So yummy. And, it's a worker owned co-op. And the workers rock. So, why on Earth would you give your money to some corporate monster when you can go to Arizmendi??!
author: Ethan B.

description: BEST BAKERY IN TOWN. Only issue I have is some (not all) of the dyke women who work there are clearly anti kids. One told my kid to shut up when he gave out a scream of joy because he was about to GET PIZZA. I was shocked that a women who CLEARLY doesn't bathe would question a child-fact is her stink was more annoying than my child yelling yeah to pizza (for the record that women is no longer there) and yes I told her she stunk-which apparently no one has ever told her because the shocked look on her face said it all. Those of us that live in the neigborhood will put up with such attitudes because the whole of the place is what counts-not one person...but prices are going up...and so has attitude. Not sure it can hold its 5 star ranking much longer. Pizza over the last year and half has gone down hill (was easily at one time the best pizza in the city..easily). And they seem to either lack bakers or they are getting lazy because they rarely have the same selection of pervious years. (i live right next to this place and have for the last 8 years). Nonetheless, even with all my complaints..still holds its own against the northbeach barkeries. Bewarned though, this place is BEYOND PRETENTIOUS.
author: LS L.

description: I just moved into the neighborhood and this is dangerous. Very dangerous. Favorites: Corn-cherry scone - amazing! Pecan roll - heaven in a sticky mess. If I'm ever in a pinch to bring something to a potluck/dinner gathering, the tea cakes ($5) never disappointment.
author: Jeannie C.

description: Delicious scones, pizza of the day and their stollen (Christmas time) is to die for.
author: Charlotte M.

description: Awesome, tasty, can't be beat: This little coop bakery serves the best baked goods in the City. From their breads, scones, muffins, cookies...to their daily pizzas and even great coffee. You can't go wrong. Don't forget to pick up their Apple-Sage Sourdough, Kookie Brittle, and Shortbread. Enjoy the pizza there if you can!  Different combination everyday!
author: M V.

description:
My dream is to one day live inside the Arizmendi bakery. It is a magical place full of the most delicious breads, pizzas, and breakfast goods you could possibly imagine. 
The corn cherry scone is TO DIE FOR but just about everything else i've sampled is amazing as well. I live about an hour away from SF, and since I can't go every morning for breakfast I had to find the recipe online so I could make them myself. However, nothing compares to the real thing, fresh from Arizmendi. 

The only downside is the lack of room to sit and enjoy my food/coffee, but I won't take off points for that because the baked goods are so incredible!!
author: Rachel S.

description: Delectible baked goods is right! Breads you want to cuddle with, organic cookies you just want to lick and savour, and others i simply rather not mention.
author: benjamin c.

description: I used to live two doors down from this place and wanted to hate it. The workers always seemed so jolly and the people crowding into it on the weekends would just annoy me. So finally a few months into living there I went in. And did I feel like an idiot. The staff was cool, the other people inside were cool. And the baked goods were awesome. God did I feel stupid for being a hater. Their chocolate brittle, their bread (especially the chocolate cherry bread on sundays), and their cookies are out of this world. The only thing that isn't good is their pizza. It sounds good but the crust is bad. Which is weird since their bread is good. go figure. Oh and their closed on mondays. Give arizmendi a try!
author: Sushi K.

description:
If you are trying to lose weight, stay away from this place! Once you have had their "pizza", there is no going back. I am not a pizza fan, but this is like no other pizza that I have ever had. If red sauce, melted cheese, and doughy dough is your thing, shake the image free before you sink you teeth into this one....Not all daily combinations are a hit, but you won't know your favorites until you've tried them out. Take a break for a good six months between stints. Your thighs will thank you!

The staff here is efficient and friendly.
author: honestly outspoken b.

description:
pizza: 
takes me forever to finish as i nibble my precious pizza that is simply better than delicious...


other baked goods: 
sensational

staff: 
super friendly and rather happy to serve you with your arizmendi purchase. 

organic, fresh, local 
AND 
vegetarian. 
awesome. 

*beware of long lines around lunch.

*when ordering a whole, hot pizza, expect to wait anywhere from five to fifteen minutes for your pizza to come.
author: Court L.

description:
how do they cram so much crack into these baked goods?  how do they expect us to wait until 8 am on Saturdays and Sundays, and survive all through the day on Mondays?  

only the collective knows.
author: Keeva L.

description: I'm a big fan of Arizmendi.  We get boxes of it for our staff meetings every month.  My favorite is probably the scones.  They are always soft but crunchy and fresh.
author: Chris G.

description: My local bakery up the street from my house. A true co-operative that forms a integral part of our community. That and they have really kick ass baked goods. The wolverine is a staple in my diet. Scones are always delicious and the Bran Muffin is hearty with a sweet molasses taste. The breadsticks and the pizza are top notch too. One of the best bakeries in the city!
author: patrick c.

description: Everyone is right, this bakery is as good as it gets. The pizza is non-traditional but scrum-diddly-umptious. Everything I've tried has been awesome. I stop by here whenever I'm nearby.
author: L J.

description: all i can say about this place is WOW!! i went there with five friends, they sat us right away. i told the waiter we were really hungry so they got us our food quickly. the waiter was very polite and helpful. the place was beautiful!! if you are looking for the most pleasant meal of your life, i recommend this place...awesome!! will be back very soon
author: igy c.

description:
yum yum yummy!
they have it all right.
good baked goods from the earth to their oven to our mouths!
and if you're on a bike they knock of another 5 or 10% or something..
and if you get someone with a smile.. it makes it even better!
author: Claire U.

description: Artichoke!!! Parsley!!! Onion!!! a good portion of the pizzas are not worth it, buuuuuuuut the artichoke/parsley/onion one is a whole different story, i've been known to leave work early to get a fresh slice.
author: Holly Golighty M.

description: This place is the bomb!  I' ve been going there for years and love the fresh bread and pizza! go!
author: Dev K.

description: lavender shortbread = heaven on earth. get a bagful, some tea, and cruise over to the cal academy, sit on the steps and bask in the deliciousness.
author: Jane P.

description: The food here has it's ups and downs. Why the 5 stars you ask? The guy who helped me was so nice! I really could crush on his sweetness. He was extremely friendly. My bill came out to be $28.15 and I was told him that I think I have the 15 cents. In the end I was a little short and I told him that sorry I don't have it, so I expected him to hand me $11.85 but he gave me $12. He kindly said, "Maybe next time," and smiled warmly. All I could hear or feel was Awww! lol They were packed and there were tons of fresh pastries displayed in the cabinets for you to grab. It's all self-serve on the baked goods in the case. The bags and wax paper are usually on the right for you to pick up the goods. They really trust you in telling them what you got. I bought almost one of everything. O=9 The cheese scone was good and tasted like cornmeal. I didn't quite like their short-breads as much. If you buy the lavender flavored one, be sure to pack that in a SEPARATE bag. Everything in that bag tasted like lavender... blech! lol I really liked the salty foccacias with mozzarella, onions, tomato sauce and more. They were tastier. We also got the highly recommended pizza. They can heat them up for you if you ask. We got two slices and it was flavorful. The crust was crisp and had a really nice texture. Each bite bursted with flavor. All in all the food was pretty good and the service was impeccable. It's a very nice place to just chill and lay back with friends. They have tables inside and outside, but of course they were all filled up when we went. At least now I can say I have finally been here! ^_^
author: Kat L.

description: So my whole lack of self control plus my low self-esteem landed me here a few days ago, drooling over the thick slabs of chocolate cake and the variety of cookies, which I know from experience to be dry and flavorless, but look so appealing in my moments of sugary diet-cheating desperation. The cake is so so so damn good here! I have to do the rubber-band-around-the-wrist trick (snapping myself everytime I think of the cake) just to keep myself away from this fat trap of a bakery. PartyBot loves their baguettes and they have a great little fridge with a decent assortment of cheeses (some bries, humboldt fog, etc) for last-minute snack runs when a trip to Andronico's seems undoable. Their pizzas are creative and tasty and seem healthy enough that I can eat a slice (or three) without feeling too much shame. Definitely try their Kookie bars (I think that's what they're called). They're (you guessed it!) bar cookies that are crunchy and compact enough that I can tell myself they're granola bars and enjoy them guilt-free. Every last chocolate-chippy, nutty bite. Minus one star for being closed on Monday. I have to work Monday. You should too.
author: Autumn K.

description:
One of my absolute favorite bakeries in San Francisco. 
Their muffins are good, their cookies are okay, it's their breaded items that make this place great.
What makes this place exceptional: 
-Their cheese sticks.
-Their daily pizza. Go to their website and check out their daily pizzas, and make sure to stop by on that day. Most of them are fan-freakin-tabulous, others can be a little on the weird side. 
-The breads. They have a lot of good bread here. But again, check out their bread schedule as some of their breads they don't make every day. 
What could be better about this place: 
-Their bread schedule. I don't mind having a pizza schedule as I don't expect them to make 20 different pizza's a day, but I wish that more of their breads were offered on an every day basis, not on a schedule.
-Their seating. Very limited seating. Not bad when it's not busy, but when they are busy don't expect to find a seat. I don't usually come here with the intention of finding a seat as I've come accustomed to not being able to get a seat here.
author: Kevin C.

description: There's not much point to adding another rave review of Arizmendi, but reiterating its goodness makes me miss it a little less.  Alright fine, thinking of everyone else happy and gorging on cheese rolls doesn't actually make me feel any better about being in a veritable vegan wasteland, it just makes me jealous. In any case, practically everything at Arizmendi is fabulous, especially since they started getting more creative with their focaccias. The cheese rolls are perfect if you want something cheesy but don't feel like white flour, the tops of the cornbread blueberry muffins are perfectly crisp and dusted with slightly hardened sugar, and the vegan mint chocolate cookies are so satisfyingly chocolatey and packed with chips that it hurts a little bit to think about them. Anyone looking for meat on their pizza is out of luck but the triple mushroom with sesame ginger vinaigrette does the trick even for my bacon-loving self. Pair anything on the menu with their fairly priced and skillfully prepared cappuccino and your breakfast, lunch or snack is complete. Maybe if enough people start pestering them they'll start shipping nationwide, it's worth a shot.
author: Tory S.

description: wasn't able to get here in the morning (which is highly recommended for this type of bakery), but even so, their baked goods were still good.  even reheating them the next day, the scones held up no problem!  the texture and flavor is just like everybody mentioned.  foccacia bread more on the sourdough side.  they cover the sweet and the savory but different from tartine.
author: Rob C.

description: I have strongly considered driving across town for a damn pecan roll... enough said.
author: Jessica E.

description: if you go here, go here for the baked goods, not the coffee. i'm not saying this because the coffee is bad, i just don't want to wait behind you while they make your double mocha latte. i need to get to work in the morning, all i'm buying is a muffin, and it's a god damned bakery, not a cafe. get your coffee somewhere else, jesus.
author: Greg A.

description: i like the idea of worker-owned cooperatives. i also like baked goods.
author: Sara M.

description: it's a co-op, it's delicious, it's pear scones, it's amazing cheese things, it's amazing cheese, it's baby friendly, it's radical basque priest friendly.....Ladies and Gentlemen: It's AAAAAAARIZMENDIIIII!!!!!!
author: sasha c.

description: I stop here every weekend, sometimes twice.  It's the best bakery I've found in the city, and certainly the neighborhood.  Out of all the other Arizmendi bakeries around the bay that I've visited, this one gets the closest the recipe originals at the Cheese Board in Berkeley.  For breakfast the scones and pecan rolls are my favorites.  Pizza of the day starts at 11:30am and you can get a half-baked one to take home.
author: Justin R.

description: This place has one of most delicious pizza.  The thin crust and fresh ingredients makes this pizza a delicate delight.  Everything taste organic and fresh.  Its located in the Inner Sunset--a neighborhood I am taking a liking too.
author: Scott O.

description:
a little backstory on how i discovered arizmendi:  my dog managed to come down with pancreatitis which is pretty serious.  she had been euphemistically "sick" for a couple of days (i'll leave out the details since i'm going to transition to food in just a sec).  long story short is she continued to be sick until things weren't the right color and a trip to the 9th avenue emergency vet on a saturday morning at 5 a.m. was required.  so i'm sitting there as tests are being run before the sun has even risen and i begin to smell baking breads.  mind you, i'm sitting in an emergency veterinary clinic which unmistakably smells of dog and, more specifically, sick dog.  at some point after the vet tech has encouraged me to come back after a little while because it's going to take some time to get the results, i step outside to figure out where this fantastic odor is coming from (no, not the sick dog smell).  that's how i found arizmendi.  and when it opened its doors at 8 a.m. that morning, i was the first customer inside.  

now, i'm happy to tell you that the dog has made a full recovery and i've not needed to return to the emergency vet.  but a trip to arizmendi is now an almost weekly journey.  if i lived anywhere near the inner sunset, i'd be there every morning until i weighed 300 lbs.

as for the baked goods (i've still not tried the pizzas), i don't even like scones but arizmendi's are divine.   the pecan roll is unreal.  do not leave this place without one.  you can eat it tomorrow if you're not in the mood for a sweet.  i assure you that you will not regret this purchase.  the chocolate thing (basically a brioche roll with chocolate chunks) is baked with so much love that i could taste it.  the coffee cake changes daily and i can safely say that the apple and the berry varieties are off the hook.  the freshly made english muffins (they've been warm every time i've bought them) are superb.  

my only complaint:  there was orange rind in the king cake.  king cake has cinnamon in it.  king cake does not have orange rind.  i've forgiven arizmendi for this small transgression.  i'll order my king cake online from new orleans.  otherwise, i've not met a bread product i didn't like at arizmendi.
author: Eric L.

description: I LOVE THIS BAKERY! The trip to get here is totally worth it. I go crazy over the chocolate things, and the pecan rolls!! YUM YUM YUM also had their pizza with red chard, red onions, fontina cheese and it was delicious!!! If i lived in the area, I would be here everyday, for now I will keep going on my special trips to stock up. Thanks for the awesome goods!
author: caramel c.

description: blueberry cornmeal muffins. and coffee. please don't change, arizmendi...please don't change.
author: Mar M.

description: mmm...great veggie pizza on sourdough crust.  my friends and i ordered pizza from here tonight, and it was light baked so that you finish baking it at home.  the flavor of the day was tomato and artichoke hearts, and it was yummy.  i think i like the pizza at cheeseboard better, but then again, it probably just depends on which flavor you get.  i want to come back and try the dif breads here as well!
author: Helen T.

description: great bakery in the inner sunset...i usually order the chocolate things and the pizza slices...yes...pizza. love em. one prob is its cash only...but thats not star-deduction-worthy, is it?
author: Roy N.

description: The pizza is pretty good here. What separates their pizza from the crowd is that the crust has a slightly crunchy exterior but is chewy on the inside -- kind of like how a french fry is supposed to be. And they have the best pecan rolls in San Francisco; actually, here I had the best pecan roll I have ever had in my life.
author: A. T.

description: The line out the door is there for a reason.  Unreal breads and muffins.  So good.
author: daren w.

description: this is one of those places that makes me stay in the inner sunset. yummy scones and pizzas - it's been 3 years that i've lived up the street but i keep forgetting that it's closed on mondays. d*mmit.
author: N K.

description: I love this bakery.  The bread, muffins, cookies, and coffee cakes are delicious.  They use whatever ingredients are fresh.  You can almost always get something warm from the oven.  There's always a line, but well worth the short wait.
author: Garrett H.

description:
This place is pretty neat - nice little shop atmosphere and very friendly behind-the-counter folk. 

Why does it get 3 stars you ask?  More reasons than one!

-The place is always too busy, and the front of the shop is too small for its own good (very hard to get in, and almost harder to get out!).  Move the tables aside people!
-They have rose shortbread, but never when I go there.  I demand rose shortbread!!
-Where's the credit card acceptance? Come on people, its the 21st century, move along with the rest of us.  Cash only is the suckage.
-The two cookies I got (the brittle and the green tea shortbread) were just not very good - both were kind of hard/crunchy and not very soft like I likes my cookies.  The green tea shortbread was just... terrible.  I hear this place is good for pizza, but I haven't had any (though the slices the guy in front of me got smelled delicious).  I bought baked goods seeing as how this is a bakery, and was thoroughly disappointed.  Maybe one day, I'll get the rose shortbread and be able to amend my verdict. But not now, Arizmendi... not now.
author: Guy D.

description: J'ai  supprise, pour cette place. C'est vraimont magnifique.
author: Konstantin G.

description: Spoiler alert.  Or better yet, just keep this between us girls.  Here it comes: I come here AFTER my dental appointments at UCSF.  There, I've said it.  I grab a warm-from-the-oven sticky bun, oozing with caramel with pecans toppling off, and devour it while waiting to pay.  Yes, I do buy more than one since I do have this little problem I am hereby confessing to.  Also, I buy two or three cheese rolls, some little wolverines (hearty chewy small loaves with raisins and dried apricots and stuff) and often a slice or two of the daily version of veggie pizza.  I could go on and on because I have literally never ever had anything bad or inconsistent or disappointing from this outstanding bakery.  Sadly, they are closed on Mondays and I have been heartbroken on more than one occasion when my dentist appointment has inadvertently been scheduled on said day.  This is a great destination for your post-De Young Museum stroll and snacking (0.75 miles).
author: Xander S.

description: Came here last week with my girlfriend and ordered a corn cherry scone and some pizza. SO GOOD. Will definitely be coming here often!
author: patrick s.

description: I love the baguette with the poppy-seeds. I really want to try their mushroom pizza.
author: Kay M.

description: they have a sign out front saying that they were voted best bakery in SF, and i can see why.  the aroma of fresh bread when you step inside is just to die for.  try the cheese rolls... soooo good!  be sure to get there early since they are popular and some of the stuff does sell  out fast!
author: vlad k.

description: Hate to admit it as a San Francisco resident, but I didn't really like sourdough until I had it here. This makes other sourdough taste like Wonderbread. Their rotating daily specials are all great, from English muffins to sticky buns to brioche to pizza. Your trip to the Inner Sunset will be well worth it!  While you're in the neighborhood, make sure to get a latte at the Beanery a few doors down (Arizmendi has coffee straight up but the Beanery has your triple mocha half-caff with the most amazing foam ever).
author: Lynn S.

description: This place rocks! Their pasties are all so yummy. I find myself always waiting outside for them to open to get my hands on their newly baked brioches. They are kinda expensive, but so worth it!
author: Rozina L.

description: This place is great, with the only fault being a slight lack of consistency. It's generally hard for young bakers to earn enough to live in SF, so I like that this is a cooperative.
author: Look and C.

description:
i love this place!  happy workers, happy enviroment and lovely food.
good organic coffee and the best chai in town.  everything here is great... there is a good variety to choose from so there is something for just about everyone.
author: solara j.

description: While waiting for the the great people at the animal emergency hospital next door to make my dog better I was feeling hungry and got a slice of some really good pizza topped with goat cheese and bell peppers. It was fantastic! The only downside was the long line to make a purchase
author: Steve J.

description: This is SF, people.  Worker owned?  Check.  Young dudes/dudettes, covered in flour, playing tunes, baking?  Check.  Millions of carbohydratic calories of anti-Atkins cheese rolls, fruit rolls, muffins, fruit cakes, pizzas, baguettes?  For spare change that you find in the netherworld of your purse or pocket?  Check.  I like Howard, who does graphic design and has been a "worker-owner" for a while there.  Their holiday items are awesome and thoughtfuly done also, but they lost the baked peace symbol, hung like a horseshoe from near the ceiling.  I miss that one, seemed like it would've made an excellent logo.  The only problem is when people show up with their Hummer sized strollers and decide to take up all the space available because, well, I guess they feel they're allowed.  One other nice vision I've had there: one of the workers very patiently helping one of the less than fully mentating homeless folks, who was just trying to get some coffee.  This is SF, truly, thoughtfully and deeply.  Those looking for the flaky, the French or the delicate will not find it here; come for dense breads that pile into the stomach, packed with nuts, fruits and chocolate.  This is the food you pack for a hike or survival situations, or for a party with friends, not a wedding.
author: ed y.

description: I am so bummed it I've been in the city for 5+ years and just now tried this bakery.  The skinny baguettes have a perfect crispy crunchy crust.  The foccacia bread pizza was delicious!  And my last purchase was the blueberry scone and that was great too.  The smell the second you walk into the bakery is amazing.  The only bummer is that they don't take credit cards there.  I will definitely be back the next time I'm within a mile radius of this place!! One last thing...if you rode your bike there, they give a 10% discount!
author: LT B.

description:
Arizmendi holds a special place in my heart. It was here at Ye Olde Neighborhood Organic Baked Goods Cooperative that I first outed myself as a lover of the oat scone and learned that I was in good company. In truth, oat scones don't sound particularly enticing, but these little puckshaped cakes are crispy on the outside, yet surprisingly moist inside. How you can do that with something made of about 75% oats baffles my mind. So the oat scones are my first choice at Arizmendi.
Second choice is the Scone Of the Day, huge and fluffy with crunchy sugar on the outside and yummy fruit like apples, berries or apricots on the inside.
Third choice is the occasional cheese roll, chocolate thing, bran muffin, corn cherry scone, banana walnut muffin, pecan roll, brioche roll, or any type of cookie. Or whatever else. I'll eat it and like it.
Maybe pick up a challah, pizza, container of olives, some jam or honey, a dip or two...so yeah, I'd do all my shopping here if I could afford it, and if I found carbo loading to actually be helpful for running and not just an excuse to eat stuff that tastes good. 
Even though The Beanery is down the street with loads of good coffee to be had, I like the coffee at Arizmendi too, and there's that dude who always thanks me for bringing in my humongazoid commuter mug and gives me  like ten cents off. Then he comments that I need a haircut, which is fine because it prevents me from lingering and blowing all my huge wads of cash.
author: Mich L.

description:
great place but their baked goods are often kind of dry and their pizzas, often too oily. even though it's kind of a pain, i would often just head over to cheeseboard instead when i wanted some baked goods. 

but i'm a huge fan of arizmendi still ... one of the better places in the city (and my favorite for pizza). the only downside is usually seating, which is also somewhat a problem at the cheeseboard too.
author: j. d.

description: My husband LOVES this place and I have to say that the pizza is pretty good.  I am giving it 4 stars because the prices are a bit high and I would like to see more "bakery" sweets like cookies, etc. there.  Also, their cold beverage options are weak.
author: Carolyn J.

description: i didn't try their pizzas which i heard were oh so amazing but i did try their pastries like their pecan roll and chocolate bun and they weren't anything to get excited over. both the bun and roll tasted dry and the pecan roll was overly sweet. it's a do it yourself bakery place where you put what you want in your own brown paper bag and just tell them what you got when you pay.
author: Lynne T.

description: Fantastic food!!! Pizza was superb, baked goods divine.  Ambiance, seating availability and cashier 'tude took it down a notch, but SO GOOD.  A must go to!  And, bring home the scones for the morning after
author: Aimee D.

description: I remember a couple years back when I was working in the Sunset I would jump off the N, scuttle over to Arizmendi and buy a cheese roll or a bialy and jump back on the N and get on with my day. After work, if I was up for it, I would stop over and get a slice of one of their ever changing pizzas for a snack on my way home. The only reason I miss working in the Sunset is that sole reason. Their breads are to die for and,  this might spark some debate, their pizzas rival the Cheeseboard's.
author: R M.

description: the city bread is the greatest loaf of bread in san francisco, except when ACME makes the meyer lemon rosemary loaf at the Ferry Building.  you'll need to get two though, because they will be eaten that quickly.    also, the pecan rolls, the coffee cake, and the brioche are excellent.   it's always crowded, and you'll get yourself rushed and bustled around, and they may give you a hard time if you got your coffee elsewhere, but it's totally worth it.
author: Kate M.

description: their espresso is cheaper than starbucks, and you can use organic milk! beyond that, you can get a blueberry muffin with a nice crust of sugar on top... and wonderful pizzas, all while knowing it's a co-op! so you are indulging in cheap, good eats, while being responsible.
author: Patricia S.

description: I frequent Arizmendi quite often on my lunch breaks. They make exceptional thin-crust pizzas (today's was basil, tomatoes and cheese) which change daily. I am a fan of their breadsticks ($0.75 each). They are extremely long, dusted with parmasan and olive oil and have specks of salt crystals all over the top. They are even good a few hours later, just pop them in the oven for a snack. I have tried their chocolate mint vegan cookie ($1.75), which was delicious, their cheese buns, their scones and their olive breads. This bakery is a gem! Just remember, they are open every day of the week except for Mondays.
author: Mizz N.

description: shortbread so good, it'll make you slap your mama!
author: M V.

description: I had the mushroom pizza with the vinagarette and it was SO GOOD. One of the best pizzas I've ever had and it's only 2.25 a slice! Be sure to get 2 or 3 slices if you're really hungry because the slices aren't that big. I also got the corn cherry scone and it was really good. It was like crumbly cherry cornbread. I'll definitely come back to try a different pizza and their other stuff.
author: Ale x.

description: I can't believe that Arizmendi only has a total of 4 1/2 stars! I mean what could anyone possibly say about this place that isn't anything but pure positivity??!?! I mean, there is excellent pizza, phenomenal baked goods, it's all organic and the people are full of good vibes! If your complaint is that it is cash only, well suck it up! Go to one of the 50 banks located in the immediate area, get some cash and go back. It's really not that difficult people. Anyhoo, they have a different pizza everyday and they only make one kind...they do not need to change that at all because every pizza I have ever had there is absolutely perfect! The pizza crust is really what keeps me coming back...sourdough, yes please! I have been told (and have yet to check this out for myself) that their cornbread is truly kickass, man I love me some cornbreadins! I went everyday for a week right after I moved into the neighborhood and it took all my willpower to not do it again the next week :)
author: Amanda S.

description: I come here at least once a week (if not every other day) and LOVE it.  $2  slices of the daily special sourdough pizza?  yum!  check out there website to see what the slice of the day is.  damn good cookies and other  bakery items as well.  and the people who work there are very nice.
author: J B.

description: I love bread. Some of the best sourdough I have ever had has come from this bakery. The pizza is excellent. The environment reminds me of a food co-op..love it. It can be pretty busy but the carb filled goodies are worth it.
author: Fresca T.

description: great food at great prices, can't beat that!  the pizza is always fresh and they always have new and exciting flavors to try instead of your dull cheese, pepperoni, combo, etc.  everything they make is delicious with nice sized proportions, not too big, not too small.  this is a must try if you're in the area.
author: Landon Y.

description: This place has some pretty good stuff. Not a good place to come for breakfast. It is pretty busy which can make it very hard to find somewhere to sit. The bread sticks are my favorite and the scones are good too! Haven't tried the pizza but definitely plan to in the future.
author: Miranda R.

description: it's good.  pretty much everything is tasty and fattening.  their coffee is usually strooooong and highly acidic and will eat a hole in the pit of your belly.  the only way to fill this hole is to eat more bread.  very clever, arizmendi, very clever indeed.  as many have commented, the pizza is excellent, especially if you're not hung up on that whole tomato sauce thing.
author: Jeff W.

description: my life is not complete without baked goods....i love their foccacia and pizzas...kudos for being a worker-owned coop...
author: Jenniflava R.

description: damn good cup of coffee.  damn good scones.  must be nice to roll out of bed and in this part of the city and stroll over half asleep for a bite!  bummer they're closed on mondays, what's that all about eh?
author: Oliver C.

description: great freshly baked breads. ingredients listed on the bins so if you've got allergies that's very  handy.
author: vickie j.

description: I admit it...I'm a carbaholic! The scones are so moist (unlike any other scones I've had) and delicious! I love how they have a schedule of when they bake certain breads because then you can plan your week around which breads you want to buy (not that I'd do that haha). Even when you're there, they announce to everyone when they have a new fresh batch of breadsticks/foccacia etc. It gets pretty crowded in there around brunch time, and I wish they had more seating so I could enjoy the yummies right there, at that very moment!
author: Tami H.

description: Hands down the BEST cheese bread in San Francisco.
author: gg s.

description: Good breads and scones, although a bit too much sourdough for my tastes. The place is run by people who appear to be hippies. Hippies scare me.
author: Peter B.

description: I'm not a fan of the provolone olive bread. Stick with the sweet items or the pizza. Some small tables and seating are available inside so you don't have to truck all your goods somewhere else.
author: M. W.

description: great pizzas (squash and garlic, yum!) and baked goods. arizmendi is the bomb.
author: Bee H.

description: 5 stars, best bakery around. everything from sourdough to pizzas. employee owned. just a good business that provides quality product at a reasonable price. 5 stars
author: Delta d.

description: Pretty boring place.  The "baked" goods are ok just boring.  I really don't get the whole thing but I guess it's ok.  Why do people think this is the best place around.  It's just a typical bakery.  They don't even have deserts.  People that hang out there are prettly sloppy looking and a little rude.  I would prefer a real bakery with chocolate as well as hippy rolls.
author: jay o.

description: It's amazing have such a fresh and tasty bakery just down the street. Great muffins, pizza, and bread. And they're worker owned. So everyone seems to care just a little more (and there's no tip jar.)
author: Jason H.

description:
I love mornings.  No better way to celebrate the beginning of it then stopping by Arizmendi; its a celebration of the morning ritual for all your senses.  Its the only place I'm never annoyed by the standing room only crowd, and being that this is happening before my morning coffee, this fact is profound.
The Nicaraguan coffee they serve is for me the best drip coffee to be found in the city.  It makes me want to wake up extra early just to enjoy it even more.
The cheese roll is my savory dream cake.  You need to learn how to pick them, and some morning bakers have it down better than others though I can't remember which days.
With that I'll usually get a pecan roll, or brioche.  The pecan roll glaze is a buttery sweet mess that is a joy to pick at, the brioche has a texture and lightness, not too sweet, that is consistently excellent.
I've had the pizza a couple times, amazing though sometimes a bit pricey if you get a small slice.
This place to me is the finest morning ever every time.
author: Philip P.

description: Love this bakery! They have the best scones there, my favorite is the Corn Cherry and of course the Currant. Pizzas and other bread are great. The people that work behind there are very nice, friendly and helpful.
author: Cristina V.

description: I used to work in this area and I loved going to this bakery for their corn-cherry scones, cheese bread with the tomatoes, olive bread, and the pizzas. Everything is always extremely fresh and tastes so good! I wish they would open one in the SF financial or embarcadero districts.
author: Grace Y.

description: One of the few perks of living in the Sunset! Gosh I miss this place.
author: Jaakko P.

description: I love this place and everything it stands for.  Cooperative businesses are brave and highly principled by virtue of the premise of a co-op model and that shows great passion and commitment to the endeavor.  In this case baked goods different, exciting, maybe unique to the donut shot concept of a bakery.  The first two items I tried when they first opened were the cherry/cornmeal scones, and the cheese rolls which I still got back for at least twice a month because they're so delicious and aren't produced by any other baker I know.  Over the years I've made special trips for a slice of their fabulous pizza, cookies, cakes, breads, fruit scones, breade sticks and other specialites that are as good as baked goods can be.  Everything they make uses generous amounts of the best ingredients money can buy, and they take the time to make these things the right way, with dedication and love.  This bakery is a true icon of the small business atmosphere of San Francisco, a destination for all who treasure integrity and passion in food.
author: Stu S.

description: Cheese scone and the pecan roll were yummy.  Have yet to try the other items.   Coffee down the street at Beanery is a bit more flavorful than here.  As well known, this place has a line always - no matter what time of the day.
author: M B H.

description: two words... chocolate bread!  yum!  the consistency was not what i expected, soft on the inside and less dense than my go-to chocolate chip bagel.  i will definitely return to slowly eat my way through everything!
author: Big e.

description: A great bakery. There's quite a selection of goods to choose from and the prices are fair for the quality you get. I love the fact that this bakery is a co-op and serves organic, fair trade coffee. For your next office party/meeting, bring their scones and everyone will ask you where you got them.
author: C G.

description: Almost 400 other Yelpers have already sung the praises of this place, and as clever as I may think I am, I really don't think I can add anything that hasn't already been said. I can't visit the Inner Sunset without stopping here and usually end up buying two or three more things than I came in for, just because it looks/smells so good... or maybe because it's all right there, in my face and primarily self-serve. I do sometimes wish they had a slightly larger selection of cakes and pastries, but it's really mostly about the bread here, so I can deal...
author: Rick A.

description: best bakery in town! the pizza is always AMAZING
author: Renee L.

description:
best scone i've ever had, perfectly flaky, w/ buttery flavor.
incredible pizza, perfectly delicate flavor, w/ crispy crust.
author: Kim Y.

description: arizmendi is so yummy and it has a great concept and great people. their daily pizza is DEELISH. and the cheese rolls mmm. but expect lots of people its very popular!
author: Auvignal L.

description: Everything at Arizmendi is delicious,  but their bran muffins are especially scrumptious and the pizza is among the best in the city.  Check the website or call to hear what the pizza of the day is... you can get them half-baked and finish it off in the oven at home, but it tastes best when it comes straight out of their oven.
author: Sara S.

description: All the bread we bought are very tasty.  The cookies and muffins are also tasty.  The only thing is that it won't last too long.  Next day you will find a "ROCK" in your bag!!!  Buy what you eat TODAY.
author: Miinno N.

description: Mmmmm.  Love the cheese rolls, corn-cherry scones and chocolate things.  Organic/fair trade ingredients are a plus (even the milk left out for mixing coffee is organic--impressive considering how reasonable everything is).  Cheeseboard, I've heard is much better, but I really can't complain--everything I've tried has been great!  Just don't expect to have your goodies here--seating is really limited (two benches I think) and cramped due to the line.  Parking is a pain.  Minor complaints--not enough to knock a star =)
author: T A.

description: I'll honestly say that I have only ever had the pizza. And with pizza that good, why bother with anything else? Come on, now - thin, sourdough crust... lite baked... take it home, stick a slice in the oven and it's all hot and melty... mmmmmm.
author: Angela H.

description: Really great pizza that's always a treat when you go. It changes daily and so you basically just go for whatever they have which is always good. Go with the Stewart's Root Beer while you're at it. Not in the mood for pizza? Then try the assortment of bread--rolls, bialys, scones, muffins, it's bread heaven!
author: Lisa C.

description: I've heard great things about this place, so I tried it one time for lunch.. This and a jamba juice. perfect combination.. I had a slice of pizza.. I think it was goat cheese and basil or something to that effect.. It was kinda greasy, but that's when the jamba juice comes in.. the greasy oily yummy taste of pizza and the soothing fruity flavors of a mango a go go.. so heavenly..
author: Mari K.

description: Okay...so the bakery makes some really good butter, sugar, flour food to munch on during the day, and I enjoy it often.  There are times when the scones are not cooked enough and are pasty, so mind your selection.  The coffee cake is amazing.   The two minor complaints have to do with the service....First, this is for those of us who are morning people by choice or trade...the bakery opens at 7am on the weekdays and 8am on the weekends, and this is about 7am and about 8am as the employees open when they are ready which is never before those times.  You're a bakery...open early please!  And second, about the bicycle discount thing...thank you for offering it as more places should...BUT even if you stroll in in your finest team sponsored polyester garb with flashy helmet, you would never know that they offer a cool bicycle discount if you don't ask for it specifically.  I guess you have to be in the know to get it, but then why offer it?  Okay, so these things seem minor, but I thought it might help a few people.
author: rabbit s.

description: I used to be a "regular," stopping in several days a week for the "scone of the day" selection.  Lately, what a disappointment.  Prices are up, quality and quantity are way down.  In recent weeks, scones have been small, gooey (read: inedible) and containing barely any of the fruit they claim to feature.  The predominant flavor has been that of flour, baking soda and baking powder.  Ugh.  Used to be well-balanced, with a nice scone shape (flatter, and therefore crispier, as opposed to the recent  fist-sized gummy globs), fruity, and with a thin layer of sweetness baked into the top that made the texture and flavor  heavenly.  And the weekend coffee cake has been cakey and boring.  Arizmendi, Arizmendi, wherefore art thou, Arizmendi????
author: Theresa S.

description: Excellent scones!  Moist on the inside. Buttery and crusty on the outside.  I will definitely be going back for the other goodies.
author: PleyYelp Z.

description: The pastries are OK, but  a bit sweet and high in sugar.  However, the brewed coffee is terrible.      It is weak and it is kept in those thermos thingies where the it gets burnt and old-tasting pretty quickly.
author: M S.

description: I love this place. I just wait for something to come out of the oven & I pounce!   I've never been disappointed here & I love that I can buy lunch for $2 and some change. $4 if I get an americano.
author: Abe N.

description: Scones, brioches, muffins, breads, even the coffee... all are delish.  One star off for the akwardness of picking out your treat and then moving over to the line to pay.  It's more difficult when you're 1/2 asleep and low on blood sugar.  But worth it.  Closed Mondays!
author: A M.

description: i want to make babies with the provolone and olive rolls every saturday.....and maybe also on thursdays.
author: bloopie s.

description: had a slice today. delicious.  like someone said, it's like the pizza joint in berkeley with all the natural ingredients and such.  only vegetarian pizzas but who cares?  it's prob my favorite pizza in the city.  thin crust, but not ny style.  i call it a west coast, organice style.  there's prob a name for it, but it's new to me.  today's pizza was roasted fennel and lemon olive oil and arugula.  something crazy like that.  they have a new pizza every day of the month, look at the schedule.  i'm pretty sure i'll be back tuesday and thursday this week to check out the other slices.  awesome.
author: shar d.

description: i loooooove loooove loooooooooooooove this bakery. they're food is so fresh and yummy.  my personal favorites are the pizza, blueberry scone, cornmeal scone and all the other stuff.
author: crystal l.

description: We were going to the Tut exhibit and I'd heard this is a great bakery in the 'hood.  it was saturday, 8am and there was nobody on my side of the counter.  just us.  i wondered why there were so many people, some dusted with flour, on the bakery side.  we eyed a piece of  fruit coffee cake apricot and berry i think, and a pecan sweet roll.  It is all self-serve and we should've made our move sooner.  All of a sudden there were  7-12 people between us and the goods.  We finally got our crullers and coffee and sat down.  there are only 2 tables inside (one for 2 and one with benches that can probably seat 6-8) communally.  The staff is very helpful and friendly.  No tip jar although I would have.  All the stuff is very organickee and wholesome I'm sure.  There is a sign there that tells that the founder's name is a longer version of arizmendi...but i can't remember what it said...only that the coffee and crullers were really good.
author: delbert t.

description: my only gripe here is that this friendly co-op bakery isn't open on mondays. i guess my mom was right, the universe does not revolve around me. *sigh*
author: C C.

description: um, yum! i love their products and they have a spelt cookie for those of us who don't eat wheat! plus they are a co-op and you gotta love that!
author: Tracy B.

description: Man!  Their goods are soooooo delectable!!!  But pleeeeeeeeeeeeease hire someone who smiles and says Thank you!  Maybe I've just hit off-days(sssssssssssssss) since I don't frequent the Sunset location as often as the Arizmendi in Oakland, where I live.  But, nonetheless I have willingly driven across the bridge, through high-traffic situations, 25 miles r/t  just for the amazing chocolate fudge cake they bake at the Sunset location!   But, for instance today I was entirely disappointed with the attitude of the service girl.   After driving for 45 mins to buy a cake and the sour faced girl never smiled, said hello, thank-you, how-are-you....NOTHING.  She actually just stood there all blank faced and dumb looking.    She made me feel bad for buying a chocolate cake.....which was $24, plus some other things which made my total over $30!  Sorry chicky, but I work in the restaurant business too and in times like these you should be showing your appreciation for business.  Just a tip from one service person to another.  It will make a difference!  People feel bad enough splurging on superfluous things right now, and your sour face and attitude only encourage them to not patronize your establishment.
author: Good J.

description: i love this place! its located in a good area. you can catch the N-Muni, 71, 43 bus to get there. the folks are very nice. the food is great. i've tried a lot of the stuff there and i like most of it. the pizza is off the hook ($2/slice). i really love their cheese rolls; they taste best when its hot/warm, when its cold it gets hard. i remember asking them if they can heat it up for me, they said they can't. which sucked. the currant scone is also really good. it sucks that they are closed on mondays because usually i crave for arizmendi on that day. overall i love arizmendi bakery. i would recommend this place to anyone.
author: Serene N.
